xiHgEAPSrjm-gLQSM9Z4DQ.text: I missed my chance to try Lobster Me at the Grand Canal Shoppes (Venetian) on my last Vegas trip, but was given another opportunity at the Miracle Mile Shops (Planet Hollywood).  I ordered the batter fried Lobsicle- lobster tail on a stick ($14). When it came out, I was disappointed by how small it was. Lobster is expensive, but still. Aside from that, I enjoyed it. It was lightly battered and tender. I also tried my friend's Cajun lobster roll. It was small and bland. I wouldn't come here again, but am glad I tried them.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cajun
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle

q4VYxxOaNQX7JWKHn4xrZw.text: The Lobster roll was fresh and oh so buttery. It was oozing with chopped up lobster meat, just stuffed. The chips were good. I dont eat cold slaw, so no review on that. Best kept secret in Vegas. This dish was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

BzE6pti7DmE9ASDH33mJ2A.text: Service is always lacking at Vegas strip centers, but not at Lobster Me.  Cathy at the register had great recommendations and also let my crazy wife make all of her "necessary" changes and requests.  My wife just said "I wish I could put Cathy in my suitcase and take her home for our business" but that might be the Fat Tuesday drinks talking.

t7sOwTIoDImPefcYhi43CQ.text: Lobster ME has beckoned me to visit every single time I've walked past it en route to Earl of Sandwich from the Planet Hollywood parking garage. Today, I finally answered the call.  Back in December, I was fortunate enough to win a $10 credit for Lobster ME at a Yelp event (see Yelp Helps: NPO-Yeah! for more info). This made any expenditure at this place a much more tolerable option, although I still anticipated having to shell out something for a Strip location that happened to serve the arguably already overpriced treat known as lobster.  I pretty much went straight to the Original "Maine Style" lobster roll. I limited myself to the medium size at $17, rather than go for the large size at $23, the difference being $7 vs. $13 out of pocket for me. This is described as Maine lobster with a touch of mayo, lemon, and a secret spice blend. I didn't taste too much mayo and I am reasonably sure that there's turmeric in the spice mix, but I can't be too sure beyond that.  This roll is pretty good! I definitely enjoyed the buttery, soft roll that still had a nice crunch, the ample chunks of lobster meat and claw, and the aforementioned mayo and spices. I probably would have given them four stars on the spot, but during the drive home I realized that it just didn't strike a memorable enough chord with me. Flavor aside, I'm pretty sure I'm barely over half full from that "medium' roll, if that.  Overall, I can see this being a convenient luxury food option for somebody with money to burn or for a tourist who feels trapped in Planet Hollywood / the Miracle Mile Shops, but I just wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends. There's just so many great places around Vegas that aren't so pricey.

X-TzwViZAJC8P8BWDxHkvw.text: Lobster roll extra meat, lobster Bloody Mary with claw $40.00.  It was enjoyable but a bit pricey for Vegas if you ask me .  I will return, I always do! Fun fast food place with Lobster, how can you go wrong !

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B1kegLc2qQKOk4qAAl7oYw.text: The food was amazing....but the service was even better!! Our son is on a very strict diet, and Jermel went out of his way to make sure he was getting what he wanted/needed. It might seem like a small gesture...but it made our sons day!! Thank you!!!!!

QXqZZBG3Ui7SRkpfFNZsrw.text: Delicious Lobster rolls here , my husband loved the clam chowder and he is so picky . Prices were fantastic and I don't know how they get such fresh seafood here. Located right in the Miracle Mile shops perfect meal after long day shopping .

c0HxqyD7sBT3rQu97TiicA.text: Lobster on a roll? - Yes please!!  I came to the food court looking for Earl of Sandwich, but my hunger didn't allow me to make it around the corner and I decided to eat here. I'm a fan of lobster, especially when I don't have to crack the shell and get messy eating it. This place is pricey for a quick lunch, but it was delicious nonetheless. You'll spend about $20 bucks plus for lunch for one. I don't regret my purchase, I only regret eating it so fast because it was soo good.  I ordered the Cajun Lobster roll, fries, and a drink. The roll comes toasty/grilled and buttery with good chucks of lobster meat stuffed on hotdog style. I could eat 4 of these easily because each bite was so juicy, buttery with a hint of crisp from the roll. The lobster had a nice cajun spice to it which added another dimension to the flavor.   Punch line: Come here for delicious hassle free lobster!

TTHzDBUuOwF3L-pBhDz2lQ.text: Read some reviews before you go, I would maybe give it 3 stars, but not much more than that. If your going to pay $25 for a lobster roll, it just needs to be better. Think strip mall lobster roll. Not enough butter on the roll (although it was good), lobster meat looked a little sad and not too much flavor. Fries half cold and a little pickle. Your better off finding a food truck that has legit lobster rolls and passion behind their product. This is a chain with all the chain flaws.

81rQV0YaOuhk3p94fRwjGA.text: Finally made it here, o my goodness the food was great. The staff were polite & helpful. We had the o.g.lobster roll, cajun lobster roll & lobster grill cheese we got the sandwichs all mediums (they come medium & large) the size was perfect plus fries. The bread was perfectly toasted & buttered, so soft melted in your mouth, sandwichs were full of lobster claw meat. These were lobster rolls like ive never had before, we will definately b back (soon LOL)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle, battered lobstertail, fried goodness on a stick
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese

Gwpmj5ihOQ22Aa2IJEzipQ.text: Excellent spot. I love lobster so I just had to check this place out. It is fast food style but wit delicious lobster dishes. I had the lobster roll, which was excellent. My husband had the lobster melt, which is like a grilled cheese sandwich with lobster meat in it, to die for.   I will definitely be back to try more things next time I'm in Vegas.

np0tvXqMtd1P6u9NI1iFDA.text: Staying at a hotel near the Miracle Mile shops-and eating at Lobster Me at least twice during our stay-has always been tradition for me and my friends! Lobster rolls became an addiction for me and it all started at this joint that's always jam packed with a line of people trying to fulfill their drunchies or simply trying to start their day after a long night of unce unce unce-ing.  I have to have a lobster roll (the Conneticut; steamed lobster) with fries and a Coke. It's a little pricey but worth every bite, especially when you have a few drinks in you. I love the toasted bun and the generous serving of lobster you can taste in each bite. There are several options but I enjoy the plain ol' Connecticut lobster roll here so much that I refuse to try anything else. They offer promotions here and there, and during my last stay it was buy a lobster roll, get chowder fries for the free. Best day ever!? Chowder fries.. Just yes. They're melt in your mouth good and they don't skimp out on the chunky goodness.  The service is fast and friendly. Which makes the lines go by quickly. Definitely one of the better options within Miracle Mile if you're ever hunting down something filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut roll (steamed lobster) comes with chips and cole slaw.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free chowder fries with lobster roll purchase--coupon found on Yelp.

JF5ZHFaeLugi4lrXcvd7Sg.text: Worst lobster place I had, lobster Mac and cheese was very dry. The lobster roll was okay..Clam chowder from a can taste better then there's!  That's about it. The end

uI9v3GTEWKh95KzTfyoPCg.text: I so wanted to like this place and was excited to try it. The lobster roll was overpriced, tiny and didn't taste very fresh. The lobster Bloody Mary was OK, really spicy and the lobster was decent. I should've stuck with just the drink.

V-ljhNKz7Qb8U3t8s0JONw.text: Went here on a Rec from an old friend and it didn't disappoint. The lobster roll was huge and so tasty and coupled with the fries it made a perfect lunch. Wish a place like this was in Chicago

tIJYrs0FrHCm_rPTu2Z5IQ.text: Whyyyyyyyy did you change the way the lobster grilled cheese is made!???  The 1 star is from the disappointment of fiending for something.. getting to Vegas.. buying it.. catching the drool before you bite it only to say WTF!!! When you do.  I didn't even finish it.

tRCfMBHRow_ni6EBEJKLtQ.text: Try their lobster roll and bloody Mary, it is ok nothing special, kind of overpriced, but it is expected inside a strip casino.....so its like try it one time and it is done....

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bloody Mary with lobster claw sticking out
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C2DX7IMw0AP85DYI1aohGQ.text: Lobster.. yummmmmmmmmmm. 3 stars for the food, but would round up to 3.5 if possible due to their awesome staff. Also, if you check in on FourSquare they will give you a discount on your tab! Since I forgot to show them my check-in until after we had paid, they offered to give us something for free, which is how we ended up with the bisque. We tried-  -Lobster Mac n Cheese- Really creamy and rich tasting, but could have used more salt. The lobster pieces are on the smaller side and are sprinkled on top of the mac n cheese. -Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche- Good, but not the best ceviche you'll have. A decent amount of lobster was in the ceviche, overall the dish is very pricey. -Lobster Bisque- The best dish that we ordered! The bisque was creamy and delicious, and you can taste the buttery goodness. -Lobster Ice Cream- We just tried a free sample but wow! It wasn't delicious.. but way better than I expected. The person working there explained that it was a Butter Maple based ice cream (or was it Vanilla Maple.. something along those lines) and they added chunks of lobster to the ice cream. I don't think I would order this, but it was definitely worth trying!  Overall, come to Lobster Me if you're craving lobster. I think we would have been more satisfied if we went with the standard lobster roll. However, this place is on the pricey side for what you get, and there are plenty of other places to eat at in Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free Sample of Lobster Ice Cream- Surprisingly Tasty!

BKU8s1lj2E9A1eGIAIAjWQ.text: The menu looked really appealing and the prices seemed right for they type of food. The macaroni was pretty basic nothing special with a few pieces of diced lobster and the lobster roll was a joke. They should be ashamed the way they keep a smile when they serve you. So if you actually know what good food is i would stay away.

GjbJU3v4P_8PF4br05i-RQ.text: This place is located at the Miracle Mile Shop in Planet Hollywood.  I came here cause my friend recommended.  Everything with lobster? COOL!  My coworkers and I almost ordered the entire menu.  Sadly, to say the everything was OKAY.  Nothing stood out to be spectacular. It was expensive too (lobster of course).    Think the decent thing to eat here is the Lobster Roll ($20 for large combo, fries and a drink).    The Mac n Cheese lobster took 20 minutes to make and it wasn't that great at all. It was simply just mac n cheese and they put lobster on top.  Lobster was cold and didn't seem fresh at all.  Lobster Bisque- (soup) was okay.  Lobster salad - I can make this dish better at home.  Pass on this one. Just salad and topped of with lobster. Nothing crazy.  Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche - The only thing that was decent (along with the Lobster roll), it was fresh and tasty, but TINY.  Lobsicle (battered lobster on a stick) - Tiny and nothing great.   All this was around $100.... expensive. Expected way more... I'll just go to Earls of Sandwich instead (cheap and in the same area!)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll, Lobster Salad, Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche

0HAiZ2TtHKdJ7mEKvZim3g.text: Ok it wasn't great but it wasn't all bad either. I had the Connecticut roll with Cajun fries. The roll itself I have definitely had better, it was lacking that warm buttery flavor. The good thing is that it was stuffed with plenty of lobster. The Cajun fries were pretty good. Customer service was great, nice and friendly and very helpful. I might give them another chance and maybe try Mac and cheese or grilled cheese next time I'm in Vegas, maybe they can redeem themselves.

CGoHryRe0PV5yQQFP6kl6Q.text: Delicious-ness!!! Love when lobster isn't served very "fancy" but still has its own flavor.. The other ingredients its paired definitely compliment the lobster in every different roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original Maine roll and the beltway roll

D74fdP8uNgrb1oaOndfU4w.text: My new favorite middle-of-the-night craving (which is unfortunate considering I reside in L.A. and have no such place near me at any time of the day)!  Lobster roll, lobster bisque, shrimp tacos, shrimp salad... All delicious! Last time I was in Vegas I made one A.M. visits two days in a row... The greatest drunken sustenance EVER!   Only thing was the place wasn't incredibly clean but I'll chalk that up to being in the middle of the mall and at the whim of random passerbyers.  Also, the famed lobster roll was served  chilled.  Tasted slightly odd to me because of this, but I guess I'm no lobster roll connosieur...

6MzdhbsARDjcXImq8ASMQA.text: My friends and I split up looking for a snack. I found lobster me in the mall. It's a cute little shop that does lobster rolls, lobster fish and chips and varietys of other lobster things. I chose the lobster fish and chips with Cajun fries that comes with a complimentary coleslaw. YUMMY IN MY TUMMY. My friends were eating their chilli dogs and watching  me with envy. I devoured my meal. The lobster was tender not overcooked, the fries lightly seasoned to perfection and the coleslaw was sweet and cream just the way I liked it. My only complaint if the portion size was small. I know lobster is expensive but they could give your more fries and more slaw bump it up from 13 to 15. I was still a bit hungry afterwards. I regret not trying their lobster rolls they have hot and cold ones. They look like the real deal and Ronnie told me it's a full lobster in every roll.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fish and chips

v5-d2rgt6zhmKa17EKde5w.text: SOOOOOOO GOOD. I can't recommend this more! Being from the east coast you know good seafood & this was just like being at home! For the price you get a HUGE sandwich & fries! The Mac n Cheese was so filling in such a little cup (in a good way). So creamy & great! I'd go again and again!

WB3EoaGbQBRIDmAPO0HIHg.text: My friend had told me to come here for the longest. So I finally came with a group of friends that were down! And they did not regret it one bit!!   I shared the lobster roll and ceviche with my friend . The roll was nice and buttery with huge chunks of lobster.... i finished it to quick :( . ... I wanted more!!!. The ceviche came in a mango salsa thing with shrimp . And these crispy flour tortilla chips. Soooooo good!! It is a bit sweet so if you do not like sweet mango salsa dont get it...  But honestly everything was epic in my book.   Ooo and of coarse I had to have a lobster shooter. Imagine a little shooter with bloody mary Mix.  Little bit of lobster and vodka for 5 dollars!!!! Uhhhh so good!. That I did not share ;).   I recommend this place 100 %

YfveHjzPkXh4kEQA_EQSQQ.text: It's pricy but overall it is so so delicious ! I got the lobster mac & cheese ( warning : portions are small) . After I was done I decided to get lobsicle and Cajun fries. Cajun fries is delicious but the lobsicle not worth it for $14 bucks. Very small

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get Cajun fries but idk about lobsicle

SWtntOkE04UFV7a190yB4Q.text: Found this little gem while shopping inside The Miracle Mile shops. Seating is limited in front of the little restaurant but there is some large ottoman seating behind the tables if you're lucky. Ordered a lobsicle (lobster deep fried on a stick) and lobster Mac 'n' Cheese. The lobsicle is a pretty big portion than I was expecting. It is a little bit rubbery since it's deep fried. I do like that they give you liquid butter to dip it in. The lobster Mac 'n' Cheese is a better menu selection. There were small pieces of lobster that were more tender and I enjoyed the panko crumbs they added on top. I say this place is good for a quick bite while you're doing your shopping.

Xi7TY_ao66JCOevWIt3Cpg.text: no bueno guys. $19 each for the Connecticut and Beltaway that's small and under seasoned. Gordon Ramsey tells u the biggest offense is lack of seasoning in a dish. please taste before serving clients underwhelming food. and the size is for kids.

0j1V2TSOVcRC_KVT2npq1w.text: Next to fat tuesday. We only ordered cajun garlic fries, OVERLY tossed in garlic. all of us liked it though, but wow, it was a kick. no long wait, it came out fast.

od5eof9NkNyp3Z5L1ng0uA.text: LOBSTER ICECREAM!!!  is the reason i bookmarked this place. i was excited cuz i was staying at planet hollywood. as i did research, reviews were lukewarm. I tried the lobster icecream and it was ok. I'd rather spend my $ at Earls. if ur a lobster freak, it's worth a looksie as they have many items like lobster grilled cheese, with waffles, lobster rolls- which are $22 for the large ones.  vibe of this place is food court

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster icecream top right

GHYZDcbLT-NnFYMSwgKaPA.text: So I've been reading about this place and have wanted to try it next time I was going to be in Vegas. Finally got the opportunity to try the Lobster Roll and the Lobsicle. The flavor was delicious but the price tag was not. I totally believe in trying something once as long as it won't break you too much in the wallet. Now that I've experienced Lobster Me, I won't be trying it again. Maybe I'll go to the Outback Restaurant and get Steak and Lobster for less for my Lobster fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original Maine Style Lobster Roll served warm
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer Battered Lobsicle

Aaed7AKPsr9PEctglF3llQ.text: Mario was amazing super friendly nice and clean restaurant perfect for quick stop or just to hang out drink a beer and chat!!

HRpaYznRj41LOsZJteYUSA.text: I loved my Lobster roll! It was just perfect! The roll was nice and buttery, the lobster was fresh and tasty, served at just the right temperature, and the fries were to die for. The customer service was excellent. The gal even have us directions to our next destination.  While it's a bit pricey, it's lobster for crying out loud. I highly recommend it! You will love it!!

q0WBRTIku9CbFx6CxGGtkw.text: First of all I'm from Chicago. You'll understand later. The Lobster log is excellent. But the same sandwich in Chicago cost about $5 less and is twice the size. Here in Vagas I had to keep telling myself I'm on vacation. The low rating is only due to the size of the sandwich.

xLn1LjcX7c6klwwJOkv4Yw.text: After an Elite event at Koi hubby and I were hungry so we stopped by lobster me for a bite. We ordered a large Maine lobster roll and some lobster bisque. Both were delicious. The lobster was tender and meaty and tasted really fresh! The sourdough bread bowl full of bisque was awesome. Scraping the sides with each bite made me happy. Pro tip: if you're a local you get 20% off!!! I was almost going to get their special. It was chowder fries. French fries topped with cheese sauce, bacon, clam chowder, and parsley. It sounded great, maybe next time :) the lobsicle looked delish too!! Think corn dog but with a lobster tail and thinner batter. We sat at the little bar top and enjoyed every bite of our meal. We will for sure return!!!!!

5gT99gsKVNFtOgjYTcx-AQ.text: Our favorite "Cheat Meal!" Lobster Me is the ultimate in decadent "junk food". It's worth every single delicious calorie. We have also always had great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grab a Sin City IPA and pair it with the Lobster Me Grilled Cheese and Lobsicle...Amazing!!!!

HQGUaen_Iw74gKZz0H-Qmw.text: Meh.  I dunno, it wasn't all that.   Located in the Miracle Mile Shops in planet Hollywood, and open all day.  Claim to have "the worlds best lobster roll".  I have to disagree, and this is based on taste, type of meat, and possibly luck.    Maybe I was unlucky to get an off-night lobster roll.  It was filled with claw meat, didn't get too much tail in my roll.  It's very lightly dressed, and while that may be a ploy to say,"we're not going to hide our fresh lobster taste!" what it ended up doing was make it painfully obvious that the roll was drenched in butter.  Lobster rolls I'm used to are more like lobster salad on bread.  And when I said filled, I didn't mean filled like bursting at the seams, I just meant that's what thye filled my sandwich with.  The bread to lobster meat ratio was something like 3:1, and it was tourist priced as heck, actually everything is here.  My wife got the lobsicle and the lobster ice cream.  I would describe the lobsicle as a split lobster tail tempura skewered and fried.  And the lobster ice cream was just a mild vanilla-ish ice cream with lobster meat.  It was ridiculous, like $5 for a small.  Don't get me wrong, I like weird Filipino ice cream, with corn and with cheese, but this just wasn't for me.    I'll eat here again maybe, but I probably won't get the lobster roll.  I'd probably just get the lobster and chips, but more likely, I'd save my appetite and my skrilla for Boiling Crab or Hot n Juicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster ice cream
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster roll

u1tkOs7x3WAOhj228dN5lw.text: This is my newfound love in Vegas (besides the buffets of course). Located in PH next to Fat Tuesdays, this place has everything lobster possible! Of course it's pricey, but what do you expect for lobster..  I've had the lobster grilled cheese, lobster mac n' cheese, cajun fries, and garlic fries. I've always wanted to try the lobster roll, but I don't think it's worth the price for a little sandwich. Everything I've tried is delicious and makes great drunchie food too ;) The cajun fries have a kick to it, but are flavorful! I'd get everything again in a heartbeat. I'll be back for you soon enough lobstaaa!

JLg-LVBYAK2qrhFAKzsOZg.text: Great customer service, nice location with eye candy.  My only grip was the amount of lobster in the sandwich. They said it was a 1 pound lobster, then deconstructed to extract the meat that goes in.  my question is why dont they just weight out 1lb of lobster meat then put that into the sandwich!   The side of fries i ordered tasted alot better than the roll. Again, if the price was appropriated with the amount of lobster i might be a return customer.

-x5LDa8Rhkav5H4R6pJ2mA.text: The lobster roll is only ok and is definitely overpriced compared to what is available elsewhere (not in Vegas, mind you).  I don't know if decent, reasonably-priced lobster rolls are that hard to find  in Vegas but the Lobster Me roll has less than 1/2 of  the lobster that Boston's Neputune Oyster's does but costs 80% as much.  Not such a good deal.  The lobster in the roll was kind of half way between the  Maine mayo style and the  Connecticut hot butter style.  Not a good compromise,  IMO.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $23 signature roll. Needs more butter. Only a snack. So miss Boston&#39;s Neptune Oyster.

4FhaFa7AFWuTjOa4JmCW7Q.text: It's a food court experience with a sit down restaurant price. The foods good. The ambiance isn't. The price was high. Good in a pinch.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheeses

4pM3SFWRHO9DPawVWMQmvw.text: We just arrived to Vegas and we decided to come here for our first meal. SATISFYING. We ordered the lobster man n cheese and surf and turf philly.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster man n cheese AND surf and turf philly

bALykO7vtSYOOibkCwz5jw.text: Good place to stop for a quick bite of Lobster!

NHglgrYmOWRnJGDh9OxWrA.text: Ok so I figure I better catch up on my reviews since I was on vacation going back and forth from Frisco to Vegas (home).   LM is the only thing on my brain when I am over at Miracle Mile shops area at Planet Hollywood.   Mmmm yum yes! Lobster Roll me up baby!  This is the location I frequent the most here in Las Vegas, ok so I was out with a group for dinner and a show, there were five of us at the time. The Staff had no issues getting our big ass order together. (Dan was super cool and patient with us)  We ordered a lot, no holds barred this night.  Lobster Roll Fish and Chips Lobster mac and cheese Lobster grilled cheese sandwich something, it was Amazing!!!  Chowder bread bowl Big basket of crunchy fried chips/fries Slaw   This visit was crazy but fun, I wish I could eat here every day but I know is not practical. I don't think I could ever get tired of their menu seriously.  I highly encourage ordering my three favorite items, lobster mac and cheese, fish and chips and lobster roll/sandwich.  In my opinion the prices are standard, I mean you get what you pay for, I think the quality is high and worth what you get. This is a specialty meal menu, you can't find Maine style lobster rolls or lobster mac and cheese on every corner.

s5BvGuMmca5yelWP5KtdFQ.text: Why is lobster have to be so expensive!?  Anyways lobster roll here is pretty solid. Huge chunks of meat in a soft roll. Crappy fries accompanied in a meal, but you don't probably care about the fries...  Jello shots next door at fat Tuesday while you wait, mmmkay?

vNrkXxyyFZcogEB3bI7sLQ.text: I've actually have been going here, but the first time I tried Lobster ME, I had the Connecticut lobster roll (I love lobster rolls lol) and knew I would go back to try the rest of their menu, which is exactly what we did.   This time there was a few of us so we got a couple of items: The Frenchy (brie/lobster panini), the Lobster Grilled Cheese, the Lobster Cheese Fries, the Beltway (lobster sandwich with old bay seasoning) and last but not least, the Lobster Mac and Cheese! We went lobster crazy!   The Frenchy (is the sandwich I had myself) is very light breading if you want something lighter than the grilled cheese. The grilled cheese was bomb too! All of it was bomb. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty much the best one for me though.  Definitely hit up this spot of you have a hankering for some lobster everything.

vz5UyPxM0IJrBuNmQ5lqKA.text: I'll be brief.  It is okay.  For a food court lobster roll, it is as good as one would expect, or maybe slightly better.  All lobster rolls (especially Connecticut style) are subject to being compared to the gold standard of all Connecticut style lobster rolls...Neptune Oyster House in Boston's North End.    I visit Planet Hollywood a few times a year for work and/or fun.  I have stopped by Lobster Me for a hot lobster roll twice.  Service was fine.  The roll is a little small.  It is really more of a big snack versus a meal, but that is fair considering the price of lobster.   I'm sure I will stop by for a late afternoon snack or something again.  Just won't go out of my way for it.

1c72q6dMUiJd13DvyQnMXQ.text: Noms!!! My friend and I shared an order of Clam Chowder and the crab fries. We were expecting something good - but Oh Man! this took us by surprise!  We opted for the chowder to come in a bread bowl and we devoured every piece of it! I loved that it wasn't too salty, not too thick or too runny... it was just right! The Crab fries were on a special menu and we felt although this place screams 'lobster', we just had to try the crab! I'm very glad we did because it was probably better than the chowder! I honestly was full from the two but couldn't stop shoving these fries in my mouth! I was addicted!   The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the lack of seating and how overpriced the food was. But I still enjoyed our meal here!

DukJ9QK9RsAAIeaJ1spL5g.text: There aren't too many places that you'll find a decent meal for a decent price in Vegas.  Fortunately Lobster ME has food that tastes great and the price won't break the bank.  This place is located inside the Miracle Mile Shops, in Planet Hollywood.  I didn't opt for the lobster roll like mainly everyone was doing, but instead got the crab cake burger, and was glad I did because it's a bigger portion than the roll, for about $14 and it comes these seasoned waffle fries which made for a perfectly delicious and filling dinner under $20 bucks.

-SjuMrrG3FRAEZDaiPceyA.text: Lobster ME is located in the Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood.  It looks like a very casual eatery like something you would find in the food court.  You order at the counter and pay.  The seating is very limited and at the time, it was very crowded but luckily we got a table.    I decided on the lobster roll which comes with fries, coleslaw and a drink.  I also ordered a lobster Bloody Mary cause I could not resist that it came with a lobster in the drink plus I love Bloody Mary's! My bf ordered the lobster mac & cheese and a beer.  Our total came out to I think about $60 or maybe it was more, I can't remember.  But all I know is I thought that it was ridiculously overpriced yes even though it was lobster.  For that price, I could of eaten a nice meal at a fancy pantsy restaurant.    The food itself was good but nothing that made me say wow. The lobster mac & cheese almost tasted like they just mixed in lobster to Velveeta mac & cheese. I did enjoy sipping on my lobster Bloody Mary and loved that I could walk around the mall with it!  The perks of Vegas!    Like someone said, the portions seemed a bit small for the price you pay.  Would I go back here? Probably not.  But at least I fulfilled my lobster cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bloody Mary
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

2CfC6eseeen7z-sBvkV8tA.text: Of course when in Vegas, always want to try something new.   This location is inside planet Hollywood right next to Fat Tuesday.   I got to try the Maine Lobster Roll. Overall it wasn't a bad roll yet I understand why it was priced around $20. It comes with cole slaw and some fried chips.   Only con was seating. Other than that, it's worth a good bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine style lobster roll

8Fd8y1PNVWemn-4IfPv4bQ.text: Lobsicle. Yasssssss. Mex street corn is great too. Great balance of flavors. Layers of flavors. Great addition to the menu. I stop by every time I'm in Vegas. Planet Hollywood. Great fast food.

7TalwS5cljhhcF7zI-1WNA.text: Stopped by this place in the mall. DELICIOUS ...had the lobster roll with mayo and a side of lobster bisque. The all delicious. Soup was so good I wish I had enough appetite for more. Will visit again when in Vegas!

wSMakar5UUp5ODq2nTF8rg.text: Great quick service fish/ lobster food. I ordered the fish and chips. Fish very good, crispy and moist. Loved the chips, had maybe old bay on them? Something similar. The tartar sauce was delicious. Next time I will get a lobster roll!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i7Ww_4I1izvUJLwm3iVKtw.text: Would've been a 4 star but my Lobster Tostada arrived with bacon!!  Isn't listed as an ingredient but it's there... Thankfully I'm not vegan, just don't care for bacon so I'll pick it off

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon comes on tostada but not listed as ingredient on the menu... caution vegetarians
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qE13GF9_SAuCnHYEr-SBig.text: Came here for a late night snack.   Food was good, we substituted for clam chowder instead of fries. We order the lobster grilled cheese.   It was really good, with large chunks of lobster in every bite. The clam chowder was the best, every scoop has clams in it and just the right consistency.   It is a fast food experience. Would come back to try more items.

4cOkNA70YPu1vMiYcz11xA.text: The fish and chips and lobster tacos were the better items on the menu from what we ordered.  We even ordered a second order of the tacos.  The lobster roll is small and not a mix, the lobster mac and cheese lacks flavor so I would say it was overrated.  It had a steady stream of customers, but was extremely slow with only one register.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac and cheese lacked flavor.  We didn&#39;t even eat 1/4 of it.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwich itself was small in comparison to other lobster rolls we&#39;ve had, mix on too was good, roll itself was lacking.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tacos are the business! Great flavor!

6YgwXGB0EI1XsBNRuRnsUw.text: Okay so I postmates'd food from here. It took over an hour for it to be delivered when it was an estimated 10-25 wait time!! I was so upset, but that's mostly a problem with postmates. But, the food sucked. I ordered lobster mac n cheese and it was SO DRY. There was BARELY any sauce and it had no flavor. I'm emphasizing on the so dry and barely any sauce because it was ridiculously dry. I got the lobster bisque as well. Not bad. But, the clam chowder was good! I just wish it didn't take so long to get my food, they had more flavor for their lobster mac n cheese, and improved their sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n cheesr

TJj8vHWdZg3NTuIjf6HIsw.text: ***Take the money you're saving on these bland, overpriced rolls and spend it on a cab to Luke's Lobster's in the Fashion Show Mall.**  After working a convention inside Planet Hollywood, my boss offered to buy me lunch and chose Lobster ME inside the Miracle Mile Shops. I was skeptical, because my previous experience with Lobster Rolls was with Luke's Lobster Rolls down the street (see my review) and LOVED IT. But my boss and his coworker were convinced this place was delicious and worth it..and who would say no to free lobster? ...well, let's just say I wish I had.   I ordered their New England Lobster Roll. I tend to be rather traditional when it comes to lobster and I'm not much for spicy, I like to taste the meat! But the roll was behind disappointing, I felt nauseous after eating it and immediately regretted my decision. This roll was little more than lobster stuffed on hot dog bun. The bun was not buttered or toasted and the meat was not seasoned. It was all just so bland and the price was higher than Luke's (although coleslaw and fries are included, whereas with Luke's they are additional) for a fraction of the quality.   I did like that you had options for you roll "style" (Cajun, The Connecticut, The Beltway etc) should you feel like getting creative and you can swap regular waffle fries for crab fries (which I did.) They weren't bad, but the sauce and the meat makes them soggy almost immediately.   Again, save your money and go to Luke's, you can thank me later. I swear to you the extra travel time is worth it!!

RvEqzc97j3JyNGToaeXHvw.text: I finally had the chance to stop by and check out this location of Lobster ME after hearing such good word of mouth from fellow foodies in Las Vegas.   I have to say the aroma had me excited to check out the menu items available.   We decided to try the traditional Lobster roll, Fish & Chips, Chowder fries, lobster mac & cheese and this delicious item "knuckle sandwich" omg it was so good!  We were super impressed by the flavor, everything was super tasty hot and FRESH. The staff was cool, I was not sure what to order that night and the LobsterME employee had some Awesome suggestions.   We will be back to enjoy this local location. I have visited the location in Frisco, I was hoping the consistency would be there and it was.   I am a Fan!

0258K3rZIvpWisGFqojEMg.text: Excellent lobster for a reasonable price!  We ordered the lobsicle (fried lobster in a tempura batter), lobster mac and cheese, and fries...worth every bite!  One star off for being in a location next to Fat Tuesday, a little hard to eat in their dining area with a long line for margaritas next to you.  Also, the lobsicle would have been great if there was more meat on it or perhaps 2 skewers, looked kinda small in my to go box.  However you like it, lobster you and Lobster ME!

jbBt2zyDAXUPEcFKMX2NYg.text: It's $18 for a lobster, chips and a slaw - it's really good, but worth that price? If you really wanted lobster you can pay $6 more at some of the neighboring restaurants and get a whole lobster.... But if you are a fan of lobster rolls (like I am for philly cheese steaks) then it's worth getting one and then calling it done.

eVbtVNIssb8ZXLPDRhg2lA.text: I wouldn't call this the best lobster roll I've ever had, but a) we're in Vegas, and b) we're in a damn food court!  So I would call this the best (and only) lobster roll I've ever had in a food court. We had the Connecticut and the Cajun lobster rolls.  My beef with lobster rolls (pardon the pun) across the board is one just isn't enough! They do pack a solid amount of lobster into these rolls. Lobster quality itself was good, but not melt in your mouth exquisite.   That being said, next time I'm in Vegas and craving a lobster roll, I'm all over it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll

bUrfea8AqnIV-ooSo3OoPw.text: Small portion of lobster on toasted roll. Only a few tables to sit at and tables were not cleaned after each patron/patrons left. Service a little slow.

dxbtFFlH3K4scccqiEoeyQ.text: 3.5 stars.  Pros: 1. The Beltway! $17 Warm Maine lobster tossed with Old Bay spice, shallots & chives, served in a toasted brioche bun, topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs.  2. Each sandwich roll comes with a side of homemade potato chips and cole slaw. Not bad for $17.  3. Big chunks of lobster meat.  Cons: 1 The Connecticut. $17 Warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter. - No FLAVOR!  Had to ask for a side of drawn butter to liven it up! 2. Lightly burnt the bun on the Connecticut. Poor form! Boo!!!!  Verdict:  I'd return again to try the Cajun!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut. Lacks flavor. $17. Skip it
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of beltway roll: warm Maine lobster tossed with old bag spice, shallots, chives and topped with butter toasted Panko
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The beltway! Yummy! $17

ld8BPi5oHRnuycMPd2HUaQ.text: Taste: The Original Maine Style lobster roll was good. The lobster meat tasted fresh, but didn't have huge chunks of claw meat like it does in the pictures. The Lobster Bisque was creamy and warming. I have to come back to try the Lobsicle (fried lobster tail...on a stick!).  Service: The cashier was very nice and helpful as he gave us some suggestions on which comedy shows are good in Vegas.  Value: I feel like the food was a little over priced. $17 for the roll and $9 for the soup. It's kind of what you expect with any food inside a casino on the strip though.   Ambiance: Seating area was a little dark, but I think that's on Miracle Mile Shops not Lobster Me. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine Style Lobster Roll + Lobster Bisque.

v9zrOJF0tThKZi8PzsB8gw.text: I've had Lobster ME on my bookmarks list for ages.   I don't go to the strip often, and when I do, its usually to eat somewhere else.    Saturday, I was at the Miracle Mile shops doing some shopping for my wedding, and was STARVING by the time I'd found what I needed.    We had walked by Lobster ME on the way to the store, and I decided that I wanted to eat here.   I was a little overwhelmed with the choices...Lobster rolls, Lobster Mac n cheese, Lobster bisque, Grilled cheese with lobster...Its not a huge menu, but all of the options looked great!  I decided to go with the Original Maine Lobster Roll with soup and a drink.   The clam chowder was delicious.  Thick, hearty, and seasoned well.    I'd never had a lobster roll before, but this was really good.  The bread was like a Texas toast consistency, with a little bit of mayo and a HUGE helping of cold lobster meat, seasoned with Old Bay.    De.Licious.   The lobster was amazing, and flavorful. There was a ton of it, too!  The bread had a great consistency.    I'd gladly come back here the next time I'm on the strip.  It was really great.

WFr4ZGsdPVR1YHCffoK_Pw.text: Diabetic boyfriend needed something to help his blood sugar. The guy at the front (feel horrible for not catching his name) let me cut in line and gave us a soda for free. Amazing! Of course I paid for the soda, but so pleased that they were so gracious and expected nothing. Kudos!!

-zR4dqanzZuiSGEZpDESNw.text: It can be a maze to get here. It's in between the Palazzo and venetian in the shops . There's also a planet Hollywood miracle mile shops location I've been to. Eaten  here quite a bit it's just alright. Nothing really wows me but it's good enough. The prices are decent . They use claw meat which to me is hit and miss flavor wise . I've tried mostly the whole menu except the lobster roll lol if can believe it. My favorite is probably the lobster Mac. The macaroni is sort of like velveeta but it all works for some reason .

0es5-5OoHhyeANAZhTg4AA.text: If you're on vacation and in a rush, but want dine-in quality food, look no further. Its definitely the type of food I search for on holiday. I had a traditional lobster roll while my husband opted for the lobster mac n cheese. My roll was perfect: the bread was well toasted, there was plenty of succulent lobster, and the overall flavor was great. Of course I had to try my husbands, and his was delicious too. My only critique of the mac n cheese was the container it was in; it could've been in the same container as the other items to get a better bite of all of the ingredients together (if that makes any sense). Of course it's a couple dollars more than I would want to spend normally, but let's be real: it's The Strip. What do you expect? And for this quality of seafood it's honestly a good deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hwBcXrCnshfksIlckYuxUQ.text: It was okay, but I've been spoiled by the overabundance of really good lobster in all forms in Maine. This place pales in comparison to even 3 Buoys, the least good lobster I've ever had in all of Maine. It scratched an itch for lobster when we weren't able to get rezos for the Sterling Buffet, but from now on I'll stick to Red Lobster when I'm not in the northeast.  The Connecticut lobster roll isn't on the board anymore but they took our order for it without batting an eyelash. The online menu says the lobsicle is tempura'd, but it's just lightly battered and fried. The lobsicle was better than the roll, but as the county fair will teach you, anything is tastier deep fried on a stick. Made me think of the Will It Deep Fry? series on YouTube.

kZVqxiSuX6DyGzyldtkvag.text: $30.00 cold frys all bread chopped in fine pieces just crap very overpriced don't waste your time here go to Luke's at fashion show mall

7luOEikzQwm4bp5XIWP6xg.text: I cannot say enough great things about this place.  My husband and I ate here on a whim the last time we were in Vegas and the lobster roll was so stinkin' good.   We just visited Vegas again, and my entire plan consisted of drinking, gambling, laying out by the pool and eating at Lobster Me.  I stayed at a casino way too far away from my beloved Lobster roll (won't make that mistake again next time), so I literally took a cab just to go get it.  Then, I texted my husband a picture of my lobster roll as seen here, and the words "mmmmm.....Lobster Me".  To avoid a very bitter husband, I had to agree to deliver one to him at the poker table a few blocks away.  My only complaint is that we really really need one of these places in Colorado.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is an unedited photo of the most amazing lobster roll I ate this weekend.  I will never visit Vegas again without eating here.

axg87TiFV2vQkJv_ne-ypQ.text: I never really ate lobster until I came here and ate the lobster roll. It was really good. I would have prefered it warm but it was served cold but still good. The garlic fries were out of this world.  There aren't too many seats here, especially because a family of what seemed like 100 pulled all the chairs together. But this experience made me really enjoy lobster- plus I was tipsy and tired of eating rice from Panda Express. I haven't had lobster since because I only want the roll from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll and garlic fries. Very yummy

vV4-VWd6UKml2nUCV4Txag.text: I got the Connecticut lobster roll.  It came with house made chips and coleslaw.  The roll was tasty.  It was everything I was expecting.  The chips were great too.  They were crisp and fresh.  I did not really care for the slaw.  This was definitely great to have tried a roll here, but $17 is quite pricey.  I would rather eat at a nice sit down restaurant and pay a little more, than eat here again.    I will not be back.

KtAPgttQ4VcDPHrK2H3XHg.text: Walk in to lobster me not s seat down restaurant great food and service ordered the lobster bisque clam chowder soup Lobster ME sandwich it's to die for highly recommended

uxqkz8n2aJyY3JigXpMxpw.text: A okay if you want lobster, but the lobster rolls are just a okay.  Big chunks of lobster but I just wish it was 1) a little big bigger  2) the bread was okay but not the best  Lobster mac and cheese was nothing special but it the lobster was good just mac and cheese probably could have used better cheese.

ZIFlvhiN0O4x2p2ELGNaEw.text: Always gotta get a roll or two here when in Vegas.  It was delicious and scrumptious!  I like the new twist they have with different styles.  I ordered the Siraracha lobster roll while my husband ordered the classic New England roll.  Fries were good too.  Didn't care much for the slaw.

lc930n-DcyOiUdUiVaXAiQ.text: Got the Lobster ME Signature Roll and the Maryland Blue Crab (lettuce wrapped).   Lobster ME Signature Roll The bread they use is excellent for the lobster but there was a great lack of care when it came to how they cut the roll.  It was cut at a diagonal and nowhere near down the center.  Having the roll cut at a diagonal meant way too little lobster for the amount paid.  The table next to us in the open seating area had the same roll, but appeared to have a better hand dealt to them in terms of amount of lobster in the roll.  I've had about 15 different lobster po-boys in my life and this place takes last (in terms of price and amount of lobster).  Maryland Blue Crab  The mixture (similar to a tuna salad mix), was decent.  The Blue Crab was definitely present in the mix, but it has a strong fishy smell you get when crab has sat  for a while.   We came here after going to Jaburrito the night before and used the 10% off coupon they gave us.   Jaburrito was excellent compared to Lobster Me (different type of food but I'd expect the same quality as Jaburrito).

8fhbpL_-QYEFh8E1Tgpgrg.text: Don't waste your time!  My first visit was shortly after they opened.  The service was very slow, but they were very busy.  The lobster??? on the lobster roll was very stingy, and unidentifiable as lobster as opposed to shrimp or crawfish or even sirimi, in some cases.  It was mostly bread. I just tried them again, and after twenty minutes (with three other customers...so they were SLOW), my lobster mac n cheese came out cool.  Not cold, but not even room temperature.  And this was after they stressed how hot it was.  I took one taste of a noodle (very metallic flavour) and took it back to them, stating it was cool.  15 minutes later the "night shift supervisor" came out and informed me that it still wasn't ready.  Did I want to purchase something else?  Were they nuts?  Over 35 minutes wasted waiting on food that never appeared.  They claim that they voided the sale, but I can see the charge on my credit card; we'll see if it goes away. Do yourself a favour, don't bother with this place!!!!!

X7TQGVYnHm9fEembAdobCQ.text: I saw this place walking around the Miracle Mile after getting a tuna melt over at Earl of Sandwich and I said to myself, "I need to try that place!'. I saw Lobster Mac N' Cheese on the menu and my heart jumped out of my chest. Ever since I saw/heard about lobster mac n' cheese on one of my favorite television shows Royal Pains, I've been wanting to have it. Honestly though, I had no idea it actually existed! It wasn't horribly priced for lobster I guess, but 10 bucks is still a little too much to drop for this dish, even though it was really good. The mac n' cheese was delicious. Made with what you could tell to be real cheese, flavorful, and the perfect texture (that mix of smooth and finely grated cheese). The lobster was only okay, which is why Lobster Me I don't think warrants any better than three stars for this dish. It was good, friendly service, but the food just didn't match up to my dreams and expectations of what it was going to be like. I don't regret trying it and if I'm ever back in Vegas someday soon I want to go back to try the lobster roll.

SPu5jr1t2hRRuvCHZrL9zA.text: i saw this place and told my brother this is your kind of place, not knowing really how good it was, just that he likes lobster, and i had gave up my room at planet hollywood so he could stay there so it was very accessible to him. when he finally did eat here, the following day, he ate here everyday and sometimes twice. and against my will he forced a lobster sandwich on me when i told him i was full ( i thought how good could it be?). so i took it back to the room and left it on the table. the next morning i knew i wouldn't have time to get a bite to eat, so i opened the bag took out the sandwich and took a bite and thought omg omg omg, cold and old this sandwich was still spectacular. i don't think it even had mayo in it, but rather crack, because it was so tasty and made you wanting more. mind you, if i went there, not knowing anything, i would have not ordered a 22 dollar sandwich, but man this sandwich was worth every penny. but if i go there i definitely will. when we left vegas my brother went online and ordered from here one more time. it's that good.

_QLaRMeKYxSOaZAFxPANKw.text: had the lobster n chips it was okay....  really overpriced.  $14.05 for four pieces of nuggets n fries.  its jus tempura covered lobster n fries  nothing too fancy.

nxd3_boYnKp9imw1IfeEAA.text: walking ...tired... hey a lobster place? gotta try something!  it all looked awesome but couldnt go for an $18 lobster roll (damn blackjack tables) so i sprang for a cup of lobster ice cream and a lobster shooter...both  were quite impressive...good size chunks of lobster in the ice cream, rich and sweet enough to veil the lobsterness not cover it up...the shooter was tasty chunky but half the shooter glass and no black caviar on top as pictured. lobster on a stick looked good but $14..maybe 10 bucks, will try lobster mac next time...

smrwVtS-dK_VCJeflLyb5w.text: went and line was ok. the cashier was helpful. the food was received in about 10 minutes. i ordered 3 sodas. it states that these drinks are large for $3 each. the actual size is medium. i ordered 1 lobster bisque, 2 lobsters and chips, and 1 mac and cheese. the mac and cheese was reviewed by my 6 year old niece and the mac and cheese did not meet her expectations. dont order it. the lobster mac and cheese didnt have a lot of lobster as displayed on pic. the lobster bisque was watery and lacked flavor. the best thing to order would be the lobster and chips.

oPm1hjLQeu413n16bmOXFA.text: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! All you can eat lobsicle!NOPE all you can buy! Prices high for little. Hope  this saves you from the False advertisement

1WhYi_ecB3FuOoRd3CFYZQ.text: Get the hot dog, only thing worth the money on the menu. I love lobster rolls but the size of this one was sad. For $18 roll I expected more than 3 oz. of meat. Hold off and spend your money on somewhere else.

olsL5Hp-8Gk5D8waZjwwfw.text: Food here was really good. I had the original Maine lobster roll and it satisfied my appetite really well. Customer service was excellent my lemonade was too. My take: food satisfies craving but not hungry, portions could have been a little bigger.

Qxiclst8j6_WJj-_BbSTAA.text: TINY sandwiches but at the same time they pile on the lobster!  If the roll was of normal size perhaps the amount of lobster meat would look as those they skimped.  Good quality but don't expect to fill up and DO expect to pay a lot.

dZ7SMUf20nswafd3JDEHRw.text: This pace has great lobster rolls, but be careful when you upgrade to a combo. They totally hosed us and didn't give us our fries. We paid $4 to add a 16oz soda to our lobster roll.

TvARW-vDJsxRP1YvR7ppDg.text: The pics look good but it's really just ok. Lobster was flavorless due to the fact that the lobster meat were previously frozen and not fresh. Nonexistent flavor. Freshness Would've made a world of difference. Considering it was more fast food and really pricey. $16 lobster roll, $12 lobster Mac n cheese (not baked or anything neat, just plain ol Mac n cheese with lobster meat thrown on top) eh. Eh.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really just A-OK. Not fresh-fresh lobster.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zVZpvhItbF-V4u65X6LYwA.text: Have been craving lobster rolls for such a long time; finally came here today with a friend :) And it was so worth the 30+ minutes drive. My friend got the original; I got the El Diablo rolls with fries, and they were both amazing. The bread was great because it was almost like a garlic toast, and it just made the lobster roll that much better.   A bit on the pricey side, but considering that it's on the strip, it's actually not too bad.   And locals get a 20% off!! :D I deducted one star because even though my friend's also from Vegas, she didn't get the discount... we think the cashier might be new.

zXgRJRkmMh2e77_gny55ZQ.text: Though the price was a little high for what you get, but it is lobster. I had the Maine and thought that was good. Not quite enough for a meal but a good light in between meal.

znn2enyyKSkZIzE-3nrEVQ.text: Came here on Wednesday... The portion and just the way the roll looked... was AMAZE balls.. But today which is Sat. ... The meat..  Small n the srevice kinda sucked. I guess if u wanna come here.. It's a hit or miss... Sadly to say.. Today a major miss.

V0lXkVMB0zJPnDmWsZnDhA.text: Gave this place a try for a quick bite while slotting away my money. Being from Maryland I had to try the old bay lobster roll. Ugh terrible there is no old bay on that sandwich. It was SUPER BLAND!  One thing old bay is not. Also I think it would have been better if there was more mayo on it and cold rather than warm. For $20 it was very disappointing. Staff was very nice. Put some more old bay on that roll!

U7-0-dZ5DEyC51Xa71PBtg.text: We got sucked in by the photo of a lobster on a stick. My sister loves lobster and had to try it. She said it was incredible. I had the lobster salad. It cost $12 but was more the size if a side salad rather than an entree. Despite that it tasted great. I would recommend this place the next time you are in the area.

jrlaEiFD-kDD6buGS-4hnQ.text: Actually came across this place by accident and was so grateful. The food here was amazing. I had the Cajan Roll and the Lobster Mac n Cheese. So delicious. Next time I'm back in Vegas, I'm getting me a Lobster Roll.

lAQKIT6K8QNIW_R3K2YpEg.text: You actually get alot of lobster for the money; very little filler unlike most places. I think all in all a good value and a must if you're into lobster, good rub on the "classic" roll.

YvO9AUXGINPrI_zsSat46Q.text: 5 stars for sure.  Excellent food and service. Absolutely scrumptious and very good service., especially for fast food.  Super fresh salad and amazing presentation.  Yum yum.

JheYtiJDPpiQ_qrayTctRw.text: I should have known lobster and fast food does not mix, but obviously gave it a try and right away you can taste the old, flash frozen low quality lobster meat. Its an ok place but you are much better off eating at those infamous lobster trucks which actually have high quality fresh lobster!

yX-8x3PzbG8dJQ7QzzZZKw.text: Lobster Me is delicious. The price was well worth it. I was a little skeptical at first about the price but it was really good. I had the Cajun and fries. The Cajun is a little spicy but I loved it. The fries are really good but they should put more on the plate. If you are in Vegas and love lobster, try this place.

GSo43f4LO97HOnUoZvmtCA.text: I thought this 24 hour restuarant was a pretty good idea to have here considering there is nothing else like it here on the strip that i can think of...  its located in the shopping mall of Planet Hollywood right next to the place where you get those big tall drinks and on the way to Earl of Sandwich! lol So you can get this as an appetizer on the way there like we did! lolol  I ordered the small lobster roll for 16.00. I thought it was a little expensive but then soon realized that we were in the middle of the dessert which is why its a few more dollars. The roll was warm, and lightly toasted. What kind of puzzled me was that the lobster was cold. I automatically assumed it was going to be warm and drenched with butter. i was not dissappointed just a little surprised by the combination of the warm roll and cold lobster. Nonetheless, it was good especially if you are a seafood lover like me.  Big chunks of lobster cold or warm will always make me happy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. small lobster roll

A-KyAJRrMfrChCdodZDgFw.text: I've been dying to try this place after seeing the pictures. Well, presentation was awesome... Looked just as appetizing in person. I ordered the large Cajun roll. The gentlemen told me if I liked a kick to chose that one. There was no kick, and the seasoning lacked a little bit. I had to add hot sauce. Besides that, you can tell the lobster is good quality and fresh. Very meaty. I found the large a little small, I can't imagine how small the small is for the price they charge. Overall pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll (large portion)

However, one won't fill you up. Maybe not even two. The fish tacos are awesome as well. Service is friendly and they wernt too busy.

peSpMwulGQ-pH79ZCxOiJA.text: The "Lobsicle" is ridiculously delicious!  I stumbled across this place while walking through the Shops at Planet Hollywood... A lobster tail on a stick... GENIUS!  I wish I lived closer :)  Very friendly staff and quick service! Can't wait to go back!

KhEamCaYQJK_I1X_gZ8Tzw.text: What can I say I saw a lot of reviews about this place on yelp Instagram Twitter about that place so I wanted to check the hype. And yes that hype was amazing.  Food is good so with that mango beer and  Lobster Roll. It lived up to the hype that I saw on Yelp and Instagram and Twitter.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q7Hefc_wJbPhBIGOc6R0bQ.text: Not for the faint of heart. If you plan to make this your meal get ready to pony up. Because in a pinpanpun your order gets over $30. I order two plates w soda and got lucky $42 but it is not like I lunch and dine at place everyday and I HAD to experience it :)  If you want to taste lobster by all means get the lobsicle see picture. Small grilled or battered small lobster tail that tastes great and fresh.  The lobster mini tacos were great tasting too but I could taste the lobster if I looked for that bite. So it is a good plate but doesn't scream lobster flavor.  Service was quick and friendly. Place is inside miracle mile shopping plaza next to Fat Tuesday drinks. For sure it is enjoyable place good food people watching afterwards and then stroll window shopping. Nice to get off the Vegas Sun and heat.

7FYts5akCWZ7IvffBR9hcw.text: Let's give this another try. The first time I had Lobster ME, I was not impressed. I tried the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was horrible!  No flavor and it didn't even taste like Mac and Cheese. I only came back here because Gordon Ramsay Burger was too busy to take carry out orders and I was in a rush to get back to the hotel.   Lobster ME is located inside of Miracle Shops Mall in the little food area next to Fat Tuesday's. I stood in line for a good 15 minutes before my order was taken and there were nothing but about 4-5 people ahead of me. That is ridiculous! Then I waited another 10 minutes for my food to arrive. So not worth the wait. One star knocked off.   Instead of the Mac and Cheese, I got a lobster roll which wasn't bad. It was seasoned well and they used big pieces of meat. The problem? The roll was 80% bread and 20% lobster. Lobster rolls are already small, but they cut the tiniest slit into the bread and pretty much just plopped a little lobster on top. Every time I picked it up, all the lobster fell out. Another star gone.   I would come back here as a last resort if I couldn't get to Luke's Lobster on the other side of the strip outside of Fashion Mall. WAY BETTER service and quality.

Ydz_BJ3sEcItP6jeWsnRlA.text: One of my fave places for lobster rolls in Vegas. I come here every time I visit. Lots of options and a bigger menu than most of the lobster roll places out here. Amazing staff and amazing food! Every item is full of flavor. Most places just have the plain lobster rolls, but this place lets you dress us up or down. You can add lettuce, tomato, bacon... All the fixings. A must if you're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xOmy21tYT9Z3P5oJitHQMg.text: Original idea of simple lobster rolls and tacos  The trio tacos was good and it has fish, shrimp and lobster also the lobster roll and the lobster soup  This is fast-food self-service place

MNnjupGF5Q0LZphpiInMkQ.text: I heard ravessss about this place. And yet I'm still trying to figure out what the hype was all about. Located in the Miracle mall, I had walked by this place a dozen times and finally was excited to try this place out!  I ordered the New England Signature Lobster Roll which costed a whooping $24 bucks.... I was actually surprised it came with fries so I guess that made it a bit more worth it. If it was just the roll alone..yeah that's pretty expensive. (I can go to slapfish and get a roll for 16 and it tastes better then this). I wasn't too impressed with the taste and I wouldn't say its worth what I paid for. I still can't find the hype in the roll. Maybe I should have ordered the lobster mac? Either way I can't justify paying that much again for anything on the menu here.  Yelp Review 2017 Challenge 68/100

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New england signature lobster roll

2b8LqS67aVKn3v1IVSg4Uw.text: This was a great meal for the price. Surprisingly it was a light meal at the same time filling. Quality of the lobster was great. The Mac and cheese was very good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gMAhbxBBgHefEScNP_p8fg.text: Can't go wrong with a lobsicle and waffle fries!  I have no idea what anything else here is like.  We have been here on each visit to Vegas because my husband looks forward to going to the mall for a lobster tail on a stick and a beer.  Always a fun little stop in the middle of the mall.  I don't like seafood, but I have a little bite every time and it's pretty good for even my anti-seafood taste buds.  We also ordered some waffle fries this time which were crispy and delicious.  Oh, always get the battered fried lobsicle, the naked one isn't as good.

FKgNJZsV4zmjHiTikIw4BA.text: The quality of the 6 inch lobster roll was good but I felt that it did not deserve the exorbitant price. ($30.00 with tip ....for a 6 inch lobster roll, small fries and ice tea...served in a paper basket with a plastic fork)  The lobster was seasoned perfectly and the meat was tender. The bread was a bit thick for the amount of lobster so I had to pull some off to balance the taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 6 Inch Lobster Roll

-I8gtmWijao4uHxI7p2HFw.text: After spending a couple hours at a nearby pool, it was time for lunch, and for some reason I was thinking LOBSTA. Yes, just like that with the Boston accent.  On our way to getting Fat Tuesdays, we checked out Lobster ME (for Maine duh); I had passed by this spot countless of times but it's mostly been closed. For the weekend we went, we separated our team into two lines: one for the booze, and one for the seafood.  Lobster ME offers plenty of great wholesome foods infused with lobster meat. They've got it all from classic Lobster Rolls to more creative fare such as the Lobster Mac N' Cheese, Crab Nachos, and Lobster Fries. Our group grabbed a bunch of these starchy goodness and everything was pretty good. The mac n' cheese was by far my favorite.  As for me, I ordered the Mexican Cobb Salad ($16) which was topped with lobster meat, black beans, and corn. It was my attempt at being a bit healthy during the weekend, and I felt I succeeded very well in that department. The salad was refreshing and the bits of lobster meat sprinkled on top added a lot to the dish.  However good the salad was, I probably would go for the fries or mac n' cheese as my favorite of the dishes we tried. The spot is definitely worth a visit so grab a bite and sip on some Fat Tuesdays to enjoy your Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac N&#39; Cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican Cobb Salad with Lobster
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries and nachoes

m4UBRJQ-TmPIneOfY_rzIw.text: Lobster me is amazing and one of my favorite parts of the shops at planet Hollywood. It is expensive but that's to be expected when you are ordering lobster. (Or eating anything on the strip for that matter) all of the lobster rolls I've tried have been amazing. Just make sure that if you get the fries that you get them chowda style! Loaded with New England clam chowder. So delicious. It's expensive and there aren't a lot of places to sit but it is good quality food with large pieces of claw meat. They do offer a military discount. (Possibly a locals discount but I can't remember for sure) I will continue to eat here when I'm back in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the chowder fries !

AD2goCMnp5Row8zq1bwVEA.text: We were looking for a quick and inexpensive lunch. I was really craving a lobster roll - but most of the ones in Vegas are over $30! Lobster ME is located inside the planet Hollywood shopping plaza near the Fat Tuesday drink stand.   They sell lobster rolls, other seafood rolls, lobster mac, and many other lobster dishes. For the rolls, you can customize your "style" like New England or siraccha. We got the signature lobster roll New England style for $24. Good thing is that each sandwich comes with fries, coleslaw, and a pickle. The pictures on yelp and their stand are definitely deceiving! For $24, you would think it would be overflowing with lobster....  I would give the sandwich a 3.5/5 for taste - I've had better lobster rolls that were very juicy and buttery. This one was okay....the lobster was good but not amazing and for $24 not worth the large price tag! I would opt for chipotle or some other fast food joint for a more filling meal. However, if you are in the mood for lobster rolls, I would try this place out because it is probably cheaper than other nicer restaurants on the strip. It's also fast so you can grab and go without worrying about time constraints.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8fgLIG_pxLkFb0-E1Xr61A.text: I was drawn to this place because of the unique menu. I ordered a lobster taco and a fish taco. Total came to about $14.50. Fish taco was much larger than the lobster. The food tasted great but the ordering process is slowwww. If a customer orders a drink, the cashier stopped and made it herself. With her being the only cashier at lunch, the line moved at a snails pace. The tacos were cute, but at this price point, I wouldn't rush to come back.

IrXv8Rs8fiqyyz5rSKftFg.text: Really disappointing when you think you're going to have the best meal after seeing an amazing show in Planet Hollywood. The Lobster Mac n Cheese was good, however the best part of it was the Mac n cheese. The lobster tacos I ordered without tortillas were just so-so. I think the downfall of this place is that the lobster is just not that fresh.  If it's over 100 degrees outside, it's going to be hard to keep seafood super fresh. When in doubt, stick to non-seafood items in the summer on the strip! The presentation looked great and service was very good here - I think if I visited here in the fall, winter, or spring, I would have felt differently about the product.

GL74zJ4vYplhVskjdyb7gg.text: I chased Lobster ME the whole time while in Vegas. The last day there my family and I were able to indulge in all their goodness. The Lobsticle was a bit pricey but worth every penny. I'll definitely find my way back when I'm in Vegas!!!!!!

wMr0LrfFKnEjbfoYcBqtRQ.text: Soooo about Lobster me..I tried The 50/50 roll dog, in which had lobster & crab...and styled it up Cali style...and an order of the 3 taco plate...(fish, shrimp, lobster) which I should of gotten for myself because it was very delicious...Honestly the roll was not that good...it didn't have any flavor...maybe I should of gotten one of the other rolls..it felt very dry..ate it anyways because I was hungry :(...the tacos on the other hand were full of flavor..I also tried the lobster Mary...it was really bad..I wanted to Like it but the flavor was nasty! (Not to mention pricey..take your money else where)

sE0nfSd1CVyKOEB2TH10XA.text: A great option if you're hungry as long as the line isn't too long.  I just wish they had more seats to enjoy their food.   Their lobster poor boys are damn good.   If you're happen to be staying at Planet Hollywood or Paris, I'd suggest just taking your food to go.

gTGwJ3L-ZkBU5k8pv6I-xA.text: this is inside the Planet Hollywood shops-towards the bend.  if you like lobster then you will enjoy earing a sandwhich from here. nothing fancy, just lotsa lobster seasoned in butter and chives and drenched with cheese and the smashed inside a roll. combe with fries and a drink will cost you 25 bucks ...taste hella bomm tho!

wMVVAIuIY-lync8CQMAnCA.text: We'd just arrived in Vegas and were walking around the Miracle Mile shops when we realized we should find some food.  Lobster Me is in the food court area.  The menu sounded intriguing so we decided to eat here.  I'm so glad we did.  We had the Cajun lobster roll with Cajun mayo and spices (request warm lobster meat), the batter fried Lobsicle, and a Wicked lemonade.  I'm impressed.  The Lobsicle is fried lobster on a stick...who doesn't want that?!?!  Everything was good.  I would have liked to return here for a quick bite to eat, but there are so many places to try in Vegas that I had to bypass a second stop.

6-kN4OmAeLkyu5pSN0VgSw.text: I came here during one of my visits within past 6 months. I decided to bring hubby here since he is a sandwich lover. He fell in love. We came here the next day as well. We love the Beltway much better than regular lobster roll. If you check in on Yelp, there is usually some kind of chowder you get for free. I am just addicted to the cheese lobster fries. It is mandatory included in my order. The mac & cheese was good but doesn't beat the fries. This is definitely a place to stop by for us during our next Vegas visit

-EPETUMkS-qQwgSKaitSow.text: My friend and I actually accidentally ran into this place after talking about it being in Miracle Mile Shops!  And boy was I glad we found it!   I'm def a crab type of girl when it comes to shellfish.. but Lobster Me got my friend and I with their Lobster Grilled Cheese and Lobster Mac N Cheese! Both filled with tons of lobster meat and different cheeses!  As to some dishes you get tired of the cheesiness.. These two, on the other hand, had us finishing every bite -- two cheesy dishes that didn't have the same cheeses and lobster def balanced it out!  Will definitely be back for the other items!

NnHpgxiqLA0S4zlniS7wzg.text: Every time my friends and I see this place we have to stop and get something even if we had it earlier.   It is that good, if you are a seafood lover.      It's all about their Maine roll with a toasted bun, YUM!!!   I wasn't really into lobster until this place.   Hands down, a must in Vegas!

PiG3pjundTRtocUJnmbSig.text: Just the best! If you love lobster you have to try the offerings here. FRESH! I got a Conn. roll as I am not a huge mayo fan. The drawn butter on the lobster was perfect as was the roll - done how it should be, crispy yet soft on the inside.I normally do not like coleslaw but this one was amazing. The dish also included potato chips that were nicely seasoned and crunchy. My friend got the lobster mac, enjoyed every bite and was so full at the end. She gave it a 4. (she wished it had been a tad cheesier but that could be personal taste) That said, she would get it again. Staff could not have been nicer and we were really appreciative of the samples of clam chowder and lobster bisque. (you have to ask!) So many things I am excited to try the next time I am in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I can die happy now! Connecticut roll, $17. Delicious!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG!

cTrHvt6wkHBayV6REd45gQ.text: I can't say I am the lobster roll expert, but this lobster roll was a tasty two bites that did not disappoint. I shared it with a friend and I had two bites. It is small...very small. I've had lobster rolls before and this was on the smaller side. The bread was buttered and greasy and the lobster was buttery. Who wouldn't enjoy that? $17 for a roll.   The lobster Mac and cheese wasn't my favorite. The cheese had a fake taste like instant Mac and cheese type taste. $12  I'm guessing if you're on the strip and drunk willing to blow some money or you just happen to be there and you were hungry, you would probably enjoy your meal. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with fries and lobster Mac and Cheese

oqHulUtql6nExLtY2Uyt5w.text: Walking around miracle mile shops I had this feeling in the pit of my stomach that Lobster Me was located here but yelp was acting slower than a snail at this time. When I saw that gold sign I swear I squealed like a little piglet!    lobster grilled cheese $11- so damn good. Right amount of cheese with the right around of lobster! It had different cheeses inside & not just american.   Lobster Mac & Cheese $12- this was the highlight of my day! I've been wanting to try lobster Mac & Cheese forever. It was so delicious with so much lobster meat. It wasn't dry or overcooked which was perfect! It is a little portion but I think it was a good amount to be shared by 2 little girls like us.   I want to come back and try everything on the menu. So, see you soon lobster me!
