UT6mCg8WzrhROIybfQNMZA.text: Quality lobster rolls!  I have been to Lobster Me for a few times during my recent Vegas trip. The restaurant is located in a mall connected to Planet Hollywood hotel and it does not offer any table service. Customers order at the counter and then pick up at the registry when called.   The menu of lobster roll is simple but offers good varieties. My favorites are the Maine Lobster and Cajun lobster roll. There are generous portion of lobster meat inside each roll and the bun is super soft and served warm. Standard lobster rolls come with coleslaw as well.  As for prices, lobster roll is around $19 each, which is OK considering it is Vegas. I find one lobster roll may not be filling enough for dinner and you may need to supplement the meal with fruits/salad/soup to feel full.   Overall, a decent place for Lobster roll.

ji0UN7DOuuzjQ65pefp4QA.text: I love lobster! I crave lobster rolls and lobster bisque soup, often. This place, just didn't impress me, my taste buds, or my overall expectations. It's located in the Miracle Mile shops, which is a great place to shop, eat/drink off the strip, or just people watch.  The manager, was very nice I'll add, and offered my man and I, a sampling of the New England Clam Chowder and Lobster Bisque Soups. The NYCC, was OVER salty. My gosh. A tad too overpowering, for the basic taste that soup can offer. The Lobster Bisque was good, but not comparable to seafood restaurant quality of course. Both were at the right temperature.  We decided to split a sandwich and chowder fries. The sandwich had about 5 large pieces of lobster chunks on it and the bread was toasted and seasoned. It just didn't have enough sauce, the lobster could have had some flavoring or be butter-dipped and the fries were just okay, with the sauce/dip kind of thrown atop, but mainly coating just a few of them on top.  We left somewhat bummed, especially at the price and despite the long line, but I did hear the Lobsicle and Lobster Grilled Cheese Melt, are pretty tasty.  I just don't foresee returning, at this point.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p1gcpDv3zeNZ5dUAcDidXQ.text: Quite expensive but what do you expect? Its lobster!! We ordered the lobster roll, the lobster mac n cheese, and the fish and chips. Everything was on point! Serving size is a little small for the price. My favorite was the mac and cheese!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

FrWksVl48ZaJ0dFaiTN-LA.text: I highly recommend the crab fries!  We also got a lobster sandwich BLT style.  Impressive flavor in the food.  It does take a little bit to get your food, so be patient!

YbWFsVFy8QJifGn2SlgPKQ.text: I think maybe my expectations were just too high. I have a high bar for lobster in general. I love seafood, and read some reviews before eating here. Must say the presentation looked delicious, and the staff was very friendly. I ordered the main lobster, the surf n' turf philly, and the lobster Mac and Cheese. All were just ok, but ended up spending over sixty five bucks. Quite pricey for food that I was not too crazy about.  Huge let down. Waffle fries were okay, but as soon as they get warm, it loses its crisp which is the best part. I also went late at night right before it closed which is convenient that it opens late on Saturdays (midnight), but again, totally not worth it. Maybe my expectations were too high. Brought it back to hotel to eat in the room. Walked about 8 minutes before I actually ate it. Maybe would've been better if I ate it there while hot. Can't say for sure.

xzucOVNt_AIqaFJzkZqLmg.text: Located in the Miracle Mile Mall by Planet Hollywood. Free parking out back definitely worth trying items here are made to order and fresh. Friendly reminder staff spoke with the GM cool guy they have plans to do specials like the crab fries running currently. Very casual a little pricey but hey it's high quality and it's Maine lobster so get over it and give it a try!

FnHKwWavyWrY9gSHR0NLfQ.text: Oh Lobsta, Lobsta, Lobsta! I do luv all things crustacean so you didn't have to drag me here for a lobster roll. I've actually had some off the food trucks in Cali and really enjoyed them. So I was eager to try the one's here. Combo Lobster roll with Garlic Tater Tots ~ yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs... They offer 2 sizes medium or large. I went with a medium and I have to say it had a decent amount of lobster meat in it. The roll was buttered and grilled up on both sides. It was perfect meat to bread ratio. I went with the original flavor with a touch of mayo and lemon. The menu only listed garlic fries but I like tots so I asked for switch-a-roo and asked for my tots to be married with garlic. Here is my close up of the lobster seconds before it was consumed yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs... Ladies there is no pretty way of eating these so just shove it in your mouth and enjoy! Worry about the mess later LOL! It can get pretty pricey depending on what you order. In the end it is lobster meat that your getting. Eyes ~ Oh Lobster Meeeeeee! Nose ~ I smell a hint of garlic from my tots!. Ear ~ Peeps walking by. Mouth ~ So very very good!. Tummy ~ Satisfied!

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll and garlic tots.

oi7qvS7EMUOyoUuGFy3BWQ.text: Mediocre lobster roll place (good for Vegas considering ). I ordered the cajun roll. Good overall, decent amount of tender lobster, the  sauce was good, nice and spicy. They serve it with chips and cole slaw (nothing special).

0YR_-KKJviRVgkYZPa9IfA.text: Amazed by how incredible the miracle mile was we decided to try this spot. Going to graduate school in the New England area I fell in love with Lobster Rolls so I immediately gravitated to this spot. My GF had the Lobster Tacos and I had Lobster Roll Conn. style. They loaded the roll with lobster and the bread was extremely buttery. How could they go wrong with that combo? That's right they didn't- they hit a homerun!  If you are in Vegas hit this spot in PH!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get in my Belly

H4zLFUWHV6t6Hoo4hNsf_Q.text: 4.5 stars! I'd been craving a deliciously buttered lobster roll for quite some time and when I turned the corner in the Miracle Mile mall I nearly lost it! So happy this place was as good as I had hoped it was.  I ordered their traditional roll, New England style and the hubby ordered loaded crab fries with lite cheese sauce. We both truly enjoyed it and I'm sure I'll be back before we leave! Only downsides-very limited seating and there was a bit of lobster shell in my meat :(but a little is typically expected) As for price, lobster rolls in my experience have always been a bit pricey, throw in the fact that you're eating in Vegas and the hefty price tag makes sense to me.

DK56VFW4ItF2zKasubFbXw.text: This spot has the best sandwiches!!! They cost you though. It's honestly the best 25.00 dollar sandwich and worth the money. Yard bird costs just as much but doesn't taste nearly as good. I love this place when I have family in town I recommend this place to family. Like I say it is expensive but it is really good the lobster tastes  fresh and the people are friendly. This lobster is always fresh. I can't say that enough. This place goes hard

1YAMPwpCNvFVt61ujat-WQ.text: Great food (outstanding lobster). Manager Amber definitely cares about pleasing her customers. I will definitely come back. Great Vegas food spot.

4Bgz6aEuuv6i3kc2iVzE6A.text: Oh, sure enough, I had the lobster in my mind to order. What else could it be but that's it, is what is the main item served in this place! Lobster, lobster, l-o-b-s-t-e-r! The succulent mighty of crustaceans!  Browsing in the Miracle Mile Shops inside Planet Hollywood for the shopping adventure, this little eatery called "Lobster Me" got me intrigued to stop by and dine for my northeastern hunger for lobster, which is one seafood I favor. To lobster lovers, this may just be the place to dine ala fast food. A cozy group of tables and chairs are set up in front of this eatery, where I may add is a good place to just take a slow and easy time to eat and watch people, er shoppers, as they go passing by.   A variety of 'World's Best Lobster Rolls' to choose from ranging from spicy, cajun, BLT, lobster with seafood, or the southwestern shrimp roll. The Lobster choices range from 'Large' to 'XL' ( Extra Large). Dish out less than twenty dollars for the 'Large' roll size of more than a pound of lobster meat while dish out over twenty dollars for about two pounds of lobster meat in the 'XL'. The "Original ME Style Lobster Roll" is the traditional Maine, New England sandwich. It looked mighty enticing as seen as a sample roll displayed behind the glass-walled food cubicle and so, it beckoned for an order of it. It's about a large lobster claw meat and chunks of lobster meat dressed with a dollop of mayonnaise and lemon in a spicy mixture on a slightly crunchy bread roll. Tasty! hmm,soar to New England! Should try "The Diablo" for the spicier tasty roll. aaah, dream of dripping in warm sea water! For soup cravings, there's the "New England Clam Chowder" or the "Lobster Bisque" soup. Ha, could be listening to ocean waves in the distance. Glancing up to the menu, find a cocktail 'Lobster Shooter' or 'Lobster Shooter with Vodka' or opt for the beer. Okay, so get that little seasick effect. If you are a late morning riser, fret not, because a Breakfast Menu is served as well...lobster with eggs, with waffle, with MEmuffin, with tater tots. That is coool! eat breakfast any time. There's lobster grilled cheese, lobster mac and cheese, lobster and chips, and 'The Lobsicle', that is lobster tail on a stick. Feeling like caught a lobster by a stick spear. Oh, there's salads and, and, ice cream. Yes, ice cream, I scream for it (in my mind, only, as you should know it, can't scare diners away, so can't really scream out aloud), the Lobster Ice Cream is a light creamy, slighlty salty tasting lobster chunkiness swathed in finely iced, milky tasting ice cream. That's it? Must I say any more, what else? but lobster in ice cream!    As landlocked is Vegas, so it is as seafaring into deep waters for a lobster dish which was just served as fast food. It didn't take me to a breezy, oceany lobster trap...aah, at least just for that moment.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ME, World&#39;s Best Lobster Rolls at Planet Hollywood
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ice Cream and Lobster Scramble &amp; Tots
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original &#39;Maine Style&#39; Lobster Roll

TUj2Tw7R7HG3BtdfEbciTQ.text: Gotta go for the Original Lobster Sandwich Large. Best lobster in Vegas hands down. Lobster Mac and Cheese was OK, kinda bland.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Lobster Sandwich Large

OGMNyk2LMlW7aVGDJv7_EA.text: What a rip off!  Stingy with the lobster in the lobster roll and soggy chips.  The only reason I am not giving this one star is the clam chowder, while overpriced was very good.  What was I thinking paying $34 for fast food.  Never again,.

QNiVFt-fktfVL16WJXuFdQ.text: Lobster Roll on fire!!'  I secretly wanted to go back and order another roll to stuff in my purse for later, but I didnt want anyone to to judge me ;-/

m-EZdhUHlNm3Koaq2A_-Aw.text: This was okay for a lobster roll. It was a little bland for me. I Ordered the Cajun roll. And it was the best out of the rest.

7qm7enHvY9xR3y4p-3BIsw.text: Hands down as good or better than any lobster roll I've had, and I've had some of the most renowned in the country.  Wife and I had the large lobster roll, large Cajun lobster roll (spicy good) and tots.  Ton of pieces under 3 good sized pieces of claw meat, the rolls were soft and tasty.  Tots were perfection.    A lot for a fast food type of place, but if you love lobster or lobster rolls, highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Lobster Roll &amp; Perfect Tots combo.  Delish.

14zWS1nevjK_UZhzyeXxEw.text: Connecticut Lobster Roll, yum. Toasted texas toast, warm buttered lobster, what more do you need? Oh yes, chips and coleslaw. I love that it comes with chips and coleslaw, some places it is just the roll for the same price.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut Lobster roll with chips and coleslaw.

TJ9LAHj-lM_xWAuzr7wKtw.text: Decent lobster roll joint in vegas. I would come here anytime I'm in vegas and craving some lobster. I am from the bay area so there are definitely way better lobster rolls out there, but for vegas this place will do. I got the original lobster roll which I thought was pretty good along with the combo of chowder fries, coleslaw and a drink (~$26, for this price I'm not sure it's worth to get the combo unless you really want to try the fries and sandwich), and someone else in my group ordered the grilled cheese w/ Lobster (~$11) which debateably is the better thing to order.

ZsNknnAW7D66YS7y46TUiw.text: MUST.  TRY.  I had found this place a long time ago (being from New England I've been craving a good Lobster Roll for a long time) and hadn't tried it.  Was recently in the shops at PH and gave it a go - even though it is pricey, it's worth every single dollar.  I don't even know how many lobsters were used in the preparation of my roll (I'm thinking about 5?), but they were enjoyed SO MUCH.  The lobster mac and cheese was delicious as well, but not quite as good as the roll.  Just had the regular roll - will be back in the future to try the special ones and report on those.  I'm hungry just thinking about it...

8-BnMdqB9bF1iuKT3zzeTw.text: This place ROCKS! I normally only get lobster if I'm out for a fancy meal. This was such a treat  to just get to eat fresh, delicious lobster in a fast casual setting. I've eaten here twice now. First time I had Lobster Grilled Cheese,this was very rich oof! But good of course. Chowder fries were OUT OF THIS WORLD good! 2nd time I had the Lobsticle and lobster cheese fries. I dont know which one was better. Melt in your mouth!!! Of course, this place is not cheap because this is REAL lobster but who cares. DELICIOUS!!!

5cnW6bWdUWbiH8WVfc4hMw.text: Portions are a lot more than San Francisco! Coleslaw is a pass but comes with roll.  Some chips are soggy due to being placed with the roll. I am in love' lobsta me now! :)

t-ak-GHaBHxYNNCudX5QPA.text: My free gift card made the price even more reasonable.  "El Diablo" was mildly spicy and full of flavor.  I was warned of how spicy it was and usually laugh when people warn me about spiciness.  I may have a white face but my stomach and mouth must be Thai.    The lobster portions were generous even for the "medium" size.   The staff was knowledgeable and friendly.    Overall a very pleasant experience, especially for mall food.

hggoqoU7TGQZyyC65z8Jyw.text: This place should be called Lobster Meh.  My friend and I were shopping at the mall and decided to try this place.  She is a lobster bisque connoisseur, but trying it was a disappointment.  It tasted of roux with a little lobster base. What it did have going for it was a lot of cryovac lobster pieces in it.  The lobster mac and cheese was alright, but void of any real lobster meat, although it was garnished here and there with some of the same lobster pieces they used in the bisque.     I ordered a long island iced tea and the cashier kept trying to push this fishbowl vessel on me.  I'm a local and I will not be seen walking around holding and drinking out of a fishbowl.  The drink was mostly sweet and sour mix  anyway.    Save your money and dine elsewhere as this place is highly overrated and overpriced.

0YyEnR3ZCtQakxpc8JaNnQ.text: If you like Lobster, you will like this spot. Very unique foods all with lobster twists. Sort of pricey, but hey its lobster. Definitely worth a try. Had the lobster sandwich and it was pretty good. Next time I will try the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QuSF2pY5lhwWcfwfI9JxJw.text: I love lobster rolls and this place had such great reviews I had to try it.  It was pricey, but lobster is expensive, so I didn't mind as long as it was good quality.  The first bite was great, but upon subsequent bites, I bit down on shell twice.  No one wants to crunch on a shell when trying to enjoy lunch.  Would not return.

fxxIGWIyImP8IcPeezxpGw.text: It all started with a heartwarming greeting from Rebecca, she was wonderful, how she honored my dad's wishes when he ordered and made it a joy to order. As she was helping my dad her smile radiated to everyone else in line, and comforted and served them like melted butter!! Next, the food came. We're from New England and I was raised on lobster, and used to what lobster rolls should be, and believe me! This one is just like it! Loaded with lobster and sides toasted to perfection JUST LIKE IT SHOULD BE, believe it when you order from Rebecca you'll be taken care of. Great experience, perfection!

zEUpLJdyawKFdDIS4P9QIg.text: Let me preface by saying I grew up in Maine, currently live in LA, and am VERY picky about lobster, especially lobster rolls. Is it the best lobster roll in the world as proclaimed on the sign? No, for that you need to literally pull a lobster out of the frigid Maine ocean and cook it immediately. Is it pretty outstanding considering it's in a mall in Vegas? Absolutely.   I've had the lobster roll and the lobster grilled cheese and both are just wonderful. In my opinion, there's too much lemon and spices on the roll, but otherwise it's perfect-big chunks of lobster tossed in mayonnaise on a hot buttered bun. The lobster grilled cheese is also excellent-hot, steamy lobster in gooey melted cheese between two buttery, toasty slices of white bread. Yum!  Food in Vegas isn't cheap, period, but if you want something relatively inexpensive that is different and not fast-food, I highly suggest you check out Lobster, ME.

eOrvPFw9q2kqA7Gu_zakCQ.text: Best lobster we've had in a long time!  I think the key is to go there for breakfast and be the first ones in line. Everything you get is freshly cooked and it is definitely worth waking your ass up for even though you're hungover.   We got the lobster mac n cheese, lobsicle, lobster roll, and lobster ice cream. Each dish was better than the next. Amazing!  We are fans for life and we are already salivating just thinking of the next time we're in Vegas!

Xco-LENAq9aBH7yG18OiJQ.text: I got the classic lobster roll for $17. The lobster salad inside the roll was made up primarily of claw meat that was not to try. The roll itself was a thick piece of soft, buttery toast. Just the right amount of mayo.   There's a reason this place has stuck around. If you love lobster you need to visit this place.

NvuOP_rNT9Uq2o44lrEqSw.text: Not bad but kinda pricy. We spent 70.00 for 2 lobster rolls, a lobsicle a clam chowder and 2 drinks.

pwgNG2Ub4i1xKQHCq1YtqA.text: Not the best lobster rolls, but it was a lobster roll none the less.  It's super expensive (I know, it's because it's on the strip) and it's a decent roll so if you're craving one (like I was at the time) then just go for it.

0_Wr89U4HyiC24JongeuJA.text: Which sewer are the using to farm raise the lobster they serve? If I could give zero stars I would. I was so excited to find out about a lobster roll place in Las Vegas. Spent $110 to try a few things with family. All the lobster was bland despite the butter and mayo. This is not Maine lobster. Tilapia would have been more flavorful. Order came out wrong and instead of making a fresh Connecticut roll they just poured butter on top of the Maine roll. Disgusting, expensive. I left there feeling nauseous.

oiQxqMom_BJQFFcZFdtR5Q.text: Absolutely delicious! The lobster is actually fresh!!! The Cajun Fries are wonderful, too! Must try!

IRljhwTGP1hsxnxC8fx7Uw.text: Stayed at the Elara. Saw this the last time I visited Vegas but was pregnant so couldn't have lobster. So when I came back after baby, I went stir crazy buying lobstericle, lobster sandwich, and lobster mac and cheese, about $45. All of it was great with the right amount of lobster. The sandwhich was like a 4 inch, so kinda small, but really tasty. Was in Vegas for 7 days and only went once. Was a case of been there, done that. Recommend at least once. 4 stars for uniqueness, tasty food, and location. Missing 1 star because pricey for what you get.

Rmiylt2Ywpyb-mwtTXS_ZQ.text: I walked past this place on my way to dinner and thought, I could sure use a lobster snack later instead of ordering room service when I got back from a night out in "Vegas baby." I ordered the cajun lobster roll and carried it around after dinner for about an hour or so until I placed it in my fridge and then went out. When I cam back and broke that high-end munchie open... threw the roll in the microwave for a few seconds and put all the ingredients together as instructed. Yes, I had my roll deconstructed so as not to ruin the late night snack attack experience. It was perfectly spiced and the lobster was meaty as well as a really good amount for the price. I would make the journey back when in Vegas without question.

mFwDe4ypCntbu7Va2zNu4A.text: i feel very indifferent to this place.  the lobster roll did not look appetizing, so we ordered the lobster and chips, a lobsticle, and a lobster grilled cheese, on the recommendation of the people who worked there.  as lunch, this place was extremely heavy.  the lobster and chips were pretty good but it was so very deep fried that we feel a bit gross and greasy afterwards.  actually, it was so heavy that we felt a bit disgusting for the rest of the day. they really skimp on the lobster too...there were maybe five/six small lobster nuggets and the rest were their mediocre fries.    the only thing that i would recommend getting is the lobsticle!  it's a lobster tail that is smothered in tempura batter and fried (yes, FRIED, again!!!).  it was really good, although pretty small and still cost $12!  the lobster grilled cheese was GROSS to me.  i don't know what kind of white cheese they used but it did not taste good, it was too mayo-ish.  i mean, i love mayo just as much as the next person but really it was like smothered in this mayo cheese.  i would not order that again.

7EQQ2V6VY34Ai5Q85ng7pw.text: Loved it!! Lobster mac and cheese was delightful and the lobster roll had chunks of lobster instead of sparse bits.

zAYukTEmyfRsPGXTOVRpfA.text: In the Miracle Mile shops.. doesn't get much better than this! Buttered rolls, lotsa LOBSTER and mixed with mayo only.. delish.. squeeze some lemon. Healthy portion, about a LB. I get my Garrett's Popcorn fix (cheese corn!!) while I am there.. Can't wait to go back.

ig1ouTwEf8AKCdo3egekig.text: Just a quick observation by someone who does enjoy lobster and also someone who has some difficulty spending $50 on a lunch for two in a food court atmosphere. Yes it's lobster but just consider that the lobster rolls contains claw meat, not the premium tail meat that we are all familiar with and enjoy and the medium sandwich is relatively small and did not meet our expectations, my suggestion, go to Costco and buy a couple nice tails, a couple nice steaks, have a nice meal.

AyQRbPDVEn8B0HUOWOxOzQ.text: If I could give negative rating, I would do that.  Maybe I was on a bad day or whatsoever, I couldnt understand why people were raving about this place. First of all, the only good thing about this place is the price. The price was about right. I didnt think it was expensive since its on strip. However, here comes to my horrible experience. I went shopping with my girl friend one day in PH and came across lobster me. I really wanted to try it awhile ago since i saw so many good reviews on yelp. Yelp never (Ehhh.. maybe seldom.. maybe sometimes) got me wrong, this was the first few times. So me and my friend shared a soup. We waited for about 5 minutes for the soup and I was excited for the whole time and the first thing we saw in the soup was - A HAIR. It was really gross but we got over that. We took it out and we tasted the soup. THE WROST SOUP EVER I HAVE TASTED IN MY 21 YEARS OF LIFE. I will never ever never ever come to this place again!

57bZxOhe26D42sDruIs7Pg.text: I liked it!  I have eaten Lobster rolls from a truck and this place charged a bit more but this sandwich was waay bigger.  I got the one for $17.  Not cheap.  So if you are a cheap bastard this place is not for you.  It was a good snack for me though.  I am not the expert with lobster rolls, but this one made me happy.  It tasted fresh, and lots of flavor.  It is perfect to snack on before your show so that you can get your occasional nourishment between your alcohol binging.

WjAkX4FSoUi1VSRKwvn4Ow.text: We went to Lobster ME in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.  Quite possibly the best lobster roll that I've ever had! I like the concept of a Connecticut roll because it is warm, but always want the mayo.  Lobster ME allows you to have both--warm rolls with mayo bases.  Definitely add the fries instead of the chips and spring for a lemonade.

DzXGXrj8kR9C50UckrYRGA.text: i had the truffle lobster roll and it was absolutely to die for.  I didn't see it mentioned in other reviews.  yes, it is expensive but duh it's lobster!  I thought the portions were okay.  Would have liked two of those lobster rolls but that would have been too much.  This place is pretty special and should be given a serious look by anyone in the mood for quick and easy lobster.  My friend had the lobster grilled cheese and didn't thrill over it the way i did the truffle lobster roll.

0FZdI8oFce5_ifS66AOhsQ.text: Lobster butter and a roll. An expensive lunch. But your in Vegas so just go with it.

I9s9_AQ-8QiPI45fC_ceHg.text: I LOVE this spot, food is amazing and service is nice. A must stop if you're in Vegas looking for a great eat

BTubqUqQHORzYdG9ZubPNg.text: I went here because a friend of mine posted some pics on Facebook and I wanted to check it out. This location is located inside the Planet Hollywood. We went on a friday night which was probably a bad idea. The place was pretty packed. We actually didn't have any place to sit when we first put in our order. We got lucky though and snagged two tables later on. Just so everyone is aware this place has very little seating. What is frustrating is you'll see one person sitting at a table not even eating and the only thing you're thinking about is where the fuck am I gonna eat this lol. I gave two stars for the food which isn't bad. I ordered the lobster and chips and I got the lobsicle. I didnt return the food because I was so hungry I just ate it. I was pretty disappointed that they screwed up my order. They don't give you many french fries so if you order anything with fries they really skimp on them. I ate my meal and I was still hungry. Luckily my sister inlaw gave me some of her lobster mac and cheese which was just ok. This place isn't cheap. The meal's dont come with drinks. I ordered a Sprite and they charged me $3.00 plus tax and it was a small cup. It's not a bad place if you happen to be at Planet Hollywood and you want to get your Lobster on but I would'nt make a special trip. One more thing, they're suppose to give you a 20% locals discount but this location didn't do that. I think it's fucking bullshit because I know they honor this at the other location at the Venetian.

gGSOovo_A8-8rX2iC-ag6A.text: Lobster? When do I eat Lobster other than at big Chinese dinners at a restaurant.  In Vegas!!! I came here because I was definitely hungry, wanted something quick , easy to eat, and most importantly something DELICIOUS!. Can you go wrong with Lobster??? Yes of course you can. But for me, I shared the LOBSTER bisque and Mac and Cheese. The Lobster Bisque in the bowl was good. I especially love the bread bowl with it. The bowl was fully edible, soft but crispy. On the other hand the Mac and Cheese was a bit of a disappointment. They totally trick you in the container they put it in! Lift it up and you'll notice that its only half the size of the container!!! WTFF!!! It wasn't even cheesy! The Cheese wasn't melty either and was pretty dry. But I won't complain, I still ate it because macaroni and cheese is still a good combination. I definitely want to try the Rolls next time ;)

8PXNe-NlFr6bCyWrPG2dcQ.text: It's okay.  I tried it in Vegas with my sorority friends because the place literally just opened an hour ago...  The menu is very limited and the prices are ~$10 for everything.  I ordered the grilled cheese... it took much longer than it should in my opinion.  My friends got all their food before me, and I ordered first.... does that make sense?  Grilled cheese for $10 is not worth it.. even if there is lobster in it.  It didn't satisfy me and the combination of fishy + cheesey did not work here.  I tried a little of my friend's lobster mac and cheese... it did not work in any favor.  It was an interesting concept, but I'd rather walk a little further to Earl's.

xsoFfcVX5ol6MewlXNX7CQ.text: I got the The Original and it was just ok. A little heavy on the seasoning and mayo, and just overall nothing I'd jump for joy over. It wasn't bad, but considering the price I'd probably leave it at that... not bad. Unfortunately I also chomped down on a big piece of lobster shell, that was mixed in with the roll, and hurt my tooth. That made the overall experience nothing I'd return for.

RPsDFNrzG3_b_TkECY-YiA.text: Lobster here lobster there all i see is lobster.  This place is good but pricey but well worth it.  Get the lobster roll and mac and cheese they are amazing and you won't get disappointed

MRvOIjQis6E43mDPCs8_Kw.text: I was disappointed.  My $14 lobsicle was very small, and I am not a big eater.  The good news is the beer is cheap.  $20 buckets and $5 Sam Adams draft.  The lobster ice cream was very weird.

1X-x1EzCjRW2bbFgP_bzNQ.text: This place is overhyped. The lobster Mac and cheese is powdery and flavorless, the lobster roll needs salt and pepper and tastes strongly like rosemary, the lobster bisque is also not creamy enough and lacks that oomph that lobster bisque have. Not worth $10 for bisque and Mac & cheese, each. Also not worth $16 for the roll. The Lobsta Truck in LA is SO much better.... I am extemely disappointed...there weren't really sufficient seats in the area at Planet Hollywood. I gotta say, though, the service was really good and the staff was extra friendly. Two and a half stars. Didn't really do it for me.

5lKzE31O2q34Xx_20k2IJw.text: I'm from Maine, live in Vegas and have eaten more lobster rolls than I can remember. This is the third lobster roll I have eaten outside of New England and the first time that I ever finished a lobster roll and said I'm full.  Mine was served with fries (and a beer). Now it was $23 for a large and for me it was cheaper than a plane ticket to Maine so I'm good.  The staff was great - very helpful !  I plan to try everything on the menu that has lobster in it.  One happy Maine girl !!!!

6DgYpaKDq0Yv7ihlLHQ3Mw.text: Awful awful awful service!! They were getting almost everyone's order wrong. I waited 30 min for a lobster roll order they couldn't find? What make it again I have the receipt! It's a Wednesday afternoon get your act together. I wish I spent $17 anywhere else.

jEIs2OaZsN4FKrpTkIQ0sQ.text: I'll give myself one more day to chuckle at the idea of lobster ice-cream. Who said only the Japanese were innovative with their desserts? (e.g. shrimp/tofu ice-cream) My mom and I happened to be walking along the Miracle Mile Shops when she saw a big sign that said 'Lobster ice-cream, free samples' so I went up to the cashier and asked for some to which she handed me a spoonful. Not bad, I say. I was expecting something bland and downright icky but surprisingly, it was pretty flavorful. The ice-cream could've passed off as vanilla, then there were the strings of lobster meat that came with it. Was a fun try. If only an order wasn't fixed to $8 and they had sizes, it would've been great company for a walk under the sun.

QyfWfotcY1tBEXqU6cMjGA.text: Got a coupon from the Miracle Mile Shopping center for free beer with any lobster roll.  We tried the regular lobster roll. With $17 bucks, the lobster roll indeed comes with full packed lobster. The taste is good. However, it will be much better if less greasy. You can also upgrade to XL size with additional $5 bucks

jpwPEn_c1leby1sMlV1_5w.text: Located in Planet Hollywood, Lobsterme serves (well you guess it) lobsters. Got original Maine Style Lobster Roll $17. It's chilled lobster with mayo and spices on a bun. You can also order it warm if you want it but it makes it weird. Flavor wise it's very simple and fresh, can still taste the lobster there. I'll definitely do the lobster popsicle next time. Couple friend tried it and they love it. 4 star due to limited seating area

9269OsOzByqGWaCw3Td9UQ.text: Not bad but kind of pricey for a lobster roll, lets face it though, it's Vegas

HYYEg-YFgE9r5ukDOEi_Vg.text: Lobsicle!!! I wasn't really into the tempura part but the tail with butter and lemon is still pretty tasty.

pzlyh9v-PcVcml4Yq7q-3w.text: The lobster roll and lobster and chips are great! Happy to pay $17 and $13 for each of them

bIsQEICOgEMnyl1ph0Hx7w.text: Better than expected.  Excellent service by Christine. Good Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac n Cheese.  Would have given 5 stars but a little bit over priced.  Will definitely be back !!!

4FtehZTs5Sv2pzRdU-XPNA.text: "Lobster Me" was a smash hit for me. Although there were many passer byes as you ate, I didn't even notice because the lobster roll had all of my attention. It was a little pricey but nevertheless worth the cost. In fact, I took one for the road.

vUEAROWhPAetetDiUNSkFw.text: Lobster Tacos...hands down amazing; it comes with 2 and I had to get a second helping of it because it was that good! Try it!

-EX451HOaxQ0_kCkM5sw3A.text: The lobster roll was pretty good but the meat is very cold and a little too seasoned with old bay.  The roll is buttered toast, yum. Skip the grilled cheese, the lobster is so chopped up you can barely taste it.  Cheap beer is a plus.

Op5nwS_a1yqcolOV5wqDIw.text: came here to try their classic lobster sandwich with the hubs. though i love the fact that they lobster wasnt drenched in mayo (there was no mayo at all) the lobster was pretty cold. i was taken back by it. i thought it wouldve been buttery/garlicy and at the very least luke warm. thats the only off putting thing for me personally. maybe its the way lobster rolls are supposed to be? ive had one at sams chowder mobile and it was great!. probably wont stop by here again anytime soon unless a friend wants to.

-mXmr8ZrjWtrCu1HNOetdg.text: We had a Connecticut and an original Maine lobster roll.  Both were full of meat and sized about right.  Lobster bisque was good as were the fries.  Drink menus somewhat listed for Vegas, but it is somewhat of a fast food style restaurant. Took a little longer than I would have liked to get food, but I would definitely eat there again.

Dc1QlpQBEL6kZ1yMT2naTg.text: Delicious...the lobsicle is delicious and so is the lobster bisque soup.. the most delicious meal u have  eaten.

8wPc_6G1ocAvrnprNA4SQg.text: great lobster mac n cheese! for a mall setting.  but the mall is in vegas.  and i was able to drink a beer in the mall with my mac n cheese.  check it out!

yjSPQVkNLwQcQVSdRtRdCA.text: Get two of the small lobster rolls rather than 1 large delicious , but expensive, YUM!

rop7PfQ9si_ENlSLPFCzgQ.text: I checked this place out in between work one time for lunch with a coworker. I couldn't believe there was an actual place with lobster rolls. I am a harsh critic because I frequent Boston, my original place of birth quite a bit and have had it fresh there. I ordered their Original Maine Lobster Roll with fries. I liked the presentation when the roll came out with the claws on the top of the toasted bun. The roll tasted great! It wasn't too seasoned, not too garlicy. The lobster meat was fresh and I will definitely go back to this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine Lobster Roll

XeNKzynlmg0gTJnxr-4jmg.text: Lobster Ice Cream...say what? Yes I tried it and yes it was good. Sweet ice cream with chunks of lobster.  This place is pretty easy to find, its in the Miracle Mile next to Fat Tuesday.  I think its reasonably priced considering its the strip. We got the mac n' cheese, the grilled cheese, and the shrimp tacos.  The shrimp tacos were not good - too spicy with little pieces of shrimp. Serves me right for eating shrimp at a lobster place. The tacos are the reason I couldn't give it 5 stars.  The mac and the grilled cheese were right on the money. So good. I wanted to lick the mac and cheese container clean but then I'd just look like a pig. =P  The line is hit or miss meaning it could be short or long depending if all the partiers are awake.  Next time we're in Vegas this is one of the places I will be hitting up again.

79ctSawMvyGrMF0nBTPQ3g.text: Lobster ME, more like Lobster No Me! We used to love this place, pricey but we'll worth it. Not anymore. Small lobster roll, 3 tiny pieces of dried out fish, an oceans worth of salt on the chips and tasteless watery clam chowder. All for $45. Never again!

r3zJiBX-fVW_p-KOOUflOw.text: My friend told me about this place, so as we were staying in Planet Hollywood, I had to try it out! I had the Beltway lobster roll and it was delicious!  The brioche bun was toasted perfectly and the lobster topped with butter-toasted panko crumbs really hit the spot.  The lobster roll doesn't seem that big when it comes out, but it's more than enough to fill up one person, especially if you order fries as well.  My friend ordered the lobster fries and I have to say that was disappointing.  The sauce was ok and overall the fries were just soggy and not that great.  Stick to the lobster rolls if you try out this place.  Also, it's right next to a Fat Tuesday, so there's that!

BNztVhKS3xIr7ihWKPG2eA.text: I came here in August with a bunch of buddies for a bachelor party.  They normally rave about this place but honestly, I have had better.  The Lobster tastes good but the cashiers screwed up multiple orders in our group.  They just kept getting things wrong.  It should be something as simple as confirming they are pressing the correct button on the cash register as what the customer as saying and then confirming that what they are bringing to you matches what is on the receipt.  They shouldn't be leaving it up to the customers to show them a receipt and ask them why what they were given doesn't match what is on the register receipt.

s31dVZI4fQwx7MVY-w-erw.text: Came here for brunch after a nice night out in the city. Have to say the food was great, but not for the price. Bought myself a Lobster Mac and Cheese for $12 and gave the Bloody Mary, spicy, for $5.  Let's start with the Lobster Mac and Cheese, although it was a small portion, it was quite delicious. However, there was not that much lobster and it didn't really add to the food itself. For that price, I was hoping for a much larger portion of food, didn't really quench my appetite.  The Bloody Mary was great, if you're a fan of Bloody Marys. It wasn't a cocktail made from scratch as I expected, but rather made with store-bought Bloody Mary mix. But hey, it was great! Can't complain about that. For $5, that's a reasonably good price. Again, wish there was a larger portion of it.

4FRmSFX3KHwhfm-pUW2H8w.text: Great servers!  The funky, skinny redhead gal was awesome. Great customer service. The lobster roll was okay. The bread overpowers the flavor & taste of the lobster. The taste of the bread was very good but I just couldn't taste the sweet, succulent lobster. $17.00 for great bread?  Fool me once; shame on you. Fool me twice; shame on me. (I won't be fooled twice).

_8glvL5gI-biePxzpT8c3w.text: Pretty weak, had lobster roll and lobster bisque...no real meat in soup to speak of.... Shrimp tacos were god lobster roll ok ...ho hum..

P-ZCOZPAI4F6BXStDG-waQ.text: In Miracle Mile, right next to Fat Tuesday.  Everything lobster. Great hangover food. Be daring and try the free lobster ice cream. It's surprisingly good.  Cost: ~$12-$25 depending what you get.  What's good: - lobster mac n cheese --- really heavy, and cheesy  - bread bowls looked delicious  No bueno: - lobster rolls were very good. filled with big pieces of lobster, but small.

u8ykWncOYy-ToDSxqfHw-A.text: Favorite dish is the lobster mac. It's really good and super filling

KHNoFZXr0VBpe9UGBI-bRQ.text: I'm not a big fan of lobster rolls but if given the chance I would still try it especially when there is truffle oil included.  I came here with a bunch of friends and it's basically a fast food joint where you order and they bring you the food.  I had the lobster roll with truffle oil and a side order of clam chowder fries.  Lobster roll was probably one of the better ones I've had and for $19, the price was fair and portion was generous.  The clam chowder fries were tasty.  This is something you think of doing as a kid and as an adult and the chowder making the fries soggy with bites of clam is a winner.  I was a bit disappointed that my friend who ordered the same thing got more fries than me.  Other than that I'll be looking for Lobster Me wherever I go.

d-KJsknKYFF2f2QM_I11IA.text: I heard a couple good things about this place so headed down to the strip and try it.  It's ok, just not worth going out of your way to get.  If you're already walking around planet Hollywood and get the itch, then try it.  It's rather pricey for a lobster roll, 18 bucks (not the combo) with housemade chips and coleslaw.  Small, more of an appetizer than a meal.  OK is best I can say.

uBmgvokuEIwlbKDK8OMAFw.text: I went here during the Mayweather vs Pacquiao fight weekend and this place is good. I had the cajun style lobster roll and I loved it. It was very tasty and had a ton of lobster meat inside. The bread was toasted slightly covered with butter. I was totally surprised with the quality and taste. I recommend this place with you are looking for a quick bite to eat while on the strip or shopping.

7R7YgXQnmp9hV2ZLJRZNVg.text: The Connecticut lobster roll, lobster Mac & cheese, and deep fried lobsicle are dangerous. Very, very delicious...man I wish there were a location in San Diego.

eXtoqwZPzp0ZzyYstbAWDQ.text: I used to frequent this place often, stopping by at least once a week.  As the months passed by, the menu kept changing.  I have nothing against a change in selection, but the food quality drops with each change.  The seafood is very bland.  I have tried both shrimp (sliders) and lobster (tacos, fries, mac n' cheese, rolls).  The rolls all come seasoned so those are normally okay.  The same can't be said for the rest.  The clam chowder is the only dish that has remained the same, which I will continue to purchase.  If the clam chowder has an off day, a little salt and pepper will fix that easily!  In the end, if you pass on trying this place I wouldn't blame you.

Glag4DTrdXVWUBasoZpAOQ.text: When I saw this place, I got excited. I live in SoCal and the only time I can get my hands on lobster rolls is when the Cousins Maine Lobster Truck or the Lobsta Truck are in my city.  I ended up buying a lobster roll with a soup, and it came out to $28. By being that pricey, I thought it better be good (especially since lobster rolls from the lobster trucks are $12-$13). So I finally take a bite and I was surprisingly disappointed. I love me my lobster rolls, but this just didn't meet my expectations.  Sorry, but if this were a food truck, I wouldn't follow.

o6RBvJkH0fnfow9P4FXfJA.text: My daughter had the lobster mac and cheese which was good but didn't have as much lobster as I would have expected for a place named "Lobster Me." I had the grilled cheese and lobster sandwich which was soggy with too much cheese and not much lobster. Flavor was okay but it was over-priced. Fries were average.

_n5Ij0hGPQRBZYH3zGz07w.text: My first trip here was pretty disappointing. Tried the lobster roll and the lobster mac and cheese. The roll was light and not too rich, but it was bland overall. The fries were standard. The coleslaw was ok...not anything special. The lobster mac and cheese was really bad. The lobster was ok, but the Mac and cheese was dried out and gritty. I've had better lobster mac as appetizers at places that don't specialize in lobster. If lobster is your thing, all your lobster dishes should be stellar.

QfxWliclBvQ1bQGft1x3yA.text: I'm Very sad.  I bought the lobster melt and literally only had 3 pieces of lobster.  Very disappointed

6d3UtFGBnsym_2ycuYVh8Q.text: I have been dying to try this place for years. I go to Vegas once a year and everytime I walk by im always full or we are heading to a fancier place to eat. I am so glad I stopped at this place. I have had some really expensive fancy lobster mac n cheese but this place tops it. It was absolutely amazing, The lobster was perfect. The cheese that they picked to go with it was fantastic. I will defiantly be going back next time I am in Vegas. If you love Lobster check this place out. It looks cheap but, it's way better than what you expect.

lRytlc_bFYk1qZVomvN9yg.text: I've only been here once, but wow $18 for a lobster roll.. That's Vegas for ya!  I had the El Diablo Lobster Roll which was tasty, but the portion was very small. The bread was a bit soggy from the sauce, and there wasn't much substance beyond that. I did enjoy the side of cole slaw that they served, but again not something that I would consider ordering again unless I was desperately craving lobster.  I still link lobster is a bit overrated, but my friend enjoyed it so at least we were content.

_2j_MnOMe1eQAPmCx7jbzQ.text: 1st off i walked all the way around to find  the place and i order the signature lobster roll for 23 bucks and i get a baby roll with about $5 dollars worth of crab and lobster . What a rip off

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The receipt is almost as wide as the sandwich . Wtf

jlivChgRAm0XtlXnbgurag.text: I ordered a lobster taco and shrimp taco it was just okay. Not enough shrimp or lobster for the price.

FyhVSqZEXXIglWcKCbLJ1Q.text: My friend and I went here during our trip to Las Vegas. Price was $43 for the lobster roll and crab roll (Cajun style) with a side of fries. Bread was good which is why I'm giving it a two stars.   Otherwise, the lobster was over cooked and the Cajun style was way too salty. Will not be returning.

4x94I8ordxbCs_9uWsEd_w.text: I had the signature roll. I had high expectations for this roll since the lobster came from Maine and I paid a steep amount for it. Well, it's not bad. But it just did not justified the $25 USD I paid for it.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ME

6sSYoW07Sx9T_zOR2yTxxw.text: In a city dominated by corporate chain restaurants and celebrity-starred restaurants, restaurants like Lobster Me are a dying breed. With no Gordon Ramsay or Joel Robuchon advertising for it, its only star is... The Lobster!  Lobster Me's entire menu revolved around the wonderful crustacean that is the Lobster.  Spanning from the original Lobster Rolls to the Lobster Banh Me Sandwich to the Lobster Mac & Cheese, you can't avoid the main star of the restaurant.  My friend and I found Lobster Me after coming tru the parking garage @ Planet Hollywood. Being the Lobster lover I am, I begged my friend to try Lobster Me as well. I ordered the Lobster Mac & Cheese with the french fries (covered with lobster seasoning powder) and a fresh lemonade. My buddy tried the Lobsicle (a stick of grilled lobster meat) with the homemade potato chips.  There was plenty of lobster in my Mac & Cheese. Even though the mac & cheese wasn't one of those gourmet mac & cheeses you would usually expect at a high end restaurant, it gets the job done. I loved it, even though I would probably not get the fries in the future because it wasn't that good. My buddy raved about the Lobsicle, deeming it a masterpiece and the lobster flesh succulent.   Service was good. The employees consistently came around our tables to ask if we needed anything and offered us refills on our sodas. (no refills on that delicious lemonade). The only negative thing I could say about Lobster Me are the high prices of their food fare, considering it's "fast food". A meal per guest will come out to average almost $20 for lobster entree + drink + fries/chips.  You could definitely spend more money at a worse place ( I am talking to you, Serependity 3). But hey, leasing a place inside the Miracle Mile Shops doesn't come cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy lemonade (actually good kind)  no refills on  fresh lemonade  tho
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster  stick  with potato  chips
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac  n cheese ( must try)

lSQY04tZZ0pPnA0upPO__w.text: I ordered 1 lobster roll with butter and chives and upgraded lobster bisque, 2 shrimp tacos, a new england clam chowder in bread bowl, and 2 modelos on tap. It was Taco Tuesday so the shrimp tacos were only $3.50 which was a steal for how big the shrimp was. It didn't say that they were on the spicy side, so beware if you're sensitive. I ordered this for kids and they weren't able to get them down. So I had to switch with the $24 lobster roll that I got. The bread bowl was soft and there was sufficient amount of soup. I hate it when there's not a lot of soup in those bread bowls.  The lobster roll was great as well. Soft sweet roll type of bread and a lot of lobster. However, not worth the price tag. Probably more like an $18 cost would've been better. I paid an extra $2 to upgrade to the lobster bisque. It was good. The broth was not thick, more of a lighter texture. Big chunks of lobster was a bonus.   The beers on tap were not really cold. I think I would've taken the cans if I had to order again. They charge $0.54 for tap water cups. But she gave us 2 for free. The food came out fairly quickly. We were in a rush to get something in our bellies before a show. And managed to order, eat and get out within 25 minutes. That was with a small line.   The tables are like mall food tables. So they're not the cleanest. But it's fast food, so you get a few extra napkins and have to wipe it down yourself.   Overall food was tasty and it served it's purpose. I'd definitely eat again.

Hy74pRqtIjCnAmg0YYzlJQ.text: Our first time here and the lobster meat you get is worth it . I got the Signature Lobster Roll New England style and my husband got the lobster mac n cheese . Mines came with coleslaw but it was bland in flavor so I didn't even eat that and the mac n cheese was more like a soup. Service was great and the gal that helped us was very friendly. I would still go back for the roll.

UUBgcd48DJu5LJCgeZLgDg.text: If you love shellfish, this is the place to go. WOW! I cannot believe it took me three days to find it. I got the lobster grilled cheese and it was amazing! If you like a little spice, ask for some sirracha on the side. I promise you, you will not be disappointed.

ryLhVnzEpOWENUu4EHwSfQ.text: What a fun eatery! And I heard it's a chain, how I wish they'd expand over! It was fun discovering all the creative lobster items and although we only settled for classics (lobster roll and lobster salad), they were both good! I especially enjoyed the homemade chips accompanying the sandwich.   The only turn-off was the fact that they'd charge for water! And be prepared to wait a little for your food. The place looks like a fast food counter but everything seems to be made to order. With patience comes good food!

I'm not a big fan of anything else cause my favorite rolls are from slapfish and the lobster bisque is a bit too weird cheesey for me. However, the clam chowder omg idk why it's so good. It has such amazing flavors! And when it's nice and thick and creamy on better days..yess

s8Ds6s_qqwnhDwHpabO5dg.text: Lobster bisque bread bowl=amazing and if you order something that comes with a side of fries I HIGHLY recommend getting their cheese to dip them in! So yum!

fLxtI8MqVYIP-40nZm5PyA.text: 3 stars for the food and 1 for the value.  Ordered the Philly and lobster mac side.  It wasn't bad or fishy or anything... it just didn't have a lot of flavor at all.  Definitely not worth 25 bucks.

kviShrXpNJEr0jTTYGfMEw.text: Good Maine Lobster roll.. not great. But good.   Fries were just ok.   Good alternative to the other fast food joints near by.

9qEO9u95VeeoyOeZ0uNNSw.text: If your brand has Lobster in its restaurant name, then the lobster better be the best of the best. Unfortunately, this is not the case at Lobster ME.   This location is located in the Miracle Mile area of the Planet Hollywood shops. Seating is limited, so make sure you grab a spot if you see one  The lobster roll here left much to be desired. For $18, you get a 3-4 inch bread roll stuffed with lobster. For one, I was expecting the bread to have a nice toast to it because it appeared to look that way. The semi soggy texture of the bread already killed it from the first bite. Maybe it was left sitting for awhile. Who knows... Although the lobster chunks were good in size, the lobster itself was bland.   If you are a lobster lover and have high expectations, fulfill your lobster craving elsewhere. You may be disappointed here as my husband and I were...

3ITZhDPciUSZAtTm7v4YFQ.text: Once again you find me at Lobster Me. I couldn't come to Vegas without stopping at one of the best and cheapest places to get my lobster fix. This is only a small place in the Venetion. You must wait in line to pick out what you would like to eat. They give you a big number to put on your table and bring it out to you as it's ready. I could eat here every day and have been known to do just that. I'm suggesting that if you want a nice meal for a decent price, this should be a place you must consider.  The Lobster is flown in fresh and everything tastes absolutely like it was from the east coast. I had lobster chowder and a lobster roll and my husband had a crab roll.

I really want to try the Lobster Roll next time! For something quick I think this place will do just fine.

DIQ6tL3kAhcMbDt-nv4g_A.text: Get the shrimp and chips and thank me later. The fish is just okay, but I really liked the shrimp.

5V4fwNUpcBt_Q6C6X-WfzA.text: Delicious I had the fried lobster on a stick & a lobster roll. Didn't care for the Mac

4jTyZZzOm589uONu9Wr3pA.text: A fast-food experience for sit-down restaurant prices.  Ordered the lobster Mac and cheese.   Lobster is good bc nature made a bug stuffed with delicious meat, which makes it even more egregious that it couldn't save the sad, soupy Mac and cheese it topped. An insult to the lobster that gave its life for this!  Maybe it was an off day but the sauce was thin and gritty bc the cheese wasn't fully incorporated into the sauce, nor was there adequate roux, if at all, to start the sauce.   The result was a mass of bland noodles with the occasional sad speck of coagulated cheese stuff, topped with crunchies and lobster meat. All the flavor ended up in the soup at the bottom of the container.   For $16, you can do better elsewhere.  Service isn't the greatest, either. It seems like the staff was too busy with what they were doing to be personable or upbeat.

eexUsIeL28cUVjnfMHHpSg.text: The review is solely based off the lobster bisque soup. After seeing pictures of the lobster rolls and different lobster menu items I'm convinced that this place has the right idea. The rolls look filled with lobster and nicely garnished with butter and other sauce toppings of your choice. No one wants a dry roll. My lobster bisque was very delicious and had a great amount of lobster mixed in. The only thing I can't understand is why soup is so expensive in Vegas. Literally everywhere you go. The lobster bisque from Cousins Maine is $6 for a cup and $8 for a bowl. I paid $10 for a cup and it was $12 for the bread bowl.   My friend did get a lobster roll and said she enjoyed it more than the roll from cousins Maine. They are a little pricer with the option to style up the lobster roll. But I wouldn't be opposed to paying a little more knowing there are more options. The Cajun, Sriracha and Baja options are free, but you do have to pay $2 more if you want the Cali and BLT option. I also loved that they have the lobster Mac and cheese on the menu! This place is quick and easy if you are shopping your way through the miracle mile shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

spV0L3D-Bo6YgZL4vsSGNg.text: Ugh, TALK about Las Vegas' best drunk comfort food. I could rave about everything here from the super friendly and hilarious staff behind the counters, to the scrumptious lobster-filled foodies on the menu.  I simply saw the name of this place and knew THIS is where I wanted to splurge for "fast food" so to say. Get ready to open your wallets up wide because it's not exactly cheap, but hey, you get what you pay for. Seafood isn't exactly inexpensive, after all!  I was in awe when I saw the menu because everything made my mouth water. My fiance couldn't talk at the time because he had lost his voice, so he went simple and got the lobster bisque ($10 for 12 oz). He loved it and when I tried it (first time EVER having lobster bisque by the way) I fell in love. So creamy and delicious. I ordered a lobster roll, Cajun style ($23) which meant there was Cajun aioli, green onions and lemon. YUM. I made that a combo and got crab loaded waffle cut fries with it.  Best choice I ever made in Vegas, and best choice you'll ever make too!

Mx4PKGrV1_I-dBazsQ6XLw.text: This was a tasty treat while walking the Miracle Mike shops with the Mrs. The food was awesome, as the Lobster Roll was perfectly prepared. The lobster bisque was delicious, and both washed done nicely with fresh lemonade.  Kevin, the GM was great, as he gave us some background on the establishment along with some great suggestions while in town on vacation.   If we ever make it back to Vegas, we will definitely be hitting his place up.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pfV_-szqJrC8bZXz7OJIag.text: I knew better as the title says but did it anyway. Just common sense and a little geography will tell you that the "lobster" (questionable and crab is def fake) in no way could possibly be remotely fresh. I was going to just bypass it all together but they had a surf and turf philly and that made me stop. My wife ordered already so when it came my turn I found out the onions are already mixed in and I can't have onions. Strike one. Got the lobster grilled cheese and clam chowder. Clam chowder is more potatoe soup then anything. The lobster roll my wife got the roll was stale so she just ate the lobster out of it. Strike 2. My lobster grilled cheese was literally tasteless. Literally. Didn't taste like anything. Maybe all my time in Salem MA ruined me for anything less then easy coast lobster. Idk, I won't be back though

84t3dS6R0nYrMQKolf1lug.text: Stumbled upon this place inside Planet Hollywood's miracle mile shopping center. Little joint next to this popular drink place that everyone goes to, Fat Tuesday. It's a small location with just sitting tables outside the restaurant. Nice people servicing you. They have good recommendations.  Now for the food, I needed up with their main food item the lobster roll. Definitely pricey for the amount of food. Don't really know if the lobster really comes from Maine either. The fries, unlike other posts, tasted ok to me. My roll ended being the Cajun style. I gotta say, it was, one... pretty salty, and two... not that well stacked. Half of my sandwich was mainly bread. Taste wise, it's decent but definitely not worth the $24 that I paid for it. There was a lobster roll I got in Newport Beach, CA that was about 17-18 and that seemed still a little high, but quality was a bit better.   Overall I'd give this place a 3/5 stars as the food is way overpriced. Service is ok, the sides are fairly typical but the main seller isn't that great that I'd pay 24 again for a simple sandwich. For you to try at your own risk, I was hungry and thought lobster sounded like a good idea but it turned out to be ok at best. So for you to try and let us know. Cheers.

RF3HZ1pbiwLTwEnl1SfNTA.text: I'm torn between a 3 and 4 star with this place. Located in the Miracle Mile Shops, we had walked by this place numerous times since we were staying at the Elara. We decided to try to this place for lunch one day and the food was just ok in my opinion.  We got a couple platters of the taco trio which consisted of 1 lobster, 1 shrimp and 1 fish taco with a side of chips and cheese. The food was lukewarm at its best and didn't even taste fresh. I've had better fish and shrimp tacos for a fraction of what we paid here. The chips and cheese were ok too, nothing to write home about. Maybe we caught them in a off day.

AabOB3afgT0QBn3VGfNfgw.text: The line was long when we walked past then we went past again and tried it And it was delicious. I have Trio tacos and it comes with Chips and cheese. And they have Bloody Mary for and mimosas for $5 I was amazed and loved the service

4Us3PGoA9GMYexws1uHr-A.text: This place is Awesome!!! If you are a lobster fan. You have to try the lobster roll!! I have never had lobster on a roll. I'll be coming back for sure!! Also the young ladies that took care of me were very friendly..

Ry658f-7X_hnA-mWF0NxEQ.text: The sandwich or roll is ok I've had the other lobster roll company  and it was delicious  but this lobster me is just ok  the bread was buttered not the lobster I think that would help. Too much claw meat

ZdF2XiXSaBolGY2DROa9Cw.text: Very good rolls here! The breading is light so it doesn't make you feel too stuffed and the fries topped with crab is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!!!

IIA3aEiwZKmOnjUXHJCtYg.text: This place is ridiculous. Please don't waste your time and money.  Food 1/5 service 1/5 cleanliness 2/5 speed of service 1/5  Lobster rolls were blend, the lobster melts didn't have enough lobster in them. I couldn't taste any lobster but only cheese and butter. My family waited over 30 minutes to get our food. Lobster me did not offer appropriate apologies, even though it skipped our order and served other 3 tables first who ordered after us. .  I could find so much better food and service for same price in Vegas. It was the worst dining experience in Vegas.

Q9EHsgd-ogX0Mn3TehII8A.text: I ordered the 2 lobster tacos.  I would have like the lobster meat to be a little warmer but they were still enjoyable.  The kid's mac and cheese is great.  I also ordered a bread bowl with the cup of clam chowder to take home.  The clam chowder was very watery and not thick at all so I would check it out if you plan to order it.  Very friendly staff.
