Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Lobster Tacos $17
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uTXdRN1kFBJH7FemVooDTw.text: Great fresh succulent lobster that I will never get tired of! I'm going here all the time !

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

8zlKId97chP6HVtElvLVkA.text: I was treated to Lobster Me by my friend who is a chef that I trust very much. I have never cared for lobster rolls but he kept talking about the one here. We had Old Bay style. I am now a lobster roll lover. No mayo or celery, just garlic butter and Old Bay. I think I'm in love. The Old Bay fries are also very yummy. The draw back? Customer service and employees always eating. The one who brought our food out was not only eating but speaking to us with her mouth crammed full. GROSS!!! Not only that, she always had a scowl on her face and acted like she would rather be anywhere else. Plus, a prep cook who we could see from our table through the pass through was also eating and doing so WHILE WEARING GLOVES AND PREPPING ORDERS!!  I really almost left but  my friend convinced me to stay. That grossness needs to be fixed. Also, he said the Venetian location is better all around. We will go there from now on.

vBjcQWqzUI2O5FrSP4c3-Q.text: I am a New Englander.  I have cravings for lobster - especially a good lobster roll.  Good lobster rolls are hard to find even in New England - too much mayo, celery and other fillers and the lobster is drowned out.  I love the Maine Lobster Roll!  It is a real, honest to goodness, sit on the pier on the Atlantic and throw your shells into the sea, Maine lobster roll - done the way it should be done.  For all of you who think the price is high, have you ever bought lobster before?  Do you have any idea what it costs?  I go to the Lobster ME in San Francisco, and love it.  I go out of my way when shopping downtown to have lunch there.  Pure delight.

-Gw7N3py8CemJ6U4qAIXdA.text: Well it's a lobster roll. Bread and lobster. Toasted bread with juicy lobster. I don't like the price but it is lobster and it is Vegas. Ordered the lobster roll, lobster melt and chowder. Very good stuff.

OifDO97S2Fnh8iYjFWtFnQ.text: Drunk date with lobster! We stopped at about 10 pm on Sunday night, pretty busy but they were organised and quick. Got the original lobster roll. Amazing. Good crisp chips and smooth coleslaw also! Friends got lobster mac and cheese and it was great! Will definitely be back to stuff my face again!

N48uNxaj4so4RojN8g_7QQ.text: The lobstericle was $15 and it was good, nice size piece on lobster tail. I had to wait 20 mins for it because they ran out, the cashier came to me and said they were cracking fresh tails in the back. Besides the wait at least it was fresh. They gave me complimentary soda and salt n vinegar fries which were good as well.

Pw8PiPPJL_BjAbWnFjVgUw.text: Lobster ME is good, but expensive "food court" food. I have been to the Venitian Shoppe location a few times as well as the one at Miracle Mile.  There really isn't too much to say about the food. Its Lobster done a few ways. I have tried the Conneticutt Lobster Roll, the Lobsicle and Lobster Mac & Cheese. This was my favorite of all the menu items I have tried. CT style is my favorite because it is a warm protein as opposed to cold protein with mayo in the Maine version. Butter and chives round out the seasoning. very, very yummy.  What is a Lobsicle you ask? its basically a lobster tail on a stick. You can order it deep fried or grilled. Neither was as appetizing as it sounded. Think greasy vs bland.  The Mac & Cheese I had a few bits of lobster and a soupy consistency of cheese to mushy mac. I always prefer a more al dente noodle and cheesier and drier with a nice crust. This wasn't it.  Staff, for the most part the cashiers and expediters have been very pleasant and reassuring when ordering. They will recommend things if you are undecided.  Location ambiance, well...its a food court. So,that says it all. If you are looking for upscale fast dining, this is it.

L8zth_463O6RBSoyPnNJ1g.text: I dream of the Lobsticle. Sounds gross, looks expensive, but if you LOVE lobster, and HATE cracking it open and digging it out, it's literally a RESTAURANT grade lobster piece you can just stick in your mouth. I thought for sure it'd be a junky grade seafood, but it was AMAZING. The lobster mac n cheese will surely make you die early from the oil and cholesterol but it was quiet tasty I must say.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster Mac and Cheese and a Lobsicle

XqouN5STMLykBgg4XMrXjA.text: Lobster Me, please!  I go here every time I'm in Vegas, which is once or twice a year. I can never decide between  the lobster grilled cheese (yum) and my fave - lobster mac&cheese (deeeeelish!), but the mac&cheese always prevails. I've had a sampling of their lobster ice cream and lobster bisque, which I wasn't feeling. Next time, I'd like to try their lobster roll (but for $22 - yikes!). Definitely a great place for lobstah lovers.

vkJhwUQDyNQupD9bCPduiQ.text: Food is decent, not the best I've had. Not worth the price though. For a place that claims they exist for the love of lobster, they're pretty stingy, but I guess vegas is stingy in general.

ZiZUAx-SLtNv7ShLQ755Yg.text: Fast-food like joint i the middle of the Miracle Mile in Vegas. I was hoping to try the lobster ice-cream as weird as that sounds... It's intriguing. Unfortunately, they discontinued it... Sad  We had classic lobster rolls: on a cushy brioche bun they are quite good.  With fries: average. Crispy but not fresh.

trgYam5jidHiCehhe0pyiA.text: The food here is bomb!  The lobster Mac n cheese was great and very filling.  We also shared the chowder fries.  This place is awesome and priced right! Check it out if you are in the area.

ErPoU578gF9VUk_DeVBQwA.text: Some of the most quality food I've had in Vegas or otherwise! Every dish here is prime dining with excellent quality and amount of lobster meat! I dream of the day I come back.

hJvloho3wAeEz7nJR0lbPw.text: Great food, flavor and not unreasonable in price. I mean, yes it is 19 bucks for a drink and a lobsicle but 1) its freakin lobster people! And 2) you're in Vegas, everything is expensive here. Friendly staff, less than 10 minute wait time, great locations. Hoping they expand to California at some point!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best lunch for me!!!

eFfr4Zgsg0dZU4LCIKeLog.text: Awesome lobster rolls and bisque!  Fast and convenient if you're staying at Planet Hollywood.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo deal is lobster roll, fries, and a coke. $21.62 with tax
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Feb 2012

0wivVSd_zsNnk5huk73JTg.text: So maybe the girl behind the counter flirted with me a little but the food was "DA BOMB" my maine lobster was so good I had to go back and take one to go. even if I have Gout that pain was worth every bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster butter and happy

7JxTBI9Zuds-JfoSmy-sFQ.text: All lobster!!!  Youu get a lot of lobster!  Cajun style was delicious. Its in a mall so the atmosphere is really casual.  Fries are OK.  Drinks are small but otherwise service was great and food was delicious!!! Too pricey in my opinion though

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

aDdR1nuhiBaunlYbJyuLbA.text: Again, hangover food at its best. Lobster bisque and lobster grilled cheese sandwich are AMAZEBALLS. It's so good that I would book a room at Planet Hollywood again just so I can roll out of bed the next morning and shovel food into my mouth.  One MINOR gripe though: they were slow on giving me and my roommate our morning tea. But who needs tea when you have alcohol in Vegas?

iyOJaGfioSJsNU1jQq0zXA.text: Warning up front, if you haven't had a real lobster roll in Maine, you will NOT understand the value of these rolls.  You will probably think they are too expensive and not filling.   Now for those of us who have pulled our cars over in Maine and ordered a lobster roll from the many roadside eateries, we will understand how WONDERFUL it is to find one that is so spot on and in Western US.  Let alone in the desert.  LOL  The first and foremost thing you need for one of these rolls is the bread.  I promise you, you will not find it out here.  You have to bring it in from the East Coast.  Then you need Maine lobster and Lobster ME has it ALL.  If only I could smell the Atlantic I would have been transported back to beautiful Maine and all the lovely ways they know to prepare lobster.  I have had the traditional roll and the bacon lobster roll, both were excellent.  To be honest I was not crazy about the lobster mac n cheese, but as I have said in other reviews, I make THE best lobster mac n cheese so I am biased.  Having said that, no lobster mac n cheese was left in the dish.  Lobster ME will also give you the option of having your lobster heated up before being placed on your roll.  I prefer mine cold, but if you do not like cold protein go ahead and have them heat it up for you.  Now grab a beer and savor your sandwich.  I know I will every time I'm in Vegas.  NOTE:  There is free valet parking in the garage, all you have to do is tip them.  So getting in and out of here is a breeze and won't cost you much.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Liquor counter
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front counter

2tjrrB3EmDj9yrVnecg5ow.text: Fast forward to 2018. My last visit was in 2016, and alas... although they improved on the serving portion of the lobster roll, it's a little bit bigger now, the quality is still questionable. The lobster was underseasoned, rubbery, and didn't taste like anything. It had no flavor. It didn't even taste like lobster. I got the "BLT".. very minimal bacon crumbles. It was just so lacking all around. The lobster bisque on the other hand.. Overly salty! It was just another disappointing experience. I'll definitely won't visit for a 3rd time.

JeEPGH69_3U4K1VmkX1gNg.text: I really enjoyed their lobster sandwiches. I would definitely come back to try different options but their home made chips are awesome as well! I would opt out on the cole slaw, nothing too unique. But their staff is great as well.

emb3qGE9TIVqRv2I6dE_VQ.text: Had to stop by Lobster ME when I saw the sign for their well known lobsicles! I didn't order them since I was set on the Maine style which was recommended to me by a couple friends.  The Maine style roll comes with chives and mayo on a warm soft delicious roll.  The roll is loaded with a good amount of lobster for what you pay for in Vegas so that's a good deal.  The chips that come with the roll unfortunately are a different story... they don't have any flavor and they're very dry.  It honestly tasted like cardboard box! I had a couple bites and just couldn't with the chips.  If you're looking for a quick bite on the strip and something different from burgers and slices of pizza you can give Lobster ME a try.

zGCbQcxkuIuaxCw6troV2A.text: This was average. Not a lot of lobster and mostly bread and sauce. Because of the mismatch, it is just ok.

kqLEmYZzoQLwk0l5REWuiA.text: Pretty good lobster Cajun rolls. The roll was pretty small. More like a snack to me. It comes with potato chips and cole slaw. The lobster bisque bowl was big and good but lacking lobster pieces! Not sure I will come back as its pricy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Cajun roll and lobster bisque bowl $24
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster me please!

rHCR6B9L4PBYhVyg1GmoOw.text: As much as I love lobster, I really think this place is overpriced. I was really excited to try their lobster ice cream, but when you think about it - it's really just bits and pieces of lobster with vanilla ice cream. There's just nothing really "spectacular" about that.  The lobster bisque was all right. It came with a bread bowl - but it just didn't impress me that much. As for the lobster on a stick - the lobster is deep fried but not that big.   The staff was nice and friendly, however just be aware of the fact that you're paying more than necessary.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried lobster on a stick
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ice cream
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque with bread bowl

WO7NHsVoy8Gh1DcB2R1saw.text: Lobster ME was a total surprise and I'm glad I was taken here since I was so hungry in Las Vegas!  I told my friend, "I'm hungry." (This is a common scenario...) He said, "There's Lobster!"  I said, "WHAT?!!#!@$#@! Take me there now!"  We show up and I'm staring at the menu trying to figure out what to do with my life and what to feed my life with.   FOOD - 3.5 Stars: With much anticipation, I ended up choosing a lobster roll and lobsicle.  Lobster Roll - I was really excited to get this, but kind of let down. Don't get me wrong, it was still delicious. However, I was had higher expectations. The bread was toasted really well and buttery. The lobster was good, but instead of having pieces of lobsters, it had what I would call shredded lobster. There was plenty of meat, but shredded meat. *sad face*  Lobsicle - This was a surprising item. You have a choice of getting the Lobsicle either grilled or fried in a tempura batter. I decided to get it fried like the healthy person that I am. When I first got it, I was a bit underwhelmed because 4 ounces of lobster looks relatively small. After the first bite, I was like WHOA! It was so damn good and full of flavor! it was crispy on the outside and meaty on the inside. No shredded lobster pieces here. ;) LOL. I'd definitely get this again. Maybe next time I'll get one grilled and one fried so I can enjoy the goodness of both!  SERVICE - 4 Stars: The staff was very friendly and answered all my questions. Yes, I asked a bunch of questions because I wasn't quite sure what to get. I was finally able to narrow it down and place my order. I grabbed a number and waited for my food to be delivered to our table. The worker even brought us some Tabasco when we asked for some. Overall, really great service.  ATMOSPHERE - 3.5 Stars: There's not really enough seating. It's right next to a Fat Tuesday's, which always has a long line. There's only a few tables unless you want to sit at the counter at Lobster ME. So, it's hard to really enjoy your food. My group was lucky enough to swoop in and grab a table.  RECOMMENDATION: Lobster ME was a surprising find here in Las Vegas. I guess I shouldn't be surprised since it is Las Vegas. I will come back and try other items on the menu. I'd think twice about the Lobster Roll though... I'm hooked on the Lobsicle though... like madly in love. So, check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle - This is fried in a tempura batter

f4IN6ol_NLgg3lTwKjG82Q.text: This place was recommended by my boyfriend, and it was the first time that I've been here as well. He order the Cajun style lobster roll, and I got the original lobster roll. The lobster rolls came with a side of coleslaw and house-made chips. For drinks, we ordered a lemonade from here.  I was just want to say the Cajun style is a lot more flavorful than the original. The original was a tad bland. The Coleslaw was really good, I'm not a big fan of coleslaw but this didn't even taste like coleslaw! It just tasted like a regular salad with dressing. Lemonade was really good, you can never really go wrong wth lemonade.  The pricing is pretty expensive for the portion you are given, which was really small in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ae4qaZ2bD3C8miIfzddL6g.text: QUICK AND TASTY SEAFOOD   I like how it's a "fast-food" seafood joint. Here's the goods and bads:  Lobster grilled cheese was bomb. Totally worth the price it was cheaper than lobster roll.   Lobster Roll Connecticut style: really good! The lobster meat was chunky and abundant. Heads up this roll is pretty small. Much smaller than the pictures but it's still filling. But if you're a big dude order two.   Difference between Maine and Connecticut is the Maine is cold lobster and Cont. is warm lobster in butter sauce.  Lobster Mac and Cheese: thick shell pasta, cheesy and delicious! A good amount of lobster meat.   PASS:  Lobster Bisque: more like Lobster WATER!!! Bisque is usually thicker and have chunks of lobster and veggies but this one here was the opposite. It was straight watery lobster soup. Skip it.  Blueberry lemonade was sweet and yummy!  Tip: if you add a combo you can substitute the drink for a beer for $2 more!  PS. As you can see by  my picture the lobster rolls are pretty small.  But what I'm confused about is why our rolls didn't come with the huge claw meat on top like all the other pictures show???  Manager should be alerted that this place isn't consistent.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac and cheese was delicious!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque was bad. Like not good bad. It was watery and had no lobster meat.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut lobster roll was bomb! Warning it&#39;s a bit small. See my little girl hands holding it? :)

8Nb593lpW71sL6Gv_0BJlg.text: When in Vegas, must stop by Lobster Me which is located inside Planet Hollywood. I've tried the lobster roll sandwich at many locations but this is by far the best place. Try the original lobster roll with Cajun fries. This roll comes with chilled lobster meat with mayo and spice added. Since it's "lobster" price can be a bit higher than a normal sandwich. Still worth the bang for your buck!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lobster roll with Cajun fries.

r_SXTG1__ikU_dz4GDDfug.text: YES! Lobster without having to visit one of the Vegas buffets! I came here with a friend after shopping around the Miracle Mile. Located right next to Fat Tuesdays...I ordered the original "Maine style" lobster roll with chowder fries ($26). While the meal was a little pricey, I think it was worth it. I did not feel the glutoney of eating at a seafood buffet and still had some leftover.   The roll was buttered and the lobster was adequately seasoned. Despite being a little soggy, the chowder fries were good. My friend ordered the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster bisque. The grilled cheese did not look as pictured, but the lobster bisque was amazing.    Want a lobster roll? Go here.   P.S. Check-in on Yelp to get a free lemonade when you order a lobster roll =)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The original &#34;Maine Style&#34; lobster roll with chowder fries

CLwgA8pFOUNDLGyQg7S2YQ.text: Nothing beats Lobster on a Stick!!  There is nothing special about the location. You sit in the mall and it feels like a fast food restaurant. But none of that matters after you get your food! AMAZING!!! Forget Hot Dog on a Stick. Can anything beat deep fried Lobster on a Stick served with drawn Butter? The Lobster Rolls were also very good! In a town where you can pay $75 for Lobster, I found it to be very reasonably priced as well if you understand what you are getting.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Tail Deep Fried on a stick!!!

ZSkxeEXa5y4L2Vnt4ZvaIw.text: This place has been here for awhile, but I never actually wanted to try it until this past trip! Ordered the deep fried lobsicle and the Conneticut lobster roll, and it came out pretty quickly. However, it was super pricey for what you get- $13 for a single lobster stick, and $17 for a lobster roll.  The lobsicle was good; but not worth the price. I wish I had gotten the grilled lobsicle instead. The lobster roll with the melted butter was yummy, and the chips and coleslaw was a good combination. I thought everything was pretty good, but nothing special. I guess the price does make sense as it is Vegas, but definitely will not go out of my way to eat here again!

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut lobster roll

wJDH3v7-0FYWsJVNtvQ1oA.text: This was the worst food I have ever had in Las Vegas.  I was really looking forward to trying this place.  We had the lobster roll.  It had no flavor and was only mildly warm, the fries where stale.  My BF had the lobster grilled cheese and it tasted very fishy.  Had to send it all back.  Total waste of money.  Barf... oh and I had an allergic reaction.  I'm not allergic to anything but had a sore throat from this?

fKg3kUMMH6Jubo_y1kXCcA.text: Late night, I was craving something to eat and this place caught my eye - after moving from Boston, I just love getting lobster rolls when I can because I miss them so much. I ordered a lobster roll that came with fries and coleslaw. Service was pretty slow considering there was one other table of two sitting there waiting. The fries were just ok, coleslaw wasn't very good, and the lobster roll was very bland. Looking back, the guy taking the order asked what sauce I wanted on it and I said I'd just do the butter sauce to keep it traditional and let the lobster shine. Maybe this place's specialty is the fun sauce they top the rolls with because I felt like the roll was lacking in flavor. The lobster tasted fresh, but it really needed the squeeze of lemon to make me want to bother to eat it. Later both my boyfriend and I didn't feel so hot and this was the only thing we ate....so I'm left to assume it was this lobster roll.

s4Pp5z11BLjlDMVQpc2NLQ.text: Just had a lobster roll's from here the wife told me about it. This place is a little pricey  $ 20.00 + for a meal+ drink . Don't get me wrong the food was good but it ideal for a gr ok up of 4 or more people seating sucks  in the area at Planet Hollywood  in the Miracle mile shopping center

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster  roll&#39;s are the bomb

TT8UMRTyWamnZDMGsGf0VA.text: Given the mixed reviews about Lobster Me, I had low expectations, but I really liked it! Yes, it is a few dollars overpriced, but given that it is lobster, I wouldn't necessarily expect fast food prices.  I ordered the combo meal, which came with your choice of lobster roll (I got the Connecticut, so the lobster was warm, mmm), fries, cole slaw, and clam chowder, as well as a drink with free refills.   The lobster roll was delicious, lots of meat on a slice of buttery Texas toast. Wow, that was delicious! Yes, I wished it was bigger, but I savored every bite. The fries were good, nothing special, but I found it interesting that the chowder was served right in the same container as the fries, which made for a messy chowder sauce. I didn't mind it, I just found it odd. The chowder was good, but I didn't taste any meat in it. The cole slaw was unremarkable, but fine.  Lobster Me offers a locals' discount, so that took a few dollars off of the total. I would definitely return!

ILeoGW3fUZNpWrGxrT4CGA.text: Saw the sign for a lobster sickle. Couldn't resist. $14didnt buy a very big lobster tail. Flavor was good it size was lacking

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My hand isn&#39;t big :-)

QCuromvGdJQlrhs-FO7_3g.text: This place is pretty awful. The food is horrendous. There was no flavoring in 5 of the 6 dishes I tried. The grilled cheese had a lot of sauce, but it was gross and extremely soggy. We pretty much threw everything away. Worse $100 spent. :(  Please don't come here. Save your money and go to Earl's Sandwich.

TKv1EGEDLAswS5RB4WSEbg.text: After my initial review, management reached out to me to address my concerns, asking me to give the location another shot. I did not think much of it at the time, but, fast forward to a year later, my husband and I were going to be in town again and I decided to take them up on the offer. Why not?   Okay, so I think the new menu is awesome and the changes that they have made in the past year are great! The prices have increased, however the rolls are slightly larger, a little more toasted (yum), and there is more lobster !!! The potato chips are gone and the standard fries have been replaced with seasoned waffle fries and they are delicious.   The lobster mac and cheese was very decadent.  You can probably check my reviews on Yelp and OpenTable to verify that I don't really hand out five star reviews lightly, but not for nothing, I was super impressed with our meal at Lobster Me today.   My only suggestion would be to serve the lobster mac and cheese in a more shallow dish as the current serving dish is a little deep and makes it a little awkward to effectively eat the dish, although we easily solved this by pouring it all out into the larger boxy serving container that the mac and cheese came in.   I often wonder if reviews left on review sites or blogs even make a difference to the companies or if they even bother to read them. I thought it was pretty awesome to see that some of the things that I initially griped about were fixed over the past year and management actually seemed to care that a guest that spent money at their establishment was unhappy and reached out to discuss concerns. That pretty much never happens, anymore. Great to see a company with an open ear for criticism and feedback.   The changes to the menu are great and I look forward to coming back here next time we are in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

moIqhMQxkikMc9XPFLsDyQ.text: Lobster Me is quality, juicy, succulent lobster in a convenient, mall food court setting. Mouthwatering lobster rolls? You got it. (5 different ways!) my recommendation? Maine. My friends also enjoyed Cajun (not too spicy at all) and Connecticut.   Excellent service. Perfect niche with a few quality options for lobster lovers, like lobster Mac and cheese and lobster on a stick. Prices a little higher, but it is Vegas, and the quality is worth it. Major cravings for lobster rolls are a regular thing now.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll - Maine
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster fries.

Yzv00MOIs-9SAefEst9-zw.text: Just okay. Nice presentation, great customer service, good fries but wasnt a fan of my meal. I got lobster grilled cheese and i believe the bread just overpowered the crab and lobster. Better luck next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8kS38HnveMsA5nmJ9_QUPQ.text: The food was pretty good, I expected more lobster for the price we paid but it's Las Vegas so what do you expect. The location was good because we walked by and immediately wanted to try it, but seating was pretty much nonexistent. If you don't mind taking the food Togo, that would be your best option.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kufp3Y98Vn9ik8-BbL5etw.text: This location is in the Miracle Mile shops in the Planet Hollywood so you can get your food to eat there or to go. There are a few tables where you can sit and they bring your order out to you.  Had a lobster roll from here previously and it was very good. This time I tried the lobstercicle which is basically a lobster tail on a stick. You can get it fried or grilled. We opted for fried. It was pretty good. Prepared fresh and hot out the fryer. Not too greasy but the side of butter was a bit much seeing that it was already fried but I'm sure the butter would be great with the grilled one. I plan   to try that next.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried lobstercicle
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gb5wqvyh7LaJlNTCcaUnTQ.text: Not terrible.  It was the first night in Las Vegas fighting the jet lag and we got dinner here.  The food wasn't too heavy (it was the lobster and steak thing) with a beer.  Solid enough food if you are getting food in a food court setting.

jo-W9viO305AY6LGnn3lpw.text: Got the lobster Bloody Mary.   Was good but they made it to thick.   Also got the Mexican corn and it was delicious.  Prices are a little high for the lobster rolls but then again it is lobster. The lobster was very good and service is pretty fast

WOZPpOKag963yhiA2x5C-Q.text: Good food good mood:) Tasty, I recommend this place if you like seafood. Taste pretty good.

8yzE28o29fWfHUkZygFRsg.text: Prepared by one chef (it seems) so we waited about 14mins for our snack (yes, snack; ONE street taco since we had dinner reservations for an hour later).   Me: not worth $8 The Man: worth $8  Gonna still come back and try something different. We'll see!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mXytt1wcXHlKFKKaV7uNug.text: The lobster grilled cheese was too cheesy and not enough lobster and the fries were not soft, but the lobster rolls are meaty and yummy. Good taste and good portion sizes. I wish swaying was a little better and employees had just a tad bit of a sense of urgency.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R8s8dppXK4C_CxgSj3qx9A.text: This place is totally awesome favorite place to get lobster the roll the bisque and lobster Mac and cheese was phenomenal to say the least highly recommended parking in the lot off Aubrey was easy and free

ehSspeuso8xlQNuB0Z1oVg.text: The food here is excellent! My husband and I enjoyed the Lobster Bisque, lobster roll, lobster grilled cheese and clam chowder. We will definitely be back. Plenty of beer choices on ice! It's casual and friendly. Our wait was only about 10 minutes for our food. Try it you'll like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

igqKu98pW18o_9jPdNkmyw.text: As many times as I have gone to planet Hollywood, this is the first time I have ever stopped at the spot. I was there on a girls trip, for the weekend, and decided to get something to eat. I got a simple order of fried shrimp and french fries. It was really good and I believe I paid $14. Even though the day was super busy, I did not wait long for my order. I think maybe a total of five or six minutes, so not bad. Just be cautious that the area gets pretty crowded when it is on a Saturday. So you may have to take your food to go (or sit elsewhere) if you cannot find a small table.

YKUwxjIeZqC-LS4i4HTRRA.text: I have never not liked lobster until I ate here.   Over priced sandwich which I didn't even finish because it was just meh. Maybe I ordered the wrong combination?  I ordered the Maine lobster with Cali. I was expecting some warm and juicy/buttery flavors of the lobster and everything and it was disappointment at first bite. Fries were good though..

yZzfatZyNoyQ8NzB-m3Nug.text: A fast food place for lobster!  Is this the quality of lobster you'd get at a sit-down restaurant? No, and it isn't supposed to be. I wouldn't order a lobster roll or a deep fried lobster tail on a stick at a sit-down restaurant either. For a tasty lobster roll outside of New England, this serves its purpose very well. I realize the hefty price for "a sandwich" turns some folks off as soon as they walk up, but this IS lobster. Just prior to stopping in, we stop at one of the ABC stores in the Miracle Mile shops for champagne; that elevates the experience nicely every time. (Nothing goes with a lobster roll and hot salty French fries like cold champagne) Seating is available right in front of the store out in the mall, but it is sometimes used but non-customers (not sure of a good remedy for that).

_9RborjFh1g1XPaIUBpqzg.text: Only had the lobster taco. Very delicious but pretty small. Was not disappointed by the flavour tho

WoDxKCnX3n6IZwwG4nRiqA.text: Grabbed a quick bite just before the next show....don't want to be too full so I suggested that we choose the lobster taco. The lobster claw piece that I tasted was very fresh and delicious! It came with some coleslaw which wasn't dripping with sauce so that's good! The chips were freshly made and not oily. Fast service and we could go!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster taco and chips
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9QryY8HPiSiMGXKSIoI1_A.text: Wonderful fast food type seafood place nestled in the miracle mile shopping center on the strip. Had the crab cake sandwich with mac and cheese with drink for $22.00. Excellent service - highly recommended

DxBYuOsRoxUotMlkV3G6Mw.text: I decided to try an item that was not lobster... so I was taking a chance when I ordered the crab cake sliders. I honestly had low expectations and was happily surprised at how well cooked they were and full of flavor. My boyfriend thought it was a bit dry but I liked it overall!  The waffle fries were good but some of them weren't fully cooked and half seasoned, so that was a let down. My boyfriend ordered the lobster roll.. I took a bite and didn't like that the lobster meat was cold.. I think that's weird and he didn't like it that much either... Lastly the side coleslaw was bland as eff.. bottom line, this place is okay.. there's so much more better options at the mall and in Vegas for sure. Definitely had better lobster rolls elsewhere.

Rnoxh54NdH64-Bv_tb7JKw.text: They changed their menu but it's still delicious.  You pick your sandwich and then the flavor.  Try to lobsticle grilled with butter.  It's 4 oz of deliciousness...wish it was maybe 6oz but still so so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovsticle....4oz grilled with butter.

qTp205aGYCDJFaa-vQUyIg.text: If you like lobster, this is the place to come! The lobster roll rocks! I would be giving this place 5 stars, but they changed their menu lately and only have small lobster rolls now. Bring back the big one!   Also, I think the bread changed too. It's not as tasty as it used to be. Still an awesome roll, but compared to before, it dropped a star.

tI_rYU5utUelBnVWsZ_RfA.text: Over priced and not worth it. The chowder fries were better than the $19 lobster roll that's for sure. However, the fries hardly had chowder in my opinion. They should be called cheese fries with a drizzle of chowder. Don't let the line fool you. If you're hungry as we were you'll be royally disappointed.

GaEnwKb71CDTObkMm2LkZQ.text: Was glad to see the Yelp sticker posted. It reminded me to check in which resulted in a coupon for a free lemonade. That took $4.00 off my order. The beltway lobster roll was quite tasty. Flavorful and piled high with warmed lobster chunks. The rest of the plate was disappointing a few haphazardly thrown chips and a cup of coke slaw. I tried it, enjoyed the roll but probably will not repeat the dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beltway Lobster Roll

PZFpTKZdAKI3MHGDTK-a6A.text: Giving this place a 2 star because the portions were ridiculously small for the price were ordered fish & chips and it was one piece of over cooked fish chopped into 3 pieces !! And fries I would not recommend this dish at all. Save your money. We also tried the main lobster roll and it tasted OK not amazing and if your gonna to pay close to 20$ for a sandwich the portions should be healthy and worth it !

iTTcEytlGJLJbn4Fwcy9aA.text: I walked past this place a few times before trying it and I really regret it.  I thought it was going to be frozen lobster, cooked to hell and not worth the price which is a bit more than what lobster rolls go for in the Northeast.  Yes, I was wrong.  I tried the lobster roll with a drink for a late breakfast on my last day in Vegas.  Man, it was perfect.  Overflowing with claw meat, the buttery goodness from the roll, I instantly regretted not going a size up!  I've been craving another one ever since and this will definitely be on my "go to" list every time I hit Sin City!

A_gufJhYhAcmAyVvcn2qaA.text: Very, very pricey for this place but the food is aright. Ordered the Cajun style but didn't taste very Cajun to me. I was able to finish this myself and I'm rarely do. Ordered as a combo so it comes with fries and a drink (free refills). I was still hungry that I even was able to finish up the yard long fat Tuesday's next door. Also ordered the Mac and cheese which my kids finished up quickly. I'm guessing it passed the Mac and cheese test and was up to their standards. It was ok for a first time try but I highly doubt I will return.

Ws1OdvcClSBVU7XkpaR_yQ.text: I came to Las Vegas with my husband, who is here for business, so I'm on my own during the day.  I was walking around the Miracle Mile Shops and was looking for something for lunch.  I saw Lobster Me and decided to get the Original Maine Lobster Roll Combo.  It was delicious and loaded with lobster !!!  I agree that it's pricey, but it is lobster, and I've had more expensive lobster rolls that were not as good as this was !!   All the workers there were extremely nice, so that just topped it off for me.  I'll be back for another lobster roll, with my husband, this week before we leave Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine Lobster Roll Combo

cR0BmbCHe_yVuzoyywMYXA.text: Such a hidden gem! The last bite was mostly all bread for me, other than the uneven spreading out of the lobster through out the bun.. It was delicious! And worth the $. There's also a deal to make it a meal (fries and a drink) for $4 more.. It was yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cajun

40rR2N3lxM95Is83bvaF5w.text: Really?  Don't.   Connecticut was cold. Lobster Mac n cheese was not cheesey or flavorful. Bisque was very watered down. Save your money for Red Lobster.....

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sX9GNFIYqnGJv0DXp2Qq_g.text: fries were soggy and the lobster roll was mediocre at best.  for almost $25, i was expecting a lot more.  the amount of lobster served was on the generous side, but the quality was so so.  overkill with the sauces imo and the bread was soggy.  please toast the bread to a crisp on the outside at least.  didn't seem fresh baked to me.    seating and decor left a lot to be desired as well.  lobsterme is pretty much fast food at nice restaurant prices.  i rather spend the $50 bucks and have a decent dinner somewhere else.  probably won't be back anytime soonn

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nQRXkehXW5B5ZiEB63rjAQ.text: Fried Lobster! What more can I say?  3 stars because it was expensive! and the portions are small! But let me tell you, where can you walk around, get a Fat Tuesday and walk 10 feet and get a lobster on a stick! Such a good combo!   Lobsicle- $14 but worth a try. Not super large, but it was fried to perfection. Their batter is crispy and not too bready. Very good! Pretty greasy though, especially if they already give you a side of butter.   Cajun Fries- Absolutely the best Cajun fries I've ever had in my life. I will come back here next time and skip the lobster and order the fries. Soo good!  Lobster and Chips - not worth it. in total, there was probably like 4 bite sized pieces of fried lobster with some fries. Pass on this and get something else on the menu that's more worth it.

reqItL-ahXbx7fYWpKUA5w.text: Lobstahhh!  The lobster roll is served with hunks of chilled buttered lobster tail meat tucked in the roll and whole claw meat atop the roll. The roll is toasted and also buttered but I prefer a more denser roll than the soft one served here. Overall, if you're willing to shell out some cash, hopefully you've been lucky at the casinos, the roll is definitely worth the money for pure lobster decadence. Fries are just mehhhhh, so maybe the tots are better.  If you're trying to take it easy on the pocket, there's also lobster mac-n-cheese, shrimp tacos, lobster grilled cheese sandwich, and ceviche.  Service is friendly and there's some seating right in front of the Lobster Me window/stand. A bonus that Fat Tuesday is literally 5 steps away from Lobster Me.

qgKo-qoVOa8V8cvOQSGMcg.text: Ridiculous culinary experience at great prices.  The concept is just amazing.  I liken this to a food truck experience; gourmet but not formal.  Jumbo Lobster Sandwich:  A+ Fantastic value for the portion size.  Sauce was great, real HUGE chunks of lobster served over a toasted bun.  I will be back for this.  Granted its a bit pricey, but really its lobster.  Lobster Ice Cream:  A I'll give an A because it tasted great, had real chunks of lobster in it, and was incredibly innovative.  Lobster Mac & Cheese:  A- A little too cheesy; not as much lobster.  Fries:  C Mediocre at best.  Great filler  I'll be back here.  Also, its located right next to Fat Tuesday so you should grab one of those while you're at it.    PROTIP:  Great drunk food.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R_8i7d_VjrRMN0cz6M4DAg.text: I have been trying to get to this place my last three trips to Vegas. I finally made it but I only had time to try the lobsicle. It was delicious - cooked perfect and served with warm butter.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PZ4QQvRAJcGLr8L3qAkFcA.text: Food is great I had the clam chowder soup and the lobster sliders and it was wonderful  Def recommending this place

9J_AwKuv4Mm2fckKOk2Q-g.text: The foods are okay. Nothing special. A bit overpriced for the portions :/  If you're from the bay area, don't bother

Sdb8FfmpKjVFYzQcsYpzCA.text: This one is located in the food court of the Venetian.  For lunch we ordered Lobster taco and chowder fries. Excellente!  We came back for lobster rolls--Maine and Connecticut. They were a little plain.  The Maine one needed a little more mayo. The service is friendly and the food overall pretty good. I would definitely come back.

2qYoThVrueGSXFd0Cok4ww.text: Not what we expected at all....very disappointed. ...the prices were very high and the food was sub par. The lobster roll was so small compared to the photos and the grilled lobster sandwich only had a few pieces of lobster and barely even any cheese.  I wouldn't recommend. There are way better restaurants here for a lower price.

Avq_f5BKD67jgPK9WI44sw.text: I super love the grilled lobster tail here. It is so flavorful and yummy.  It is $14 without tax for 1 tail and I think it's worth the price. They also have clam chowder which is good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled lobster tail

BpXycgh6xH5pm2bGCOp0Qw.text: Tried the lobscicle and lobster ice cream. Do you want the good news or the bad news first?  Okay bad news it is. The lobster ice cream I would never get AGAIN. The ice cream was great and fluffy and had large pieces of lobster in the ice cream. However, the actual lobster pieces did not taste great at all. The lobster pieces where very bland and too chewy and had to chew it for a while.  On to the good news. $14 + tax for a lobster tail, that's awesome. Comes out and it's smaller than I expected (but my expectations were too large for a lobster on a stick. come on bro. LOBSTER ON A STICK smh) The lobster on a tail was awesome. Great for a quick bite and an unique idea.   Try the LOBSCICLE !

olCthuCp1w7zWUnvVMKTSQ.text: This was my 4th time stopping at Lobster ME to see if they had any lobster ice cream and to my complete amazement, they did have some.  They were not out as they were the last three times.  I am persistent if nothing else.  Since the place opened, I've been intrigued by the idea of lobster ice cream so I had to give it a try.  There is one serving size, a dish with vanilla ice cream with mixed in lobster pieces and a larger frozen piece of lobster as a topper.  The ice cream was not very creamy.  It had a crumbly texture.  The lobster flavor was not evident until it warmed a bit--they opened a new 5 gallon container--so it was quite frozen.  Now and then, you get a piece of lobster that has a salty taste.    In the end, I rate this as just OK.  It's certainly worth a try once.  The prices here are high with the lobster ice cream being just under $10 including tax.  That's a lot of froyo at other places around town.  Considering that the cheapest lobster sandwich is $17, this is the least expensive lobster treat at this place.  There are some round tables and I was able to people watch--one of my favorite hobbies on a Saturday night in Las Vegas.  The number of people buying their frozen yard and 1/2 yard drinks was funny.  I'm sure I won't be back.  This was a one time try.  I'm just glad I was there once when they weren't out.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ice cream

-3-KOVvk-v9G3NjlgeVPwg.text: My husband and I were catching a show at the V Theater and decided to visit this eatery. I'd say it's higher end fast food -- you order at the counter and the food is delivered to your table. It's more expensive then your usual fast food but is much cheaper than a sit down restaurant on the Strip. I had a lobster roll for about $13 and a Lobster Mary for $14. We shared a lobster bisque for $9.   The lobster roll was so so, the bread seemed like a folded piece of Texas toast rather than an actual roll. The lobster meat also didn't have a lot of flavor. The Lobster Mary was fun because it's served with a piece of claw meat as garnish. The lobster bisque was blah. It was too salty and oily for my taste. If you don't want to spend $50 per person on your meal in Vegas, this is an okay place but just know the food quality is not that great.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mary
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

NNlNQFMEw_AaOo5RYlwXDQ.text: 'Cheap' lobster?! Only in Vegas I suppose.  You get what you pay for. The lobster isn't the freshest, but it's not bad at all, and it's a good value for what you pay for.  I didn't opt for the lobster roll, but it looked pretty good.  RANDOM but this place showed the best customer service I had in Vegas this time around. The 2 cashiers we came across were nice and chatty (not invasive and awkward at all!) They must like working here :) =======  We got: Lobster bisque ($9) - comes in a sourdoughbread bowl and serves 2. Comes piping hot. Wish there was more lobster flavor, but hey, can't complain for the price. It was a'ight.  Lobster tacos ($14) - meh. I was trying to be a taaaaaaad healthier but regretted it right away. The lobster was kinda dry (I mean, I wasn't expecting it to be fresh.. but still - again, fair for the price) and the tortilla/salsa was pretty whatever. The salsa came in a small serving cup and was probably canned. It comes with chips so it makes it seem like it's a better deal, I didn't have any though. The portion was pretty satisfying.  Chowder fries ($7) - THIS WAS MY FAVORITE THING! It's just chunky fries with cheese and clam chowder, simple but oh, so good (not good FOR you of course..). The fries were big and seemed double-fried so it held up to the chowda and cheese. The flavor was spot-on. I would return just for this.. and MAYBE to try the lobster roll.

XusFG5zGoT30QfjA3r-CfQ.text: I'm used to getting their chowder fries but I'm convinced that I have to get the lobster cheese fries next time. I can easily eat everything on the menu but it's all about control I want to like this place still, so in order to do so, I just gotta limit myself. I really enjoy the chowder fries though, I did have the grilled cheese and that was yummy too. Texture and flavor for both is on point!

Cd5Sz0XZEsFdqLDKi3-vsw.text: Rip Off. They gave barley any lobster for a place that has lobster in the name.  Typical fried food. I would pass on this.

512o2HO-VjJFXvgiquKT9w.text: "High prices, even high for Vegas."  This couldn't be more on point.  The sandwiches we ordered, The Beltway and the Connecticut, were both roughly $20 each.  Yup, each.  While this isn't totally unheard of (this is a lobster roll right) you usually get a decently sized sammie.  This was more like half a sandwich.  It was tiny! Did it taste good? It was decent.  Toasted bread, lobster and butter, just appetizer sized portions.    What was even worse were the stupid chips served with the roll.  They were completely stale.  Some tough, some were soggy, but all were downright wrong.  Just give me a freaking bag of Lays already.  At least those would be crispy.    Service was also a big downer.  The guy at the register was polite, but he kept getting corrected by the rude gal behind him.  The food took forever to come out, even though this was pretty much a pick up, fast food type counter.  There is a decent amount of food court type seating also serving Fat Tuesday, but if it's all taken, you're SOL.  You better be prepared to walk and eat, but then again, the sandwich is so small, you'll be done in about 2 bites anyway.    Yeah, we won't be back.

wMur4eygBg2ScF5TtXsrtg.text: A lobster on a stick...probably the best thing I ate while in Vegas for in my short time there.   At first I was hesitant to pay almost $10 for a lobster tail, but it was so worth it. It was a little bigger than a Twinkie and deep fried. It came with a side of butter and a slice of lemon. As soon as I bit into it, I was in heaven. The lobster was so juicy and moist! I would eat a dozen more if I could afford it!   When I visit Vegas again, i'll be sure to return and get another heaven on a stick!  P.s...don't eat it while in the car. The butter can get a bit messy.

cPLOOA93d6U_uWCpXjWWGg.text: I try to make it a mission to eat here everytime I come to Vegas, and I come a lot every year.   The key is to get the lobster sandwiches WARM. That is when they are the most delicious. The employees don't always suggest cold or hot sandwiches so make sure to get warm.   All the sandwiches are good but I prefer the Cajun. They have lobster on sticks and everything lobster. If you are a lobster fan, make sure to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chomp
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster sandwich

7eVmTlPwCZWxLq88yfY3-A.text: I'd have to agree with some of the other Yelpers. $24 Dollars for a combo is kind of outrageous. The sandwich has a lot of meat, so I guess I can see why that's $19 (debatable for sure). A $4 upcharge for a coke and a couple of fries is good evidence of being overpriced though. I'm wishing now I would've gotten The Melt or Cajun roll. The Connecticut kind of made me wish I just went and got an actual tail somewhere. I can dip the tail in butter at least. It's important to note, I've never actually had a lobster roll before. I've been wanting one since "Lobster Day" last year, and I'm seriously on a mission to find another place.... Hopefully, Atlanta will do it justice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Connecticut. It&#39;s good, not great. Check out the size of it compared to the paper coleslaw cup. Aren&#39;t those cups used to ketchup places

LWx9qdgYJRbuhYVNXPMDnw.text: Me and my bf decided to try this place thinking anything with lobster has to be good ! Wrong lol by bf got their lobster roll and it was small plus the lobster didn't taste fresh. I had the lobster soup which was ok but it could've been way better the fact that it had lobster in it!  We won't be eating there again.

JHmEw1PNdDlIrVIeEscVrA.text: I was so excited to eat here, but so so disappointed.  I got a lobster roll for $23 and added $4 for tator-tots and a small soda. A little pricey but I wasn't too worried about it. However, when I got my lobster roll I was so disappointed. It was tiny! Definitely not worth the price, plus the lobster was over-cooked, chewy, and bland. The best part of the meal was the tots. I'm not impressed.

bZyJUuf-zJjcHT8d7GcZsg.text: Some of the best lobster you'll ever have. Everything is perfectly cooked and the food is delicious. Everybody was friendly and the restaurant was perfectly clean. Also the service was great. I loved how they mixed the lobster and crab. The only problem I have  with it is the fact that it was over $20 for 1 lobster roll. The place isn't very fancy but it was the food was very good.

wPXrZnzBAaUV7a0ksJ9Ogg.text: I had a traditional Maine, New England- style lobster roll. It was just "ok," but what can you expect from a mall- based lobster shack? I've tried it, but it wasn't good enough for me to ever want to go back. The lobster was chewy,  but I can say it was real because I got at least 3 shells in my roll.

CGScQmkcKBpyB1islTZrVg.text: My wife and I were in Las Vegas recently, and I found Lobster Me at the Milennium Shops attached to Planet Hollywood by googling "Best Lobster Roll Las Vegas."  My wife is allergic to lobster, so I don't get a lot of lobster rolls at home.  Not that I could anyway - we live in San Diego, where good lobster rolls are hard to come by.  That's why I googled away - I had some time, and, having spent some time in Northern New England, I love a good lobster roll.    I tried "The Original 'Maine Style" lobster roll, which the menu describes as "Maine Lobster served with a touch of mayo and lemon and topped with our secret spice blend."  Additionally, the menu notes that "all rolls [are] served on our toasted, New England-style, split-top bun."   Big chilled chunks of lobster meat, perfect claw pieces on top, the mayo, the aroma of butter, the bun itself - it was great and it really hit the spot.  Was this the best lobster roll I'd ever had?  No, but I'm in Las Vegas a lot more often that I'm in Maine, and this roll was exactly what I wanted.  This roll was also powers of ten better than what I can find in my home city.  I'm already looking forward to going back again the next time I'm in town.  Other items on the Lobster Me menu sounded great, including the other varieties of lobster rolls and especially the breakfast options, but I will probably get the classic Maine Style roll next time too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Original &#34;Maine Style&#34; Lobster Roll, Nov 2012
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Me storefront, Nov 2012

-GQ4mbYfLRYapBlpBT3O6w.text: Located on the corner next door to Fat Tuesday, this restaurant is good for something different.  Lobster rolls come in two sizes - Large ($17) and XL.  They are served on a paper slip, similar to how a large hot dog might be served.  Sandwiches are cold, and I tasted most of the special seasoning only on the lobster claw that is laid across the side of the sandwich (see pictures I posted of the menu and large sandwich).  There are other flavors, but I had "The Original."  My husband had the Lobster Grilled Cheese ($10).  He said it was pretty good.  It didn't look particularly big - about the same size as a regular grilled cheese sandwich - maybe a little thicker since the cheese inside was mixed with lobster.  It was good, and while I understand the price a little since we're talking lobster, but it was still pricey in general.  I wouldn't say this sandwich would necessarily be a future craving for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

PTMZTsqURp2XO_nMpPwmJA.text: Lobster Me advertised a deal where you get the lobster melt, you would get a cup of lobster bisque for free! I love freebies! I don't know if Lobster Me was using this promotional deal to get people to try their $12 lobster melt sandwich... but I took the plunge and did just that. My lobster bisque did not have any lobster in it. It was literally just seafood flavor cream soup. My lobster melt and all of the ooey gooey goodness of a melt with maybe an ounce of lobster meat in it. While the melt tasted good, it lacked the meaty lobster the pictures on the menu and website promised. The Lobster Mary, total delicious. You get a whole lobster claw in your bloody mary, but it was a weak drink. Overall, if you want an expensive 2 star quick meal, this is the place. I'd say save your $30 and pay the extra $20 and go to a buffet where you get all you can eat seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cross section of the lobster melt
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster melt and lobster bisque
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank you Yelp for the free cup of bisque

jBJB-aopVyOdQUHS9ayDeg.text: Lobster Me was awesome! The first time we came we got fish and chips and a lobster grilled cheese. I was unimpressed with both, but they totally redeemed themselves this time with the Lobster rolls! So yummy! My husband and I got two lobster rolls and split them. (We were a little hungover so we couldn't eat that much anyway, haha) We got the Connecticut style and the Beltway. Both were good, but the Beltway was definitely my favorite! It just wasn't as plain as the Connecticut, although if you squeeze the lemon they give you on the Connecticut, it's a lot better. The Beltway had old bay seasoning, mayo and toasted breadcrumbs, and it was served warm. Delicious! The bun was toasted perfectly and there was plenty of lobster meat inside. We will definitely be back! Thanks Lobster Me

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Beltway up top, Connecticut on bottom. Beltway was my fave! $19 each

zBed3jJiNyHqVnevKdUIvQ.text: This is another one of those reviews where I'd like the ability to give a place a half a star rating.  For my money it would be a 3.5 rather than a three.  I'm taking off a half a star because while the food is very tasty, the portions are small and even for Las Vegas, I thought $17 for the size lobster roll was steep.  For an additional $4 you can have a drink and fries instead of home made chips.  The fries were good, obviously home made and not out of a package, but again, small portions.  Potatoes are cheap folks.  If you aren't going to fill the guest up with a huge sandwich and a very tiny portion of cole slaw, then at least pile on the fries.    It's very casual, in a food court in the Venetian which is fine when you just want a quick bite.  Young people waiting on the customers were very pleasant and plenty of tables around to sit or you can take the sandwich out.  Plenty of folks partaking of the sandwiches.  Didn't hear any conversation so have no idea what others thought.  Again, my only complaint, small portion and pretty expensive.

eGPAd8tX08TZjQrxTGS6Dg.text: Lobster Me is a great place for lunch or a snack. The place is located in the Miracle Mile mall in the Planet Hollywood hotel next the Fat Tuesday. For a small place inside the mall they do make a damn pretty good lobster roll. I usually getting The Maine lobster roll it full of lobster meat no filling. Very tasty. Highly recommend place.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine lobster roll

1vWMTDV--lIZgh5Di30pmg.text: Don't. Just don't. Came here because Luke's is closed for renovations. $19 lobster roll that was terrible. The lobster looked greasy and it tasted like it had been sitting at the bottom of a freezer for a month. I only took one bite and that was more than enough. Lobster shouldn't chew like gum. The Old Bay fries looked and tasted like the fryer oil hadn't been changed recently. The "chowder" nothing more than milky water with a few sad potato chunks. One star for the crushed ice in my Pepsi. As I mentioned above, I only took one bite and pushed it away. Had been by myself, I wouldn't asked for a refund. But, my husband is much nicer than me, so he ate it. I hope I don't have to sit with him in the ER later on tonight :(

nu0YsRJk3nbliLnm18O7WQ.text: I just added Lobster Me to my list of must visit places everytime I visit Vegas. The lobsicle was the bomb. $14 for a skewer of deep fried lobster meat. Super awesome. Can't wait to try the grilled one next time I visit!

OFokSW--qmN8izWkmrL1hA.text: First of all the lobster rolls are great here. Today at the recommendation of karina - I think that's her name I tried the one that is warm with old bay seasoning.  Yum!!! I can also honestly say that this young lady also gave some of the best customer service that I've experienced in Vegas. That girl "gets it" and is going places!!

ZKI3X8FMw83DAW0ceAwbcA.text: Every time I've been to Vegas, I have always wanted to try this place. I am a huge seafood fan especially lobster and seeing their poster "Lobster Ice Cream" definitely enticed me. NOT because of the lobster flavored ice cream but the idea that they were serving everything-lobster.   We were so desperate to figure out something to eat really quickly that wasn't fast food so this place was going to do the job. EH. Honestly BIG BIG waste of money! I got a Lobster Salad which was $15...I expected something bomb. When the salad came out it was literally the size of a fast food salad you can get from like Carl's Jr or something. The only good thing about it was, yes, their big pieces of lobster. Other than that this was not worth it!   The people working were nice though. Their lobster rolls sounded good but after looking at the photos....all they do is drench mayo all over the lobster? gross.   Never eating here again! Not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Salad

NRcJ7rroq3DfvDBoPx2OzA.text: This is a fantastic idea for fast food, I wish we had this in Australia/New Zealand.  At Lobster ME they will offer you the choice of grilled or fried lobster. Your lobster comes in a roll ($19), or with fries, or my personal favourite, the lobsticle (lobster tail on a stick). The lobsticle is small but there's deceptively quite a lot of meat on the stick.  This is my new favourite takeaways!

GTYo0P9TnnXPIOO3Cu6qSw.text: At the Miracle Mile Mall near Fat Tuesday. This spot is soooo over rated if you ask me. And very pricey for the small portions. I guess cause it's "lobster" the prices are escalated.   I had Lobester fries with cheese... $14. This meal looked like something you get at a ball park, except with chopped up lobster on it. Fries were soggy towards the bottom...smh. Not a fan of this place.

xJ-gsf9UwDBbUgKzkVSF3Q.text: I came to Lobster ME for a quick bite after landing and waiting to check in to the hotel.  I ordered the Lobster Grilled Cheese, Cajun Fries, and Blueberry Lemonade.  The Grilled Cheese & Cajun Fries were tasty and hit the spot and the Lemonade was refreshing!

4jY0-qEOjBMJmgf2SyK99g.text: After going to Fat Tuesday...for about the 6th time in one day....we decided to have a snack at Lobster Me.   I ordered the Lobster Grilled cheese. Now. I'm not a huge fan of fish or lobster, but the thing about lobster is, it's not supposed to be fishy.   The lobster in the sandwich was really fishy and just didn't taste fresh. I had about 4 bites of the first half of the sandwich and my husband had the other 3 or 4 bites. When I offered him the other half...well...he declined LOL.  I gave the other half to my friend and she ate it...and seemed to moderately enjoy it I guess.  The wait was also SUPER LONG...like perhaps they had a nice lagoon in the back to actively catch the lobster...of course, they should have tasted fresher if that was the case.   I won't return.

ZlQ_ByE0IfSZatDObKwh-Q.text: So delicious!  They do not skimp on lobster!  What I order each time I go: -Cajun lobster roll ~$17 -lobster mac and cheese  What my friends like: -Lobster bisque -Lobster grilled cheese  What you can pass on: -lobster ice cream -the fries, unless you really want fries  Tips: -Grab a table before ordering! Seating is limited -It's a food stand located inside the Miracle Mile shops next to Fat Tuesdays -Be kind to the staff!  They are always friendly and generous with drink refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll is the best!

bQUSnKwm7XfstHxPOUdCdg.text: Lobster was ok. Lobster Mac and cheese was cold. Very expensive for what you get. There are better fast food options inside Planet Hollywood.

7BOL9_KL5RxQKgALEPADxg.text: Don't you dare come here! I know lobster is expensive but come on, I expect to be full after having a lobster roll and bisque.   My girl was dissapointed as hell. REALLY! The bisque was blah, the bread was stale and the roll was done in two bites. There goes $33  Plus there is no real seating area, just small tables next to the noisy Fat Tuesday's bar!  Their customer service looked like they were lost and didn't care!   SKIP IT PLEASE!

V9A9XgO9Kdz3ut-Q2Vn53A.text: $14 for three bites of lobster is a scam. It tastes good but the portion size was the same length as one of the french fries so it's basically less of a meal than getting an ice cream cone.  Definitely not worth the money and no where near the size of the menu pictures. Either they lack decency to give all customers similar portion sizes or   it's insanely overcharging in comparison to other establishments.  Fries in the combo was less portion than Mcdonald Dollar Menu so don't  expect that to help.  Would not go back.

L8QTgNkpxmtVdBhMlyEExQ.text: Best and most creative Lobster I've ever had and the primary reason my wife and I are considering going back to Vegas. We have searched for other places with similar Lobster Sandwich in Seattle every since, to no avail. Its spoiled all other lobster for us...

JBxtN2pXKDfc43iCHv4a6Q.text: I was expecting more bang for my buck, but left kind of disappointed. Since I was a first timer, I took up the recommendations of the cashier and got the lobster mac & cheese and lobster Maine-style sandwich with fries to share. Unfortunately, it was alright and did not satisfy my starving belly.   The lobster mac and cheese definitely needed a lot more lobster and the mac and cheese was too greasy and the cheese was too watery. There weren't even enough macaroni noodles to compensate for the cheese-like soup that was in the bowl. I would not recommend getting it.  The lobster Maine-style sandwich tasted like the ocean...enough said. I did enjoy the fries though! Would I come back? Maybe- but definitely not to get these two dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Maine Style sandwich

3ku1gsgm9ZIv2s-sgnDFpw.text: There is really no other word to explain this place, it's AMAZING! I always get the lobster fries and lobster grilled cheese and its like heaven! It's very flavorful! I was hesitant upon trying, now I make it a point to go after a few drinks from Fat Tuesday next door! Even the staff are nice and fast! You are missing out if you dont try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xlu1Ngiu65VyUxXEc2371Q.text: I would say that our experience at Lobster ME was (fair), not super fantastic but ok. Ordered the Maine style Lobster sandwich with coleslaw and fries and a chowder to split.  Not much seating in the Miracle Mile location, just a few tables that seem to be shared with the Fat Tuesday next door. Service was fine (not super friendly, but not rude either). $19 is pretty much what I would expect to pay for a lobster roll, enough meat, not the "best" pieces of lobster, but enough to fill me up. Flavor was fine, butter roll was tastier than the lobster. Chowder was also ok.  As you can tell from this review, everything was (ok), but not the (best). So you have to decide how hungry you are to try Lobster ME or not.

s6JL1l3O-dcwQN-RR86mOQ.text: If it sounds to good to be True....than it is!,  This writer bestowes the new name, "Lobster Me Not". Small portions and old looking lobster make it another Vegas ripoff.  A rule of thumb....if it is connected to a Vegas hotel or a mile of shops... run the other way. Same goes for the infamous Vegas Buffets. When Rent is too high, food quality and value go out the window. Im still trying to figure the bill, considering there wasnt any water ordered or consumed?????

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SJi19LL4mMnxpKrYkjgqLg.text: Me and wife popped in on a Friday after work. I got the Old Bay and my wife got the Cajun. Both were really good! The lobster was fresh and we'll seasoned, I was totally shocked cuz in Vegas seafood can be risky. But I would totally recommend this spot to anyone!

2dHBCMkdVYS39pMmt3egVw.text: I was really excited to try this place out!  After attending a pool party and walking around the strip, my friend and I finally decided to stop by here for a quick bite before returning to the suite. It is conveniently located inside the Miracle Mile Shop next to the Fat Tuesday!   FOOD --------------------  - Cajun Lobster Roll (cajun spices, lemon, butter, and seasoned mayo) - I ordered this one because I wanted something spicy! I made a great  choice because I really liked the spice and the seasoned mayo, but the lobster meat was a bit dry... The size of the lobster roll isn't something to rave about!  - Original Lobster Roll (Mayo and lemon with their house spice blend) - My friend ordered this. I tried and it was just OKAY!  - Garlic Fries - VERY GOOD AND TASTY! It's really worth it!  - Lobster Bisque - We ordered this for our friend, and she said it was good!  Overall, Lobster ME is GOOD. I don't think it's worth $18/roll but I'm just glad I crossed it off my list. It's not something I'd eat every time I'm in Vegas! I must say though that the customer service is great here! The girl who helped us knew the menu very well! And she was very engaging with every customer! Kudos to her!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll!

vEhqh-ec7iM6xd-im7Lhdw.text: 3 words: Lobster Mac N Cheese. Jesus H. heaven in a bowl for sure. It's a little pricey but it's lobster and it's vegas. A great easy place to get a snack, meal and a drink (where CAN'T you get a drink in vegas?)  It's in the middle of Planet Hollywood Mall so it's a convenient location for where I usually stay (cosmo)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese! Legit!

TBuCmqieFMct7Q9CUyCHvg.text: This is located in the Miracle Mile Shopping mall in Vegas.  It's in a mini-food court section.  I found the food to be relatively bland and overpriced. Despite the potential, this is typical food-court faire.

rCZwEy6ac8DF9lUObrtDkg.text: Good food! Lobster rolls are delish and the crab fries were also fantastic.  Way over priced but everything on the strip is.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut lobster roll with crab loaded fries.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Store Front

Ysoi2-d8iakbzUm-tonM2g.text: Been here before and I enjoy the food. It's $24 for the lobster roll, so it's gone up in price a couple of bucks the past few years.  The guy working the counter was nice. We ordered two Maine rolls, one with clam chowder and one with fries.  They give you a number to take to your table and they bring it out to you. It took about 15 mins to get our food.   The rolls were good, bread was butterred and browned nicely, the lobster was cooked well and not chewy, nice mix of salad dressing and greens to lobster. The fries are waffle type and were cooked great and not to salty.  The clam chowder had a good flavor but not a lot of clams but hey, it's a mall food court and it was good for where it's located. We don't really expect 4 star food at a food court do we? ((:

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CSmBcT66E7b4fJi64rWasg.text: We found this location of Lobster ME accidentally when we were looking for Fat Tuesday inside Miracle Mile Shops on the Strip. Coincidentally it was literally right next to Fat Tuesday and they share tables with them in a mini food court area. They had a decent amount of customers and the food looked good from afar. Customer service here is friendly and they bring out orders in a timely manner.   Nadine C ordered a Lobsicle for $16. It's a lobster tail on a skewer. The tail was very small and we felt that it was rather expensive for what it was. She gave me a taste of it and it was SALTY! Maybe if you dunk it in the butter, it'll help with the saltiness but it shouldn't be that salty. I think I'll pass on Lobster ME in the future. Thanks for sharing and for the experience Nadine!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle

4Lj0u8_Rjleknw7y2cwdBw.text: I ordered the lobster roll, it was delish. It came with waffle fries that was so yummy and the cole slaw was good as well. Ty and Corinna was so awesome!! The excellent customer service makes you want to come back. It's a tad bid expensive but they gave a military discount which is always awesome!! I would definitely eat here again when in Vegas.

wmd1Va57gJs2UdYDQsnJTg.text: You get what your pay for! It was a good catch while walking around The Miracle Mile Shops in Planet Hollywood. The price range for each meal is pretty normal for lobster. Everything tastes fresh and delicious.   Seats are available for you to eat your order at this branch. Plus, the line isn't too long. I recommend the The 50/50 Sea Dwag which contains half lobster & blue crab.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rT7YVTotBs-OftjTNNHoRQ.text: Great location inside the miracle mile shop. Not very many tables and chairs. Ordered the lobster roll with fries, lobster bisque on the side. Price little pricey for $24 for the lobster roll but it was delicious. The soup was great. The size of the lobster roll did not match the size advertised on the board. They got my order incorrect, missing fries. However m, the manager who was walking around asked if everything was okay. When I explained my order was incorrect, she gave me fries at no charge. Great customer service. Will Return again.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JgD2bfwpxiZu3gNEK5XHXw.text: Never had a lobster roll before.   THIS PLACE KNEW HOW TO DO IT. I mean, i have nothing to compare it to, but if I had imagined the goodness of a meaty, buttery, lobster roll, this place definitely met my expectations. I wanted to try the Clam Chowder, but they sadly didn't have it ready by the time that they opened.. went for the lobster bisque, it was GREAT.

eyFG4gdh3oUuljyJ7JxwQg.text: What an amazing experience eating at lobster me. Our cashier was so friendly and courteous. The food was delicious and came out timely for a busy restaurant.  I had some modifications to my order and the cashier was so nice and friendly to make them for me aside from free refills! My party and I visited on a Friday night and sat up at the bar area.  It was my first time eating there and I definitely plan on coming back and sharing the experience with my boyfriend who loves seafood! Keep it up lobster me!  Attention management your male cashier with the bleach blonde hair is amazing! Love him! Love him! Love him it's workers like that that create amazing experiences for tourists like me!

wdfnzuJet-947ftEY9BpYw.text: This place used to be 5 stars to me, and that was why I was so excited to come back to this place (after eating at this place for two years in a row). However, it was a big disappointment this year. I don't know if they changed their recipe or cook but the taste is not the same. The lobster in the sandwich that I ordered was very dry and the taste was bland. The Mac and cheese that I have always loved now tasted watered down and bland. I'm giving this place 3 stars because of the past two years.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u9NCQfrGSIp7vWGxJxi0tA.text: My husband and I went here two days in a row! We both ordered the Connecticut Lobster Roll( extra butter is a must) with clam chowder and waffle fries. We both absolutely loved our Lobster Rolls! The waffle fries were tasty as well.   The young lady that took our order ( I believe she was the manager) was very warm & polite. She even brought our order to our table.    We will be sure to return next time we're in Vegas.

Jx1Pri2r_38QJ0h5pzo3tQ.text: This is my favorite Lobster Me location. The service is outstanding and the food is so much better than the one in the Venetian. The lobster roll is really good but I feel like the portions are a lot smaller than what they use to give.  It's $25 for a lobster roll, fries, and coleslaw. Good but expensive. I love it so much I usually eat one once a day while on vacation. Lobster Me is a must stop if you are near Planet G

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with fries

XFlVHKPlLPdFm-gmN9WehQ.text: Better than expected for a mall restaurant.  Everything fresh and made to order.  Didn't get to try the lobster Mac.  Next time!

PIP4Ci1cJFs-e0a8Bb-O9g.text: Lobsicle... a lobster tail on a skewer!  Sounds good and looks great, right?  For the price, I was a bit disappointed. The lobster tail was on the salty side and I finished it in about four bites!  However, it was fresh and I didn't have to peel it.  I chose the grilled lobsicle over the fried version.  It was a novelty item and I'm glad that I satisfied my curiosity.  (It was served on a bed of shredded lettuce, with a lemon wedge and a small container of melted butter.)  Next time we're at the Miracle Mile Shops, I might get a Lobster Roll. I had the lobster mac and cheese in the past and it wasn't bad.    I realize that this is a shopping mall with possibly higher prices.  That's why I really appreciate the free parking!

8HAnSShzPOFFiFMMY6Fjfg.text: This place is great! Some of the best lobster bisque I have had! Lady taking my order was polite and on top of my order. Very reasonable price too.

BEhfnN8crzFNo-EJaMu8PA.text: I still love this place and make it a point to eat here every time I visit Las Vegas. Soooo new pics from my September 2018 visit. No changes. Still a fan!
