IMLmCwjn0N3x2mW9bEVPcQ.text: The driest most tasteless lobster roll I have ever eaten, plus it didnt taste all that fresh and was not super mild. $26.00 for a very disappointing experience. Save your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e549EaqVYTlQaZAnzAeIGw.text: I cannot even believe how great this place is. The food is top notch. We are here visiting and have made this our primary eating spot. To make it even better, the staff is outstanding. They are pleasant, knowledgeable, and happy to be there. One person specifically blew us away. Ty went above and beyond what I would ever expect in this type of setting. He's personable, knowledgeable about everything on the menu, and knew just how to help me navigate my gluten allergy which can be so tricky sometimes. He spoke so highly of the company and really made us feel taken care of.

RXT4kd3268yff-Pr00wIhA.text: A convenient place for a quick bite should the need arise while at the Miracle Mile Mall.  The portions are not large but the food is freshly made.  The seafood based menu results in higher than average prices.  Service and promptness of the food was as expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Fish Tacos,  Taco Trio with Chips
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FTaRN3MSoik9vYdZhDoGGg.text: Must visit quick, affordable lunch!  Connecticut Lobster Roll is my favorite. Probably my 10th visit today and it never disappoints!

BJ_AFHfz5NH2TlNMhzPpCA.text: Price was Fair for the location. 4 stars for Lobster Bisque  4 stars fir the service 2.5 stars for Lobster roll 'Cali avocado ' Butter. It looks ok but taste kind of bland . The Bun was dry. Need improvement on Bun and sauce. For $25 roll could be better.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3FjQbsjs3xpWwoObddODkA.text: I love lobster and this place was so disappointing. I got the lobster Mac and cheese and it was sooo watery. Plus the portion was very small for the price. It did have enough lobster but it wasn't great. I would not recommend this place.

RPTdJgXPZR9tRbQdj_tOqA.text: Dear lord, please avoid this place. I wasn't even hungry but the pictures looked pretty appetizing so I stopped to grab a lobster roll. Picked up the old bay flavor roll and it comes with home made chips and a side of coleslaw. The chips felt a little stale and the coleslaw just tasted rancid. As far as the roll, I couldn't have been more disappointed. The lobster pieces felt rubbery, kinda like they were previously frozen pieces and they recooked them before serving it. Totally not worth $20+ and I'm most definitely not going to give this place a 2nd try.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old bay lobster roll

_vI-f6dG1-OqoRSLqIy2Sw.text: Yes, it's lobster.  Yes, it's Vegas. Yes, things are going to be overpriced.  Then at least have better service, man.  I was super annoyed bc the place was literally empty--no customers. The guy working the front was chit chatting with his friend. Sees me waiting, keeps chit chatting.  WOW.  It was long enough that I was contemplating if I should just leave.    ANYWAY.  Got the Old Bay lobster roll and the lobster bloody.  A-OK.  Got more bread than loster in the roll and the chips were stale.  The lobster bloody was really good. Of course they had the lobster claw as garnish (that's how they justify the hefty price tag) and I did have someone stop me as I was walking through the mall asking about it.  It had good spice and was pretty good sized.  I tried a bit of my boyfriend's chowder--really good.  This has always been a spot that I've walked by and thought--I really need to try this place out--and I finally have.  I probably won't ever buy the lobster bloody again (it was good for the gram, though!), but I will def try other things on the menu.   Eyeing that lobster mac n cheese or grilled chZ.  Not sure.  Til next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Bay lobster roll

9h0ZNAsZsYUv61utgLhabg.text: Great idea for lobster. The prices are reasonable considering you are getting lobster. It's downplayed by being in the middle of a noisy mall. The good tasty food, I recommend trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle combo

yVtE76kWcZ937b09ET4zFQ.text: Surprising it the best way to describe Lobster Me. Not sure but this seems to be a food truck concept that is now brick and mortar ? This walk up mall location offers a wide variety of all things Lobster indulgent. yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs... It's like Forrest Gump for Lobster. Lobster Rolls,Lobster Mac'n cheese, Lobster grilled cheese sammie, Lobster Bisque, Lobster Tacos, Lobster deep fried, Lobster salad and what ? Lobster ice cream( oh yes that too). To be clear even though it's a walk up order counter, don't expect cheap prices. The 2 Lobster taco combo will set you back $17 but the are well worth the splurge for fast casual dining. Large and fluffy chunks of freshly steamed lobster meat fill the taco. These are not "langostinos" or left over rubbery stuff often passed off as lobster, this is bona fide lobby goodness. Squeeze that lime onto the sweet spot of the taco with the cabbage, pico, and some of their chipotle cream sauce and oh my. yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs... yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs... Surprising to say the least. I wish I had a bigger appetite when I was there but this was mid afternoon, pre-dinner snack that two of us shared and it was perfect. I will go back and try the other goodies next time I am in town. Wonder when these are gonna make their Cali debut?

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Up close on the combo
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Taco Combo, delicious!

LlHkbkLZHylX3fSALSdFsg.text: Slow as hell. Tables are all dirty so when the guy brought me my order, I asked him to wipe table...he walked back to get a cloth wiped the table and chucked the cloth in the garbage...WTF? What a douche ! Food was OK, but way overpriced.

9wbNP2p7OFaDpGjE42wqPg.text: I didn't really know how to rate this place. So let me give it a shot!!!!!  Pros - The food was real good  Cons - The wait was crazy long. There wasn't anyone in front of me and it took way too long. I feel like the price was too high.   Done!!!!!

ILv2w4ctcF9YWGJNqviAmg.text: We ordered the lobster roll. It was delicious. The toasted bread is flavorful. Cole slaw was meh, not good or bad. I am not a slaw eater so can't tell either way. It wasn't soggy or overwhelming. The fries were delicious. I didn't even use ketchup. It's fried golden crisp and had a nice flavor of salt and other ingredients. There are chunks of lobster in there. The sandwich is kind of small for what they are charging. Maybe they can make he roll bigger and add some other filler in it like zucchini or something. It's $21 for the sandwich so it's not cheap when Chipotle is $7.50 for their bowl. Soda will run you a couple bucks but they have free refills. They are busy so you have to wait for them.  I think they should just place it in the front counter and let customers help themselves.  Service is friendly. They bring the food and drink to you even. It's 5 foot away so we could just as well do it ourselves really. The better half was waiting for their food truck last year and they never came. Unfortunately, I was with her that time and we ended up ordering some other trucks meh sandwich.  I managed to snap some pics of the menu if you want to see pricing. There's a locals discount too btw. But I would not come back just to eat here again. The strip is busy and it's a bit pricey.

_QI4sm2W-Rd3uX1IVJvdmQ.text: This place has great lobster dishes.  Highly recommend The Surf and Turn and fish tacos.  Fantastic sauce on tacos.  Also, the Pepsi is perfect

nAHB3wT8y0KJiPSkoe3tOg.text: Can't resist anything lobster.  The food was excellent, but not excellent enough to be over priced.    All the specialty lobster rolls come with chips for $19.  They're not big portions either.    I had the lobster and chips, which came with a "Lobsicle" or lobster on a stick, a side of butter, and fries for $15.  The Lobsicle was so small.  This meal was probably 85% fries, and 15% lobster.  Tastes excellent, but I was still hungry in the end.  $15 and still hungry.    Good flavor, but expensively priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and chips (lobster on a stick)

obdmGYu1h64eWPk4cydOVQ.text: Stopped for a quick lunch, had a coupon in the AAAmiracle mile book for 20% off . We got the lobster grilled cheese with fries, a grilled fish taco and the Mac and cheese lobster balls. It was all good but the grilled lobster grilled cheese was more like mashed mystery seafood in a piece of cheese between Texas toast. Is not get that again but try something else. Price was about average for the meal but the discount made it more palatable . We will go again - the lobster Bloody Mary is on my list ! It does look fantastic

x5kuFkSXziQytYoiPd8PjQ.text: Very expensive - even for Vegas prices. The lobster grilled cheese is basically a crab grilled cheese - Underwhelming with a minimum amount of lobster. The CT lobster roll was also underwhelming, and tasted unusually fishy - not fresh. I wouldn't try this place again. The fries were good.

v4XXualvTaQcFYpWQY1ImQ.text: Loved the concept of a lobster grilled cheese. Had bacon, lobster chunks, choice, cheese sauce and bread (of course!) accompanied with a soda and old bay fries. Food seemed okay.. noting special. Right up there with my homemade grilled cheeses. Actually I think my bacon and spinach grilled cheese is better. Anyway, I won't be back for this but maybe next time I will order the lobster fries since the fries were delicious .

gvG_YutS5Lxm8vN78qLmUg.text: Pretty much everything here has lobster, so of course it appealed to me. It was difficult for me to choose what to eat, but I decided on a lobster roll and the lobster bisque. Both were extremely good and filling. The one thing I was bummed about is that they served chips instead of french fries or tator tots.   That would be my recommendation to this place: make some dish with lobster and fries or tots!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with lobster bisque. So good.

NsaN6GNV5noKTo8B6pUAYw.text: The Best place to eat on the Strip. Totally worth it!   For the Main Lobster sandwich, they make sure you will taste the lobster with each and every bite.  The Lobster Bisque taste soothing with its exquisite balance of Creme Sherry, and really hit the spot during windy and cold Las Vegas weather.  Review based on Maine Lobster & Lobster Bisque

2mjpXTb3O4JQiQM4SN_Ymg.text: Lobster me at Miracle Mile Shops was my favorite place. Tonight changed my mind. Did you know that the prices at this location and the Venetian location are different? Neither did I!   Tonight I bought a Connecticut Lobster Roll, no sides, and it was $27!!! At the Lobster Me at the Venetian, I got the same Connecticut Lobster Roll and it was $19! I said that was a huge price difference and they agreed. Psssst, come on son!   From now on, I will go the the one in the Venetian Shops.   Food is good though.

JbZNQScSBKHCGKCD6jvILg.text: Cold lobster meat thrown haphazardly into a slit on a roll. Not much going for it in taste or serving size. Served with fries for about $30? Will not be coming back.

QDaeG65p6MGXVZ0e7-kDSw.text: On our search to eat at places we don't have in Orange County, my boyfriend and I stumbled across this place. We ordered the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Crabcake Burger with Lobster Bisque and OMG it was heavenly. The bf is hard to please and he loved the lobster bisque. Would definitely try this again. And the service was great, the cashier was very attentive and gladly explained certain entrees we were thinking about ordering.

L8Dc8JB-8nDSvJ_DxB3vUQ.text: Pretty good place to grab a quick lobster snack but can be a little pricey when it comes to the lobster rolls.  This restaurant could be hit or miss depending on what you order. The lobster roll itself was a bit dry due to the amount of bread given in contrast to the lobster but had a great taste. The item I enjoyed the most was the lobstercicle. That deep fried lobster was awesome with the butter to dip on the side.   I'd give three and a half stars but until yelp allows the half, this gets three from me.   Lunch 7/13/2014

UzZXN5O60uv7WbxknYylAw.text: Delicious! That's all I can say. I got the Connecticut lobster roll and it was delish! The bread was buttery and perfectly toasted. Thick slice and reminds me of Texas toast. The lobster was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. Comes with home made chips and slaw. Eh to those but I didn't pay for those. I paid for the sandwich lol. Service was quick and friendly. And, if it makes a difference, Fat Tuesday is right next to it :) I'll be back tomorrow. They have a lobster melt which is basically a lobster grilled cheese I'm dying to try! And yelp has a coupon offer when you check in to get a free lobster bisque with a melt. Sold! Highly recommend. But remember I'm a Texas gal and not from the East Coast so this is a southern review ;)

PCsYbRosfFHF1utwBuw7LQ.text: The grilled cheese lobster is a must have. A little gem inside the Miracle Mile Shopping center next to Planet Hollywood. Definitely recommend the lobster bisque too while you are there. I wish they had more seating area.

sxiceKcXFzxcD2J_X0zmTQ.text: Ok food- definitely over priced for what you get. Lobster roll is about 4"long. Mac n' cheese was rather blah...clam chowder and lobster bisque was horrible. Grill cheese was the best thing I ate there...

CkpqZwHlmm23euTtmVDV0w.text: This place is bomb. If you want lobster displayed as a tiny portion at some fancy schmansy restaurant, do just that. This is the perfect meal to share after a night of insanity, it hits the spot. I've read other reviews that there isn't enough lobster on the roll, but I must have gotten lucky because this was loaded with lobster and delish sauce. Definitely will be coming back for a carb-load hangover fix

bTO5YqngxVHQoyy9_ETRpw.text: Not as good as expected....bisque was meh...very creamy not strong lobster taste. Tasted like lobster but just not as much as I would've liked. Lobster salad was very small, they should just add more lettuce and veggies, it was more like lobster pieces on bed of lettuce than a salad. Lobster roll was good but lobster pieces were not as large as I saw in photos. Service was slow and not rude but neither efficient nor overly friendly.

Z5VvcbQnPwRN8hG2edRLBA.text: Stopped here for convenience since it was close to my hotel and on the way back. Ordered the lobster fish and chips, which came pretty fast and was a quick option. At 13 bucks...it's also not too bad of a price, especially for lobster!   Being in Vegas, I wouldn't expect good lobster/seafood at all due to the fact that the place is in the middle of the dessert, HOURS away from places to catch fish and fresh seafood. This lobster was pretty bomb though and there were pretty decently sized chunks of meat within the fried pieces of lobster.   The main thing I disliked was the location. You basically eat out on the tables in the middle of the walkways in miracle mile and there was no secluded seating area strictly for the restaurant.

tVdbl2e7vzdBbJtnYrVZcQ.text: I still love this place but it looks like the price increased and they took the option of a large lobster roll. Cajun fries are also a dollar more now. We usually come twice the weekend we go to Vegas but we're probably going to have to cut down now.

DCnAu0emM6NTXj7RQZfTGQ.text: Being a Lobster fanatic, i just had to try this place during a quick trip to Vegas. I was a bit surprised and disappointed to see that this is more of a fast food type set up. I was expecting and would have preferred a sit down place with actual plates and silverware.  However, this place is definitely a must-try for all lobster lovers! Is the lobster the best quality around? No. However, it's still good and where else can you get lobster waffles, lobster grilled cheese, lobster ice cream, lobster on a stick (list goes on and on...) for a reasonable price?   This is certainly not a nice dinner place - but for a unique and delicious breakfast and/or lunch and/or late night treat in Vegas, LobsterMe is a GREAT choice! I will be back the next time im in/around Planet  Hollywood.

2t_qwKcdk_cVQGlJD3cqww.text: Gimmicky...as far as the "Lobsicle" and bisque. Avoid. The lobsicle was tasty but was tiny..Not worth the $. The bisque was watered down. Ive had better bisque from costco.

C6IxijuJK0nPTGSpqCfIqw.text: Stick with the Cajun. It has the right amount of butter mayo and peppers. The flavor is enjoyable. My second time here. Ordered the Connecticut as well not bad but preferred the Cajun. Overall if you love lobster this is a must. Enjoy it

ziWqk-T5hV1EeBR36wTbyA.text: Having never been to Maine, this is THE best lobster roll I've ever had. My friends and I go here every time...and I mean EVERY time...we are in Vegas. Sometimes more than once in a week. I've tried the butter, the mayo and the diablo. The straight lobster and butter is my fave. They'll even warm it up if you ask.  I've tried some of there other menu items but nothing is as good as that lobster roll. It also gets bonus points for being right next to Fat Tuesday. You really can't lose with this one.

4_meLkw6yIPUrSoN2k-qtQ.text: Food was great and presentation was well. The lobster rolls was definitely better than the tacos.

LTdMwBKRdU1009ICxJxxyg.text: I used to love this place, sandwich was nice lobster tail was awesome, now they serve you a bite of a sandwich for the same price and a lobster tail the size of a tootsie roll tootsie pop for the same price, unless you want to spend $100 to get half full from an empty stomach i would suggest sandwich of earl for a fraction of the cost. This place WAS awesome.

JS5_pSWQH6Sw7k1RPyX29g.text: Was in Vegas July 20, and thought I stop in and try the Losbter Me, what a waste of monies, the pictures posted here on Yelp is nothing like the sandwich they give you, more like a Lobster spead instead of a Lobster sandwich, trust me when I say this save your monies so many better places to eat at and for $17.00 and its True the sandwich is not bigger than a cell phone. A mess if I was not in my room when I open the sandwich believe me it would have went back but I choose to trash it and take the lost.....

wzfe_7luLvMpF-TAVnv4_w.text: I have to start by saying the portions are tiny.  My 4 year old hammered down the fish n chips in under 5 min, not bc they were delicious but because they were literally 3 strips the size of my thumb!  For $12 it is a horrible buy  The lobster sandwiches are also for the post bariatric surgery patient with a belly the size of a orange.  The lobster chunks were good but for $17 I would expect more than 3 bites folded in 1 slice of regular bread.  Pros Convenient location  Cons Size Portions Size Portions Cost Cost  Do NOT recommend. For $4 more might as well eat a full Planet Hollywood buffet!

GWurF2-GALkOOLT8QEfiQw.text: We stopped here after the Koi Yelp event since we were still a bit hungry. It is located inside of the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood.  It is an interesting location for a restaurant such as this, but whatever works. It was close to 10pm and I expected a moody employee who was done for the day, but when we got to the counter we got just the opposite. The girl working the counter was very friendly and sweet.; we joked, made small talk about Yelp and she offered some suggestions. Kudos for great service! We opted for the Lobster Bisque and a Lobster Roll to share. The bisque was served in a bread bowl and was nothing short of absolutely delicious. The lobster roll was very good as well - they did not skimp on lobster at all! The price with tip for those two items came to be around $31 which was not bad for the quality and quantity of the food there. but it is still relativley pricey. And of course, can't forget the great service.

_gVb1xK49g6-e6Gz4I2PNA.text: I had the Connecticut version, just lobster meat and butter. Very good but for $18 it was a very small roll, maybe 6 bites. Served with small amount of coleslaw and chips. Service was friendly and quick.

xGdiMhdRhvydE5Lwb4dIww.text: Firstly I would like to start out by apologizing to the lobsters that have died an unworthy death in vain for this place. The lobster meat here just does NO justice at all. God where do I start? The meat is dry and tastes like it has been frozen for months, and i dont mean the good frozen with Idina Menzel, the only thing this place "let go" of is their quality.. And for their stingy portions, I would rather get better quality at a fine dining restaurant for cheaper. We ordered the Connecticut lobster roll which was $17 and 5" long.. Roll was dry and stale, not buttery fluffy or light like it should be. Soup was average and served cold instead of warm not like it was supposed to be, and the bread bowl?...yes you guessed it, stale and hard! I understand escalation for being near the strip but $17 for 5" of trash given in worse portions than the meals handed out during the holocaust is just cold.. Sorry, was that joke in bad taste? Not as bad taste as lobsterme. This was the most expensive lobster roll and at the same time the worst I ever had, I'm heart broken at this. Dont be fooled by the yelp pictures, most are a year or older before portions were $6 for costco free sample sizes (literally that is the equivalency if you size it down). I wish i could give 0 stars.. RIP lobsters who died in vain for lobsterme, may heaven grant you a better roll with fresh ingredients to rest upon..

tI5rWGoY_qZu7joiFm01bA.text: This will go down as one of the best splurges ever in our many years of food exploits. I was so curious about trying the lobster roll ever since we noticed this place opening last year (never had one! seen them on the food channel on DDD though, so was familiar). Enter last friday when I was entertaining the idea of places to check out this weekend. I had my mind set on this place. I kept talking to my husband about it and we had a nice build up. I was hoping to have it yesterday, except we had spent some time on the east side with my in-laws (translation: we were out all day), that we decided it would be today. Yes, finally, today. Can you feel my anticipation?   Lunch was relatively empty for a sunday though there were lots of characters passing by (the people watching). There are about 16 tables about five feet away from the restaurant. You order and pay at the window. Ok, a short feeling of sticker shock, over $50 for two combos, the XL Lobster Roll, fries, and a drink. I inquired about the Lobster Ice Cream and the cashier gave us each a sample. Nice surprise, because we didn't ask, but that was nice of her. It was different (not that bad, actually, though my husband made a face suggesting he didn't like it), and now we can say we've tried it! A short wait later, another nice lady delivers the food to us, and what a picture! The nice server brought us lots of ketchup, napkins, and plastic utensils. She also cleaned up when we were leaving.    The lobster meat (claws and knuckles) on both sandwiches was very generous, and the mayo was light and the seasonings were just right. The bread was lightly buttered and was toasted enough for a light amount of crustiness. (I hate when the bread is soft and gets squashed up.) Also, the bread was not heavy, making the lobster the main attraction (as it should be!). It was the perfect balance. The lobster meat was sweet and fresh tasting (no smelly fish smells here), there wasn't a whole lot of mayo (hate when it's mayo overload, gross), it was delicious!!! Usually, I eat pretty fast, but I went really slow, because I wanted to savor it. In fact, my husband finished his sandwich before I did. I got a few small pieces of shell, but it really wasn't a big deal. The fries were skin-on, thinly sliced steak fries, seasoned, and crisp. The fries were flavorful, but the portion was very generous, so I didn't finish it. Drinks are free refills until 11 pm.   We both really enjoyed it. It's such a nice thing when a place lives up to your expectations. Yes, it's not cheap, but it's lobster from Maine, people! And yes, people passing by will stop and stare at your food, but who cares, I was so into the food, I wasn't even noticing them. I was so happy to have finally had a Lobster Roll, it was food bliss. It is worth the $$$. Take a to-go menu (no prices) and plan the next meal here. Afterward, some walking around the mall was in order, as we were both satisfied, and fully nourished.

ULFE498CxoOFh4_qLrxzCQ.text: Fantastic Lobster melts. This place was very busy. They could use more seating. Prices were very reasonable. Great Yelp check in offers. Had Lobster bisque very bland. Not much flavor. I also tried the chowder fries and loved them. My meal reminded me of down home comfort food. Besides my bisque everything had great flavor and fresh tasting. Thanks for a quick meal without the fast food feel, while walking the strip.

mk4EmUrmBjfdT5YXyUVGVQ.text: I love the concept. The ice cream was mostly vanilla tasting with an interesting texture of lobster, which WAS plentiful in it.  The mac and cheese with lobster on top was delicious and a huge portion for $11.  The service was polite and friendly, but the preparation time was a little slow, and I had to fight for a seat in this mall atrium. They could use a few more tables if the mall will let them have it. Especially since people buy buckets of beer there and sit in place for a few hours.  I'd say though, spring for the lobster roll. It is worth the extra 5 bucks over the other things on the menu.   I just like saying the word lobsicle. Can you blame me?

KJk9VoEXtolF9CXR5s0jfA.text: Best lobster roll I had to date and this is saying something since I visited Cape Cod after this.  I went there 2 years ago and forgot about it.

FtGfZ6kwH595_AoUewZhdg.text: The lobster roll itself is actually almost 4.5 stars, the salad we got is aprox a 3-star but it is kinda pricey, yeah yeah I know its lobster but still; its a casual fast-food type service.
