rX3KiyrSBtE2vhqIbvmU2w.text: Disappointing ! to say the least. The bisque was watery with no lobster pieces and the lobster salad was small with a vinegarette salad dressing that ruined what was poor to begin with. I usually try to give places the benefit of the doubt but I was truly disappointed in this spot as a former New Englander.

BanlmXDYAzE4gyJcVsIPMw.text: be prepared for over seasoned and over cooked lobster..... Watery lobster bisque and flavorless bread. 40$ of nothing. Totally disappointed. Who puts oregano in a lobster roll?

UiaIQQwywulXxE4Wan_eZw.text: Went there tonight for dinner, ordered the traditional lobster roll which ran me $23, was filled with tasty lobster meat, my very first one so have nothing to compare it to, enjoyed it but it was kind of pricey, this place is located in the Miracle Mile Shops next to Planet Hollywood Casino, which is a pretty cool mall as malls go.

4gp5WzglPJNl66yrCOHV4w.text: Went there for lunch today. Expensive for what you get. I ordered the lobster and chips, there was only 4 extremely small lobster bites and a small handful of fries. The taste was good but for 14$, are you kidding me! My husband got the original lobster roll, they cut a small slice in the roll and put a small amount of lobster in it. So you get a mouthful of mostly bread. Don't think we will ever eat there again.

TFQnW_Kc_L121uEXA9XS_Q.text: Got the lobster bisque and tator tots. The tots were outstanding and even though I'm not really a lobster fan the bisque was quite tasty. Good value for the price.

KTEYblpTAL7Ste0F719b1A.text: We were starving after a day at the pool and wanted something quick and easy. We happened upon Lobster Me under our hotel and decided we both wanted some lobster. I eat gluten free so I was hoping they would have a gluten free option with Lobster. They did in the form of the Lobster Salad. My partner got the lobster mac and cheese. Both were alright but not spectacular. The mac and cheese was oily. The salad had very little lobster for 15$. and an orange juice for 5$ was not very cheap. Cashier was very friendly.

Zsul2i2-TRy43vJSkidOjA.text: I just eat the grilled lobster deep-fried lobster on the stick the Diablo lobster roll lobster macaroni and cheese are the best you can get  I have no words to say but excellent the manager dan really is the best hot and fresh lobster

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster lobster very good lobster on a stick

ued2MHzCIY1D__xP5er0Ig.text: Loved the Lobster on a stick.  Had it grilled, it was amzing. Looking forward to the next time:)  We had a big group there and everyone had something different, and loved it all.  If your in Vegas this is a must eat lunch or snack at!!

1Wknu8D3_yebiMk57CLkSw.text: Meh. Not at all what I was expecting.  It's in the Miracle Mile shopping center.  So expect a mall food court atmosphere, which means lots of Vegas tourists, strolling by slack-jawed, making noise and being obnoxious.  Your food comes on plastic plates with packaged plastic ware, fountain drinks in styrofoam cups or bottles.  Food was good, but it's location leaves a lot to be desired.  I am unsure if this is a chain restaurant but it sure feels like it.  I thought Bubba's Shrimp Company had better food, and lobster bisque.  If you are doing Vegas and eating on the run, this place is right up your alley.  If you are looking for a good sit down eatery, keep looking.

3NvIOvMleBvsxidg5kd1Og.text: The woman or young gal that was working at the cash register on Sunday evening was superb, excellent customer service. The food is fantastic. My only complaint is that they should have some green salsa for the lobster tacos. #LobsterMe rocks! Delicious, definitely will be back.

4t8IUBgDRYWs9Xc36mFcog.text: I guess I should have walked away when it seemed that everyghing I wanted to oreder was gone, but I decided to take a chance and ask the cashier what he would recommend. He directed me to the Lobster Roll, and albeit it being ok, It was sooo tiny I could not even enjoy it, an for $17 I would not recommend it to anybody

KA_SIknGmY7K_w5blxmrPQ.text: wow what a little gem hidden in the mall. I do wish the lobster meat was served warm but it was still alot of meat and tasted fabulous. After a late night of drinking and dancing this will fix you right up!

cfaP1SPET9_A7xO8rWVgNw.text: Went back to Lobster Me to have the Lobster bisque and was very happy with it. It was rich and creamy and more than I expected from a place in the middle of the miracle mile :-) will definitely be for more when I'm on the strip!

Rkia5U9elV8GTp91hjIxTA.text: Lobster roll my girlfriend ordered was delicious. A little pricey but you get a fair amount of lobster meat. I had the fish and chips and wish I had ordered a roll myself.   The french fries are decent, but nothing special and the fish I was told was atlantic cod but the texture was all wrong. The batter was ok but uninspiring. It tasted like the ff and the fish had both been deep fried in the same oil. After eating two of the triangle fish nuggets I gave up and stared at my girlfriends roll. -1 star  Next time I will stick with what they do best  The boards were easy to read above the walk up and order counter but they have limited seating. If you stick to just ordering a roll you can forgo a table and sit on nearby benches.   Overall pretty good, I will be back and can recommend this as a good spot to fix a lobster roll craving in a hurry!

VtbXKWWbQxPJs8W0u_IU2A.text: Good lobster roll but it's EXPENSIVE! My fiance and I decided to share everything so make sure you get the large roll. It comes with a side of fries and a drink, but we also got the mac-n-cheese and clam chowder. All of which was over $40!!!   We couldn't finish it all, it's heavy in the stomach! Ohhhh, FYI: one thing that sucks is you have to fight for a spot to sit at cause it's in the middle of the miracle mile and they don't have enough tables and chairs for all their customers.

n2D3NyR31JV-yGoqrBxFdA.text: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! All you can eat lobsicle!NOPE all you can buy! Prices high for little. Hope  this saves you from the False advertisement

2QA5FUIGap2dpjNdYGZX7g.text: Ended up gettin the Diablo....  Man ...!!!!!! It was bomb ,.... The chef told me to try Cajun style next time ,...  Lobster Mac n cheese was ok ,...   Cajun fries were to oily needed a more crisp to it ,,..   All in all was pretty coo just cuz I luv lobster an most deff going back for another roll ,....

hnmUt3rbVu_biW082MOUAQ.text: I'm a lobster fan, just lobster in general.  When I had found out that this place existed, I knew it was over.  Could there be a little more lobster ?! Yes, but then again, I want it all.  It's at a good price point for what is offered on the strip.  Staying on the Strip or eating on the Strip, it will cost a few nickels more as opposed as to eating from some location elsewhere.   I'll admit, I have been going here everyday since I've arrived.  The lobster is fresh and service is pretty decent.  There's a little wait depending on the time of day, but it's well worth it.  Their fries are deliciously twice cooked so you get that extra crunch in each bite.  I liked the lobster rolls, but since there are many-few options on the menu, I'm trying to try them all.  It's a small feat indeed.  Their lobster mac and cheese is simply delectably delicious as well as their lobster mac and cheese fries!  Service is friendly, great product.  If you're on the Strip, stop in for a bite.  It hasn't failed to please.

wNnj_ZQIJXxbDGd9kfb8Ng.text: I recently went on a weekend trip to Vegas and heard good things about this place! While it was a little expensive, my lobster roll was absolutely delicious! I ordered The Original Maine Style (chilled lobster meat) and my friend ordered the Connecticut (warm lobster meat tossed in melted butter).   The bun was warm and toasted but not too crispy (and not burned!) and the lobster tasted fresh. The spices they used added to the roll, the perfect touch!   My only complaint would be the price, but I was expecting to be paying a little more because it is lobster after all!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine Style

CDmg1JCE2DTcdIBwZ-z0aw.text: This used to be our favorite lobster roll place, but they just recently changed the menu. It may be a little expensive but for it's price of $19 the roll already comes with coleslaw and chips, but this was before. Now the menu still has the same price of $19 but this time no chips, only lobster roll and coleslaw - for the same price of $19. Really? It did said on the menu board though that the roll is served with pickle and coleslaw, but when we got our order there was no pickle - only the roll and coleslaw. But even with the pickle replacing the chips, it's still not worth it's price anymore. BRING BACK THE CHIPS!!!

M-hXPVTsEjoMAN4CTTkNDQ.text: gf and I hit Lobster Me post-Meatloaf concert.  I was kinda surprised it was a "fast food" styled place where you order at a counter, sit in an open table area and then they bring the food to you.  We ordered the lobster roll ( medium - $18), Lobster Grilled cheese ( I believe it was $13 ) and lobster mac n cheese ( dang, I was tired - I forget the price but I'm guessing $15 )  Glad I bought a large can of Corona ( $10 )  - I just about killed the can before the food showed up.  The verdict - not bad.  The roll was very basic - grilled roll and chunks of lobster saturated in butter.  Decent serving size.  Lobster was tender.  Lobster mac n cheese - I liked it;  gf didn't.  She felt the lobster should have been cooked into the mac n cheese.  my response, " Why?"  I've commented on other reviews I question the combination of mac n cheese and lobster ( I feel the lobster gets " lost " in the cheese ) but I felt this serving was decent.  I do agree with the gf that the mac n cheese probably would have been better with a sharp cheese, but again, this will probably result in the lobster getting lost in the shuffle.  The lobster grilled cheese , well.... same principles as the lobster mac n cheese - too much cheese means less lobster flavor so why bother.  Still, not a bad sammie.  Not sure I will eat there again if so, i'll stick with the lobster roll.  pics included

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster roll - simple but all good !
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster grilled cheese - ok

J3b9pSCbZcmsUVFRmmhd0g.text: Delicious! My mom and I came for lunch and ordered the trio of lobster tacos and the lobster texmex salad. The tacos had large chunks of salad over a bed of cabbage with some sort of mayo based sauce. They were good. I didn't eat the corn tortillas but they looked like decent store bought tortillas. The salad was good! The salad had romaine lettuce, black beans, corn, jack cheese, bacon and avocado. It also came with a yummy green dressing that I also used on my tacos. I would definitely return.

s7LRjlDEJnWXJ4YhNZTbBA.text: I liked the food, but as others pointed out I really didn't get the lobster taste I was looking for. I really was going for hefty chunks of lobster in my sandwich melt. I would say it was a very good grilled cheese sandwich! It's located in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops and is more of a food court type of establishment. The service was good but what really kind of confused me is that all the condiments are kept behind the counter. I was like, can I have some ketchup, can I have a napkin, and can you refill my water? I got up like 5 times for my requests. When I finished my sandwich I wasn't sure what to do with my trash. Do I bring back or put it in the little trash can? They eventually came and picked it up for me. I sought this place out and with parking and the walk; I probably walked off the calories I ate. Lol.. Is it a fine dining experience?  No!  Good value for what you get? Pretty close. Would I come again? I suppose if happened to be walking by. Definitely not worth the hunting I did to seek them out, so I'm going with a mid-grade review. Thanks for taking the time to read this.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P9WqdxbP4rvMF0C0lB5KUw.text: Lobster ice cream?  WTF?!  I sampled the lobster ice cream and it was definitely interesting.  Tasted like butter cream with bits of lobster.  Not bad, but the texture is unexpected.  We ended up ordering a lobster grilled cheese sandwich and a lobster roll (photos are included).  The lobster roll was small but was very good.  The grilled cheese sandwich was also good but was a little bland.  They had tapatio sauce to help spice it up.  Over all for a lobster roll, and lobster grilled cheese, and 1 drink, the total was a little over $30.  It was a good place to munch while you are shopping.  Other items on the menu included lobster mac n cheese and lobster soup in a bread bowl.  What I did not like about this place was the wait literally took forever.  I also did not like that it did not provide enough places to sit down.  This was a good place to grab something good and go.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

Jgr_AXjm7JRyf5PM1kjffA.text: Lobster mac and cheese and lobsters on a stick are delish! I see alot of reviews about the price, dont be surprised, you are eating LOBSTER?! Service was excellent.

nX2wSTTTvM8rKhoL7v9WcA.text: I got the crab burger and wife had the philly steak, good but pricey for what you get

k4-JIK3mbZ0bX0SBT2CJMw.text: I was expected more from this place. We had seen signs all over Vegas for the Lobsicle (fried lobster tail in a stick), and finally decided to try it out when we were in the Miracle Miles shops. Ordered a Lobsicle, Lobster Bisque, and Cajun fries. Fries were good, as was the bisque (not a whole lots of flavor though), Lobsicle was meh.... For $14 you get about 2-3 bites. Not much seating here - they do have about 4 spots along the bar, and food court style seating nearby.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle and Cajun Fries

wsYA17o9uwy5PQZbvvq7cw.text: Yum!  I'm glad my husband and I gave this place a shot. It's in the miracle mile at planet Hollywood.  Their is limited seating but you do have the option of eating in or take out.   Obviously their specialty is lobster and the lobster rolls looked delicious but pricey. They also have something called a lobscicle which was featured on some channel like a&e.   We ended up getting a lobster grilled cheese  sandwich and the clam chowder fries. The sandwich was delicious!  The right amount of lobster and the bread was crisp. And the clam chowder fries were sooo good!  The portion is small though.   I'm definitely coming back the next time in Vegas. Apparently they have one at the Venetian/ Palazzo too. I might get the clam chowder soup by itself and I would like to try the lobscicle.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese sandwich
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder fries

AtTmEqyiaxp1ykQCWdvWMQ.text: This place is pretty good for whats presented as kinda food court fast food.  In any other city in American the price would make the fast food comparison laughed but in Vegas its not bad.  I wish it stayed open later but I dig the idea.  They have a couple of different styles of lobster rolls.  It comes down to what you get it tossed in.  I got the cajun so it was tossed with some cayenne/lawryish type dust and was really good.  I know with seafood the closer to the coast the fresher and all that but as a semi late night snack after gambling, this did the trick.

tClVS_y0eljNBsn1uTFWlg.text: This was our 1st time eating there and for 2 rolls and their taco trio 3 sodas $94. And some change.  They were good, not delish.  A little over priced but hey.....

R4U4a72K71moaMqCV9OxLg.text: so this is only for the lobsticle!  I saw the sign outside and thought it was pretty creative so i decided to give it a try (i love lobster)  the lobster on a stick (lobsticle) was around 15 bucks plus the taxes, which i think is pretty high but its vegas i guess,   it took about 10 minutes to get ready and they bring it to your table  it was reallly hot and juicy. It wasnt too chewy or anything and it was fried. fried makes everything taste better....but its lobster, its going to be good regardless, dip it in the butter and add some lemon juice and your going to love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmmm
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsticle 15 bucks.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aMNUJIuBYjo3xHfqEoPWuA.text: Ordered a lobster grilled cheese is was ok... lobster mac & cheese with overly cooked (& probably rinsed) pasta with no cheese. Cole slaw was drier than ever tasted like it was just cabbage  never again waste of money

ncmuxX_OFltL5gcNH1SAhA.text: I think the lobster tasted great! Fries were okay. But the price was too much in my opinion. The size of the lobster roll is about a 6 in. Inside the roll isn't much lobster, but does have tons of bread for $25 each roll. Which we needed 2 so for $50 some thing bucks i feel like we could have got something else much more filling for same price.

KMaW6BRN8fy8R01-SSzmhw.text: A fast food style Lobster Roll restaurant hiding in PH Miracle Mile Shops!  So I presume you are coming here for Lobster right??  How do the rolls compare to the ones I've tried in Boston/Maine recently?  Here's what I ordered : "Maine Style" Lobster Roll ($17): Touch of Mayo, Lemon, and Secret Spice Blend. This is very good! More seasoned than the ones I've had on the East Coast, but very flavorful with sweet and tender Lobster!   The others I have tried are all pretty simple and plain...just butter and maybe a touch of mayo.  You don't need much more than this to have a great roll!  But Lob ME does a nice spice/rub on their lobster, that adds a great taste to it, without being too distracting.    I saw they also have a cajun rub, which might be good...gives me a reason to come back and try it!  It might feel a little expensive at first, but these are actually cheaper than most places on the coast (avg was $20-25), even during lobster season!!  The fact that it is located in the center of the strip as well, makes the price seem very fair IMO!  Check it out and see for yourself :)  Pic :

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Maine Style&#34; Lobster Roll ($17): Touch of Mayo, Lemon, and Secret Spice Blend. Very good! More seasoned than others I&#39;ve tried

VbLwbuXnNEEv1kQNo_Salg.text: We decided to have a quick lunch and saw this place as we were walking.  We got a lobster roll, and fish and chips.  The fish and chips were flavorful, but the lobster roll was pretty disappointing. I saw someone with the crab roll, and thay definitely looked more appetizing.

gilZJTiaL63wS_JUoqQV_w.text: Meh, I was disappointed. My husbands roll was ok. Expensive for what it was, but he said it was quite tasty. My lobster grilled cheese had very few pieces of lobster. I actually could not taste anything except cheese so I looked inside. This is ridiculous and not what they show on their own photos. I should have told a manager who was nearby asking customers how much they were enjoying their food, but I did not feel like arguing, I just wanted to leave at that point.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That is how much lobster I had in my soggy Lobster Grilled Cheese. All of these pieces were very thin.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese - do not order, very little lobster inside
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JKMMqmiqZNoQcSzKBgXRhA.text: Lobster grilled cheese was decent because it barely had any lobster.    Lobster Mac N' Cheese on the other hand had enough lobster and tasted awesome, each bite was heavenly.  I'd order this again in a heartbeat.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac N&#39; Cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese

RWdcauWWKG63HwBsKnxxUw.text: My favorite lobster roll place so far. Prices are pretty fair amongst some other similar places. The bread here is really soft and tasty. Service has always been pretty good here. I usually get the beltway (fave one). The lobster grilled cheese and lobster bisque is really good. Lobster mac and cheese was just alright tho. I will stop by everytime I'm in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beltway lobster roll with lobster bisque $19 + $7 add on for soup and drink

pfkUFAYOjK3eLp76crOfgQ.text: I ate there yesterday before heading to the airport.   Words cannot describe how good the Connecticut sandwich was.   I am a huge food fan and a huge lobster fan and this place is a home run.    A day latter I am in Chicago at the office and I am still thinking about that sandwich.    So much so that I am actually writing my first restaurant review ever...    Advice to management.....Open one up in Chicago!

ojXvYCjK2nO50-TC4VUEPw.text: Would I pay for a lobster roll that's the size of a tiny chipmunk? YES.   Who knew you can have delicious $10 lobster rolls in a food court stand? A small sandwich, for sure, packed full of sweet and salty lobster, and guess what? I don't even like lobster. (crab legs for the win!) But this sandwich I love and I would eat it again in a heart beat (if I was rich).   Now as much as I promote their rolls (specially their Maine roll?) their lobster mac and cheese is left to be desired. Tasty and cheesy mac and cheese with the tiniest bits of lobster. It was kind of sad. Not worth the price. Go for the lobster roll instead.

qMJTJvmBb5QU6UADkhnw7w.text: I was so excited to try this place after seeing all the photos. The reviews were mixed so I wasn't sure how I would like it. But if it has to do with lobster, I will definitely try it.   Its located in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops. The staff was friendly and helpful. The prices were high to me, in relation to how you could pay the same amount and go to a buffet with tons of seafood.   I must say I was disappointed with my meal. I chose a large original lobster roll with fries and a drink which was $21.62.   I love fries but not these.  The fries tasted more like fried batter than anything else. I opted for the original Maine style lobster roll  which is lobster served with a touch of mayo, lemon and secret spice blend on a 6 in New England style split top bun. The lobster was tasteless to me. I couldn't taste any flavor, not even the mayo. It just tasted like lumps of cold lobster and to me, lobster has to have some sauce or of course butter to enhance the flavor.   Maybe I just didn't try the right dish, who knows. Unfortunately for this place, service doesn't keep me going back to a place (it does help of course) but the product itself does.   I satisfied my curiosity but not my tummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. large lobster roll and fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LowcdDhKwN-tG7AL2igTlA.text: After hearing such high reviews from friends and the employee who took my order, I have to say I was really disappointed with the food. I expected a smaller portion after being warned but was assured that $19 for a lobster roll,  chips, and slaw was worth it. I added the $4 to make it a meal which includes fries and a drink. The fries were the best part of the meal. I ordered the Cape Cod and I was expecting the lobster to be sweet, juicy, and buttery, but instead tasted just like heated artificial crab. The garlic roll was good but the lobster lacked flavor and was rubbery. The saving grace of our meal were the fries, and the lobster Mac & cheese which was reasonably priced. Overall, spent nearly $40 on a lackluster meal. Would never recommend this joint to someone. Save your money and eat somewhere else. :(

jz0Cik6P4Rf4pF6fb49ZLQ.text: I think all the different lobster sandwiches are about the same with different toppings. My friend said they give more lobster meat then other places. It was tasty and when you need that lobster fix it was just the thing. The French fries were more salty then I would have liked them. The coleslaw was boring and bland. The lemonade was good and of course sweet which means lots of sugar.

4rCW2jMxjCk3ALqeTGOaUA.text: I am a New Englander by birth. You tell me there is a joint, landlocked in this Valley of Las Vegas, that will make me a fresh and delicious lobster roll? Until today I would call you a liar and probably spit on your shoe!  It's real. The unicorn that is a freshly made, legitimate lobster roll in Vegas has been found! My fiancee chose the Cajun style and I chose Classic Maine style.. I didn't get to try his (by the time I thought to ask he was finished) but mine hearkened back to camping near Bar Harbor as a little girl. So freaking good. Perfect amount of mayo, fresh lemon wedge, just a tiny bit of salt pepper and minced parsley. OMG. It even came on a toasty buttered split top bun!  The only thing I was not so jazzed about was the price. We had the two medium sized rolls and two fountain Cokes.. it came to $43. That is just insane, but I am a sucker for snacks!

b-2dlu2AoUXPJTZLTbOk_g.text: After coming here on out last trip, we really enjoyed the lobster rolls so we decided to come here again.  My bf ordered the Connecticut roll which is warm lobster and I ordered the Cajun lobster roll which is chilled lobster.  The lobster rolls were packed with lobster.  Both were delicious just as we remembered.  We also ordered the lobster mac n cheese and it was alright.  I think the rolls are way more worth it.  After ordering and paying for your food up at the counter, they give you a stick with your order number on it and when the food is done, they'll bring it out to your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut roll, Cajun roll, and mac n cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun roll

HU1h8Y7RGuCsSjqj8IAvnw.text: Yummy! For the love of Lobster! Fresh & Quick Lobster Salad! The grilled cheese lobster looks amazing!

MpATVFguCo5mxeU87w8bcA.text: Nice location right in the Miracle Mile Shops near Planet Hollywood. Honestly, I was expected mall food court type food, but the lobster roll was quite delicious and succulent. I was surprised. The bread was toasty and the roll had healthy chunks of lobster. The sauce was light, yet creamy enough to bring it home. Great place to take a break from shopping or for an afternoon snack. Yummy!

BFoBKYSzJwJ-uL6TxE_Pew.text: We ordered lobster mac & cheese and the frenchy sandwich which totals $31 something with one drink. When you looked up their menu it is pretty pricey already and I could only say maybe because of the lobster that they're adding onto it. But, oh boy!!  nothing is so special about it. There's only 3 pieces of lobster in my macaroni and it was just plain boring. The frenchy sandwich with lobster is also boring...it just seems so typical kind of sandwich that we can make in our kitchen that we can just add lobster into it. The funny part was the fries tasted better than the sandwich.

FTZyuTq43wS2zHSO0LNZlw.text: Very good lobster roll. Great coleslaw. Awesome chips! Very excellent for mall food. Delicious in fact!

ejWL8mXWz1t2ZKUjt0kdzg.text: What a total disappointment :( Located in the Miracle Miles of Planet Hollywood, this is definitely an overpriced food stand. It costs $17 for a lobster roll the size of my iPhone 5! Or possibly even smaller.. I understand lobster rolls are small and with the obvious lobster meat, but this one didn't even have the taste to back it up. Don't even bother with the clam chowder. It was seriously the worst clam chowder I have ever had!! I poured 4 packets of the pepper into it just to add a little flavor. Ughs. Friends did enjoy their lobster mac & cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good but so tiny!

1gph_-Xv1iyRt1cQYFb8mg.text: Lobster roll was so yummy. And the roll bread was soft and delicious. Highly recommended, though pretty expensive for a mall lunch.

vyoZ3oYU5zolSe0k3yanQQ.text: I've been wanting to try this spot and I finally did. We ordered the Beltway lobster roll with clam chowder fries for around $22. When we were given our food we were pretty disappointed in the size of the lobster roll and the presentation of the fries for the price. But.... Both tasted was amazing! The bread was toasted and buttery plus the lobster and its fixings were flavorful. The fries were crispy and a perfectly smothered in clam chowder, bacon, and diced tomatoes. I gave it 4 stars because of the portion size and the lack of presentation with the fries but I would definitely spend the money for it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Beltway Lobster Roll with Clam chowder fries!

4DhKDhOVZ3pWT8dg_8SoMA.text: This place is not a sit down restaurant. You place your order and sit to eat at a choice of four tables about eight feet away. The bar seats about four people and can get cramped really quick. Service was o.k., but nothing special. Saw the lobster roll and was surprised because it was small. Looks a lot bigger in the pictures. The lobster Mac n cheese was good with a great creamy cheese flavor. The lobster however was dry and void of flavor. Lobster should be the best thing here since it is called, LOBSTER ME!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VuDKanmV7dr5uo2uJyaIMg.text: Used a coupon I found in a booklet that was in my hotel room.  Get a free beer with a lobster roll.  They kindly substituted a large soda for a beer.  Thanks!  Good service all the way around.  The roll was super tasty, not filled with celery or such.  The lobstersicle was expensive, but tasty.  I felt that lobster didn't need to be deep fried, so my lobster tail was broiled and came with drawn butter.  Small but tasty.    Dine at tables in front of the food stand inside the Miracle Mile mall.

erRn6VscN2aoNCja_1iS9w.text: we wanted a snack since linner really was enough for lunch and dinner...heheh. while walking through PH, we finally found Lobster ME. the lobster is caught in Maine and flown to Canada for deshelling/freezing, then flown to vegas twice a week. there is currently only one location; however, they will begin to franchise soon. Lobster ME is due to open in Santa Monica sometime. i had a discount from the miracle mile coupon book. buy one large lobster roll and get a 16 oz draft beer free. the lobster roll that was in the window was an extra large. it didn't look that big. so we tried the large lobster roll thinking that we would only get one bite since hubby and i were sharing. we were wrong. there are actually big pieces of lobster tail in the sandwich. the buttered bread was slightly toasted; lobster was added afterwards. the lobster was actually not one piece but more like two layers lightly salted and spiced. you get roughly 1/3 lb of lobster in your large roll. we enjoyed it very much. yelp.com/biz_photos/6Vyp... it was pricey but worth the try. $16 + tax = 1 large lobster roll + draft beer(which is $4) also sampled lobster ice cream which i disliked. tasted like heavy, sweet vanilla ice cream with pieces of lobster mixed in. i was disappointed that they didn't try to incorporate the lobster taste into the actual ice cream. felt like they could have tried to infuse flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $16 lobster roll (large)

55TL7clP3p32-SBUW92TxQ.text: Don't waste your time. Overpriced, under seasoned, undersized. The Mac n cheese was runny. The lobster roll was done in three bites. I know, I know. It's Vegas. I should have known better for a tourist trap.

DgPoNo-f6OGDW9cA0w5mpg.text: Come here for.. Of course the lobster rolls. Everything else is ok. They give you a generous amount of lobster meat. Pretty pricy, but it's lobster! I've tried the Maine and Connecticut I liked those the best. It's Simple; a little mayo, melted butter, special seasonings, and a squeeze of lemon. The truffle roll is good, but the truffle aioli overpowers all that lobster goodness. Lobster grilled cheese had too much cream cheese. The soups here are ok, doesn't really taste fresh, but it comes with a bread bowl and its the cheapest thing here ($7), they have clam chowder and lobster bisque. Place gets pretty pack and there are only a few tables so get it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine style
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll

5bp8DzkpvPVF2B1oppZpyQ.text: Came here to visit Sin City with Hubster last month and wandered around aimlessly at the Miracle Mile shops on our first day trying to find something different for lunch, and came across this place.  We shared a lobster roll and it was worth the $23, except that they need to drizzle some hot drawn butter because it was a bit on the dry side.  If you're feeling a bit bold, feel free to try their lobster ice cream!  I really wished that I had the chance to try their lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  Highly recommend this place whenever you happen to be in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So rich and yummy!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll!

HkoaJRH5NYL9Hj7I5iCRVA.text: Ughhhhhh, I can't believe I ate here...    First of all, this is NOT what a lobster roll is supposed to taste like.  They put so much crap on the lobster that it made the taste of lobster go away.  I literally rubbed the crap off of my meat so that I could eat my sandwich.    The lobster mac & cheese was watery and lacked any real flavor.  I didn't like any of the flavors here.  The lobster was super tiny and didn't add much to the dish.  The only saving grace was the lobster shooter, which wasn't horrible.  It consisted of a chunk of lobster meat, some ketal one, and some pepper sauce or something (lol, I don't know the exacts... it tasted like a bloody mary to me).  I thought that was pretty good (and not too pricey at about $8/shot).    Over all, not the best lobster roll, but whatever is clever.

cRzR3J0eMDfIRs6zkJE6Vg.text: Overpriced for what it was, the counter service both times were really friendly but my boyfriends lobster Mac and cheese came out cold, not like it was sitting for a while, but cold like it came out of the refrigerator and wasn't microwaved long enough. They apologized and gave a full refund but it was a little disappointing.  My lobster roll was very meaty but definitely not worth the $$.  I'm sure this place will do fine either way though due to the uniqueness/ concept and the location.  I usually try to avoid the strip restaurants for the exact reason of being overpriced for mediocre food but its so convenient if your at the MM shops or PH.  If I'm on property again I'll probably go to Earl of Sandwich instead.

Y8egB59FWXcH9GDhLTyMBA.text: When I get down to Miracle Mile, Lobster ME is my fave place to eat. If I'm not hungry yet, I'll even hang out at the mall longer until I know there's space in my belly. I've tried the lobster mac and cheese and the lobsicle, but it's truly the lobster roll that I come for. For under $20 bucks I leave full but not sickeningly stuffed. Expensive, especially for a counter in the mall, but it is fresh, made-to-order lobster in a Vegas tourist trap after all. Locals do get a 10% discount with ID. Go when you're hungry, as lobster doesn't travel well--although a cold lobster is just about better than any other sandwich anyway.

hDUsqcArl6NWUgkUTqR1sQ.text: This place was pretty good although this is my first ever lobster roll...I think it was pretty good.  The lobster roll was @22 for the large and $16 for the regular. I got the large as I was sharing with the wife. The bread was nice and toasted and the lobster was great. I liked the lobster because it wasn't mayo based as people say alot of them are. it kept it light and from being too fatty and bloated.  There was plenty of meat in it to make it a meaty roll so with that I am pleased.  We also got the lobster bisque in the bread bowl $9..this was good but I had definitely had better bisque all over the east and west coast. It lacked....some serious flavor.  So final report...will I go again? maybe but definitely not going to hunt it down again.

CNJ0ZnLpNVGFVfP--UB6BQ.text: I had the chance to try their lobster mac and cheese+ tator tots. I was not impressed, i found myself not wanting more after a few bites..The lobster left me with a bad after taste and the it wasn't cheesy enough. I didn't enjoy the combination together, definitely not coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster mac and cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tater tots

5e6H29fhrXyhqhAfp1oWkA.text: Lobster on a stick! Really what more can I say to sum it up. My husband and I dined at Lobster Me after reading about it on Yelp. As others have said, it was a bit pricey but again we're talking about Lobster here folks! The place is located in the Mile of shops next to the Planet Hollywood hotel/casino. Suite #435.   I had the Lobsicle. Which was basically an amazing huge chunk of lobster fried on a stick. I also upgraded to the cajun fries, which honestly I don't remember how they were because I was in Lobster Heaven. The husband ordered the Maine Lobster Roll which was a toasted buttery roll with huge Maine Lobster claws in it. The lobster was cold, which was a bit unexpected, but who knows maybe that's how it's supposed to be? He also had the garlic fries but I believe he didn't eat them because that huge Maine Lobster roll filled him up! We also ordered a bucket of beer, because well, it's Las Vegas! All together our total was $56 and worth every cent.   I can't wait until our next annual trip back to Vegas. Lobster Me is going to be one of the first stops, perhaps before even checking in! Yeah, it's that good.

BmKZ3YQwp9Urtm1AKiQSFg.text: Waited 30 minutes for our food.  People were irate.  Manager was in over his head.  Lady there was trying to hold it all together by herself. One star because food was good but never again.

UeYb4bFey0yr2kdoYlGhXg.text: The taste is soooo amazing!!! The chowder fries were surprisingly amazing. My husband and I both had the warm Cajun Lobster roll. The only this that kept it from a five was the roll was pretty small for the price you pay. Besides that we would come back again

7e3RTTwAYZl7jSnRDJiphQ.text: Im a fan but I won't come back every time I'm in Vegas. The bread was yummy, the lobster was too but I didn't like the claw part, it was yucky.   I got the XL cajun and my bf got the original XL, meat was a bit cold. XL for $23. I thought it was a bit pricey but I assume they sell it by weight, so idk..   Everything came out totaling $68 for lunch. (2 XL, fries, large drink and lobster mac & cheese - which was overrated.) And again, I thought it was pricey for lunch for just sandwiches.   Will I be back?   Maybe when lobster ice cream is available. For this trip, it wasn't.

1VS_6cFNQWmfLVYJ-4Wwsw.text: Underwhelming is the kindest word. Over priced, tepid, bland, and greasy are a few others. May have caught them on a bad day but that's no excuse.

hfsHELIj7tKKTuA6nDI3PQ.text: The people who work here are the nicest and the food is amazing too!  Definitely glad I chose to try this out. It's amazing!  Anyone who likes lobster should come here.

lFtfsgobTyAO5G__h81MCQ.text: Very pricey.  Small amount of lobster in all the dishes we tried.  Large portions of bread  to make up for it.  The food is tasty just no where near enough lobster.  Cute gimmick just won't satisfy your need for shellfish

-Z1ZMppzUyRdrDiVylHBYA.text: Crazy fat sandwich stuffed with lobster.  I was drinking at the time so this review could be slightly off.  Also I am not a huge fan of lobster but the people I was with were cause I left for 3 minutes and 80% of my sandwich was gone!    $20+ for the sandwich so worth a try but since I am not a huge lobster fan, I doubt I will go back.  So many great places to eat in Vegas.

0Zym4laYbppEnWD4LYNxyw.text: The Connecticut is fucken bomb, cooked lobster on buttered bread. It could be bigger for the price and it isn't so filling, but I'd still order it again. Their cajun fries taste a little too garlicky for me and the Mac n cheese was pretty good, not too cheesy/creamy but still tasty.

vCNioC4VOj5IZUanBp_-CQ.text: Decent portion of tasty lobster on a nice buttery roll, I'll be back!

qp9PuqG2l9bJq0_qfCDUtg.text: Excellent and friendly staff. You can't go wrong with a delicious Connecticut Roll. Located in the Miracle Mile shops in Planet Hollywood.

1pKKfpg07w_NAYyntWsAZw.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy! We ate here 3 times during our week stay in Las Vegas. Top dish was the Lobster Grilled Cheese - sounds strange, but it was mighty tasty! Next we tried the Connecticut Lobster Roll - sweet buttery deliciousness! Lobster Mac & Cheese was pretty good followed by the Lobster Fries. I would not order the fries again - they were better without the toppings. Overall I am sure I will dream of Lobster ME until we visit again!

rG_CVd-3SdMdNxouC5R0Ig.text: If you're a lobster lover do yourself a favor and get the maine lobster roll. OMG, to die for. It comes with their house made chips which are also good. I'd go back and get this again and again. It's that damn good!

zAlyF4N3xVJKUh-AX-1gSg.text: Meh.  I didn't see what the hoopla is all about.  They say there's a pound of lobster in each roll; not sure what measurement scale they're using.   It was nothing to write home about.

1f8j4RZAgJ6rnTiB66TOeA.text: Five stars because this was my first ever lobster roll so I have nothing to compare to.  I tried the Original Main Style and it was delicious.  Huge chunks of lobster on a toasted roll.  Lobster was amazing.  Came with a side of coleslaw and house made potato chips. Service was friendly and fast.  What more can I say?  I'll be back!

TtCr1liqXgDTmYgSyrYyDA.text: I went here about a month and a half ago and I thought the food was good but a bit too heavy for me. Pricing was on the expensive beside but it is lobster meat....big chunks too! My friends and I shared a large lobster roll, fries and lobster mac n cheese. The mac n cheese was one of the best I've ever had! Must try that. I would go back if I'm in the mood for heavy comfort food :)

_msARBqedYQ5lGewW3YpWA.text: Being from the Midwest, I've had my fair share of fried things on a stick. I also love lobster when done right. When we passed "Lobster Me" in the Miracle Mile, we actually joked about the billboard advertising the "lobsicle". A lobster tail on a stick battered and deep fried sounded strange and intriguing all at once. On our way back through I decided to go for it adding a new tally to my fried food on a stick resume. Let me tell you how happy this experience made me. I know I know. It's just food but OH MY!!!!! The food gods have showered us with an amazing concept that has blown me away.        The "lobsicle" is the perfect size lobster tail speared on a wooden stick, battered and fried to perfection. It's served with a lemon wedge and cup of melted butter. My lobsicle was cooked perfectly and so tender. I couldn't believe the frying process didn't turn it to unedible rubber. The only negative I can come up with is that Lobster Me closes at 11pm and I can't go get more RIGHT NOW!!!      If you're looking for a quick, affordable and sinfully delicious new treat give this a try.

UP_ffFBzEssabISOTrhgcw.text: Great little place to stop for lunch or a quick/casual dinner. Lobster rolls have about 5-6oz of tail and claw meat and the lobster was fresh. My son had the fish and chips, fish was cod and fries were fresh. I had the lobster/ shrimp cheveche it was okay but they mix it with mango and it made it a little to fruity. Overall the meals was good but a little pricy for a food court type meal. Good lunch spot or quick snack!

OPM2f4x8DD1aDU0BLUMMkQ.text: I wanted to see what all the rave was about the Lobsticle, hell might as well call it a Shrimpsticle, the thing was so small I busted out my binoculars.  For the price it is not worth it, yes its Lobster but come on.  And not to mention the $7 dollar Hot Dog with NO fries for my kid (he really wanted one) that was also outrageous.  Mac and cheese was also flavorless.  2 stars for the free refills.

iL0MhWAO-bKBK3bsY8YQ_w.text: Good place for Lobster Lovers. I personally really like lobster but I feel this place could be a bit better with certain dishes. I had the lobsicle, lobster mac and cheese, lobster bisque, Conneticut lobster roll and some tea. The Mac and cheese needed more lobster and cheese as the shells were left dry. The roll was good. The lobsicle's batter coulda used more flavor. All in all not too bad

PDfCdbt3J1z22bPM_DS9iA.text: I had the original lobster roll, my husband had the lobster grilled cheese, both delicious. Great option if you are in Vegas and looking for a quick bite for lunch.

W83IAsTysXakb6QZN-byVw.text: So one of my buddies from Hawaii went to Vegas and I got permission from the hottie to spend a gambling weekend with him.  Since we hit the tables non stop the entire weekend, food was just a secondary thought.  However, I did want to try this joint the last time I was in Vegas so we went there for an afternoon snack.  Be prepared to spend about $20 for a lobster roll and if you have a big appetite the lobster roll will not fill you up.  But you do get a pretty generous portion of lobster on your roll and it is quite tasty.  Since this was my first time there, I went with the original lobster roll but my friend got the cajun lobster roll.  He said it was very good.    Next time I think I'll try the lobster mac and cheese..... hhhhmmmmm......cheeeeeesseeee.

FeERNugSY7hW_XjFGyau_w.text: First off, the owner (I think he is) is a dick.  The food?  Overpriced and low quality.  If you ever had a decent lobster roll, you would never eat it here.  What a waste of space!  Don't waste your stomach here!  Too many awesome places to eat in Vegas for this crap.  Highlights *None!  Lowlights *Overpriced *Dumbass owner with an attitude *Claims to serve lobster bisque in bread bowl. NOPE.

XNM77FozBDuLaTWubUtRqg.text: I am so disappointed! A few months ago, my friend and I saw this place and promised the next time we come, we'll order as much as we can from here because we love lobster! When we came, we ended up just ordering 3 things: lobster mac & cheese, lobster grilled cheese and lobster & chips. Right when took our first bite of the lobster mac & cheese, we were SO sad! The cheese had no flavor and there was very few chunks of lobster. Then we tried the lobster grilled cheese and it tasted so plain. The lobster & chips had only ONE piece of lobster but the few bites we took from that piece was good. We've tried many lobster meals and this was honestly one of the worst experiences we've had. We thought maybe we didn't experience the True "Lobster Me" experience because we didn't order a roll but we agreed we wouldn't even try any because we already spent $40+ on a meal that made us full but not satisfied.

3CIK2zWELLtNi-xkdRjBSQ.text: Expensive, but good. I had the lobster roll. I've had better, but this was pretty good. But $14 for a lobster roll???

v6BPMMStVOspHcExbSGCYQ.text: Just discovered this place on last Vegas trip. SO wish there was one in Philadelphia!!

QtWaoD0g8Ct7yzcBQ9BP8Q.text: Took the family out to check this place out after a good review in a local magazine. I have to say without a doubt this is now one of two reasons for me to hit the strip. The service we got from the staff was pleasant and they answered all of our questions. The wife had the grilled cheese and our soon had the Mac and cheese. As mentioned in previous reviews the Mac and cheese isn't out of a box. It was fresh, hot, and they didn't skimp on the lobster. The grilled cheese was warm and plenty gooey with plenty of lobster as well. I went with the regular size lobster roll combo that included fries and a drink. I most say I was a little surprised at the size of the roll for the price, but the amount of lobster in the salad and the claw meat on top more than made up for it. It was so good that I ordered a second roll.   For me the only negatives is that you share a common area with the bar next door selling those touristy size drinks in those goofy cups. The music that they had on in that bar wasn't something I wanted to listen to. Also the restrooms are a far away and the distance is off putting for us dining with a younger child who needed to use it.

Vx2aa9iKGz8dJkIp9HFJ_A.text: Located inside of a miracle mile shops connected to Planet Hollywood.  I tried their lobster mac and cheese for $12.  I have to say it had chunks of lobster (it better for $12) and mac and cheese flavor was pleasantly good.  One star down as I thought it was way too cheesy!

EoKGls1oST4OY0yZ5KDwIQ.text: I got the lobster grilled cheese which barely had any lobster in it. It wasn't worth the 11 dollars.  My friend got a lobster salad and she said it's just like a side salad with lobster in it.  She said she was expecting more than just a side salad with lobster in it.

O138DTfAtZEjpKs93voFcg.text: Just ate the lobster mac n cheese, DELICIOUS!!! Generous portion for a generous price. Definitely would come back for more!

4ASKTEfWZflomWw4PxoWsg.text: For fast food joint that serves lobster exclusively in the middle of the desert, this place is pretty good.   On a mission to have a quick snack and proceed to get our drunk on, Lobster Me was conveniently situated by Fat Tuesday and looked extremely intriguing. I mean, if you love lobster, can you really turn this place down?  We had a lobsicle which was well breaded, was cooked well and tasted delish!  This was a great place to stumble upon. It's a great hidden gem on the Strip!

MkMyYe95kyjGcTf8_DMY8Q.text: I came here at a prime time for dinner at 7:30 PM to order the popular Mac n Cheese and was told they were sold out! I wanted to give this place a chance so I ordered their other popular item, the Lobster Roll. I'm a seafood lover and I could not taste what was so special about the lobster roll. I doubt I will pay $17 for one single item at a fast food counter again. I would rather spend that kind of money on an entree at a full-service restaurant.

9VuiFs6MmX03hsooeUe7iQ.text: I liked it! I got a lobster roll, it was kinda expensive, but the quality of the lobster and amount of lobster exceeded my expectations.  My other friend got the lobster mac 'n cheese, it was a little bland, it definitely needs a dimensional characteristic whether it's heat or truffle or something.  We tried Tabasco and ketchup ...sort of did the trick.  My other friend got the lobster grilled cheese which reminded me of a tuna melt.  He wolfed it down and we didn't even get offered bites, so my guess is it was good :).  Servers were very friendly & fast!

W63iUXxzjZE2Zs-Gc4A-bQ.text: Looked delicious from the menu. Ordered a Connecticutt lobster roll combo and Lobster Mac and Cheese.  Lobster roll really was as delicious as it looked. Unfortunately they don't tell you they're bite sized- 2 bites actually. Mac and cheese tasted like it was from a dollar store box with lobster crumbs sprinkled in. They forgot the fries with my combo so I had to remind them. Heads up: check your order. Next time I'll stick to the rolls...but I'll eat somewhere else first.

wWgViDITxjQxdHmQyXsR_w.text: Stopped here 2 different days for lunch. 1st day we had conneticut lobster roll, lobster mac n cheese, chowder fries. It was amazing and friendly staff. 2nd day we had lobsicle, original roll, chowder fries, and grilled cheese w/lobster. It was delicious. The only complaint i have is that the seating wasn't the best. The food makes up for that.

ovk0XIRa3LpzPgLaX3movA.text: While the food was great there's no place to sit. Very limited seats and tables. Makes it difficult to give more than 2 stars

8CHXgTsfXkdsF9Fbgl_TPA.text: I just got back from Las Vegas. The family decided to get lunch at Miracle Mile. I told them I didn't care where to eat, all I know I needed to do was get a lobster roll. TO my amusement, None of them had ever had one and they all decided to tag along. Two trays and about $200 later we were all full and ALL 7 people loved the food. YES this place is expensive, but it's Vegas. Have YOU ever tried to get fresh lobster shipped to you in the middle of the desert?   I was finally going to try the lobster ice cream, sadly, they were out  ***NOTE TO OWNER**** My lobster roll had a channel of mayo on the bottom which was kinda too much "goo" in a bite, If possible please have the cook SPREAD it on the bread. THANKS! Be Back in a month for CES 2013

oeAS5OISHBREiwsuodr3qg.text: Overpriced, expensive, horrible food. Lesson learn: do not have seafood at the desert.

GYFj6FteP-pj2TI5s4hQIg.text: Lobster mac n cheese worth the cost to me, just get a drink. Something a little spicy builds up as you eat. Worth the walk, yum!!

WGBsfZApIh6rK_MpaWDESg.text: The original Maine lobster roll is good, real lobster meat, not flour covered/battered fried . It is small but I understand lobster is expensive . My only complaint is the side chips are hard, maybe out for too long

56P4FgO0n-TwsJClZlCcUw.text: Say the word lobster and I'm sold! Lobster Me you had me at Lobster ice cream...I know it sounds kinda weird that lobster can be mixed with ice cream but the crazy part is that it tasted pretty good.   My cousins and I were walking the mall and I noticed the words Lobster ice cream free sample. So hey why not take a crazy chance and try something different. We ended up ordering it and we all shared. Of course it was $8.50 for a small ice cream but it was worth the try.   The second time I came was to try the food; my bf and I decided to get the Lobster Mac n Cheese and the Lobster Bisque. Yum! The Lobster Mac n Cheese was not bad it could use a little bit more sauce. The Lobster Bisque was delicious especially in a bread bowl.   I definitely want to come back here and try everything! Especially the lobster shooters, yes I said lobster shooters with Vodka!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty good! $8.50

_X36B6Gf0zftFpZKAcnGEQ.text: the best deal in las vegas for food.  i brought my whole family to eat from here and it was a hit!!  We got the lobster sticks (whole lobster meat on a stick the size a full lobster tail covered perfectly with fried batter)! And its quality lobster meat. Usually that amount of lobster meat would cost $20 at a nice dinner restaurant where you eat the meat off a tail.   We also had the Connecticut (warm) Lobster Roll and doused it with the side of butter. this is the time i tell my self "hey, you only live once, butter it up!" Yummy and perfect with the Lobsicle lobster stick. i was so full!  Tip. make sure you save yourself a seat! if  no seats initially, sit at Fat Tuesday seats and get a drink from there! Good with lobster me food.

uxygylP5Tpwnd42LZiCyIA.text: We got the Connecticut lobster roll and lobster grilled cheese. The roll is very small not worth the money but the lobster grill cheese was awesome and worth the price. We came back the next day and bought 2 orders for the road. Definitely would recommend making a stop here anytime your in the Miracle Shops or Planet Hollywood and need a simple quick meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

we1M8uy57RcrOKWpVGP_VQ.text: Lobster me NOW!  This place is located in the mall of Planet Hollywood right next to Fat Tuesday's. I walked by this place a couple times during my stay at the Elara, and finally decided to give it a try. The menu was simple.  What I ordered: Cajun Lobster Roll - HOLY MOLY. This roll was worth the $20 (or maybe it was $17). They gives generous amounts of lobster and the spice is just fantastic. So much flavor bursting in my mouth, and it didn't overpower the lobster. Every bite was much too perfect with the buttery bun it comes on... wow. If you think $20 is too expensive for a roll, please keep in mind that IT IS LOBSTER... in a desert :P Lobster Salad - Nothing to special about this salad. I wanted something healthy, but still try the lobster here. I ended up eating just the lobster and a few bites of salad, ha. Nothing too special about this one.  Service was good and very friendly. A verity of beverages to choose from. Give it a try! You won't be disappointed :)

3_Fulw9wTFc26KYuhiQSVg.text: El diablo lobster roll: Flavorless and small portion $18  Lobster mac & cheese: flavorless and dry (had to add ketchup to eat) $12  Chowder fries: pretty nice! Small portion for $6  Its no wonder people are flocking to chipotle right around the corner. For a fast food style restaurant the prices and portions are a downer even on the strip.

ajYIMyTKqRJ0RYzO4dSZMg.text: It was a long long day and we didn'tt feel like dining out anywhere, just wanted to get some food to go and go back to the hotel. since our hotel was literally inside/right by the mall, we decided to try Lobster ME! everything seem to be a little price but then again, we're in vegas and on the strip, inside of a popular mall. everyone should try the Mac and cheese lobster! It's seriously the best! it's very rich and creamy! so good but so expensive, only a few lobster chunks. Lobster and chips were ok. I thought it was a bit pricy $30 for both and the portions was small. Only 5 pieces of lobster in each entree.

sLvnXSFsA3NLb3qeF8caFQ.text: always a refreshing and quick bite everytime in Vegas!! convenient location! and delicious lobster entrees!  It can be a a bit pricey considering it is 'fast food', but come on...still really good price for lobster!!!

2cH-RzP9HLa4UUOkht6JjQ.text: Got the lobsicle. Paid 15 bucks and its smaller than my hand (im 5 feet and asian so thats saying something). Taste was horrible too. So disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobsicle....so disappointing!

atFpr1xka3DQ46aAR02BRw.text: Lobster Me is the perfect place for someone like me who is OBSESSED with seafood. I dream about anything and everything with lobster in it so stopping by here was a must on my last trip to Vegas.   Too bad this place definitely didn't live up to my high expectations. It seemed extremely overpriced for what we got. And we were still hungry after.. So I somehow paid $28 for a small amount of food and I got to go back to my hotel hungry.   I'll come back to try the lobster ice cream though. That sounds super interesting..

bgkaIqmSQzqJDNVMrSvqXw.text: Disgusted by the service and food. The Lobster Bisque had a hair in it and the manager said "none of our workers have hair that long" He refused to give me my money back or even an apology. I wanted to punch him so bad. His name is Dan. Take you appetite and money elsewhere. I've never been so furious in my life. Just typing this review makes my stomach turn.

i9dWXhgBjnqFrlGoTnF-GQ.text: LOVE this place! The lobster was bomb dot com! I had the Connecticut which was amazing; my kids had a lobsicle and the Cajun. The Connecticut and the Cajun is a lobster sandwich which we found tasty. The Cajun was seasoned but not spicy. Definitely a different take on lobster fast food lol Now my hubby  did NOT like his fish and chips. He said it was more like fish strips cause it was chewy, tough and not what you think of as fish n chips. Def not worth the $16. Upon our leaving, the cashier asked him how he liked his food, he was honest and she gave us our money back for his food. The rest of us LOVED our food!

_ZroH3R0mOPJFuMDi7_vzQ.text: We ordered the "L" Lobster Roll, that they claim is the best in the world. I beg to differ.  For $17, we thought we were going to get something extraordinary.  C'mon, it's lobster!? But...FAIL! It was tiny and the ingredients were easy to figure out. Really?: Old bay, mayo, butter, and pepper...all in a bun. Wow...big whoop de doo. UGH Very disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $17 L lobster roll...not so large. Not worth it.

vXhxNPL6pjVHwJoxw-7ClA.text: Not even One stat deserves this place !  i'm so annoyed for the fact they changed the size of the sandwich here ! Spend $23 for a lobster meal with literally 10 pieces of cajun fries that were like $4 plus a TWO FUCKING INCE LITERALLY LOBSTER SANDwich! I remember 2 years ago they use to be about 6 inches !   DON't WASTE YOUR TIME AT THIS EXPENSIVE, HYPED OUT, PLACE! They rob you for your money.   Never will i go again! I even recommended my friends for the fact last time we went it was good now its just shit

VrKsbK7lT-wCGN5tRmgSlA.text: For what it's worth, Lobster Me is a decent fast-casual place to eat. I've had the experience of having fresh seafood on the East Coast, and nothing on the West will ever compare to what you get in cities like Boston. But, I believe Lobster Me tries hard to make their seafood tasty, and what they do with their seafood works for them.   Conveniently located in Miracle Mile, I was able to walk here from my hotel room in about 5 minutes. Lobster Me is an order and pay at the counter type place, which worked for me!  All three people in my party who ate here ordered the Original Lobster Roll. This was their no frills roll -- filled only with lobster, a couple of their "house" spices and stuffed in a delicious piece of bread. Each roll was $24. Pricey, but you're in Vegas!  Our food came out in about 5 minutes. I really enjoyed my Lobster Roll and thought the lobster was fresh for Western standards and very tasty with all the spices they threw on the meat. But, the two other people that were eating with me were born and raised on the East Coast, and both of them said the lobster was only "ok". One of them didn't like the spices that they put on the lobster and she even picked some of the lobster pieces off and didn't eat them. We all agreed that the bread was delicious though.  We also ordered a side of fries and we all really liked the fries as well.  Overall, just your average seafood place. Nothing special, but nothing horrible either. Check it out when you're in Vegas since it's worth at least one visit!  Cheers!

K-a_EVK3N75PGlsunL58rA.text: Large original lobster roll and Mac & cheese. One word: WELL DAMNIT IT TASTE SO GOOD! That was more than one word but it's so good. I really enjoyed both items and not stingy at all with the lobster. Great snack before boyz 2 men show later. Whoop!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll and lobster Mac

2i2hONbWEnNpMTTh1rLFxw.text: butter me, yummy. Sweet butter bread excellence, lobster precooked a bit dry. Still delicious

iDotmRe32BVBwduUOOn2bw.text: Worst place ever!! Portions were so small it would barely fill my cavity especially for the prices they are charging. Was looking so forward to coming here too. 2 thumbs down!!

jwaCMi5AIFznOdIG1K2N_g.text: Wow amazing! A little expensive but what in Vegas worth its salt isn't? Whole lobster claw served in the chowder, I'd have liked it shredded or what not but this way there isn't any room for arguing about the completeness of your lobster. I also got a claw in my bloody marry and she got the Mac with whole claw. Delicious bread crumbs on the top of that cheesy delight. This place is from Maine (ME) and all America.

RQwSXM75EpEB2sLzMXUJhA.text: Best lobster roll I've ever had!!!!!!! Tender, juicy ,and not rubbery at all. AMAZING !!!! I just wish I would have had the lobster bisque too!!!!!

icFzJzJpJGE8CTbwmQWs6w.text: Lobster Lovers Rejoice!  I stopped to refuel here while shopping at the Miracle Mile Shops. I was drawn in by the allure of the "lobsicle", a piece of deep fried lobster on a stick. I sampled the Manhattan lobster roll - a toasted bun heaped with top quality lobster and butter. This is now officially the best sandwich I have had in my life. The lobscile was good as a novelty. There is little seating. This place was so tasty it would warrant an entire restaurant location. We also tried the "wicked lemonade" which was a grown up lemonade cocktail with a scoop of frozen lemonade in it. It was like a hard lemonade float. What happens in Vegas...right!?

sglCUUtJQORHsE1P69lqJw.text: Mehh I am thoroughly disappointed. I got the cajun lobster roll and expected a little kick out of the cajun mayo that was supposedly in the bun... Nope, didn't get that. I think the roll would have been much better if it had mayo, or butter, or something! Mac and cheese was flavorless, we had to add ketchup to it. Honestly, mac and cheese is a fail if I ever have to add anything other than black pepper to it. Grilled lobster cheese sandwich barely had any lobster in it, my friend had to stick in extra lobster from the mac and cheese lol.

DzDuUeHvcjyi9kU4Cx2Q2w.text: I was walking around the mall in Las Vegas and notice a restaurant that caught my eyes. The lobsters were calling out to me to eat. I felt like in the mood for some lobster chowder, hoping it will be tasty to eat. I was pretty disappointed with it. The chowder wasn't thick and creamy. 8Ti78nvmARNcff-AaaRpNw.text: We just wanted some snacks nefore a show and in turned out to be the best food we've had in the 2 days we'be stayed so far. Had a lobster taco and the kids had lobster roll and Philly roll. Everyone loved it!

RaT7mgVb_YlZ8XPnEyfKjg.text: I stumbled across this place whilst walking through the Miracle Mile during my vacation last year ... Frozen icy alcoholic beverage in one hand and an empty stomach meant there was no chance I would go past this place without buying something. After a little bit of alcohol, your body always craves something fried and greasy and what better way to sate this craving than to have fried lobster meat and fries ??  Granted this quite an expensive snack, it is still cheap if you're from Australia and used to paying with a pound of flesh when it comes to anything seafood ! I would come back here if I'm passing through Planet Hollywood and in need of a quick snack!

HBrnfCAV87LCwtg_dDyl1g.text: I was sort of disappointed by my visit to Lobsterme. I ordered the lobsticle, and I was really excited because I'm from Miami and I've been looking for places to try ALL WEEK while I was in Vegas , the food looked sooooo good through the pictures and the reviews were really good . When my food came I was shocked at how small my grilled lobster on a stick was . I could have eaten 3 of them little things . I asked the lady if that was how big they normally were and she said yes they shrink when they get cooked .  I was mad and still hungry . IoSuCCwrjMBYT4ovGpE0vg.text: We were very disappointed, #1 for the prices that didn't match what you were getting in food.  The lobster rolls were dry and not tasting very good.  The fries were just okay.  The cole slaw was dry as hay.  Horrible as our bill was as high or more than a good sit down restaurant.  Never going back.  It is a total rip off!

d8KDTsEijcQjvQJPprVd-A.text: I got the classic lobster roll and it was really good! Maybe not $17 good, but it's vegas and lobster so pricing makes sense. Definitely recommend if you're craving some good lobster or crab!

_ZX3QxQnINI6_W-rcnvmqA.text: DELICIOUS Maine Lobster!! Quick service style next to the Fat Tuesday inside PH! Im a really picky eater but I am able to customize my order to my liking and have made a point to go back every time I am in Vegas ever since my first time there.  The only con is limited seating if you go during a busy time, but we all just squeezed together and it was fine. Another time i just got it to go and ate a couple minutes away where there were more tables.  def recommend it to friends and will go back!

r-2FzTAeselCVkrFIPGNkw.text: The trio taco is awesome. All three are great! I'm very picky and this place was surprisingly very very good.

fQupDTcjmQLdw-9mPgnEHQ.text: I had a Cajun lobster sub or whatever...amazing is an understatement. I could eat it every day!

Nil0u4HVYBSQfp600o4cqw.text: It always bothers me when people give a place less stars just based on the price.   First of all you're in Las Vegas. They don't call it Lost Wages for nothing. Second of all it's $&@?ing lobster, in what world is lobster ever cheap? Please tell me. I'd like to live in that world.   Rant over. Now let's get to the nitty gritty. Lobster me's food. I had the lobsicle and the lobster bisque. The jury is still out on battered and fried lobster tail on a stick. Maybe I'm partial to grilled or broiled lobster but it was just ok. Nothing to write home about. The bisque however hit the spot. The flavor was great and there were nice little chunks of lobster throughout and it came in a bread bowl. I love bowls you can eat. Who doesn't? The only bad thing about this place is there's not enough seating. Even though it was very mall-food-esque the service was incredible. The people that work there are grade A, I don't think I had better service my entire trip. You go Lobster Me, you go!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle. Lobster bisque. Delicious.

auv0qVlDkXNCOLkDZHS7VA.text: I don't know what kind of food these other reviewers are used to eating, but I found no substance to any of the claims being made about poor taste, quality, or quantity. My wife and I ordered the lobster mac 'n cheese, a traditional lobster roll, salt and vinegar fries, and a drink. With a $4 online coupon, we got all that for $32. And after a solid afternoon of dodging drunk idiots on the Strip, we found our previously empty stomachs delightfully filled.  Both the roll and the mac had a good amount of lobster chunks. Again, I say that these were CHUNKS. It was not flaky, or fakey. Straight up lobster chunks from a real lobster. The mac was not huge, but it would definitely satisfy your average hunger strike if supplemented with a small side (like fries) and a drink. The roll was smaller (as lobster rolls are supposed to be), but still on the larger side of ones I've eaten in the past. The roll itself was like a buttered and grilled Texas Toast. It was probably about 5" long and completely stuffed with lobster meat.  The fries were only lightly drizzled with vinegar to avoid an overpowering taste. The salt level was good.   Look, if you want lobster without the buffet price and/or pretentious ambience, go to this place. I think it's a worthy substitute for excavating a lobster's exoskeleton yourself while paying a very reasonable (at least by Vegas standards) price.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &#39;n Cheese. Notice how delicious and substantial it is...&#39;Cause it is both.

auhAtmcDpQJe8hz56qJtpg.text: Not sure what happened to this place - 3 years ago, we felt everything we ordered was really good.  Our recent experience was completely the opposite - - the lobster rolls we had were below average.  The lobster mac and cheese was just dreadful.  Hopefully things can return to our prior experience.

uURL6xeVMZJoAR8AQGR6eg.text: This is my favorite place for an awesome lobster sandwich!! I've had lobster sandwiches in many different places but nowhere compares. The sandwich is perfectly grilled with butter and filled with large chunks of lobster. I typically like the sauces on the side so I can control the amount I like, usually on the lighter side. This is a MUST stop every time I'm in Vegas!!
