eLM51G-t8SsHZ-o-kgVWsQ.text: For our second visit here, we ordered many things:  lobster and chips, lobster and waffles, lobster bisque, cajun fries and the original lobster roll.  The original lobster roll wasn't as memorable as the first time we ate it.  The lobster roll was overflowing with lobster.  I really liked the waffles and the lobster bisque though.  The waffles were soft and delicious.  The lobster bisque was superb also, served in a bread bowl.  We were beyond stuffed and will probably come back again.

pA7uY5TXx-URad7z4ay8BQ.text: This is my first review, nothing compelling that made me decide other than rhoji calling me out on being yelp thief. Alright, straight to business.. The food was good, it was good for food in general and as far as lobster rolls go it was the best and worst considering it was my first. I just remembered why I dont write reviews, so I apologize for wasting your time.  Pros:  Good food Entertaining atmosphere Dank mad nasty awesome seafood  Cons: Poor value Awkward seating I feel it would be better if it were hot lobster  All in all nothing special just the only place I know to get a delicious lobster roll

jelpGzfKlmCTQr5Cn0B-1Q.text: Ahhh the lobsicle !! I spotted this awesome place bc I was staying at the planet Hollywood and thank heavens I was blessed to spot this place ! I was so confused to choose from all the lobster menu but I ended up w the deep fried lobsicle and added the fries and drink for an extra $3.  They also offer free sample of lobster ice cream which I cannot resist. the ice cream wasn't too bad but when I spotted a big chunk of lobster meat in my ice cream I was kind of freaked out lol. so none the less, I threw out the ice cream. my lobsicle was absolutely delicious comes w a slice of lemon and sauce it was heavenly sent. Next time, I wanted to try the lobster spring roll and probably the whole menu! ;)

1iC4Y03UKemjgf6mE8LFeg.text: Great lobster roll. It reminded me of New England. Closer and easier to get another one.

zjdJ7q0uP2N0wLO8Xs-pwA.text: My husband and I absolutely love this place. We discovered it walking around the mall and decided to give it a try. Its a great way to have delicious lobster in a fast food type setting. Their lobster bisque is amazing. I cannot wait until we go back to Las Vegas just so we can eat here again.

V3BvNTjihWGhTo9SVDD0uA.text: Been a regular at Earl of Sandwich everytime I stay at Planet Hollywood but wanted to venture out to see what else was around. Lobster Me is close by, next to Fat Tuesday. Their menu is amazing, everything lobster in all kinds of variations! I wanted to try everything, but I just got a lobster roll cajun style. Boy is it spicy, but very good. Quite expensive for a sandwich/roll, $25, but that's what you can expect with lobster. I'll definitely be back to try other items on the menu that caught my eye, like the lobster mac n cheese and lobster bisque.

YpNQnyjSqcx0UuzUw4esag.text: The Cajun lobster roll and the lobsicle (lobster tail on a stick) were so good my husband and I ate the same exact thing the next day. $3 vodka cranberry and $5 shocktop drafts, best place to eat and drink while shopping in Planet Hollywood,

pSOYIQ8FF_dsOUUT83KKOA.text: Very good lobster rolls. A bit pricey and the loster meat is cold. Baguettes are warm though. Worth the try but I have had similar quality for less price, but hey it's Vegas.

q5EvQnnBewul68j5vTA3Xw.text: Long wait for food (when there was no line to order), pretty low quality on the sandwich -- had the lobster mcmuffin, pretty gross and not even assembled together

IquVhmgCgH8R3scqzRM_1w.text: The Cajun lobster roll was great. Lots of lobster and the bread was  excellent. Get the garlic fries with it. Very good too.

qdutRLKSqt2Jhx6Gbks5dw.text: I wanted to go to the Earl of Sandwich but the line was too long, just like it was last summer. So we settled for this place because it looked good. The clam chowder bowl was pretty good. My boyfriend said the shrimp tacos were okay. I got the lobster and waffles. DON'T get this. First of all, the waffle turned out to be a pancake. Then the lobster pieces were covered in so much batter. The batter tasted like grease and the lobster was chewy. This was a very disappointing and expensive meal.

7EGPe494lkJZ5yY4_T-rvQ.text: Skip it. Both the Cajun Lobster Roll and Lobster Mac & Cheese were dry and lacked flavour.

E6U-bMwSeg2WpwfyzcuKkQ.text: I really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't make the cut.   First off, where do we eat?! Too many patrons, not enough tables! Second, the wait for the food was probably about 20-30 minutes. Kitchen seemed to be a bit unorganized, as I noticed like 10 or so tickets at the window! Now for the important part, the lobster... We ordered an original lobster roll, lobster mac and lobster grilled cheese. Unfortunately, we weren't really impressed! The lobster roll was inconsistent in flavor. Some bites were pretty good, others were eh. It was also pretty small! (should not be called "large"). The lobster mac was, sad to say... Bland and runny. Couldn't really taste the lobster and it looked like Mac and cheese, but the flavor of the cheese was almost nonexistent. Definitely would like it to be more creamy and rich. Finally, the lobster grilled cheese was actually the best of the three, but was far from phenomenal. The grilled bread was good but was mushy. It didn't have that crisp you expect from a grilled sammy. I told my girl, the best part of my meal was my beer.   I read an earlier post about this place... It stated "if you don't like your money, eat here." I wanted to find out for myself, but about $40+ poorer, I definitely should have taken that yelper's advice! Don't say we didn't warn you!

pb8_rS6eISIadLtevupUHw.text: Pretty darn good for a food court meal. Be warned, it's expensive! I mean, lobster is expensive (somewhat) so of course it's going to be pricey when it's prepared for you. We ordered the lobster bisque, served in a bread bowl, and the diablo lobster sandwich. The total was $30!!! WOW, for a SMALL sandwich and soup, that's freakin expensive (at least in my opinion). BUT, the bisque was very tasty (could have had more lobster though) and the sandwich was very tasty as well. For a food court meal, this is pretty damn good, except for a food court meal, very pricey!!!!

WgarXm5jatKFTFVZ_tJtgA.text: great idea but this place won't last. way overpriced, ridiculously small portions and not enough tables for their diners. You're telling me I just spent $40+ and there's nowhere to sit to eat it? It's gimmicky and I've been to similar places that are much better all around (see my review for Slapfish). lobster me once, shame on me, sorry, don't lobster me again peeps

hkw6Z9_Nr8vuk99yrvhRAw.text: Food sucks in general but if u like lobster get the lobsicle four oz tail meat on a stick.  Safest thing to get.

J2_7ZCCb1uXJNYkZt7GKtA.text: This place is right next to Fat Tuesday at Planet Hollywood. My boyfriend and I ordered the grilled cheese so I can only give a review on this one order. Based on this grilled cheese, I would love to try out everything else on their menu! I was skeptical as to how much lobster there really is in the grilled cheese but surprisingly, our sandwich had a lot of lobster! The sisters that work there are the funniest people too! They were so positive and they gave us recommendations. They cleaned up the tables pretty fast so other people can have a seat as they eat and they were all very accommodating which I very much appreciate.

Git0lcw2wmAgESFeYNAFhg.text: It's ok. The tables they have are awful but the food is decent avoid the $8 "garden salad" aka small $1 house salad. Lobster grilled cheese was tasty.

cZxDZLx7Xm01qJZHhjBJgg.text: The lobster roll is killer. Stars just for the roll.

aFX41qVnQXzf16ttRfqPAg.text: I've eaten here the last 2 times I was in Vegas.  I mean, really--where else can you find lobster on a stick?  I just LOVE the concept! (No bib, no shell cracker, just lobster meat, ready-to-eat!)  It's flavorful and juicy, served up with a nice hot container of melted butter.  I tried the lobster macaroni too. It was pretty good, but should have contained more chunks of lobster.  This is a storefront in the mall. There are a few stools and tables in the mall area. So, expect food court style dining.

GJbzWjJHHRJEB7hlE9LMOQ.text: The food was decent, had better lobster stuff elsewhere for the same price honestly.  Had the Lobster and Chips... They should consider using actual English type chips (steak fries) instead of french fries.  Also had the lobster mac n cheese; kind of bland honestly.  They gave me a free tasting of the lobster ice cream and that was interesting, but probably would never order a full scoop.  All in all it's decent food, but for the same amount of money I rather eat elsewhere...

5S_VSt_y1DOsEgMTFTSGZg.text: Eh. I don't see what the fuss is about. It was $22 for a combo--drink, lobster roll, and soup. Lobster bisque was ok, kinda salty. Lobster roll was just a tiny sandwich and had no mayo or any flavor or anything, just lobster. The proportion of meat was good but it did not justify the price and flavor. Wish I'd tried something heartier.

Madb__q__3crtKo5ozzFKw.text: I guess not too many people have lived on the East Coast based on the reviews. Small portion, over cooked, lacking flavor is what I experienced. A major disappointment after a very long day at work. I would be an idiot if I ever wasted my hard earned dollars on this place again.

RdWp3U3ipes525l7LDG7Pw.text: It's located in the Planet Hollywood, close to Fat Tuesday! I'm a big lobster fan, and when I stayed at PH I ate here 3 times! My favorites are  the Lobster Roll and Lobster Grilled Cheese. The Lobster Bisque is good, but too salty for me.   Recommendations: Lobster Roll Clam Chowder Lobster Bisque Lobster Grilled Cheese

4sD0vOnOyT3iWp_q_EhHog.text: Cathy is amazing! So sweet and kind. Lobster roll and drinks were on point! Will definitely be back before our vacay ends.

mo2GnB-SbvhAgnAcaHs1LQ.text: Loved every bite of it. This was my first time and despite the negative reviews I truly enjoyed the lobster roll. I ordered Cajun while my hubby wanted to stick to the traditional one and we must say...we finished it in about 5 mins. The fries are okay and the service was great. The cashier Cathy was friendly and attentive even after we received our order. The location is located inside the miracle mile mall next to Fat Tuesday. There's not really an exclusive eating area but we were in and out for a quick bite within 10-15 mins. Looking forward to trying their lobster bisque and lobster mac and cheese. Definitely will be coming again.

7m3x4aoZl4EryNRviXLveg.text: Located next to Fat Tuesday in the Miracle Mile I was excited to go lobster crazy. Everything on the menu looked delicious so I gave in and decided to give this place a try...eh...I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the lobster grilled cheese and the lobster wontons. I really envisioned the grilled cheese to be made with regular melted gooey cheese just filled with lobster chunks...not the case. It was cold, they used cream cheese and it was not melted. The wontons surprised me as well because all I tasted was curry, I didn't even finish half of them. I got to sample the lobster Mac and cheese and that was pretty good, I would definitely eat a bowl of that. I also sampled the lobster ice cream, a spoonful is enough. It was very rich and buttery with lobster chunks, not sure if I could handle an entire scoop.   Next time I would go with their breakfast items because the lobster eggs and lobster and waffles looked yummy...but then again so did that grilled cheese :/ Oh, they give free refills on drinks.

5XrV0ySSIYICzRaT7lf1dw.text: Pretty damn good flavor but could stand to be a lot larger and a whole lot less expensive. But what the hell, it's Vegas!

nAD6j87raBQ9F1xcnYj-3Q.text: Ordered the infamous LOBSICLE and lobster bisque. If you're thinking of only ordering the LOBSICLE, make sure you order another one (don't order the lobster bisque.. Clhs9QlWgoOXb4q-A3Retg.text: They should change their slogan to "World's smallest lobster roll" instead of world's best. I swear the portions get smaller by the day. The roll I had today probably 1/2 the size if not smaller than when they opened. I won't be back.

1kUe54bu3VQ0GNodNYceBA.text: Good amount of lobster on the roll and the bun was nicely toasted. Definitely a bit on the pricey side though ($17 for a large,$24 xl) which prevented us from ordering about five of them each

jGs18KG4GCAM9trEWjnnjw.text: Wow...My husband doesn't even like fish and is a picky eater, and he tried my Connecticut Lobster roll and Chowder fries and said he loved it.  I wish there was a franchise near me.  You can tell this is high quality food, prepared well.

yBwbv5mQ0szoeODiko3MIg.text: I was looking for this and happened to just stumble across it, while waiting in line at Fat Tuesdays. I got the Lobster Grilled cheese and the lobster Mac & Cheese. The Mac & Cheese was awesome!!!  I would definitely go back just for that.. however the grilled cheese was more like shredded lobster salad with too much mayonnaise.... no bueno... I was expecting succulent chunks of lobster and creamy brie or something... oh well, its worth a try!

6avalX61ZBLnGZzuTzGmsw.text: Who knew you could get great fresh Maine Lobster in Las Vegas without paying tons of money? We ordered the lobster Mac and cheese, and a Connecticut lobster roll meal. We got our number from the young girl who was helpful in assisting us since it was our first time ordering.  A few minutes later our food arrived. The  man who served it was nice but, you could tell was overwhelmed. The lobster Mac and cheese had huge chunks of lobster on top of what looked like boxed Mac and cheese with toasted bread crumbs thrown on top. It was good for the first two or three bites....after that I ate just the lobster, which was delicious! My husband's lobster roll, well he ordered the Connecticut and received the Original. I took the first bite and noticed it was cold, since both can come cold we didn't think much of it. He thought maybe they mistaking gave him the cold Connecticut. After bite two, he realised it was not the Connecticut but, the Original. By then a line had formed , I was almost done, and he had eaten a 1/3 of the sandwich. So, since it was good also he enjoyed the rest of it!  Overall the food is good and I think staff just needs to slow down a bit or hire more.

EmdTmqeRVRhIQAgJPkEHxA.text: We had to go back for more!  Lobster roll and lobcicle were awesome!!  Bisque was meh.  Grilled cheese was okay.   But the roll and lobster tail on a stick were definitely what to order!  We only tried the Connecticut roll.

yL4TI1DD8qPQ6ni61x_3Xg.text: I walked pass here so many times. I'm so disappointed by the quality of food. My clam chowder had so much salt in it that I had to throw away most of it

e2MikcP_9wOLU8cMhFPZcw.text: 4/5, Location: In Vegas and planning to drink? Fat Tuesday in Planet Hollywood is one of the locations to stop by. I'm sure you'll find that place easily meaning Lobster ME is easy too (unless you're too drunk already) because it's right next to it!  4/5, Service: The ordering process is quick and easy.  3/5, Food: Coming from Hawaii where everything's already expensive, the price at Lobster ME wasn't intimidating. The quality of food was relatively the same but I realized the portion of food was just roughly the size of a fist. It tasted great but I'm not sure if it was really worth it for the amount of food you got.  If you're ever craving lobster to-go as a sandwich, I'd stop by Lobster ME. If not, it's a good place to visit once, but other than that, you'd best give some other places a try on the strip.

t4Aj3Bi-03U_Cb2NbSpNYg.text: I've been here before and tried the Connecticut lobster roll (I love lobster rolls) and knew I would go back to try the rest of their menu which we did this time. This time there was a few of us so we got a couple of items: The Frenchy (brie/lobster panini), the Lobster Grilled Cheese, the Beltway (lobster sandwich with old bay seasoning), the Lobster Cheese Fries and the Lobster Mac and Cheese. We went lobster crazy! The Frenchy (is the sandwich I had myself) is very light breading if you want something lighter than the grilled cheese. The grilled cheese was good too! All of it was good. Between the cheese fries and the mac and cheese, I preferred the mac and cheese. It just seemed like the lesser of two evils! Haha.  I believe our cashier/server was named Ronnie, she was super helpful! Definitely hit up this spot of you have a hankering for some lobster everything.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Cheese Fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Frenchy

WR8KbX-Ls_sG_pMlKDg5_A.text: My husband and I visited here for the first time last week and it did not disappoint! We LOVE lobster rolls from Key West so we weren't sure how this would compare.....but we were very pleased...it was delicious! We will be back when we visit Vegas again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ltPX7zduWDJza3rwgSlaQQ.text: Good but overpriced food. I got the Taco Trio which is one of each type of taco (fish, shrimp, lobster) served with chips and a cheese sauce. The tacos were good, my favorite was the shrimp. The chips were okay but the cheese served with it was not good at all. It had an odd texture and was very oily. The location has a shared seating are with Fat Tuesday.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco Trio

v82RabJWYX0ZRgZtAD6erg.text: Gave this place another chance and they came thru. Had ct style lobster roll. Still have fantastic split rolls but this time the lobster meat was much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TkznxegWu0A3VMAJ-vYysA.text: As others have said, it's a food court experience with sit down restaurant prices. Yes it's lobster but I've had what was probably the best lobster roll I've ever eaten for less at the Plaza Hotel in NYC. If price was the only difference I would go four stars but the roll here was not the most flavorful and was surprisingly bland. The service was friendly and relatively fast. The crab loaded waffle fries were the highlight of the evening and my fiancee had the lobster grilled cheese which was also pretty good. Okay in a pinch.

li9kFds2GJqxoJ8WmFuW8Q.text: We had the bread bowl of lobster bisque. $15  The bread as so good, loved dipping the bread in the soup to eat. The LB was perfect. Creamy and loved the hints I think of sherry, and a nice portion of lobster.   It's quite expensive for the rolls and we just wanted to grab a quick snack so I didn't feel like paying almost $30 for a lobster roll. From reviews, I hear they are good so maybe next time.

T4jf_q5OR4qCFkHQF65JqQ.text: I've been to this location twice now, my last visit being this past weekend. The shop is located in the Miracle Mile Shops, just a little bit up from Earl of Sandwich and right next to Fat Tuesday. My friend and I came here right after a show which ended around 11:30PM on Saturday night. The place is opened until 12. The cashier was a pretty chill and enthusiastic dude, not something I was expecting near store closing. My friend and I both ordered the plain lobster roll. I didn't even read the note on top, but it comes with a side of criss cross fries, small cup of cole slaw and half a pickle. It is sort of pricey for fast food, but it's lobster we're talking about. Presentation of the lobster was very nice, and it came with a small piece of lemon. It's not the freshest or tastiest lobster I've had, but it satisfied my craving. Next time I'm going to give the crab roll a try!

CFyLWtXnsNS7x-ecvQIS2A.text: Amazing. Lobster roll was stuffed with lobster and the roll was perfectly soft and toasty!

fgeTAyeoW42kC-Uztynx5w.text: So nestled deep within the Miracle Mile is LobsterME and bust my barnacles if it wasn't good yet as the 3 stars proves not something I'm clawing for as I type this either  As I have SlapFish here a big difference in LobsterMe is the quantity of the lobster given and the overall taste of the meat as well..For the prices charged for some items you should reward your guests rather then essentially punish them for wanting some great lobster at a great price..The portion size was not well proportioned in my view and the meat itself could've had a little more fresher feeling to it..I guess you can say I know by now what great lobster is and why lower the bar if I'm left feeling like I ran into the bar instead?  I decided on the lobster mac and cheese partnered with the chowder fries..As I did like the mac and cheese with both tender pasta and delectable cheese sauce the lobster was scarce overall (hence the comments above)..The chowder fries were a roller coaster for me..I did find the fries the perfect consistency (not too hard not too soft), but the tomatoes that were partnered with the chowder I felt caused it to be soggy overall  All in all it was a good find, but not a great find..I will most likely give it another shot as there was their lobsicle which was calling my name, but trial and error has shown me what to omit for sure from my palette.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder Fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac N Cheese

Kezv8xjx4SGeY7cCI7FI-A.text: Good service! Fast food preparation! And amazing food. My first time here with my buddy and we got the lobster roll which was so amazing that we ordered the grilled cheese lobster to go for the road. I would definitely recommend this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with side of fries!

Niv4SwRiBRRlB12rINc96g.text: So this lobster shack/counter is located in a part of Miracle Mile Mall. This little gem is full of magical goodness for your mouth. The fried lobsicle is a fried lobster tail on a stick, served with a side of drawn butter. When you pour the butter over the tail it melts in your mouth. I had to eat and run the first night, but it was so delicious that we had to come back on our last night. I ordered the crab loaded fries, which come with waffle fries, crab meat, lobster meat, green onions, and drizzled with ranch. Smh. I can't describe how great these combinations of flavors made my heart sing!! Aaaaaahhhhhhh. We were a party of 11 and everyone ordered different things on the menu. EVERYTHING was great. I wish they would open a location in NYC!!! (Hint, hint)! The staff is amazing and very hospitable. Keep up the great work!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicles Variety of Lobster rolls Crab loaded fries Fish/shrimp &amp; chips Crab sliders

rbbidECnUaGyNy8BPgtKgQ.text: The lobster cheese fries are exceptionally savory and flavorful. They are doused in a lobster-sherry-cheddar cheese mixture and topped with large nuggets of fresh lobster meat.   The lobster mac 'n' cheese was also very tasty; a simple shell pasta with a white-cheddar cheese base, covered in chunks of lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Cheese Fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac

d6sSuqpo6np1WWfxHelVGg.text: Lobster me please.  Lobster me good but please don't steal my wallet once I drift off into a coma.  It's my favorite crustacean and always more expensive than my Casio watch.  Even when I do find lobster rolls, they are without an abundance of lovely lobster meat. This place gives you a nice heaping of lobster meat at a great price, ~$12.  The quality of the lobster meat is questionable though, but it's enough for me to eat and not barf.  The lobster rolls come with a bit of coleslaw and potato chips too, so you don't need to order fries unless you really want to soak up some giggle water.  The roll is buttery and delicious by itself.  I'm sure it will be a good enough to devour in-between Fat Tuesday sips.  My only lobster-y wish is that the lobster mac and cheese had more meat in it.  Am I asking too much?!  How can you give me an awesome lobster roll and then send me a lazy lobster mac and cheese?  Okay, I'm a brat, but I still recommend this place when it comes to snorting anything with lobster in it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right next to Fat Tuesday

tQiLngtTECbdfLpJrjXhsQ.text: Good food. Slightly pricey for a mall food court shop ($64 for 2 people). The Fish and Chips (my wife's choice) was exceptional.

xkQv9v11SgtBC-qS6rKKog.text: What can I say? The 50/50 Dawg and the Lobster Roll we're busting with great flavor. The amount of the lobster meat was pretty good. There were chunks of lobster claw meat in our roll. The Texas roll was tender and buttery. The price is slight higher, but it's lobster! A great place to go to if you're craving for a lobster roll here in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LQ_XWuu1_kfm11nNIfdPug.text: First lobster roll ever and this place didn't disappoint. Had the Maine lobster roll with loaded crab fries. Food heaven!

XJp684Ykq7B12TISgizMSA.text: A few of my friends recommended this place when I was in Vegas last week, and even though we live in Boston where there's AMPLE SEAFOOD everywhere, we decided to give it a try! They have a lot of different things on their menu you can't find in Boston!  They have a few different styles of lobster rolls, but since I've had a few of those already, I went for the lobster mac and cheese, and Pearl T. got the lobster on a stick grilllled.   We were a little disappointed at the size of the lobster on a stick. Pretty small for ~$14 but I think it tasted good?  Lobster mac n cheeze is huuge for $12. A little too cheezy for me, but I liked the amount of lobster on top. Just couldn't finish it with all the oil and cheese at the bottom. I think this is a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get. I'd LOVE to try the lobster & waffles, but I didn't see it on the menu when we were there!   We also forgot to try the lobster ice cream, so there must be a next time! Overall, it was an a-ok experience! I'd come back if other people want to try it, but read the reviews and be selective about your choices!

ZZih7Av8KK6FdOmmEznMiw.text: What happened to this place???? OMG what a waste of lunch and petro considering I drove ALL the way from Henderson. Wow I'm very disappointed.  I've eaten here several times and I rant and rave about the place but now I'm stuck with my foot in my mouth. Starting with this soft and soggy grilled cheese that smells like gross ocean, and tastes like a "old tuna sandwich" you better not unless you want to be sick. How could you treat your local resi like this.. :(  I kind of felt like I was sold the left overs!  The mac and cheese was horrific! Watery, no cheese, "fishy smelling" lobster. I was in shock that I was given this CRAP! The macaroni shells and cheese is different. Also there use to be a breaded crust like topping Lobster roll also had fishy smelling meat on it. In case anyone was wondering, sea food should NOT smell fishy! Weird, yes, but very True. Shame, Shame, SHAME Lobster me NOT! "LUCY, Some body got some splaning to do!"  Entire staff is starving now....   2 Stars because one should mean, "please, throw the whole business away!"  Never returning...

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What do you even call this? ‍

Yv1q3PuYJr2H5X9kuXqHCw.text: Great to go option on the strip. Will visit again because the food was flavorful and definitely a better fast food option.

2-sU_6UMTn1TcMvCex9CBw.text: On a trip a few years back I discovered Lobster Me, which I quickly fell in love with. I tried it again during this trip, and I'm not sure if it was me or if the chain has changed because my love for this place has turned into a like.  Now don't get me wrong, nothing was bad per se, but it just wasn't as good as I remember my first interaction. So, if you haven't guessed by the name, Lobster Me specializes in lobster rolls, but also sells lobster mac & cheese, fish tacos and other things so just because you may not be in the mood for a roll, doesn't mean you shouldn't stop by.  This location is inside the Mall at Planet Hollywood and it quickly became quite busy after I made my order.  This trip I wanted to try something(s) I hadn't had on previous visits.  This time I went with their Atlantic Blue crab roll ($15) which is wild Atlantic lump and claw with mayo and celery (this is served chilled). Now you can, "style it up" meaning, you can add certain toppings to it. This time I chose their baja which is chipotle aioli & pico de gallo. They have other styling's like Cajun, which is aioli & scallions. I do remember my last visit, I got the Maine Lobster, which is served with that warm butter and is always a good choice in my opinion. All the rolls are served with waffle fries and coleslaw. In addition because I just really wanted to try it, I got their mac & cheese.   The mac & cheese is what I started with first. At first look I was a little underwhelmed because I thought I'd get something truly special or loaded with cheese, but after my first bite I have to say I liked it a lot. The fried onion straws on the top were a different, but nice touch. I ate the entire thing which I also was surprised about. And as a FYI, you can add lobster to your mac too if you'd like.  Pass on the coleslaw, it was not good at all. Too dry in my opinion.  The fries were okay, but I felt like they weren't that hot. I still ate them, don't get me wrong, but they weren't the freshest.  The roll was good, not great, but good. The bread was fresh and dense and there was a ton of crab and lobster meat, but I don't think I chose the right add on for me. I didn't love the salsa and aioli mixture. I think for me, it's just better to leave well enough alone and not put anything else on top of it as these flavors overpowered the seafood. I picked off what I could and finished my meal that way.  Next time I come by I'm getting my Maine Lobster roll again. Stick to what you know, right? Overall the service was great. Everyone was super friendly. This wasn't the best meal, but I think it was a combination of my choices and previous experiences at their other location. I'll be back, I just know what to order and what I don't like now.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LOBK4qX3wmBn_yO3-wVVGA.text: I am from Rhode Island & love my seafood!! Have always wanted to check this place out so finally during our last trip here I broke down & spent the $. Let me tell you, IT WAS SOO WORTH IT!!!   Yes, it's a little pricey, but they say they fly the lobsters in fresh from Maine, can't get much better than that! I had the lobster roll with melted butter & spent the extra money to add on 2oz more lobster. Soo good!! Clam chowder was an up charge but that is really good too!!  I will definitely be back next time I win some money!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll &amp; clam chowder

odUoBoSlNLjfSSWYdYWChQ.text: During my trip to Vegas, I walked by this establishment multiple times. It looked and smelled very good, so I stopped by my last night. I ordered the Lobster Grilled Cheese and was very disappointed. The lobster was very chewy and had no flavor. If you are willing to spend $19 for a sub-par lobster grilled cheese, this is the place for you, otherwise steer clear!   Also, they need to update their website because some of the prices are incorrect, like the Lobster Grilled Cheese, which is listed as $15.

qV5rhDhCSNaj8z_C94_3uA.text: Man...This place was so freakin awesome! When my wife and I first saw it we had just eaten and we just knew we had to eat here before we left Vegas. It's great that we waited to because otherwise we would not have met Jean.  On top of experiencing some amazing say that we had such an amazing customer service experience with Jean. The meaning is very simple there are so many options for customizing your lobster roll and/or upgrading your side is that it can be a bit overwhelming. Jean was funny, cool and down to earth and he took the time to explain all of the options as well as give us a few recommendations. In the end everything turned out amazing!  My wife and I knew that we both wanted lobster rolls we just didn't know what toppings we wanted. We both landed on Cali Style which because we both love avocado. My wife upgraded her side to the loaded crab fries and I upgrading mind to the Mexican street corn.  The fries were as amazing as they found which was to be expected I was truly Blown Away by how good the Mexican street corn was. More on that later. The loaded fries four tops with crab meat, bacon, chives, cheese and came with a ranch dipping sauce. Oh my gosh!  I honestly would not have tried to Mexican street corn if it were not for Jean because most of the times we have had it it has been hit or miss. I'm so glad that we trusted Jean though because this was by far the best Mexican street corn that we have ever had. They use Chipotle mayo instead of regular mail and it gives it a little kick and it's so delicious.  This will definitely be one of our first stops next time we're in Vegas!

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll Cali style (avacado, tomato and chives) + Mexican street corn.

x6Vdh-6UeUAvSg1AvgGHNQ.text: The lobster chowder is by far very good value. Eaten various other chowders like the commercial Boudin but they are more way expensive!

wdoDnUdjkvfh2_dTBxODvw.text: I absolutely loved the food! My husband ordered the lobster grilled cheese which came with lobster bisque and I ordered the Maine lobster roll. My roll was good (but I would've preferred more warm butter on it), but the lobster grilled cheese was AMAZING. I was super jealous that his food tasted better than mine. Would definitely order my own next time!

R6iGSY0s7s9aNNB6T-NDpA.text: 2/7/18  It's in the middle of the Miracle Mile shops, in a very typical mall food court, and given they had lobster rolls for $24 I already pegged them to be an over-priced mall joint with mall-food-for-the-masses kind of quality and taste, but you know what?, they were surprisingly good!...  So I only ordered this one thing, and there's what I wrote in my notes a 1/2yr ago:  1. Fish & Chips $12 "crispy, beer-battered with waffle fries, coleslaw and tartar sauce":  Fish was fried well, and was high quality and succulent.  Coleslaw was fresh but needs a ton more sauce.  8/10  So there you have it--above average fish and chips, even compared against specialty restaurants all over.  Not bad.  4/5  #lasvegas #vegas #footcourt #fastfood #nevada

kaO7u75KM6Qvr36pDm50XQ.text: Lobster Me is located in the Miracle Mile shopping mall area attached to the Planet Hollywood resort. It's counter service seafood with sit down restaurant taste! I did end up getting the crab cake which felt like cheating a little since it was a lobster restaurant but I have trouble passing up a crab cake. The sauce they put on it was a little spicier than I expected, but I'm a bit of a wimp when it comes to that and it was still perfectly cooked and very filling. One of my friends tried the lobster grilled cheese, which sounded and looked intriguing. I thought the waffle fries were good and still regret not trying their version of Elote (Mexican Street corn) but I had plenty to eat with just the sandwich and fries. Worth checking out, as they put an interesting spin on some of their dishes.

puUvxJEUqdM1b1XyBTubkw.text: Slow x 100 but yummy nonetheless!  Nice fuel for the Gwen Stefani concert.

X5B7xuchIEEWafRrPLxOWg.text: This is inside the mall- next to Fat Tuesday's. Yes, it is seafood in a food court, but they do it well. So well, that we came back the following day. We ordered the lobster roll and upgraded it BLT style ($26) and crab fries, but the real star of the show wasn't the lobster. The lobster roll was good with the crunchiness of the bread, lobster chunks, and bacon, but the fish taco ($4) was absolute perfection. It was fried perfectly and the batter wasn't thick with some apple citrus slaw, pico de gallo, and the secret must be the sauce- that chipotle aioli sauce gave it the right amount of flavor and kick. I'll take 10 please!  There is also limited seating in front of the restaurant, but it's a quick turnaround time. We ordered our food and all the seats were full, but we waited about 10 minutes and a table cleared up.

u_EKKRc1S2I8g1gmPoZQXA.text: Love love love the Maine lobster roll Cali style.  You can get it either with chives and butter or mayo and celery and Cali style adds avocado and tomato.  It was delicious, the roll was moist and soft and buttery too. The lobster meat was a little over cooked, but nothing too drastic. If you can, you should upgrade your fries to the lobster bisque, it was delicious and creamy.  Don't forget to tip

fQ4AL3ks56VJnD08FmHQKA.text: If you are CRAZY about lobster bisque like we are, you'll be in Heaven!!!!!  I would honestly say close second place to Scoma's in San Fran!!!    The seafood tacos were GREAT, but the bisque is AWESOME!!!!!!!!

wnysD6p1yUDCjIgSJPImUg.text: This was our second time at Lobster Me. We tried the lobster rolls with the butter and I have to say my preference is definitely the Mayo version. The butter made the bread soggy and almost fall apart, it was super messy. We'll go back again but now we know which version of the sandwich to order. The chowder was decent too, I've had better but it wasn't near the bottom of my list.

2FpjS9820ZFIxqw3UDchkQ.text: Always a stop for me when in LV. Last time I went was 4 years ago and looks like they changed their menu a bit. Great and friendly customer service. Food remains to be delicious. Highly recommend bc it's good food and a good price and similar to East coast lobster rolls

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco trio up top. Cajun style Maine lobster roll with crab loaded waffle fries. Yummy

BEZiEqVXoKewhXnShave4g.text: Convenient and decently priced for last Vegas. I had the Maine lobster roll with crab fries and a side of Calm Crowder. Overall they were above average and I would go back.

I5SF0yH9DooXh7jEy-mrjg.text: I order Maine lobster roll with french fries and clam chowder.  Total bill come about $45.  Lobster roll is slightly less than 4" long.  crab loaded french fries was okay.  serving portion was too small for the price I paid.

mz66OLK1VthtuQr4W4KIdA.text: I came across a jumbo poster ad at some very random hallway in the  Venetian was definitely hooked with interest. I was craving lobster and went on a witch hunt for this place.  To my luck, I found it one night as my boyfriend and I were returning back to our suite and, at a distance, I excitedly screamed "I found it!!!".  To my horror, the price of "those lobster-dogs" was $20-25!!  I was horrified at how expensive it was but got it anyways.  The lobster rolls comes in 5-6 dressings and we chose Baja.  Upon ordering, we were given a small plaque that had a number and the server would hand deliver the meal to your table.   The lobster roll, although a bit small, was filled to the brim with lobster meat and dressings.  The meat was juicy and had freshness from the sea. It came with sides of waffle fries (very crispy and delicious), small pickle slices and (probably) the best coleslaw in the world (I usually do not care for coleslaw but this one was beyond amazing).  I think I was more amazed by the sides than the actual lobster roll.    Overall the food was very good but, for the price of $25, I found it too expensive and did not justify its value.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KR0JQKS5pae-DOVlht0Y5g.text: Very tasty and good portion of lobster.  Includes fries and cole slaw, so pretty good deal for the price.   FYI next to Fat Tuesday...

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

mfec7tNS0CJQwmYXbhEHPQ.text: My date loves lobster so we ended up for dinner one night during our trip. The line up was not that long, but because of the customization, each order took a long time to be placed and processed. There were only three staff members working behind the counter and it took awhile for orders to be assembled and for food to be dropped off at your table.  I ordered the lobster mac & cheese, and my date ordered a lobster roll. The prices were average for seafood and reflects the amount of lobster used. However, I was quite happy with my meal. The lobster mac & cheese was very rich and filling. There was a good amount of lobster on it.

eApMxdG68sAeAuYrDzl4dQ.text: This place caught my eye when I was walking through planet Hollywood. This place is right next to Fat Tuesday. Great quick place but fulfilling meal. Would recommend food to anyone that likes lobster or gourmet sandwhiches/fries.

aDjaopDS0vxr-u5KbhOSTQ.text: For the price of the food we pay it not worth it.   The bread was more tasty then the lobster itself.  there were chuck of lobster in the bread but the flavor was blan 6" lobster roll w/meal- $28  The Mac and cheese taste good but the bits of lobster didn't add much to this dish. rLAbeChbZpA2s4kVUCIgHw.text: I'm a big lobster lover, so I was really excited when I came across this place at the Miracle Mile Mall. I ordered the Old Bay Lobster Roll, which came with fries. I also ordered the Lobster Mac and Cheese cause I was curious to see how it tasted.  The lobster roll was good, not great. Kinda small for the price. The Mac and Cheese was also good, but not great. They use the shells for the mac and cheese. But consider the food I got and the price I paid, NOT worth it.  Far too expensive.

f3uqYd-jyCqOt_meKkwlUw.text: The lobster melt was great and surprisingly cheap! If you are in the area I recommend their lobster roll as well.

SRzSJf8Q8ZlHB-1Rl0swmQ.text: It's taken me a year to write this review (don't judge)... So Lobster ME had me as soon as I read their name. Everything was super yummy...fresh, sweet, and delicious. My issues with them, however, were that the Lobster Roll was small and needed more lobster on it, esp considering how much everything on the menu COST. It is not a cheap place to eat, which also was a turn off. I get it; lobster, Vegas, sure. But damn. That said, everything we ordered (and we ordered a lot lol) was really good. I have no doubt I'll be back. And will still be complaining about the prices. :)

UX43hyrlm27e9h5U8EsdDg.text: Got the original Maine lobster roll combo, it was good just wish the portions were bigger. It doesn't really have big chunks of meat like it does in the other pictures. Also there's celery in it, heads up to those who don't like vegetables. Lol this combo came out as $19.81 with local discount

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine lobster roll combo

RBXJE6uwB5Izu5UYUVVY1A.text: Came here just for the Lobster Bisque soup only to find out they didn't have it anymore. Big disappointment. We ended up ordering another favorite of ours which was the Lobster Mac n Cheese and when It came out it was very dry and didn't taste as good. Another disappointment.

Van2HkZj5cvRYA1nD7URnQ.text: Having grown up in New England, I know a good lobster roll when I bite into one.  This one harkened me back to Boothbay harbor with a side of mac 'n cheese and a cold brewski.    At $ 17 for the 4" lobster roll and $ 23 for the 6" roll, this place isn't cheap but it is comfort food at it's near best.  Only thing that could improve is the setting.  You are literally sitting at a table just off the main aisle of the often noisy Miracle Mile Mall that encircles the Planet Hollywood Casino.  Trust me, this is not a picnic table on the coast of Maine.  The rolls are filled generously with only lobster meat - non of those celery or breading fillers...just a touch of butter and mayo to add to the flavor.  You always get the meat from two claws on top every 4" roll and three or more on the 6".  The roll is classic New England - cut on the sides unlike a standard hot dog bun and toasty warm from the grill.  It contrasts nicely with the cold lobster meat.  When in Vegas, Lobster Me will definitely fill the bill and put a smile on your face.

z-uriBFqMdNhJBW7DsVXbQ.text: Stopped by and gave this place a try. I like lobster so figured I'd like anything this place had for sale. I was wrong. Apparently I"m not a fan of cold lobster on a bread roll.   The meal was well over 20 dollars for a small cold sandwhich which I actually found barely edible. Some fries and a coke...no refills.  There isn't much room to sit here and the staff could have been friendlier.  I won't be back.

ByI_A5M_rf8b-6XEU_CZqg.text: Always a little wary of these "fast food" places among malls... in this case, among the 'Miracle Mile' of shops at Planet Hollywood. But I knew I wasn't going to have time to visit the Seafood Buffet at the Rio (which is quite good), so grabbed a "Connecticut Lobster Roll" here.  Let me say, it was extremely underwhelming. The lobster seemed -- literally -- like they were scrapping the bottom of the barrel for lobster pieces. And it was dry, not moist & tender as it should be. I probably should be giving this place one star, not two, but am trying to be generous. And the woman who took my order was nice.  But for $17, I expect good tasting lobster. This was just incredibly meh. And I'd swear there were absolutely no pieces of lobster tail in this sandwich, it all seemed to be from the claws and elsewhere (if that's possible). Which leads me to think, this is one of those places that buys the dregs from restaurants that serve lobster tails and have no use for the other parts. I will never eat here again, I promise.

cOMzQeDXY46J90usvOGzuw.text: I really like the lobster melts cost 10 bucks but the Connecticut lobster row 19 I felt it needed a sauce. I felt for the price you can put it in a bigger French bread.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N4QeMW4FqdjE-UHvh1bGog.text: Thank you management for your response...just for that you get 4 stars...I know it's months later but I certainly will give it another try but your attentiveness to customer service is exceptional and means a lot more than the food. ..I love lobster...it's my favorite food...one of them. Thanks again.

jpmLwPg4B_F97T1fEWI75Q.text: Date & Time:  February 29, 2014 @ 1pm Location:  Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops Dining Companion:  The Husband Scene:  Shoppers Taking a Break in Flowy Tops, Leggings, Uggs Decor:  Order @ Counter & Seat Yourself Quick Bites Spot Service:  Fast & Efficient Imbibe:  Sodas Mediocre:  Maine Lobster Roll Total:  $30

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uInzh62bwS7TfbIMUpCvRw.text: Convenient location in the Miracle Mile shops, we stayed at Planet Hollywood, the two buildings are connected. They're setup like a food court, to-go window only.   The cashier was friendly and they have plenty of options. However, considering that it is Vegas, they have a huge price tag for their menu items. Something that cost me $12 here in Austin cost roughly $23 and change at this location. Depending on what kind of budget you head to Vegas with should really answer if you'll be eating here or not.   The food was great but for the price, you could find a decent sit down restaurant with dedicated seating somewhere else. I'll probably visit again if I'm in Vegas again but that's only because I love lobster and theirs did taste pretty great - the real reason anyone chooses to eat at any restaurant.

o1jNz_FCCl59BNZkv5wa6w.text: Another 5 star from Vegas. You can find this about halfway through the Miracle Mile shops. I tried the lobster tacos and the lobster grilled cheese and booth were so good im still thinking about them a week later! Only wish I had tried the lobster cheese fries too but one can only eat so much...yah know!  Some on here complained on the freshness well im here to say...Cmon now dont expect the freshest lobser you ever had at restaurant in the middle of the desert...a restaurant in the middle of the desert in the middle of a mall mind you =)  Next time im all over that lobster roll.  Another plus is the Fat Tuesday rite next door!

WnJkkdcVXpqlNMHJHzlOeg.text: Yummy Cajun lobster roll and chips. My friend got the lobster salad and lobster bisque. Both were really good and hit the spot. It is a bit pricey but so good. When I come back in February I will bring my husband here. The food is really good and the service is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster salad

zWKXEbHK76ejRq02YvCi5A.text: Ordered the Cajun lobster roll, came out quick and had a good buttery flavor, very little heat/spice so don't let that scare you away. It was pretty good but not sure if it was $20 good. Nice view, watching people stand in line at Fat Tuesdays waiting to get hammered!

8zGJz19uHH6rHwPb1cBZDg.text: I thought it was pretty good! I have the Cajon lobster roll with fires and cold slaw! It had a lot of lobster meat inside and seasoned nicely! I would for sure go back again! I want to try the Connecticut one next! It is pretty expensive, I think a roll, fries, cold slaw and soda came out to $25 bucks but hey, I haven't had one in 6 months! There is also one in the venetian while this is in planet Hollywood!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajon roll with fries and cold slaw. About $20 bucks with the drink.. They were generous with the lobster! Very good!

XuICoQ0ySym8XCBgeHXleA.text: I was here in July, 2014, and I believe they were fairly new at that point. There was a long line to order and receive your food to eat there (food court) or take out. I ordered a lobster grilled cheese, and 45 minutes later, was still waiting for it! I watched others who were there way after me be brought their food and finish eating, and I was still waiting. I asked several people about my order who appeared flustered and clueless when I asked. Finally a girl stated, "the cook  is making it now." I think they had misplaced my order until then!  I got my sandwich after almost an hour wait. It was good but definitely not worth the headache of this highly disorganized place nor the unacceptably long wait!

MTN0zGmaL9Zy81Y00iZpEQ.text: Kind of expensive for a quick lunch in Vegas, but it's lobster and it's Vegas, so the prices really shouldn't be much of a surprise. Unfortunately, the food itself wasn't super impressive and it's hard to justify spending spending $15-$20 here when you can get a sandwich at Earl's for $7 without having to leave Planet Hollywood.  I ended up getting the lobster grilled cheese since I didn't really want to shell out $17 for a small lobster roll and shared an order of chowder fries.   -LOBSTER GRILLED CHEESE ($11) - 3.5/5 Contrary to some other Yelpers, I thought there was a reasonable amount of lobster in my grilled cheese. And there were actual chunks of lobster instead of just all shredded. The bread was buttery but lacked the crispness from perfectly toasted bread. The cheese was warm and melted for the most part, but the texture was a lot creamier than I expected (like mayo or cream cheese) rather than gooey.  -CHOWDER FRIES ($7) - 4/5 Thick fries with a generous topping of chowder, tomato, bacon, cheese and parsley. Fork needed though because the fries get kind of soggy and aren't sturdy enough to hold up the chowder and toppings.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Grilled Cheese ($11) - 3/5
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll ($17), Chowder Fries ($7), Lobster Grilled Cheese ($11)

fOFv4wTo9Yaz7xjo_-IW9w.text: This review is for the Lobster Me truck.  The truck has a short menu, with each item priced $12. Lobsicle, Maine roll, cajun roll, lobster mac & cheese, lobster & chips, and a couple others I don't recall. (Clam strips were on the board, crossed out.)  I had a lobsicle and lobster & chips. The dishes are very similar--both come with fries. Lobster & chips has lobster nuggets, while the lobsicle is a solid piece of meat on a skewer (a small whole tail?). The amount of meat is about the same in each dish.  The nuggets were a bit chewy but tasted good. The lobsicle was the clear winner, and came with a tub of melted butter.  I enjoyed the fries--nice crisp outside and fluffy interior, with skin on.  I'd call the portion and price reasonable for lobster. I'd eat there again.  Just wish they had salad on the truck.

OaiWfV2bvpmxuOy8YtnDvQ.text: Though I personally couldn't see myself paying 18 bucks to eat a lobster roll, I tried the grilled cheese and it was pretty solid after doing some drinking earlier. My brother got the BLT lobster roll and left satisfied.

dZUlAAjWyllWnLKsMx2QuA.text: I love lobster!!!!! Lobster roll and lobster mac n cheese are awesome! It's expensive, but locals get 20% off. Oh, and try the garlic fries! Yum!

1ZYx1g4JW36XxyVyCjpgog.text: The Cajun Lobster Roll is tasty. It's kind of small but they do pack a nice amount of lobster in it. I got a L Cajun Roll while BF got a XL Original. The cajun had a nice kick to it but I dont like the fact that it comes out cold. I know its a lobster roll and it doesnt need to be hot but it shouldnt feel like it came straight out of the fridge either. BF said his roll was okay, nothing extraordinary, but the size was disappointing for a XL. He said he'd probably need two or three to be full. I think i'd need a XL next time to be somewhat full.  They should really post up the sizes og the rolls so people know how much to order.  I was also disappointed that they didn't have the Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche. I really wanted to try that but the worker just said, "we don't have that today." If you don't have it everyday maybe you should specify that on the menu! Just sayin...

V2Hdrjg0E6epQJYtDSSyFw.text: Cajun lobster roll is decently seasoned not spicy but good. Hoping it was a little bigger.

cZzi1vBv0LEej7bYdae85A.text: Sooooooooooo freakin delicious!! One star away from 5 bc of the price. Pretty expensive. But it is Vegas and it is lobster. So I say it's absolutely worth it!   P.S. I was sober eating this. :)

pOyoqAGh29_HPHvwKPivAA.text: All those pictures of huge chunks of lobster had me dying to try this roll. Unfortunately after i paid my $23 for my sandwich, fries, and soda all i got was a tasty buttered bun with scraps of lobster that didnt even reach the top of the bun. I'm wondering if the fact that mine came in a togo box had anything to do with my quality. What was there tasted fine, but like i said, there was hardly anything in the bun and my last two bites were only bun. Stick with Todd English Pub's lobster rolls. They may seem small but there is 3 of them.

xy9-6i9XJHpltwBwX4JRLA.text: We decided to try Lobster Me. Each had different dishes so we could share . First off the lobster roll was delicious!!! Sinful , the Texas toast , the mayo and Lobster excellent !! The garlic Cajun Fries!! Another winner , you will want seconds!! Lastly the waffle was just sweet enough and buttery!! The Lobsicle was decent but not my favorite . Service is kinda slow, but the staff is friendly and they apologize for the wait . I would go back !!

DG4wWUiWMEfq74U0QMJLzg.text: Awesome!!! I had excellent expirence with Lobster me. Food always is so fresh, healthy and so delicious! Staff is friendly and they work fast!  I love Clam Chowder and actually Lobster Cheese sandwich is creamy and so yummy!!! I'm so happy each time I eat there:) thank you guys!

nfyp7HeHzMtetVBk3rDCgw.text: Great Place! All items on menu are really good. Large chunks of Lobster. Only down fall is that it's in a mall. Highly recommended! The original main style is a must try.

Uo41Y_B74-QUCwG-PPoddA.text: I really really loved this place.  It was a little bit more expensive than I had anticipated but totally worth it.  The best part is that it is right besides Fat Tuesday so while they are making your food you can grab a drink.  I visited here twice during my weekend trip, it was that food.  The lobster roll is really amazing.  For $16 its a small portion, but its delicious, and generally lobster rolls are not cheap!  The lobster mac n cheese was my least favorite.  The cheese they use is way too sharp.  It completely contrasts the delicate flavor of the lobster.  I was really disappointed in that.  I also tried the lobster grilled cheese which was good as well.  Their lobster bisque is extremely rich.  I would recommend taking a sample before buying, it was not for everyone.  They also had some fun things on the menu like lobster and waffles, lobster lollipops, lobster and tator tots...all kinds of stuff.  I will definitely be back the next time I am in Vegas!

QbHQGHRcqQ5wZgyfEXeDSA.text: Close to our hotel, I had wanted to try this place before we even got to Vegas (who doesn't love lobster, right?!)   It was OK. I honestly was expecting more, but I really shouldn't have from what is basically mall food lol.  The lobsicle was kinda small and a little chewy and fishy. And SUPER greasy. Not worth the 14 bucks imo... (I wouldn't have been able to tell if it was a giant prawn honestly)   The classic lobster roll however was SO yummy, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. The roll was toasty and buttery, and it was heaping full with lobster (I had to pick some pieces out before i could even pick it up and eat it) However, I have never had a lobster roll before so I have nothing to really compare it to haha.   The green salad with lemon pepper vinaigrette was expensive and a waste of my money. 8 bucks for some lettuce a few cherry tomatoes and some oil to pour on top. Pass.  My sister said the fish and chips were delicious, but nothing like we get out here in California on the coast. She said it was Vegas-good (ha!)  It was yummy, but expensive. Almost 60 bucks for our meal. We will probably not go back.

lwG8b8PtfCbl19NJhuwBxA.text: Long wait (30 minutes) for a bowl of lobster bisque - and then when I finally received my order it was tasteless and watery. I should have ordered something else instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque = not good

UFjtKe-NGvIKY7LelkRw7Q.text: The lobster tacos were a quick midday treat. Definitely better than average. The sauce, toppings, and lobster all tasted fresh and the flavor combo was great. I would eat here again for sure.

N64ICGn9xEtXIg0N_AqJPQ.text: The Lobsicle was incredible, far exceeding expectations. It was the most flavorful lobster I have ever had and possibly one of the best things I have ever eaten in any category. We'll now be stopping by Lobster Me whenever we're in Vegas.

D_ZbO_SAAgriSS7UfW0_jA.text: I love anything with lobster!! This place was located in planet Hollywood next to Fat Tuesday. Its like a food court style but there are tables and chairs to sit.  They had all sorts of lobster! Mac n cheese lobster, grilled cheese lobster, lobster roll, lobster bisque. Love all the selections! The Mac n cheese is good but I kind of got sick of eating it after a while. However, the lobster roll was really good! For $20, it included a large size lobster roll, fries and a drink. The lobster roll did not look big at all, but it was enough for 2 people to share.   Anyway, I can't wait to go back again!

sqfahs1KqN1Wb-t8BbtbTw.text: Our first stop in Vegas! even waited for it to open ;) Its just delioucous lobster. A little expensvie but worth the indulgence. My favorites include the lobster mac and cheese and lobster bisque . YUMM! the only thing is that it takes some time to get the food out. I dont think its freshly made, so couldnt understand why it took so long. Overall this will be a must go everytime I visit vegas!

UVjSm_FXC5o6XhXN7oTlhw.text: Ate here the other day with my family as we were walking the mall. Unfortunately we were starving when I decided to overlook prices. $18 for two lobster tacos and I think fish tacos were $12 or $14 with only a few chips. I was hoping to have the best lobster and fish tacos of my life at that price. Well, I was definitely disappointed. Go to Baja Fresh or rubios and get better quality,beans,and rice cheaper. Just way over priced for so so taste.

Uc2-pnuklaYI3BL6GDc5zQ.text: I've never had a lobster roll before so this was my first time eating one. I've seen them on the food network so I've been wanting to try one. so when i came across lobster me i had to try it. at first i thought to my self it too expensive for a snack but once you try it, its like a little piece of heaven when you eat it. if your trying to get full off it your wasting your time. their $17 each.
