Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large lobster roll. $17.00

Cqhkh58C7CzzMmvZNgsYQA.text: This is so good! I get one every time I'm in Vegas! Although, I wish the lobster were a bit warmer if I'm ordering a hot sandwich.

Qn-OB8_z_fdTPtucjT-obg.text: I passed by this place while walking through the Miracle Mile and felt my stomach start to growl.  Then I saw it, the "Lobsicle".  I had to try it, even for $14 - heck, that's less than the cost of one hand of Blackjack and seemed like a sure bet to me.  I had to wait a few minutes - a good sign they were cooking it up fresh - and then they called my name and I picked it up.  So it's a small lobster tail, lightly battered, fried, and served on a stick.  4 bites in all, but super delicious, nicely cooked, tender and juicy.   Next time I might have to double down on that one.

x5ydVndtBG3cnQZaQ-nASA.text: I am a HUGE seafood lover and I was so happy to have stumbled across this while wandering the Miracle Mile shops at Planet Hollywood. My friend and I split the XLarge Lobster roll combo @ $25 (we substituted the fries for tots) and the Lobster Mac and Cheese @ $9. I was afraid they would be skimpy with the lobster, but there was plenty of it on the two dishes. Yes it can be pricey but it was well worth it. They have a lot of other things on the menu that I would love to try next time I'm in town: Lobster & Waffles, Lobsticle (lol) and maybe even the lobster ice cream! :D Definitely yummy food. I'm a fan!

36GyYGXqn-jPFNOcvideug.text: Lobster ME. Lobster YOU. Lobster ALL US.  The Lobster Bisque with Bread Bowl was a perfect snack for Jesse and I. It was delicious, creamy, and had lots of Lobster chunks in it. If you stayed at PH hotel, you can order it to go, and eat it in your room. That's what we did, Lobster Bisque + Bellagio fountain view = a perfect afternoon in Vegas before taking a nap.

BpU58IG5OMXqtIaB3nFhdQ.text: Have to say, this was a surprise find.  Located inside the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood...   Counter service concept with all things lobster...  wasn't sure it would deliver - but I have to say the lobster roll I split today with a co-worker (yes, it's easy enough to hit up for lunch if you work at UNLV) was absolutely terrific.  Buttery toasted bun, fresh lobster, lots of claw meat, celery salt.    It's a winnah.

4TTL2Ydopdu8YcJ6NgJkXQ.text: I love trying weird foods.  The very mention of such an opportunity will make me pop up like a meerkat, alertly demanding to know the "Whats" and "Wheres" of such a possibility.  Mind you, I'm not going to eat anything like sour cream and onion flavored crickets (which are quite horrifyingly real, and I saw a pack of some this week), but I'm pretty open.  Cue Lobster Me.  I love seafood quite a bit, and have been wanting to try this for months, but I started normally with their lobster bisque.  Served in a bread bowl, and chock full of yummy lobster meat, I devoured it, and quickly.  It was quite good.  Then came the "weird".  Lobster ice cream.  I know.  Fish and ice cream.  It doesn't sound like it would be a good combo.  But it was actually very sweet with just a hint of a salty aftertaste.  And there are decently sized chunks of lobster in the ice cream, but they aren't "fishy" or overwhelming in flavor.  Meal selections seem to be about $8-10 an item, so select a choice or two and go (sharing works, too).  I want to try their lobster mac 'n' cheese next, and a few other menu choices.  Not a regular dining selection, but a returnable venue for me.  The concept may not work for everyone, but I had fun trying something that made more than a few friends raise their eyebrows at me.

qjZwgSxojCqRdKO6lA0KMA.text: I just had the lobster roll here by recommendation from a friend. He was a few hundred bucks up and really wanted me to try their rolls here, so he bought me one. I just finished eating a crazyass lunch at Mon Ami Gabi, but what the heck...it can't be that big...  It was HUGE! Not only that, you can taste the freshness of the lobster meat...and rest assured, they give you A LOT of lobster.   Does it match up to Luke's in NY? Nope, but pretty close. Better portions for the price here, that's for sure.

g_cdxcV97aWQ9x1csxlCZA.text: For this type of venue, food court restaurant, WOW! Service was quick, food was fantastic. We both had Connecticut lobster rolls, so so yummy. I wish we has one where we live. A little pricey but worth every penny. Don't miss it if you are shopping the Miracle Mile.

eNP480V5LVZivMF8MaOx6g.text: If I were basing this review on food alone it would be a four.  Unfortunately because of the service I have to give it only two stars. While yes,  the food is very expensive it is well worth it. This is the first place that I run to the moment I hit my hotel room I throw my bags on the floor and run to get my lobster on.  I have always had nothing but a great experience here until last weekend. The employees should really wear name tags so we know who it is that was rude. They were clearly understaffed and overwhelmed. And the young girl with the dark hair just could not handle it.  While I think she tried her best to be nice she was frustrated and it came off very rude. Two people in line walked away and I heard the woman say with these prices I don't need to put up with that.  It definitely added a sour note to otherwise wonderful food

u35x3HGb43ez2JMdUnNy4g.text: I rarely guve low reviews... but the pictures are deceiving.... servings are super small and food over priced. The rolls are decent but gone in two bites.... everything else we ordered (fish n chips, calm chowder) was not very good to be honest...

_S5hJFMbjzlnnYO1Re1gdg.text: The food was good.  However, the portion sizes are extremely small.  I was expecting a real roll but was given a miniature 3.5" roll for $19.  Do not waste your money making it a combo either.  It wasn't worth the money!!!!

7K2hyvnUHD0vFfYcWax1jg.text: They act like you get a nice meal but you get one piece of lobster and a whole lot of filler. Screw this restaurant and their crappy service.

cf0vStOCUdqp-p5eN7az_g.text: Awesome food we've been to Maine and this is Damn close. You can even get the lobster warm if you like. Quality food, quality service!

7LYEJ23pG672X8x0NXcClQ.text: Ok so the CT lobster roll turned out to be pretty good, but we sure waited ages for it. Probably better for how starved we were! They forgot to give us a number with our order, we asked them, they said it wouldn't be a problem, they'd call our name. So we watched them like hawks. Then when the huge group of drunk guys who'd come in after us got their food, we asked and they produced said roll, saying they'd called our name several times. Trust me, I was watching and they never called a name. Food was tasty but the fried lobster thing isn't worth it at all - it tasted like old oil in the fryer at the end of the day. If you're dying for lobster, check it out, but not the best service.

0V7gzfvmBDumr4UY71c_VA.text: Cajun lobster roll was just okay for me, didn't seemed like I ate a whole lobster. Although it was served on a sweet bun which brought out the flavor. For about $20, probably pass.

vLjZvZkWZkBNpUdtxxizGA.text: 5 stars all day long. Brandon is a great chef. The band I run plays Planet H 4 to 5 days a week. I eat here every night we play on our first break, and have been doing so since Nov, 2011. Being from Northern Cali and a Bay Area junkie. There simply is no better lobster in LV for the money. I first met Lucile and developed "The Ray Jon Special" with her. Though she's on day shift now, the name stuck and it's an off menu recipe for the night shift. No bread, no butter, just spices, homemade cocktail sauce, and Lemon.  The entire staff is great. Always very clean.  Because they offer a wide variety of lobster fare, you'll want to go more than once to try everything. Unless your a creature of habit like me.

AYQwUzNNSWJbES-auXIaiw.text: Though it's fast food, and it's very pricey, I enjoyed my meal very much! I got the lobster Mac and cheese and it was perfect. There was a generous serving of lobster on top of yummy macaroni and cheese. The portions were adequate. I personally can't each that much so I was able to get full off half of the mac and cheese. Some might say it's a small serving, but it was enough for me. I also got the fries to go along with it. Get the combo meal, you pretty much just get the drink for free. They share seating with Fat Tuesday and other places, so we kind of had to wait around to get a table. Also the tables were dirty... But I expect nothing less from a mall restaurant in Vegas haha. I'd come back if I was craving it. Not really a must if you're in Vegas, but it's a good place to try if you've never had it before!

wXo6-x1LNWARhy3-FrVo1A.text: It was eh..I only tried this place kuz working in planet Hollywood I got the employee discount Had the Cajun roll And honestly for what I paid id thought it be better. Tried the lobster Mac and cheese barely any lobster.. So I tried the clam chowder on two seperate occasions first time delicious went back and the clam chowder tasted so watered down disgusting. Haven't been back since Fries were great tho that I cannot complain

FhP2ab9hDXeRVB2UPb6w5Q.text: Last night,  I had a craving for lobster. I came here and the ordered the Connecticut,  lobster bisque and lobster mac n cheese. The bill came up to $35. This is as comparable at to calling McDonald's a steak house. Save your money and craving for a real lobster dinner.

_TB2lEt9hBEsVwus98sMVA.text: Lobster roll was terrific.lobster bisque came in a bread bowl and was delicious. ..all kinds of kobster dishes that u could think of here.everyone we saw looked good.

ez_dCTd4D1i2xX6vqjYERg.text: Don't even waste your money on this disgusting food!! I got a lobsicle for $15 and the thing was not even 3 inches long!! Not even enough food for a child and the lobster had a funky taste to it. It left me in the end with less money, a nasty taste in my mouth and regrets that I didn't spend my money somewhere where I can actually feel full after a $15 meal. Don't do it. Run away from this place!!!!!

8v1tR_4hay0IsWHFwdiOnA.text: It was fairly pricy and the food we ordered seemed to be too cheesy or too creamy with too much mayonnaise.   We ordered the ME roll with Sriracha, fried Mac and cheese, and crab French fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RIW6rde0rMj4ibNnCrWTsA.text: My friend really wanted to do and try this place because she heard many great things about it. For the price you pay, the amount given is a bit shady. I ordered the lobster mac & chz & my friend ordered one of their lobster rolls. We took it Togo because we were tired from walking around all day and wanted to relax.   The Mac & chz was kind of bland to me with a strong lobster flavor. The more I ate it, the more I got kind of grossed out because the lobster taste overpowered everything. The mac & chz itself wasn't all that great either. It tastes like the premed Bob Evans mac & chz you buy at the grocery store that you just pop in the microwave.  My friend got the lobster roll, I forgot which one It was. The roll was literally like 3 inches long. & about 2 oz of lobster chunks. It also came with a side of chips & coleslaw (which she never received).  Overall, this place is not worth it. Save your money and go elsewhere!

isDagMZD_jsSY_23JpWVEg.text: The crab roll is better than the lobster roll.  The lobster doesn't taste fresh at all.  Overall, disappointing.  Ate here twice in one week as I was staying at Planet Hollywood for work and LobsterMe was a short and convenient walk. After an underwhelming experience on Day One, I figured I'd give it another try later in the week.  I ordered the crab roll the 2nd time around and it was "okay."  At least it didn't taste like old seafood.  The one thing I did enjoy from here was the fries. So, they've got that working in their favor, right?  Also, employees are nice so that counts for something.

l5-8m1IbJNY43kNut8KJUw.text: Very good nice place food is very delicious  Really  recommend this to if you came In to Las Vegas

NWFyKcmxkKexZoF98kyMaw.text: Fresh Lobster Roll with the best fries! Such good food find in the middle of the canal. Bravo!

mfdz_UB4r4C-x3PDQVfx4w.text: A great place to stop for a lobster roll.  On one of my many weekday business trips to Vegas, where I usually stay at Elara (formerly PH Westgate), I was searching for someplace close to get some dinner to take back to my hotel room (where yes, I would be working, picking up where I left off when I left the client office). While wandering around the Miracle Mile, I found Lobster ME and tried their Original Maine Style lobster roll to go. OMG, so filling and so good. Definitely a nice change from the sandwiches and other quick style food to go. A little pricey at $22, but luckily it came reasonably close to my per diem for dinner. =D

F7XMwoN4e6zKOEVXj1uj7w.text: I got the surf n turf philly cuz it said it's a "favorite" but it was a bit disappointing because it barely had any lobster in it. It's supposed to have lobster, crab, and steak but it turned out to be mostly steak. $16 for a steak philly and it wasn't even that good. We also got the crab fries and sadly it was too salty. The lobster bisque in a bowl was pretty good.

pXlnA5Gf6kiYGPPvF8uy-w.text: The food was DELICIOUS! The staff had an awesome attitude as well. Definitely will be eating here again

jiN0h5bAbPg4-nShokwmzg.text: The Cajun: This lobster roll was made with Cajun mayo and secret spices, and served with house chips. At first glance I was unhappy with how small the roll was, but all that seemed to go away after my first bite. The spice and flavor hits you right away and all you realize is that you just took a bite of heaven. The buttery roll just made each bite flavorful and juicy.  Lobster Cheese Fries: Fries covered in lobster bisque, then topped with lobster meat and cheese curds. The bisque wasn't as flavorful as the roll. The lobster meat was limited, and the cheese curds didn't have much taste. However, it's quite a unique dish and I'm still happy I got it. If you really want some good fries, go and get the Chowder Fries. My friend ordered them and I would definitely order that next time.

lmP43bTABsAgN3HLPp4afA.text: A friend of mine recently moved to Maine and has been torturing me via social media with constant pictures of lobster rolls. Did you know, out by Bangor, they have vending machines that sell lobster dirt-cheap that are restocked daily?! That's crazy!  Lobster ME doesn't have vending machines, but they do have lobster rolls- stick to the classic Original Maine style with a touch of mayo and spices, or dare to try the new Beltway version with Old Bay, shallots, chives, and breadcrumbs. Anything else is blasphemous.   If you're really feeling daring, add on the chowder fries and a drink for an extra $6- they're like chili cheese fries, but with chowder instead of chili, plus green onions and bacon bits. They're downright intoxicating, if you have the calories to spare.  Bonus star for quick service and 20% off local discount- it's a smallish (hot-dog sized) but meaty roll for $17, which is actually on par with pricing in other landlocked states (so minimal Strip markup?), but the discount makes it especially nice. A $20 lunch, which is pretty much the minimum for the Strip, and the quality is actually really good for a food court-style setting.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beltway lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder fries

R155gDDahdOy0lkmnp26dQ.text: Lobster!! Who doesn't love lobster?! This is my second time coming here!   I have tried the Cajun, old bay, and Maine style. They were all really good! It comes on a toast-like bread. Its super buttery and flavorful. I wish it came on a bigger bread because I felt like I was eating 2 bites of lobster and 1 bite of sandwich. I need that balance....They definitely don't skimp on the lobster since you're paying $19 for each lobster roll. But when you have that lobster craving...$19 is totally worth it! Each lobster roll comes with some cole slaw and some chips. I have also had the fries and clam chowder. I think the lobster roll is good already. The fries and the clam chowder was just a side dish that isn't all that great.  Next time I will definitely try the lobsticle (fried lobster on a stick)

XpN349rVqc4NnNovXhtmLA.text: I don't know why I thought a lobster bar in a mall would be a good choice, but this was terrible. Lobster tasted super fishy, I couldn't even finish my roll. Price is typical for a lobster joint, which means it's way too much for this crap.

rWfOFLpdeJ6LWN-7zQLehA.text: One word:  SLOOOOW!   I really like their menu and food, but I just cannot give a restaurant with good food and consistently slow service anything better than a 2-star.  I wanted to give this place more stars because I like their menu and their food was good, but it just took too long all three times I have eaten at its various locations.  During my last trip, I ordered their basic lobster roll and soup because I was in a hurry and I figured that by ordering their main items would be quicker.  Nevertheless, that didn't help.  I waited for probably 20 minutes for the food.  They could have brought the soup over early to make the wait seem shorter, but they waited and brought both items over together.  What really got me though was that the single runner they had working was busy eating his own food while about 3 other groups and I were waiting on our food.    Don't get me wrong, the food is good!  The 2 star is simply because they are 0 for 3 when it comes to service.

cetYgBMBmTPIGMbqCzBxYQ.text: I have never tried a lobster roll sandwich before so my husband and I just happen to walk by it and say keys give a try! Now we went up and looked at the menu on dashboard and whoa! It was pricy but hey it's Vegas! So we tried! The sandwich comes with cold slaw and waffle fries. The total price was $26 I believe plus tax. It wasn't a big meal to feed two people but the lobster flavors was disappointing. My husband was like "this is it? Taste like fish poop" which kinda True but wish they had thrown in stronger flavors to get rid of the fishy taste. It was an one time experience as well. Not really worth the money.

BrY7gM5-b-pzinZOcA3dlA.text: Best ever! Who needs to go to Maine when the lobster is right here in Vegas! Lobster roll. Lobster Mac n cheese. Lobster Bloody Mary. Well rounded off meal! Fabulous and great atmosphere and friendly staff!

mDv0qoIKpiKXlyMpTqJvfA.text: Don't waste any of your money on this place! It's overpriced, underseasoned, and just plain terrible.   The food looks good when you first get it. Their presentation is pretty nice, but all the food had something wrong with it.   My family and I each ordered something different and nothing came out good. The lobster bisque was too runny and flavorless. The truffle lobster roll was overwhelmed with herbs. It tasted bitter. The lobster Mac and cheese lack any flavor outside of cheese.   We all tried some of each dish and in the end, we were left with a lot of left over food. No one wanted to finish anything.   Please don't buy any of their food. This place is horrible and you'll regret it after the first bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GZS0FKp-pv5vVKQe1HTl3A.text: Good, good food. Of course it's a bit pricey. But the food is really good. I would recommend Lobster Me to anyone visiting Vegas. If you live there, lucky you, definitely visit this place. Not on a lunch break or anything though. Because the food takes a very long time before it's ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded Crab Fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ME

jd9NsQYYSbk4ZUJvMPxSyw.text: Nothing special considering this place's specialty is lobster.  I got the connecticut lobster roll ($17) since it's the only "warm" one while the other ones include chilled lobster. I also got the lobster grilled cheese. They were both pricey for the sizes but the lobster grilled cheese was actually worth $11 bucks. It was super flavorful and they packed it with all kinds of goodies. It was okay that there wasn't too much lobster inside because the grilled cheese as a whole was good. The lobster roll, meanwhile, was too bready and the lobster was meager.   The lobster bisque was pretty good but I wouldn't order it for a whole serving-it gets pretty fishy while there aren't much lobster chunks-so where does the taste come from?

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oHE0daYDD4qVFvnFR4oq3Q.text: Cali style Lobster roll is a must here! Seating is limited but worth the wait of finding a seat!

6K5RC9TU75hUn6P-_UB4jQ.text: Surprisingly good for a fast food type of place in the mall. Ordered the clam chowder and lobster roll, both were great! The roll that they use for the lobster roll was buttery which made it even better. I felt like they put a good amount of lobster in it. They had a bunch of different things on the menu that I saw after I had already ordered so the next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely be back to try more things on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

83bV1mcVdG1mL-32WsTQXg.text: Lobster ME is inside of the Miracle Mile shops across from Guess. This totally hit the spot for me!   The Connecticut lobster roll with the warm butter.... soo yum!  Also got the grilled lobster sandwich-- didn't love as much, and also not as much lobster in This dish!  Lobster bisque is better than the clam chowder! And I would prefer street elotes over the next street corn! Still a good find, especially inside a mall!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mex street corn
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese

10qmrs5lyrojBY8cMBQfJg.text: So dissapointed. I'd eaten here before and was looking forward to the same awesome exerience, but now I see they have two locations open. Well, quality has slipped A LOT. I was so anticipating my Connecticut lobster roll with warm butter. But the lobster was chewy and didn't smell completely fresh.  The fries it came with were no longer the thick-cut beauties I'd had before, which were the best french fries ever. Now they were obviously frozen waffle fries, which were served practically cold to me. To her credit, when I asked for hot ones, the gal at the counter brought some to me.  Then, there was a little cup of coleslaw with it. Absolutely the worst cole slaw I've ever experienced. ZERO flavor.  In short, a complete bust for a $25 lunch. This has killed my craving for Lobster ME completely now. I mourn its' loss.

d6a24DSdCiCIMbY3C2gERw.text: Stopped by while shopping, no wait to get our food. Staff was friendly and helpful. I ordered Connecticut Roll, clam chowder and Lobster MAC & CHEESE.   Flavoring on the lobster for the roll and Mac and cheese was good. But if I could change on thing; it would be their pasta. It's a bit too dry, hard and undercook. It takes the moist texture away from the Mac and cheese. Clam chowder was seasoned perfectly. No complaint there.   But a good quick stop for a small bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gdfMBP-Ie8odmEHTHBdgyw.text: Wow! This place has changed and gone downhill as most places tend to eventually:-( What a disappointment! I have not been here in at least 7 years or more and Lobster ME was delicious back then. I remember it like it was yesterday. The last time my hubby and I were here, I was not a seafood eater at all!!! He bought the Connecticut and dared me to take a bite so I did. And I loved it! He loved it too and the lobster rolls were fairly small so we ordered 2 more. One for me and we split the other. Yes, that's how yummy it was. Hot and fresh lobster, buttery, and on a real fresh and warmed up roll. Today it was horrible!!!! So bad that I literally had to force myself to at least eat the $24 lobster roll. First, they changed the roll to a Texas toast type of bread so that's a huge disappointment. Next disappointment was that the lobster was lukewarm to cold on the outside and totally cold on the inside of every chunk so I'm guessing they microwave the lobster now. It did not tastes buttery until the 2nd to the last bite, which upset my tastebuds and my tummy bec it was like eating all butter. The waffle fries were over cooked so I did not eat them. I use to beg Lobster ME to come to downtown Long Beach (until today)....I no longer will. And I will not be recommending them anymore. And obviously, I will not be returning here with so many other options in Vegas. Yuck!

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $34.64 and NOT worth a penny of it :-(

wFTT2cFg45T0Ma8kJ1_KoQ.text: This was pretty much as underwhelming for me as the reviews suggested that it would be. I ordered the lobsicle which was recommended to me by a fellow patron, and while it was good, it was nothing to write home about. I paid $17 and was still hungry. If you do order it, be sure to order a side if you want to feel even remotely satisfied. I wouldn't go back, but maybe I'm just spoiled since I live on the east coast where good seafood is everywhere.

ki8uTGXjJ2J-j3vQiEsJjg.text: Overrated! Seriously $30 plus dollars for one lobster roll!? Yeah I get it's a hype because it's on the strip, in a mall, and in a desert. Still don't charge me tourist prices when I am in local. That anti right. Tasty? Sure however don't be fooled. One order won't fill you up.

B2EKAy8AsEwyz3gFQ-esIw.text: Delicious lobster grilled cheese and lobster bisque! We paid $20 for the soup and sandwich which isn't too bad for the size and being on the strip inside Planet Hollywood. Will be coming here again!

i_tBepGV2-7y9HuAkEm6EQ.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I stop by. Ordered the lobsicle, and lobster bisque bowl. Service is friendly and fast.

cLlrZBbCpbFPpmrAKTtUXQ.text: Best lobster taco ever! Ate here twice , prices are reasonable and food delicious. Service was much like fast good, but a nice snack for middle of the day.

ZBg2vwZ81or7QgjOgz7eKw.text: I love this place and come every time I'm in Vegas. I love that they're inside the mall for ease while shopping, quick, and insanely delicious. I always get the lobster roll with butter sauce. Last time I got the bisque and it was beyond amazing. The rolls are always overflowing and the rolls are so soft, buttery, and delicious. It's a must for anyone that likes lobster.

iZB-FIaioB8WGOHCwkkxbQ.text: Taste - Fish taco is hard and not soft or fresh cant even take a bite without eating the whole fish piece. Surf and turf had no flavor to it.   Service - Asked for water and didn't get it, asked again they forgot, had to go up a third time to get some.  Venue - Place looks nice with a small bar area, but outside tables weren't clean and trash cans full.  Location - Inside the Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood.   Will never be back again and dont recommend the place.

7qzOv9kXOTCQJ41nH2_9Dg.text: Stopped here on a whim while at Planet Hollywood and YUM! Highly recommend the crab loaded fries. We also had the mexican corn (good), salad with crab & lobster added on (very good), and the lobster Mac and cheese (pretty good). Would definitely recommend if you want a quick bite to eat and it's pretty inexpensive for what you get! They also offer military discount :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jodmDF8zaSihs-2-S92aCQ.text: I have been to Lobster ME a couple of times and this is one of the better counter service restaurants in Planet Hollywood.   If you are looking for something quick to eat and do not want to have a sit down meal, Lobster ME is a great option. It is a bit pricey for counter service but it is The Strip and you get what you pay for. I am a definite believer of quality over quantity and this place is what I recommend if you want a quality quick bite.   I had the Lobster Bisque and the Lobster tail on a stick with clarified butter. Both are good but the Lobster on a stick with that butter was bomb! I would definitely swing by and pick up another one if I ever get hungry in PH.  Quality of over quantity people!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

4AsVnonEcuasnYjbgBeApw.text: I was expecting more from the lobster roll. First bite it was good but not amazing. The more bites I took, the lobster just tasted salty and not sweet like others lobster rolls. The lobster bisque was also very salty.   I feel like they need more mayo and seasoning in their cole slaw also. The street corn was ok kind of lacked some flavor too.   This could be because I had Cousin Maine Lobster which made my standards high for lobster rolls. So for the quality I received, the food here at lobster me was not worth the price tag.

tdiylL30TuMPa3rPMk7lpg.text: LOL, I had forgot to take pictures before my friends had already taken their bites.  Lobster me was across the street from our hotel so we grabbed a bite before heading off to EDC for the night. We got togo and the 8 minute walk didn't really effect how the food tasted.  I LOOOOVEEEEEE lobster bisque so I wanted to try that with the bread bowl but I'm just not a fan of sourdough bread but I do realize everywhere uses sourdough as their bread bowl lol. They didn't skimp on lobster in the bisque !!! Really surprised honestly being on the strip and all. The bisque was more on the saltier side for my liking but don't get me wrong, it was still really tasty. I think I'd still get it again.  I didn't get to view yelp before ordering so when seeing what the rolls looked like, I was a little surprised they looked how they looked. I'm not sure how my boyfriend and his friend got full off that but they were satisfied so I can't complain. We upgraded our side to get Mexican corn and I'm not so sure that was the best decision I made. I would settled for the waffle fries but atleast I know next time !  I'd still recommend Lobster Me if someone had a strong seafood craving (:

5YOBoY6rtNv5PsoU0UsWsw.text: If you like lobster, you will love Lobster ME! I thought I'd was great and have gone on my last 2 trips. The crab fries was fantastic and probably my favorite. The lobster Mac and cheese is really good and so is the lobster grilled cheese. Even with all the great options, near by, I could definitely see myself eating here again; it's really good!

ZPMWLJpbCSa9LnVxYtn2Bw.text: I was in Vegas so I just decided to stop by Planet Hollywood and check-out Lobster me. I ordered lobster roll where is waffle fries $24 not worth the price but the taste was good on a buttery roll. It was my first experience I wouldn't buy it again but it was good to try

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll waffle fries

VyKGOCQqmMmeOJlPvYdPSg.text: Wonderful! We ordered the Lobster Bisque, fries, and Connecticut style Lobster Roll. All were great. Food was Hot, flavorful and service was quick and friendly. Unexpected find in a mall setting.

faPxr2BVjh_8Vm2n5_9Bmw.text: Where to start with this place. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Me & my friend had taste for some seafood & we found this gem. Beware this place is pricey but what you expect for crab & lobster. We didn't care we just wanted the roll.   I ordered the 50/50 sea dawg & the lobster mac n' cheese. The 50/50 sea dawg is half crab & half lobster on a toasted garlic roll. There's 5 options in choosing the topping. I did the Cajun topping & it was fantastic. Came with some pickles & the pickles were sweet & good. The lobster mac was good too. I had alot of meat on my roll. The young lady that took my order did get me right with the meat.   This Lobster Me is in Miracle Shop in Planet Hollywood but there's other locations too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 50/50 sea dawg roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n&#39; cheese

if2-WA-S7iNb2MUBsOb8lg.text: Omg!!! This place is addictive. Im from Louisville ky and im visiting and this is my second visit in 4 days....I wiah we had this at home

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PxTp7mDxQEnk1ZogbHA6-w.text: I ordered the clam chowder today and thought that it was ok. The soup itself was good, however, the clams were way overdone...very tough. Prices are super high...nice thing about my chowder was it came in a sourdough bread bowl. Having been spoiled by the food truck in Austin called Garbo's which has the most amazing lobster rolls, I was hesitant to ruin my pure image of a True lobster roll. So, I refrained from ordering one. Nonetheless, I did get the chowder...because who can ruin a clam chowder? Well, the clams had been cooking too long. But you be the judge. After all, it's Vegas. Plenty of dining options to be had here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder

LZnlDmrl7S4pUr2COzSjQQ.text: Lobser ME is a Godsend if you're hungover and craving comfort food to soak up all the bad decisions you drank the night before while out on the town in Vegas.  I came across this place on my last Vegas trip after my friends and I had just finished eating at Earl's. The lobster ice cream sample sort of lured us in, but they didn't have any at the time, so we figured we'd try it next time we were here. So on my most recent Vegas trip this past weekend, my best friend's boyfriend suggested we try this place out.  Lobster ME is located right next to the Fat Tuesday place, so a bit towards the middle of Miracle Mile. There are tables located in front of it, but keep in mind, this area can get packed so be prepared to fight for a table.   While looking at the menu, I was pretty much drooling - lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobsticle, different kinds of lobster rolls, and more. No joke, the lobster mac and cheese was pretty much calling out my name and saying "eat me nowwwwwww." Couldn't pass that up. I ended up ordering that, along with a side order of tater tots (if you've read my other reviews, you'd know that I loveeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee tater tots) and a drink. My total came out to be $17.   My meal came out about 10 minutes or so later, freshly made, steaming with goodness. The bowl of mac and cheese itself doesn't look like much, since you pay the price of $10, but seeing that it is made with lobster, it's somewhat understandable. The mac and cheese was a bit bland in my opinion - like they should have added more milk or something to it since it tasted a bit watered down. The lobster was good though! No doubt about it. And since I was pretty much starving, I didn't really mind TOO much that it was a bit bland. Tater tots were awesomeeee. Crispy and hot - just the way I like them.   Service was okay I guess. I mean, you just order and they call you up when your order is ready. Prices are a bit much, but it IS lobster. I was already expecting the prices to be around that much anyways. Overall, I'd give this place 3.5 stars. I probably would come back and try something else. I honestly would have ordered a lot, but I was saving my money for more debauchery.

qSeCG0L5GtGjRCe-8CWMGw.text: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE their lobster rolls!!  So fresh and very flavorful!! The customer service was awesome and service was very fast.

XK0wVM4qDVWHtxiR9QaawA.text: Stopped here before Britney Spears show and had the lobster Mac and cheese and the Maine lobster roll.  The Mac and cheese is phenomenol.   The roll had a few mealy pieces of lobster but overall very good and generous portion.  We are excited they are opening a spot in San Francisco!

J9El_R9HweUA6rcAC5IIUw.text: Really good. My boyfriend has been wanting to go here for awhile now and every time he's in town we run out of time, glad we finally made it because the food is delicious. I had the Connecticut combo and fries, worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the Connecticut combo and my boyfriend had shrimp tacos and a lobster salad. All of this was $60.

aKknEulNKfYB8nJQUvu35Q.text: Well worth it! got the Cajun roll and lobster melt it was bomb diggity...girl even took my wet money with a smile

E0Deue8o0FHFnHWkWJ6fQw.text: Lobster was definitely fresh as I actually got a small piece of shell in my roll. The Connecticut (warm lobster with butter) was very good. The roll however was haphazardly made and the filling was already spilling out of the bun when I got it. The portions are very small for the price (almost $20 with tax) - possibly the smallest lobster roll I've gotten. Yes size does matter in this case. The chips were ok - not very fresh and too crunchy  Overall ok place to grab a quick bite if you're really craving an overpriced lobster roll

6qIm3xb4sOYcAQ7sQBeTPg.text: it is a high price fast food place. i got the lobster roll for 16 bucks and add 4 dollars for a drink and lobster bisque. the lobster roll was crisp bun and warm which is how i like it. they used one whole lobster for this lobster roll. the diablo habenero sauce in this roll really kicked it up and the slaw inside gave the whole roll witha different texture in each bite. i do recommend this place. the lobster tacos which i got for 16 bucks was not good. the tortilla was cold and was not hot.it was kinda dry too. although the ingredients inside the lobster tacos were very fresh light crisp good with the squeezed of lime wedge. and the salsa picante. i did spend like 42 bucks for 2 lobster tacos and one lobster roll and one lobster bisque and a soda for 2 and it wasnt too filling where we couldnt move. its a light dinner but good experience to try if you never tried this place. most likely i wont come back for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster roll for 17 bucks and add 4 bucks for 20 oz drink and lobster bisque
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobster tacos for 16 bucks not so good deal. tortilla  was cold and dry

8hU6GmeZ0sLL2-nyCxc-Mw.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas. It's a must come to spot for me Everytime I come. Yes it may be a little expensive but it's lobster. Want a cheap meal mcDonalds is close by. Get the Connecticut and some lobsticles.  Only suggestion would be that we really wish they sold shirts. We would buy a couple in a heartbeat. Rock on

tbCUaRIpC2bWmGOxw4OSgw.text: We were in town for 3 days and ate here 3 different times.  Ordered the lobster salad for me and a plain Mac n cheese for my 2 year old.  Both were delicious!  The girls working the front were very helpful and friendly.  The only thing is that the salad I ordered wasn't as big as I thought it should be for $14.  I do have to say that the salad was VERY fresh!  I'm usually skeptical about getting take out salads and ending up with old and wilted lettuce, but the lettuce was very crisp and had no signs of just sitting around in the back somewhere.  The lobster was great, too!  The lobscicles... Absolutely fabulous!  Seriously, my mouth is watering just writing about them!  I'll definitely stop by here next time I go to Vegas and want a quick bite!

0FVNWloGcCJvtKuVOuBfOg.text: I love lobster rolls, and my friend recommended the Cajun lobster roll at Lobster Me when I told him I was going to go to Las Vegas over the weekend.   While walking around the mall in Planet Hollywood, we decided to pop by Lobster Me and try out the Cajun lobster roll. We got a combo with French fries and a drink.   The lobster roll was only okay -- the bun was toasted, which was good, and there wasn't too much mayonnaise but there was a heavy dusting of some Cajun spices and scallions on top of the lobster roll. The meat went from very bland to overspiced from all the spices in two different bites. It was weird.   The fries were also only okay, but nothing to write home about.   The drink machine ran out of ice, which happens, but it didn't improve my impressions of this place, because we desperately needed something cool to drink after inhaling all the spices on our lobster roll.   I'm not sure if we'll have the Cajun roll again, but I wouldn't be averse to trying some other items on the menu.  TIP: Free samples of lobster ice cream?? I didn't get any, since they were closing up, but maybe...

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll and fries!

D9db59IBCAtORn1GA4sHqA.text: I checked this place out the last time I was out in Las Vegas with high hopes that it would be similar to Luke's Lobster on the east coast.  Unfortunately, I must have ordered the wrong thing because their basic lobster roll was just not up to par.  The split roll contained lots of lobster meat piled high but the flavor was just salt water from frozen lobster meat being quickly dethawed.  The lobster roll didn't taste fresh and didn't justify the price.  I may have to check out the lobster fries and the lobster on a stick the next time I'm around, but if you are ever on the east coast, try Luke's Lobster - they do lobster rolls right!

uHJkXZNbVr96tGOc-Lwc1A.text: Got the Connecticut. Smaller than what I expected. Tasteful but not worth $17. If I was really craving lobster and this was around, I would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Connecticut

muGrG6NXPkHLG2Tn8K7ijg.text: Decent food with high prices (even high for Vegas).  Lobster Me was known for their lobster ice cream.  They don't have it anymore.  They are also known for their lobster rolls.  The lobster was a decent portion but it wasn't sweet nor was it very tasty.  There is almost no seating and the little seating there is, you have to battle the "Bro's" that are at Fat Tuesday.    I'd give it more stars if it weren't so darn expensive.  I mean it wasn't BAD, it just wasn't really good and worth the price.

Rrfr_txaH91OzgBbMnolCQ.text: Honestly-   I tried this place last year and haven't shut up about it since.  Was in Vegas last weekend for my birthday and, not gonna lie, totally ate here twice within 24 hours, haha.  I was saving the lobster mac and cheese for my actual birthday, but I had to eat something the night before and since I was staying at the Elara (which is attached) I thought, "Well, I can have the lobster grilled cheese instead, so it's totally not cheating." The lady serving was super nice and we chatted for a couple of minutes, then my order was ready so I grabbed the container and headed up to my room to get ready for Chippendales (if you haven't been, GO.)  I sprawl all of my crap all over my room and jump up on the bed and open the container- IT WAS LOBSTER EFFING MAC AND CHEESE BY MISTAKE.  Best. Mistake. Ever. I wasn't even mad- trust.  I inhaled it. And then I went back and got it again the next day on my actual birthday and inhaled it all over again.  No regrets.  It's a little bit pricey - $13 or $14+ per entre, but DAMN, I'm still thinking about it. None of the others I have tried have even compared, honestly.  Thank you thank you thank you.

II5pn024kEyiuRCwPqxHBA.text: I don't know anything about the other items but avoid the lobster cheese fries! They don't give you a lot for $14. The fries were disappointing, the lobsters were disappointing and even the presentation was disappointed. I immediately regretted this. just trust me don't try this!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster cheese fries. Disappointing!!

n7R19WDEQZGTOR2vcsOKJg.text: I'm writing a review after a second visit to this location.   My first visit to this spot was quite some time ago and I absolutely fell in love with the MAINE roll. Soft rolls and a heaping serving of shredded lobster and a large chunk of a whole single claw I believe. I also ordered the lobster bisque which was to-die-for. Creamy and warm and not too spicy.  My last visit to this spot was just the other day to meet a family member. So I ordered the Maine Roll once again. My boyfriend ordered the Lobster and Chips. We got our order and were SO DISAPPOINTED! I'd received a sad little sandwich. The meat was at least filling. BUT, I advise my average meals are child-size servings, so this was okay for ME but definitely not for the average person. The food was good but I honestly was still starving. My boyfriend Lobster and Chips WERE PATHETIC. I'd never seen a serving of fries look this sad. It looked like they threw 10 fries into the box and maybe 4 SMALL pieces of lobster tots. SUCH a waste of money. I've seen tapas plates more plentiful than this.  Overall, I will NEVER re-order again. The food was good but I spent $32 on 2 items and was not satisfied. I am always willing to spend on quality over quantity, but these items did not make rank.

4AUjLQMVWI_HdOXTUrIRQQ.text: I was excited to try this... and quite disappointed to say the least.  False advertisement of saying that this place had the "best" lobster rolls. I should of known... self-compliment is never good. Lobster Me, you are far from being the best, so stop saying you are!   My friend and I got the Maine Lobster Roll and the Cajun Lobster Roll. Split it so we could taste both flavors. Unanimous decision that the Cajun tasted better since it was more flavorful.  Everything about the roll was just meh to okay. Also, the rolls were really greasy, enough to be cringe worthy. I hate the feeling of excess grease on my finger tips, gahhh. I took a gamble and I guess I lost --this place is not worthy of your dollars my friend, on to the next.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll, looks better than it tastes lol

TJRqtGtpYOxJKPBUcDEpkQ.text: This place will satisfy the need if you're absolutely craving lobster, however for the price I can't justify the purchase or a return visit. It's 19 dollars for what seems like a 5 inch roll which is basically lobster in toasted bread.   Most people will want a combo which will tack on another $4 which includes a small drink and a side of vinegar fries. That brings the total to about $25.00 for a standard meal. Now I know this is lobster and the location is on the strip, but for the portion and amount of flavor you are getting your money is better spent at a sit down.  On our visit we sprung for the Connecticut roll which is supposed to be buttered version of the standard roll however I could hardly tell the difference. After what seemed like 3 bites we were finished with our rolls and still had an appetite which is quite disappointing so we shared a lobsicle ($15).   It may be because it was deep fried and piping hot but this is the one thing I would recommend if you HAVE to eat here. It has some flavor and the temperature keeps the meat soft. Again, the portion is small but I'm assuming the reason you're here is because you're craving lobster right?  The overall establishment is clean, very casual, the staff members were very polite. The seating area is pretty much like a food court so you're sharing seating with Fat Tuesday customers. We went on a Saturday and there was plenty of seating available so that shouldn't be an issue.

tnN_-fd0uF8N6-KcUJB0gQ.text: Yay, I finally get to cross "Lobster Me" off my list of spots to try on the strip! It's located conveniently next door to Fat Tuesdays, so this could be a good place to grab a bite before those icey dranks. The Seafarer Lobster Roll (yelp.com/biz_photos/lobs...) caught my eye because it had some veggies mixed in with the lobster. (Lobster and seafood salad with mayo, cucumber, celery and green onion). I like how the roll is buttered and toasted, but I wish there was more lobster in the roll! I was expecting big chunks of lobster but instead got minced pieces of lobster. I'll definitely get a bigger roll next and share a few items with some friends. Altogether, it was alright-- not sure if i will ever be craving this though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lobsta roll

a53HAqwhDAmLsubZCmFCxQ.text: I bought the miso lobster roll and the beltway lobster roll for my parents to try. This was their first ever lobster roll, and it kind of blew their minds! They couldn't stop raving about it and how something like this could exist for so long without them knowing about it. Brought total joy to my heart to see them munching away happily on this. They liked the toasty, but soft in the middle, buttered bread, and the generous amounts of lobster meat in the center. It's not cheap -- about $18 per roll with a side of chips and cole slaw, but honestly you could probably find a lot of places charging this much for a regular sandwich WITHOUT lobster. Will definitely come back here when we take another family trip! Total hit with the fam!

16_WaqiTvcLPxzPY26C5Vw.text: Came for the first time for international lobster day today and it will be the last. Quality was not necessarily bad but cashier was slow and not paying attention. I ordered a roll plus soup and drink. When she asked my order, I said, Cajun with bisque and Dr pepper. I had to repeat myself 3 times and it wasn't because I wasn't clear or loud enough. Not to mention that only 2 customers in front of me took an agonizingly long time to stand in line while people are weaving in and out around me. Annoying and then to have the cashier not even able to take an order. Then the roll was only about 3 bites. Half of it was bread. For $25, I could've sat down at a restaurant. Soda had so much ice that a few long sips and it was gone. Soup is advertised being in a bread bowl but upon getting my soup, I asked and the girl said they changed the menu just today. Lucky me. Not really. Quality was ok but portion ratio to price was ridiculous and added that employees are not the brightest bulb on the tree, will not be back.  I also found out that being a local, I'm supposed to get 20% off plus I checked in and I'm supposed to get free combo upgrade. I believe that's what the hold up was with the guy in front. They didn't know how to use the yelp coupon which seems to me to be an easy cop out because so many places do the same thing.   Ugh...nothing worse than being over charged for poor service and small portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $25 and slow service? No thanks. I&#39;ll pass.

wwh8lT2C-OPDGjjF5jdlVQ.text: Definitely hit the spot, if you like lobsters as much as I do. This is the place to go to end your lobster craving!  Between my cousin and I, we ordered Lobster & Chips, Lobster Roll, Lobsicle, Lobster Bloody Mary and Lobster Waffle. Yes, we went all out and pig out!  Definitely filling, better come with an empty stomach!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle butter dripping
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bloody Mary

p-p80JW8uJXcHO8yBivxhA.text: Hubby found this place on Yelp and suggested we check it out as we both love lobster. Finally found it in the mall... kind of food court style. Ordered the lobster and chips... 4oz grilled lobster was delicious... chips were cold and greasy. Hubby ordered the lobster melt... said it was great. Yelp offer of free bisque with the melt was expired but they honored it anyway... classy... except they were out of bisque so we go Clam chowder for free. Clam chowder was ok. Old fashioned lemonade was delicious. Over all, under whelming. Probably won't be back but giving high score for the honoring of the Yelp deal.

2BhQqAMujD5tsjaEHqmR3A.text: Wanted a quick bite to eat, so stopped by for a lobster roll. Seeing numerous places have these just decided to try it since it was next to Fat Tuesday. Ordered the Cajun Lobster roll. Came with fries. The lobster roll itself came with lobster meat, with cajun mayo and spices. It was better than expected, very good for the first lobster roll I had ever had. But Still just giving it 3 stars, since the price was so high. Not sure if it was because of the lobster, but still expensive to me for a quick bite, roughly $20 for my combo. Try it if you have never had it before though, really good! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Lobster Roll with Fries

ubtvPuxKw6jnUUxTdtVX1Q.text: Excellent fast service. The chowder fries were to die for! Only for stars because it was a 28 dollar lunch for 1 person, but then again this is Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zsdEoNmYxvVqhK6M_fo3Lg.text: I'd come back for the grilled cheese and lobster bisque. You can also sample the lobster ice cream which surprisingly works.

HvkQeiG3VrltUFifd5wSaQ.text: Came on a Monday for lunch! There was 1 couple in line in front me , not busy at all. The cashier was super friendly, I had a couple of questions and he didn't hesitate to answer - well no one was behind me in line. Last night, I searched Yelp for a good lunch spot here at Planet Hollywood and I swear I went to bed craving their Bloody Mary, Lobster Mac n Cheese and of course their famous Maine Lobster Roll ! Bloody Mary isn't on the menu but you just gotta ask , I got it a tiny bit spicy and it's perfect! Currently grubbing right now - and everything is amazing ! I wish I had gotten their Lobster Bisque to dip my roll in, but it's hot outside and I'm about to layout poolside . There are a bunch of mixed reviews about this place, and I don't get it. Unfortunately, there aren't any Tater Tots anymore. The quality of the lobster is great! I'm getting full off the Lobster Mac N Cheese, it's really delicious. The Lobster on the roll isn't frozen at all, kinda warm, but I like my seafood a bit on the colder side anyway. Kinda still hungover from this weekend , but that doesn't take away from the fact that this place is bomb! sober or not! Next time I come , I'm gonna have their Chowder Fries and Lobster Bisque with my Crab Roll. I love crab more than lobster - but I'd rather spend that money on a dinner buffet and get endless legs! I love seafood, and I had high expectations coming here for lunch - and they were all met! Delicious food! And extremely delicious Bloody Mary, which I'm saving and bringing with me to the pool! I paid $50.83 for these 3 items , but what do u expect to pay in Vegas for seafood?!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From left to right: Lobster Mac n Cheese, Maine Lobster Roll with coleslaw and pickle, and Bloody Mary

DtSR-WAb1XwIkJ3xZ3eKaw.text: I ordered the Lobster Rolls, Connecticut style with a side of clam chowder. The lobster is surprisedly fresh and the bread taste like it's been dipped into a big pot of sweet butter, yummy!! Clam chowder is puuuurfect for me because it is not salty. For those that may need more taste there's salt and pepper packet you can add in your soup. The drinks are refillable. Seats are very limited so prepare to stand to eat or bring it home.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh lobster!

u33ej2ksVpi5CWLjOh3T-g.text: Lobster rolls in Vegas, who would've thunk it?!?  I have actually been to this place 2x (I know 1 review for 2 visits = yelp suicide) but sorry it's been lost in my que for a while now..  I digress...  This place is one of the better quick dining options in the Miracle Mile. I hate to call this place fast food but it does Flt the category for a quick lunch.  I have done both the original an Cajun rolls here. My personal favorite is the Cajun. It is just the right amount of spice yin to the sweet lobster meats yang! The original is your basic lobster roll: chilled lobster meat tossed in secret sauce.   There is a third version on the menu that i am too much of a coward try; it goes by the name of diablo. Call me silly but I want to enjoy the lobster roll and not have it blowtorch my tongue while I'm eating it.   Lobster rolls are one of my favorite sandwiches but there are not many places in town that do them. So being that said I get my fix here..

S6i_WFQ87S4uSW8lvERHFg.text: I was in Las Vegas to visit my daughter on 12/17/17 and really really really wanted to try Lobster Me. First problem is location, you guys should let customer know that this restaurant is located inside the mall. I drove around for an entire hour looking for a building not a spot in the mall. my second issue was my lobster roll, the lobster had no taste at all, not buttery, no salt just meat on a roll. the Lobster Popsicle was great. mac and cheese balls didn't have a lobster crumb in them. Thanks for the experience. I might try them again if they open a store outside the mall.

dRgEvylWf2npfNbVEtucvA.text: Uhhh hello! AMAZING. I always want to try something new but I can't resist The buttery toast bread with the flavorful lobster meat. I've heard of people getting skimped on their meat but mine is always overflowing ! They're salted chips and fries are always a nice side too, oh and they give you Cole slaw.   Always get lost in the mall trying to find this place but it's a tradition every time I go to Vegas.

A2Zu9t6L4iyd03_92ISrfQ.text: THIS PLACE IS SO DANK! I just finished my Cajun lobster roll and I'm so sad it's gone. Totally worth 18$. Lobster fries was delicious as was the lobster mac and cheese. They don't cheat you out of lobster either!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun lobster roll

rKuLcPt7GESienEQ4_Lbag.text: Had the cajun roll.  The flavor was delicious but I have to give it three stars due to the value.  Yes, I know lobster is expensive but... $25 for a small sandwich, fries and a drink was too much for me to want to come back.  Definitely glad to have a taste though and if you don't mind shelling out the funds!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder fries were tasty.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great flavor!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The roll was in my opinion nothing more than a slice of Texas toast folded in 1/2 with a dainty amount of lobster.

gZvPbiGdt3B5F2o4zCRU2w.text: so when I first heard about this place I was actually expecting a sit down restaurant by the sounds of it. Well surprise surprise, it was a quick little place in the mall. Of course it looked awesome. So I ultimately had the lobster fries and both kinds of rolls. Now before you think I had them at once, I actually went to have them on 3 separate occasions while I was on my trip!!!!!  Do I need to say more if it was that worthy?! Anywho, the lobster fries were out of this world especially after I squeezed some lemon on those puppies. And the lobster rolls with some mayo packets was TO DIE FOR ... Sadly this post has only left me craving it all over again and I'm a few thousand miles away...*sigh*

kqX7JrRLDSVAOeLTOeV8Rg.text: We can all agree that lobster rolls are always on the pricy side. There are at least 15 bucks for a small roll. If we are lucky and sweet enough, the staff stack the warm roll with a lot of huge chunks of claw meat. Lobster Me was perfect lunch portion for someone that is not super hungry, but I-should-eat-before-I-go-to-dayclub-because I-woke-up-late-for-lunch/I-am -hung-over/I-cannot-not-do a-buffet-because-I-will-not-make-my-moneys-worth. That totally describes someone I don't know at all.   The sandwich was on a warm toast, with room temperature lobster... which is a good thing. I didn't want it chilled. I got the original which was topped off with curry seasoning. I wished the cut their lemons a different way so that more juice comes out. The lemon makes a difference! It makes the sandwich a little lighter since of course the bun us smothered in butter.   The roll came with a side of cole slaw and home-made chips, which were also yummy with a squeeze of lemon. Ask for two wedges!

UilLJO33egzaD9NJAUKazw.text: Ordered the lobster mac and cheese and was very disappointed. The pasta was tasteless and starchy, and the lobster part was a joke. They included a few sad pieces of the very tip of a lobster claw, the part you usually don't eat when you get a whole lobster. On top of that the portion was small.  Waste of money.

KDAxiC49moBPlk8b1e9RYg.text: I'm giving Lobster me 2 stars because although the customer service was good the $14 Endless summer salad was the worse salad I've had. There isn't very many healthy choices on the menu and the one thing that's the healthiest lacked taste from the dressing to the ingredients. I'm very disappointed that I had to pay $14 for it. Can you please use another recipe? I guess I was paying for the lobster!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Endless summer salad that was very disappointing!

BAXvUAJNLQ_DzNzEUW6GDw.text: I LOVE Lobster rolls and these are THE BEST in town . Blows Luke's out of the water . You really get a lot of meaty lobster perfectly cooked and seasoned . For me it's a great deal and an equally great lunch!!

go4A6tb-PT-TcUtGq1HZBg.text: I've had Lobster Mac and Cheese twice in my life and this was definitely better of the 2. Located in the Miracle Mile of Planet Hollywood it turned out pretty convenient from where we were staying to bring back to our hotel. It was also reasonably priced at $13 for the entree item, I was feeling so full from eating out all weekend I didn't want to order any side items. I'd definitely come back and try something else here though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese

ZkW7T26i8tMnYN6Do5e24A.text: Great food . Great customer service . I will be back ! My favorite part was the crushed ice and the speedy service ! I will be back when I am in town !

2XJzeaFbZnYwKWQBCThVSQ.text: I only had their lobster roll and cajun garlic fries. Some other people had received their food before us and were complaining that their bread was cold. As soon as our bread arrived I touched it and it was cold. We sent it back and got it toasted a little longer.   Overall not bad, if you've never had lobster roll in Boston before. But I've been spoiled. You get a lot of lobster but it just isn't the same. It's better than the lobster rolls in LA but definitely does not compare to Boston.   Sorry Vegas, I guess this is one of the few food items you can't replicate.   The cajun garlic fries were good. :) But not enough garlic. :(

6_IaqATuPTiAC7kQmQeE9g.text: I had the lobster grilled cheese sandwich. It was pretty good, but it would be better if they spread the cheese and lobster out to the edges of the sandwich too. Towards the center of the sandwich it felt too cheesy. Even it out please! Clam chowder fries were delicious! Yum!

AoT8BSJs5DIG5HMBjKE7bw.text: Overpriced! And it looks nothing like the picture on their screen. My friends and I all ordered the lobster mac and cheese. It tasted pretty decent but the portion was small and we got sick of the Mac and cheese taste pretty quickly so we needed to go to chipotle afterwards to satisfy our appetite :(

mAT9qhvbfLbXCepIh5d9UQ.text: Great place to visit if you love lobster. The lobsicle is the best. It's lightly breaded on a stick served with lemon and butter right next to Fat Tuesday

IX_tu4b4_UyGnVpECUys8g.text: Within a month, I go to Vegas twice. And within these two times, I go to Lobster Me every time. It's like the place to go for a quick lobster fix. For the price, you get your lobster's worth!   First time I went with my bf and a couple friends. My bf orders the Lobsticle (Fried whole lobster tail). It was GOOD. Like, straight up lobster. Especially with the butter, oh man... As for myself, I order the Lobster and chips. It's basically similar to the Lobsticle except smaller pieces. One thing I really enjoyed with both the order was the batter. It was really fresh and wasn't too greasy.   My second experience was my 3rd day before EDC. I order the Lobster salad because I was craving something fresh and light. I think I made an excellent choice. The lobster and salad worked really well together. On the other hand, my bf orders the Lobster Grilled Cheese. Although I did not take a bite out of his, according to him, he was full after the first half of the sandwich. He was also pretty sick of the taste (too cheesy especially with lobster together). My other friend orders the Lobster and Shrimp Ceviche. The ceviche was pretty small, but for the chips they gave a lot ...   In conclusion: I really like this place. I was not expecting an actual lobster place in the mall of Planet Hollywood. The price isn't bad considering it's Vegas. The amount of lobster they gave you is enough to compensate for the price. Also, props for this place being right next to Fat Tuesday. I will come here again and again every time I'm at Vegas :) ***Sunday special: Bloody Mary $2 for any Lobster purchase. Bf says it was one of the best Bloody Mary he's had.

oAFZjM8jvoafdrnp7Otigw.text: The place was a real treat. They had so many interesting choices on the menu. I had the Cajun roll. Lobster was well cooked and the bread was tasty as well. The lady was even nice to offer another refill on my lemonade when she saw mine was all finished.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ayMSF_DRWJg0PsEgHzBqjw.text: Not even close. Being a lobster lover and had many rolls in Maine these lobster rolls are not even close. Very dry with a thick roll and not much lobster.  At $25 you would expect the best ever. The lobster Mac n cheese was very good.

SZk1HnI9u5Z_F2ly7_dT_A.text: I tried the lobsicle with the lobster deep fried (the other option was to have the lobster grilled) and it was great!  Juicy, tender and flavorful.  Unfortunately Im leaving Vegas today so I'll have to get lunch here the next time I return

k4c5Mn-m17eUzT5ZsiOXiw.text: It was a mistake coming to this joint in the miracle mile. The menu looked good, it was a little bit on the pricey side, but I figure it's lobster...   Ordered the clam chowder soup, felt like it was can soup....  Ordered the lobster sub from the menu, but it's very disappointing... it was overpriced for it's small size... with the abundant choices in las vegas, I made the terrible mistake on choosing probably one of the worst "pricey" joint. the food is definitely not worth the price. will not return.. :(

8G5SpjLG949bcWu6HduMyA.text: I've never had an authentic Boston Lobster Roll, but this lobster sandwich they had was amazing!  large pieces of lobster.  I am very tempted to stop by the planet hollywood casino everytime I am in vegas JUST to go to this place!  Taste: 5 stars  Service: 5 stars  fast, friendly  cost: 3.5 stars $25 ish dollars for a lobster sandwich.  not a great price, but I guess it's not a bad one either

MR49-w1vQacWd8DOk57wLg.text: I love lobster, so I thought the menu was fun. They have a variety of lobster food items, which you don't really see around much at a other places.  I tried the Cajun Lobster Roll, and although I expected it to be a little better, it was still good.  It was the first lobster roll I've ever tried and the most expensive sandwich I've ever tried, priced at about $19...but it is Vegas...

4TFOBhvFyBoZmPWMYj4MRw.text: Mmmmm LOBSTER grilled cheese!!! I am in lobster heaven right now ! The best part is that its right next to FAT TUESDAYS ....who doesn't like lobster and a frozen margaritas! DELICIOUS !

fNugCn9X2Sg1cAfHFYZvaw.text: this place is yummy!  I've been craving a lobster roll ever since moving west from the east coast and the lobster roll here is delicious!  Their lobster mac n cheese is also VERY good. Their cajun garlic fries are soooo good and just the right amount of crispy.  Relatively expensive, but then again, it's Vegas and it's lobster.

X_DIgHy2xZS5dqGzRP231g.text: Tried someone's the lobster mac&cheese... Too little lobster, noodles swimming in cheese and grease.  Bought a lobster grilled cheese... Way too much cream cheese and again too little lobster for the price.  Overall, it's not the best but it'll do.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese

0UuBP4JbTlH8_UPccoGtpQ.text: The lobster & chips was magically delicious.  I'm usually the person to ask for extra butter to drown my lobster in but there was no need here. The lobster was lightly breaded and perfectly tender. It was amazing amazing amazing. I'm kind of a fry snob but I loved the fries also.  Have a feeling I'll be eating here on my birthday because I'm also addicted to lobster.  Eat here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster &amp; Chips

E3cod8BzPW-ATEIOFtvS_w.text: Located inside Miracle Mile, Lobster Me was a pit stop that was really interesting to try. The advertising for a free sample of lobster ice cream was very enticing also. Here we go:  Location: Such a good spot next to Fat Tuesday and right inside Miracle Mile. You can't miss it. There are lots of tables in front of the shop so you can sit there and eat or take it to-go.  Food: Had the lobster grilled cheese. It was pretty good and was pretty packed with lobster, but the only downside was that it was pricey. It's expected though because it's, well, lobster. And, couldn't resist the lobster ice cream sample.. free is always awesome (: The ice cream just tasted like vanilla ice cream though.

es_nhuKVyvh93f6BAalPtg.text: The roll is like a Texas toast it's not very big. There is not a lot of lobster for the price you pay.

zQ-5BGBjxAXqFXLsL_DTAQ.text: Walking through the Miracle Mile Shops and found this spot next to Fat Tuesday.  A win win!!  We had dinner reservations but had to try them out so we shared an Old Bay Lobster Roll, Cajun Fries and Clam Chowder.  Wished the roll was a bit bigger but it was yummy.  Fries were perfectly cooked and the chowder was great too!  Definitely will come back.

vP03uQ1FgFldPzsVfU3ODA.text: I wasn't hungry.  Not at all.  I had just eaten at a buffet.  But I had to have a lobster roll... at all costs.  I stood in line and waited to order.  It's right next to the place that serves up the obnoxiously large purple plastic yard glass of alcohol slushy.  You know the drink I'm talking about?  You have to have a lanyard around your neck to hold it because it's too big and they drink out of a fat plastic straw that is never the same color as the plastic yard glass.  Well, we had to stand next to that lot of half-drunk, half-hopped-up on a sugar-high crowd.  I ordered The Cajun lobster roll and I sat down to wait some more.  By the time I got my food, I was hungry again.  The lobster roll was good, but there's some kind of optical illusion going on where there's not as much lobster goodness as it looks. The lobster roll is mostly the bun that is split open at the top, but isn't open enough for the lobster goodness to be inside the bun.  So the lobster goodness just sits on top of the bun.  So you think you have this deep bun full of lobster goodness, when really you better watch how you're holding that bun otherwise your lobster goodness is going to fall on the floor.  As I had seen some on the floor already.  The seating could be nicer.  They need to send someone out from around the counter every once in a while to clean up the tables and the floor.  Someone's gonna slip on some lobster goodness.

lBj1hxjEBls_YhQIADWhzw.text: A lot of what I liked about this place was the name.  So, well done.  The food varied a fair amount:  - The Diablo - Lobster roll with marinara sauce.  This was pretty good.  The sauce had some kick and it had big, meaty chunks of lobster.  It's very buttery and basically is a sandwich made with garlic bread.  - Lobster Mac n Cheese.  This was okay.  There wasn't much lobster on it, and it was a little bland.  - Lobster Ceviche.  I'm sorry, I thought this was terrible.  The ceviche had no flavor at all; it was thoroughly bland.  I literally tried one little piece and then didn't touch it the rest of the meal.  In the end, it's kind of a fun idea, and is conveniently located by Fat Tuesday's, so it's an easy place to stop for a snack and a frosty beverage if you're wandering through the mall.  But, I would not seek it out on my own.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac n cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ceviche
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. El Diablo

vQFv9EDFri_M417gMZTYRA.text: I had dinner here while on a business trip to Vegas. I picked it because I love lobster and a fast casual lobster restaurant sounded perfect after a long day.  I ordered their classic lobster roll, which was $17 including chips and cole slaw. Expensive by New England standards, but hey, it's Vegas and lobsters don't exactly grow on trees around here. :-)  The sandwich was very tasty, albeit a bit on the small side, again by New England standards, but it was adequate for a meal. The lobster was sweet and tender, and there was quite a lot of meat and just the right amount of seasoning. The chips tasted home made, as did the slaw. Service was fast.  I didn't try the lobsicle, which is one of their featured items (think lobster tail on a stick that you dip in butter) but some people sitting next to me ordered one and it looked yummy. Be aware, however, that it's a really little lobster tail...like 2 or 3 ounces tops.   All in all, Lobster ME delivered a very tasty, above average fast casual meal. Definitely give it a try if you're hankering for lobster and don't want to spend $50++ for it at a fine dining establishment.

nKb4OJKm5JPSA60UNSKKIw.text: XL lobster roll 23 bucks! It didnt taste fresh ( Frozen), and had to much Mayo.   Although I really did like the Hot dog roll that was drenched in Butter and toasted to Perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of the XL Lobster Roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half- Lobster Roll- Inside the Sandwich

Z70Ium18KU7JQ65cxVxylQ.text: Overpriced? Yeah...but it was good and most of Vegas is overpriced.   Recommend  Bucket of import beers Cajun season fries

CrjquA5MTS-BHXZ9N2S7oA.text: My first lobster roll was at this location. I ate one of their rich and buttery sandwiches and I was hooked. They left me on a quest to discover other places that may be serving these decadent sandwiches.  About a pound of lobster goes into each roll and yes, the prices can be daunting for some. A meal is easily $45+ for 2, but it's so worth it IMO.   Look out for coupons if you are staying in surrounding hotels or coupon books u can pick up at the Miracle Miles guest services.  The venetian location had a 20 or 25% off a sandwich and the coupon at Miracle miles included a 16 oz beer with the purchase of a lobster roll ;)

lgw855fRu2YkcbnN-iHx8Q.text: Stopped by again today to have brunch and a lobster Mary!! The food (all) is so darn fresh and delicious  Never fails and service with a smile every time!  Prices are great for fresh lobster on the Las Vegas strip!! We'll be back again and again!!!!

igCj4_td7nPIulK-441vVw.text: Lobster Mac N Cheese and a Lobster Grilled Cheese! Quick Easy and Fantastic!! this hidden little gem inside the Miracle Mile Shops in the Planet Hollywood is just that, a hidden gem.

hrlLg6AO9n3GT02ljlfOgg.text: Lobster in casino shops equal a great snack and tourist stop.  Lobster me is located in the planet hollywood casino million mile mall. A great little shop in one of the center spots. Quick service is always great when entertaining with little ones. Lobster tots n fries is a good value and big portion for two to snack on when walking the "mile". If you have more time order the bisque in a breadbowl or the lobster mac for a good heaping lobster portion. Will be back.

SIyxQb5nH9K1NAvuLdrbTQ.text: This place is located inside the Planet Hollywood Hotel/Casino in the mall area. I saw it last time i was there so this time decided to try it ok for one it's lobster so prices are going to on the expensive side. I opted for the maine lobster roll combo which is the lobster roll, fries and a drink total came out to about 21 bucks for the small size the larger size was like 25 bucks not including the combo I got the small which was 17 w/o the combo which is not worth it in my opinion but again it's lobster lol next time i'll try the lobster mac & cheese or the lobster bisque bread bowl those prices were a little better. Oh they also were advertising lobster ice cream but i didnt want to try it even though it was ice cream lol.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9kBDR1R7deEwc0xouWUawg.text: Ermagherd so delicious lobster mac and cheese and Cajun fries. Yes a bit pricey but hey you're in vegas. If you like that fishy taste, lobster, cheese, you're in the right place!  Portions are small so savor the bites :)
