hZsqVUCFlA5bvOvCUnP52A.text: First time having Lobster Me was in April of 2016 while staying at PH. Indulged in the Lobster Bloody Mary two days in a row. Sure it's a little pricey but it was worth it. They were strong (they use Smirnoff, though) and tasty and the woman working there gave us both large claws each time.   Was just there with a bigger group that I dragged along. We wanted the Bloody Mary's (obviously) and figured we would give the food a try. In total we ordered the lobster mac and cheese, lobster roll, and chicken fingers and fries (I know but I wasn't in a Lobster mood). The mac and cheese was tasty but a small portion for the price and the lobster roll same thing. The chicken fingers were gross but the fries were good. I asked for ranch when I ordered but they didn't give it to me so I asked again for it and she told me it was a $1.50! Ok..... so she brings it to me and my change (they charge tax so it was $1.63) and it was a tiny cup of bland ranch. Really??? Seems stupid but that totally turned me off.   Also, I guess they are told to make the bloody Mary's weak now because we watched her pour less than a shot in it. If I wrote this in April I would have given 4/5 stars but the ranch and the weak expensive Bloody Mary annoyed me.

1JigLO7OjyR5noaMCd4T_w.text: Lobster everything, lobster rolls, lobster mac and cheese, even a fried lobster on a stck they call a lobsicle!  This place, inside the mircle mile shops, has a small but strong menu with a really good lobster roll.   I tried the lobster blt, applewood smoke bacon stips, lobster, mayo, lettuce and tomato. Very good!  My husband got the original lobster roll with secret spice blend, both came on toasted split top bun.  We also got a bowl of clam chowder, served in sourdough bread bowl, yummy, a large amount of clams, small chunks potato, very good.   Limited table sitting, very busy area, free refills but gotta ask and very good food, just a little pricey!

CkEeH0BJLSYhvPxJLNgNMw.text: Had the 50/50 Sea Dawg meal with the loaded fries Mac and cheese crab balls  and it wasn't a disappointment!!. The lobster and crab meat taste fresh , the Mac and cheese balls were nice and crispy , it comes with slaw not a fan of that tho. But overall definitely wasn't a disappointment I left full and happy!! Oh! And they have vodka lemonade

zkb-91LWHy5Vn_Z95hlitw.text: Lobster "M E" = Manipulated Expectation. First off, I will say, I give this place 2 stars vs. 1 since the food was not of poor quality and the service was fine. The value however, was way off. Looking back I have only myself to blame, but I hope my post will dissuade other big hungry guys or perhaps their wife will read and warn them. DO NOT expect a sandwich from this. Despite the fact you are paying more than a filet minion, the sandwich is not a sandwich as many lobster roll joints have come to be known for providing over the past few years, but in fact an old school 5" bread roll.   Here is where you "Lobster-Lost Me" folks:   If you were charging $5 to $7 for a 4 to 5 inch old school lobster roll (or even $10 to $12 in Vegas), that would be OK. However, when you charge $27 bucks, you better damn well slap that sucker in a hoagie bun and fill it up as I and every real American man expects it!   The giant "sandwich" photos at the booth at first glance look like normal sandwich rolls (AKA Hoagie Rolls for our East Coast Friends). Here is where I goofed. If you look closely at one photo, you can see wedges of avocado on the top. If I were smart and not hungry, I would have realized the roll was only slightly larger than these wedges. What these are is in fact, a bread roll and not a sandwich roll. At the price charged, the roll needs to be at LEAST 8 inches long and still contain sufficient lobster to spill out of the edges to the point of being nearly impossible to consume. Alternatively, Lobster ME may cut their prices down to $6 per roll.   I am doubtful either will happen. As such, hungry men everywhere, unite! Demand value and say "NO!" with me to this cruel and unusual punishment of our wallets and our appetites!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A 4&#34; wimpy bread roll &amp; what the &#34;Sandwich&#34; is on. What are we doing; dining at the country club in the 1950&#39;s? 1950&#39;s prices please!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a 7-8 inch bread roll! That is what the sandwich SHOULD be on, but it&#39;s not.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge sign and massive $27 cost made me stupidly believe these were on 7-8 inch hoagie sandwich rolls, not tiny bread rolls.

EHpjkE1LIa8uApN0aSRLjw.text: I had always wanted to try their lobster Mac and cheese and I really loved it. The lobster tails were melting in my mouth. The only reason I give this business 4 stars is because I think it's a little bit overpriced and it took them too long to prepare my dish. Everything else is perfect. I will come back!!

OpsWbWdYUWLDI63YMNLuSQ.text: I got the Lobster Mac and Cheese and it was pretty good. The pieces of lobster were on the top and the cheese was very thick. It was somewhat of a small portion size alone but you can make it a combo to get fries or soup.  I got my order to go and on a Sunday afternoon for lunch the wait was about 5 minutes to get my food.  Good lobster but I probably wouldn't get the Mac and cheese again if I go back.

3iQDlRe0sdyn6b5kEgQOeQ.text: It's just ok!!! Probably, I was expecting too much, I guess. Got the lobster sandwich.

jKZmdQWbR7o0LE1X7fduvQ.text: Whenever I'm at Planet hollywood, either watching a show or just doing a bit of Gambling I always make sure to stop by Lobster Me in the miracle mile shops. Their Lobster roll is like being right back in the northeast and their lobster Mac n cheese always hits the spot for comfort food!

wz5JPWnzqJ4lf89QdmVx6A.text: Lobster ME is a decent mall choice for lunch or dinner, but expect to pay for it.  That being said, it is lobster, which is not a cheap ingredient, and it is the Las Vegas strip, which has fewer and fewer bargains these days.  On my last trip to Lobster ME, I had the Cajun lobster roll with tater tots.  It's a decent size roll (the large) with the requisite buttery split top crust.  But, the lobster was overcooked, it wasn't tough, but it was getting close.  It certainly wasn't succulent, which properly prepared lobster is.  I liked the spice on the roll, and it's stuff full, so the amount is not an issue.  The tater tots are okay, better than say, Sonic, but just okay.  The entire meal is $27, which again, I don't think it's worth.  However, as noted above, I understand that lobster is not cheap and I don't expect to find value in a mall on the Las Vegas strip.  You can certainly do a lot worse if you are looking for a quick meal on the strip, but don't expect to be blown away at Lobster ME.

CDNkoBetAzVHbbJUWDcm0g.text: Yummy...yummy... This is a counter service location, but they deliver the food to your table. The customer service was absolutely excellent. And the food was so fresh and good. The quality of their food product is great and the price is outstanding. We had a 20% off coupon, you can get the coupon booklet from the Miracle Mile Mall guest services. The Lobster rolls include a side of coleslaw. You can make it a combo with french fries and a drink  or  fries and a beer for an additional price.  I will definitely eat here again... And a again... And again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Counter service with a small but great menu.
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Lobster Roll with  Fries, slaw and a beer.

ZuokdsQgENltTNIZuMG_JQ.text: Lobster me is the shiz...the people are great and super friendly, a couple of names to mention is Rosa, and Carolina. Jeff deserves manager of the year, I've never seen a manager that works in the food that handles his employees and customers so well, this is my second time and I will be back as long as he is manager.

ynqbEUlMN2vWty5UW9mY_A.text: Came here last week for a late dinner. Ordered a lobster roll, lobsicle, and bisque. Cost quite a bit more than I was expecting for a food court style shop. But hey, it's lobster.  The lobster is definitely legit. You get decent sized portions considering it is lobster. The lobsicle which I got grilled looked tiny for $14 USD. But again, it's lobster, and relatively speaking it was a relatively decent size of meat. I guess I was a little deceived after seeing a picture of it on their menu. Nevertheless it was quite delicious.  The roll was not bad and had decent chunks of lobster meat. But I felt it was eerily similar to the lobster roll I get at the local hockey area for half the price.     The soup I could have done without.   Unless you absolutely craving lobster at some exact moment you walk by this place in Vegas, I personally would probably eat elsewhere.

Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobsicle

KNIdDh3ngeXgmgkCC5gbYA.text: Perfection!!!! Extraordinary!!! Words cannot adequately describe how delicious and flavorful the food is and how spectacular the service was. The entire experience was amazing!   I live in California and my mother lives in Las Vegas. I wanted to arrange to have a nice lobster dinner delivered to my mother for Mother's Day. Earlier in the week, I sent an email to Lobster Me to inquire about the options and obtain some recommendations. Kevin, the general manager was quick to respond and over the course of several days, he answered all of my numerous questions and made some excellent recommendations. I ordered the following:  Lobster Roll - Connecticut Style Lobsicle - Grilled Lobster Mac & Cheese Chowder Shrimp Cocktail Old Bay Fries  When I attempted to have the order delivered using the Postmates app, I encountered a problem. I was in panic mode and I immediately contacted Kevin. Not only did Kevin resolve the issue but he truly went above and beyond to personally make this delivery happen. The level of service that I received from Kevin was absolutely outstanding. He treated me like a Vegas VIP!!!  After my mother devoured her lobster meal she called me and she was so incredibly happy that she was almost speechless. She is a major foodie and she has impeccable taste and a very discerning palate. She told me the lobster roll was not only the most delicious lobster she has ever had, she further stated that it was one of the top two dishes she has had in her entire life!!! She said if there is food in heaven, the Lobster Me lobster roll would be there. My mom also loved the lobster mac and cheese and the seafood bacon chowder! She was too full to try the shrimp or the fries, however she indicated they looked very, very good.   Bottom line: The quality and flavor of the food was exceptional and the only thing better than the food was the outstanding level of service that Kevin provided. I have the highest praise you, Kevin. Thank you for making Mother's Day so special for my mom! You are awesome!!!

ssUNW9izr1TZVO11tOe9zQ.text: A little stingy on the lobster for the price of $20, otherwise quick service and good sandwich

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kkKXQN18g3BPSCkA1opkJA.text: For fried food the fish and chips arrived hot and tasty.  Service was nice and even cooks came out to counter to deliver food especially if there was a customer return.  I would have appreciated a healthier option but could not discern from the menu.  Seating is first come, mall seating.  Perfect for grab and go or take to your hotel room or poolside snack at the Elara.

The fish and chips also had no flavor and the fries were stale. If I eat here again I'm just getting a lobster roll, there's no way they can mess that up.

Maybe I am spoiled as a result of being from New England and knowing what Lobster is supposed to taste like but Lobster ME doesn't just miss the mark there not even in the same playing field as the mark.   Lobster is dry and overcooked, by the taste it was cooked days ago. This is one of those places I wish I could roll back time and simply never experience.

4VtaD8H6Hhu79gY19dZ06w.text: Came here a few months ago and had the Cajun Maine Lobster.  I made my return and once again it was great!  Les the cashier who took my order my last visit was there! He recommended the shrimp and chips he said they were his favorite and they were great! Not popcorn shrimp, but the perfect size the batter was amazing and I got the crab loaded fries with it great combination! The young lady who brought my food out was so friendly she came back and checked on me, those two who were working definitely made me feel comfortable and I love that in a restaurant. Everytime I come to Las Vegas I will be eating at LobsterMe!

_lIN6RLlKOmR8wOqkbmLHw.text: This I had to be hands down the best fast food seafood restaurant. My boyfriend were just walking around one night at the strip and came across this place and when we saw the pictures of their food I just couldn't resist in trying. I had the 3 tacos trio for $17 and mannnnnn. The first bite until the last was amazing. I had to order two more tacos. The trio comes with lobster, shrimp, and fish taco. And the sauce is banging. I will be dreaming of these tacos until the next time I come to Vegas.

d_-XlwwS-KC5f9vkFslHqw.text: Went back to Lobster Me today and had the Maine style and the Old Bay. This experience did not disappoint. Both rolls were just as I had remembered as the Lobster really popped and was prepared wonderfully this time. The Maine style had  celery, chives and a small  amount of mayo on a wonderful soft roll. Very generous portion of lobster. The Old Bay roll had shallots, chives , mayo, and seasoning with buttery Panko bread crumbs, again with a generous portion of lobster.   My favorite was the Old Bay, and the mixture of the panko, butter, and shallots really made this roll for me. Absolute purists should try the Original Maine Style if it it their first time, and then branch out to try the others. Washed it down with a refreshing blueberry lemonade, although there were several beer selections if you chose to partake.  A shout out to the staff and very helpful manager, Jessica at this location for guiding us thru the menu and providing friendly and helpful service.

JLiCDvFtEmjClCHq8YJyPQ.text: I love this chain. Mainly because I have no access to anything like it when at home. Conveniently located in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood, Lobster ME has plenty of seating and quick service. There are several lobster roll options, soups, and more. I had the lobster grilled cheese. It has a nice amount of lobster on some gooey cheese and definitely hits the spot. I would eat here every day if I could afford it.

I used to really love this place, I don't know what happened

oXvUhgbvEGa07Ml9G1KwUQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Mac and cheese is my favorite, along with lobster and crab.  So of course I had their mac and cheese. I got the combo so I could have an iced tea, and my friends could share my fries. I knew $18 was a bit steep for me, but it's Vegas - and lobster!  The portions were bigger than I expected! Except.... for the lobster. But whatever. It was still delicious and fresh. Fries were good. Medium cut with semi-light cajun seasonings. Iced tea was unsweetened as promised - nothing special.  Employee working there looked very alternative, and was super friendly and helpful. I want to try one of their lobster rolls in the future. Hopefully there will be a little more lobster next time around.

zVOhuU1CFfvPT_wySmnbFQ.text: Came here for lunch. There was a long line but we waited and ordered the crab cake burger and the grilled fish sandwich ( specified fish of the day) they came with waffle fries which were pretty good. Both sandwiches had a hamburger type if roll and had coleslaw. My grilled fish was pretty good and had a hint of pepper. I tried my boyfriends crab cake and it was also good. Prices were reasonable, about $ 30 for both. The line was long even when we we're done eating. We were able to get a small table. I would recommend this place. Food was tasty and filling and price was right

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t7X2_zMVAgejpChlaOhESQ.text: In the Miracle Mike Shops next to Fat Tuesday! Yum! Good seafood in the middle of the strip. Nice menu selection but some items are pricey (it is lobster). Lobster was very buttery and fresh. I would come back. I had the Surf n Turf Philly.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A82gttrTnGcxYVq-j8529Q.text: Lobster Mac and cheese here is amazing!!! Good place to come for a quick dinner, there aren't many chairs in this good court area however but other than that if you're looking for amazing lobster rolls you will mos def find that here! Will definitely be coming back. The coleslaw and waffle fries were great too :)

YOAU3AJRZpoRF2TRVd985w.text: Tried this place on my most recent trip to Vegas and so glad we did! We had the lobster philly, grilled lobsicle with garlic butter, and lobster Mary (Bloody Mary). All were delicious! I wish we had a Lobster ME in Illinois! Prices were a bit high, but it's Vegas and on the strip (inside Planet Hollywood) so I wasn't surprised! I would definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mary
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mary
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOBSICLE (grilled with garlic butter)

EnsS9bXpJ7Zq6u-eIye6oQ.text: The lobster roll(real small) was amazing the cajun way. Waffle fries fried way to hard. I barely touched them. Lobster mac n cheese was under whelming..needed more flavor but okay $45 spent with water. Value was not there and in vegas thats a good buffet price.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac and cheese(3/5 max), waffle fries(1/5) , Lobster roll(5/5)

LE_zHAbRVS5qPelRkaJhPg.text: The lobster grilled cheese sandwich is my favorite here. I had try the lobster mac and cheese but wish there was more lobsters with it. This is one of my places to go on the strip!

J8XTAzXyQyopGUjYdV1_cw.text: Not as good as I hoped the lobster roll was why I went but it wasn't worth the wait walk from Aria across the street

WAyMQ06Z3N8k8Au3eK8XwA.text: Lunch with my loved ones . They are visiting and wanted something good to eat. So we came here. The rolls are awesome ..

CkVBdEhZsbhdoUY_MsT76Q.text: Decided to have this as a late meal.  I ordered the Fish and Shrimp combo and a Lobster Bisque.  I gave this place a 4 star because the food was actually quite good.  However, the Lobster Bisque was a let down.  The lobster bisque, although had a sufficient amount of meat, it was more on the saltier side.  As for the pricing, it is definitely a couple bucks for the same food.  The food though, was very filling.  I just wish they had more sauces, unless I missed it, then never mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp/Fish and Chips Combo.

wNmPxO832UdqExyUNqJRyw.text: Ordered a shrimp taco and a 50/50 sea dog! The presentation of it was very nice, but it took extremely long to get. When we ordered we were the only ones there and it took us about 15 mins to get a simple shrimp taco and Hot Dog. In my opinion I thought it was going to be a lot bigger then it was for the price $16.  The 50/50 dog was a pretty decent size for $19. Yet still the wait took a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ngY17EMQ269TTvjGRJHzog.text: I'm a huge fan of lobster and lobster rolls. Ordered a lobsicle and lobster roll looking for something amazing. Unfortunately, lobsicle ($16) was pretty small for the price and lobster roll ($24) had a way higher bread to lobster ratio than desired. For a place that makes just lobster rolls, I really expected more esp for the cost. Luke's Lobsters, and even chains like Legal Seafood, do a better job. That said service was great. But I'd rather my money go to more lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VMyj2SbI12HU1LlYeLAftw.text: This is all I wanted for my birthday!   Breakfast, lunch and dinner. I'm from Philly and love all you can eat crab nights. It is not a thing here-so once a year I treat myself to some crab meat and lobster. Some of the best seafood I have ever had.

ooAr46_sj-1l8DNMaNZtUQ.text: Came here because it was right beside Fat Tuesday's in Planet Hollywood. I was getting pretty buzzed from my drink and LobsterME seemed to be a fantastic place to get some grub.  I know it's lobster, but it was a little pricey for how much you really get.... food was good but small   Service was pretty good. Friendly people and they were really friendly in helping me choose what to get.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YCMPVXGx_tDHwPY9-ouFJg.text: We recently went to Boston and these lobster rolls were  seriously just as good. They do not skimp on the lobster, it's worth the price. I upgraded my fries to the crab loaded and it was awesome, but made for a very filling meal. So delicious, I would definitely come back.

QU12CHwhC1M76XdWBZrxxA.text: Service was good. The lobster mac'n'cheese was really soupy/ runny. Needed a spoon too really eat it. The lobster was plentiful and was a good value.

f8UOTzCz0IWnZYD_t0hkEQ.text: The lobster roll was ethereal. A perfect balance of  crunchy bun, buttery aioli creaminess and crisp lobster meat awaits the patient diner. The freeh out of the fryer waffle fries put the whole experience over the top! OMG!

QpuCJtVuSUkejE-1IAN-3w.text: Had an amazing dinner here!  We weren't super hungry but needed a little something. Jeffery and Dakota were extremely helpful in guiding us through the menu and making recommendations. We ended up sharing the lobster tacos and Mexican corn. Holy lobster deliciousness were the tacos good - huge chunks of lobster and slightly grilled tortillas to give a little crunch. The Mexican corn had a nice smoky flavor with a kick of heat. Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BkwATxMGg8cCaUcNwCRKZg.text: Great find! I always feel like seafood is a gamble unless you know and trust a restaurant. I had the Taco Trio which included lobster, grilled fish and shrimp tacos. All were delicious and tasted fresh, the street corn was insane!

cXf-Zjv7YtFkhQgAi-mXBg.text: I walked away from Lobster ME having a fast-food experience, but paid sit-down restaurant prices!  I really really wanted to like this place more. Lobster and Crab are luxurious ingredients that have a simple cooking process... steamed and buttered. We paid $24 for the lobster roll and $15 for the crab. It's a cold served product, and it still took 40 minutes to get our food. And the clam chowder was bland and flavorless.  PRO's:  Convenient location in the Miracle Mile Shopping center. Friendly and courteous staff  CON's: 40 minutes to get two cold items  Flavorless clam chowder

qMM6Dy4i-QnG-inaz72k5Q.text: If you're not on a budget in Vegas, pleasssseeee stop by here! The menu is a little expensive, but it's EVERYTHING LOBSTER.  You can't be cheap on that.  I like coming here for lunch since the portion isn't big so you don't feel too stuffed.  Especially if you have to get ready to go to the club.  I always order the Maine lobster roll which basically has lobster with butter on top.  I like to keep it simple.  The roll had a good amount of lobster meat.  You get what you pay for.  I added a side of Lobster Chowder and it was delicious!  There were actual chunks of lobster and the chowder wasn't too salty either.  There's a lot of different options to choose from and so far, I haven't been disappointed.

6j47pvKe-PMeqB1OB4s7Hg.text: I need to remember to follow my own rule that if a restaurant's specialty is in their name, just stick with that. On a recent visit to Vegas, I stumbled about Lobster ME while shopping and decided to try their lobster roll sandwich (Connecticut style with butter) and the crab fries. The lobster roll was delicious, although a little bit light on the lobster for the $24 price. The roll was delicious and satisfying. They offer different ways to upgrade it and I really should have tried California style which also includes avocado and tomato. Definitely my plan for my next visit.   They lose a point for the crab topped french freids. Absolutely not worth the extra money. The cajun flavoring on the fries blew out any potential crab flavor as well as the flavor in the lobster cheese sauce. I couldn't taste anything except cajun spice.   I'll definitely be back, I just planning on skipping anything that isn't overtly lobster.

2khQcoRHG-H-Vyvi3n_dWw.text: Free soda refills until 11pm!  Great spot when you get tired of the endless celebrity steak houses and cheesy buffets. Good lobster roll which has more smaller chunks as opposed to those huge ones you can find in Boston. Great lightly salted butter on the toasted roll. And the free soda refills are awesome. They come by your table to check on you periodically and offer to refill your cup. Good service and attitude, reasonable prices, and the lobster roll hits the spot. I'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium Cajun lobster roll

74CIAZTaAUSgid2qgL8anA.text: A friend on facebook posted pictures of her meal her and it was then I knew we needed to make this a priority on our Vegas trip.  This location is in the shops of the Planet Hollywood hotel right across from where we stayed at the Bellagio. My husband was still full from lunch and, frankly, so was I but I was craving the lobster mac and cheese. The cheese is quality because it's not watery and has great texture and flavor. The lobster is so yummy, warm, and buttery but I could've used more mac and lobster.   Two observations about this location: 1) My mom ate at the Venetian location on her trip and their mac and cheese seemed to have more lobster in the picture. And 2) they didn't have the lobster melt here which they had at the Venetian location and, as noted in my other review, was my instant favorite item from this stand. Definitely hit this place up, but maybe consider a different location.

_z9wIlVD24u9beqHJ5fFMQ.text: I'd say for a quick and tasty lunch that doesn't break the bank in Vegas, come here! It's easy to find in the Caesar shops, and they have a lot of seating.  Their lobster rolls are really good, and they're priced pretty decently. I've had some lobster rolls that had barely any meat in them, and these were pretty stuffed. Their lobster mac & cheese is also delicious, though we would have liked it if the lobster was mixed in to the pasta and not just dumped on top. Their tator tots are bomb as well...super crispy! I'd def come here again for a quick and easy bite to eat

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster mac &amp; cheese
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tator tots

eEDZEWZe4OvOlgjQAof3QQ.text: It's food on the strip. When is food on the strip ever 5 star worthy? Never.   I got the lobster grilled cheese with cajun fries. The lobster grilled cheese was pretty good for what it was but it wasn't amazing. Like everyone else said, I wish there was more lobster meat in it. 2 stars for that.  Added an additional 1 star for their cajun fries. The best cajun fries I've ever had. It was actually SPICY. I'd probably just only get their cajun fries next time as a snack and nothing else.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese and Cajun fries

kJLQ-tigCkVaI9S13YTH6w.text: I absolutely love this place! I feel like a kid in a candy store here, but in this case, a Lobster store. Portions are a bit on the small side but the food tastes great! I highly recommend the Lobster Cheese fries as they are absolutely delicious!  The shrimp and lobster tacos are also very tasty and both are served on soft corn tortillas.  If you like soup, their lobster bisque is out of this world. Creamy and rich this soup will have you rolling your eyes in the back of your head.  Lobsicles are really good, both breaded and naked but you might need two of them as they are on the smaller side.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wM2iXT_JnMTfSHr4cma7fw.text: Ordered: Lobster and eggs.  Middle school tater-tots Didn't taste the lobster in the eggs  Wasn't worth my $10 :/

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and eggs

gFiOl4YKLHt8Qu4trp4UyQ.text: This place gets an "eh" for effort. A friend and I ordered some things to go (we were staying at Planet Hollywood and were planning to eat in our room).  We waited around 15-20 minutes for our food, then went up to the rooms. When we got back, we realized they missed 2 lobsicle orders (worth half our order). So we had to go back down and ask for them. The comped is drinks, which was nice. What wasn't nice were the overlooked grilled lobster tails the size of my index finger, served with plain cabbage and what was undoubtedly imitation butter.  The rest of the food (signature lobster roll and loaded crab fries) were ok, if not a tad salty. There were also some crab shell fragments in the fries that was not pleasant to bite into.  The people working there were nice, but I still wouldn't return for the quality of food for the price (and in Vegas, you can definitely do a lot better).

9Opl4edRAbWzWQjK3JYOJg.text: Lobster me is located in miracle mile's food court. Right next to FAT TUESDAY !! There's usually no line at any hour. Lol...   What I ordered:  Fish taco: the fish wasn't crispy and the tortilla tasted bleh :(  Chowder fries: delicious !! Good mix fries and clam chowder !   Pricing: $$ $10-20/plate Parking: miracle mile at PH , structure parking Portion: 1 : 1  Service: kind of slow; probably waited at least 25 minutes for our food. There was only 2-3 customers too.   I only come here for convenience...

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos

Je-Fj2EbVyEl6CyX5kuxBg.text: Meh, more like 2.5/5 stars.  Nothing is special about this joint and I understand it's vegas but it's too overpriced for what it is.    After eating earl's for the previous 5 meals, i decided to venture out and order something else. Lol...  I know, I'm a creature of habit.  Conveniently, this place is located right next to fat Tuesdays in the Miracle Mile.    Ended up getting the lobster roll and the lobster bisque.  I've had some legit lobster rolls in Boston, and lobster me doesn't even hold a candle to it.  This is a pretty sad excuse for a lobster roll.  It's just pieces of lobster on a butter roll for about $17 bucks.  And as for the soup, the consistency is a bit runny.  I doubt lobster bisque is supposed to taste like that.    There are a few seats located right in front of the shop, but if you come during rush hour, you might not be able to sit down.  The saving grace about this place is that the people working here are friendly.  You're better off taking your money and finding something else to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $9 lobster bisque in a bread Bowl
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $17 lobster Maine roll

XmIeeEvrXRq9FXXlpu6cWQ.text: WAYYYYY OVER PRICED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 17$ for a fried lobster tail!!!!!!! On a fast food place!

EL4sWEOqb4i5bMuGxdxZMQ.text: I was so excited to try this place!  We ordered the lobster roll and expected it to be outstanding but ended up being pretty disappointed.  $19 is normal for a lobster roll, but these ones were so not worth the price.  It's a pretty small roll so sides are definitely a must if you want to be full.  Ours came with one or two chunks of lobster surrounded by a lot of minced chunks.  Not at all what I've seen in pictures!  There really isn't any taste to them either.  The lobster isn't sweet, it's not buttery, not much seasoning to accompany the overall blandness. But, that's what I should've expected from a fast food type shop.

qhMTRju-ukSg04NPLJj4zw.text: It's almost a public service to have a restaurant that includes lobster in most menu items, and this establishment for the most part delivers. The lobster sandwiches taste good, but I'm not a fan of how they serve it in a way that makes it impossible to eat like an adult. The lobster strips practically sit on top of the roll instead of actually inside of it. I also wish the portions were bigger. Not a fan of the waffle fries. Lobster mac n'cheese was "okay". Service was friendly and courteous, and didn't have to wait too long for my order. In town for a work conference and it helped hit the lobster spot.

kSlR7mHZ_s9gMd3DNMEE_w.text: Not bad, but not the best lobster-themed place I've been to. I got the Lobster frenchie but was kind of disappointed because it didn't have much cheese and didn't have much lobster. The seasoning was good though, and the lobster bisque (free with Yelp checkin) was delicious! I dunked my sandwich in the soup for more lobster flavor. The chowder fries weren't really special, not much sauce was on it. I had a bite of my friend's miso lobster roll and it was quite unique and yummy though.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sesame miso lobster roll and chowder fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frenchy with lobster bisque that was free with Yelp checkin

4y-kSXh-5EBkSk28cBgjuw.text: YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY YUMMYYYYY!! Haha The chowder fries were DEELICIOUS! I love how they added chowder on their fries. Considering I love chowder, this was a genius concoction!   I reallyyyy wish they had garlic tots again! Garlic anything would win me over any day so PLEASE BRING BACK THE GARLIC!! Thank youuu :)))   The lobster bisque was reallyyy good too. Probably one of the best lobster bisque I have ever had.   The BELTWAY LOBSTER ROLL was tasty. The lobsters inside were huge and fat! Just the way I like them. The roll could be more toasty. It was soft. The coleslaw and chips that came with it were good as well.  The people working here are nice too :) Did I mention this place is next to fat tuesday? haha

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese, chowder fries, &amp; the beltway libster roll!! Mmm

WC3G61tSM7p-pKxkCG2BuA.text: We had the lobster grilled cheese. It wasn't 100% lobster and the guy was honest when we ordered it. They filled it with crab also. But it was still delicious with the bacon inside. I'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster/crab/bacon grilled cheese sandwich

g6G5vSJycmYuR9LpIw-lKg.text: I love myself a good lobster roll and Lobster Me have been a place I wanna check out for sometime now. We order the 2 combos one Cajun Lobster Roll Combo with Clam Chowder and fish taco combo with a side of chowder fries.   For $18 a combo it's pretty pricey which I wouldn't mind if the food was good. At best it was decent.   Nothing special about the lobster roll I had or the water down clam chowder. Fish taco was suppose to be fried but it didn't taste crunchy at all. I was very disappointed with our lunch.   It was said to be the best Lobster Roll in U.S   Not True, this is the worst Lobster Roll and clam chowder I have ever had. Even chowder in a can taste 10 times better then their water down chowder they serve.   The only reason why they got 2 stars was because the server was very friendly and they give you free refill drink.   Btw, if you yelp, hashtag, or Facebook they'll give you a free drink!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Lobster Roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chowder Fries
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Tacos

ZN6cmXEKqZiqTeU3X-WpPg.text: Lobster on a stick! Yum!!!  Their lobster grilled cheese should be called Only Grilled Cheese. No Lobster what so ever, and for $11 I was expecting some lobster at least at one point in my sandwich.  3 stars just for being ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock Lobster!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese

FpAdDz0Bk9xLDAoJgtNYjQ.text: My wife and I decided to try this place out. I'm not much of a lobster person. We tried the lobster grilled cheese which was good. Not much lobster in it but I think I've decided I don't really like lobster. There wasn't anything wrong with it but just not my taste.   The clam chowder fries on the other hand was bomb! The chowder was really delicious. I think next time I'd order the chowder itself because it was so good. They smother it on the fries. This was a surprise that it was that good! Definitely will try this place again the next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam chowder fries!
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese.

ZqVECZYBqPX_oSMN4ssSFg.text: The smell stopped me in my tracks! The meal overall was just okay to me though for the price and fast food type service. Wasn't too long to place and get my order but can see how they could get behind at times. Seating was lacking, got told to slide over, wasn't my fault she said the table was in the bar beside them. The bar gets packed and make seating and eating unpleasant. I might try them again if walking by hungry and bar isn't busy. Give them a try at least.

S_D7q1CwHHrvRCfl7aVdTg.text: If you enjoy Lobster, but doesn't want to spend $50-100 per person for it, then this is a place to get a quick fix.  They are located just in the middle of Planet Hollywood's Miracle Mile shops.  The place operated like a fast food joint, but seats could run out quickly depending on the time you visit them.  We got the Cajun Lobster Roll and Diablo Lobster Roll.  Both were full of nice flavorful spices.  The Cajun one was slightly spicier.  Lobsters were served cold, but still delicious.  Drinks were refillable.  Price was about $15-20/person.  Lobster Me, lobster you?  The staff served us quite well and it did not feel like a fast food joint at all.  I look forward returning to explore other items on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Diablo Lobster Roll
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Lobster Roll combo

LBlD9NeIIMG0vsiHNiN8kw.text: Good food and good service for a mall-type restaurant. Five stars if there was more lobster on my frenchy lobster melt.

0rzYK7PmjGNyRdHCvs2PkQ.text: A nice little find in the back of planet Hollywood. Great lobster options for when you just want to grab and go and not worry about a long dinner.

J9mvdsQBRp1k4NAcZry1MQ.text: Other than clogging arteries,  this place was fantastic for a mall food court. I got the lobster roll and chowder fries. $24 is expensive for mall food, but this is Vegas.

TkJFetZI52y4M4EQyAmvtg.text: i like that everything here has lobster in it.  I was disappointed by the lobster roll though.  Sure it had tons of seasoned lobster on it, but that was the only positive.  It was rather bland and pretty dry.  The bread was boring.  It had a bit of spread on there (mayo I believe).  Then the cold and pretty drab lobster chunks on top.  Def. not my favorite.  Luckily, I also tried the lobster mac and cheese.  While it didn't have much lobster chunks in it, it was still a solid, solid mac n cheese.  I'd probably come back for this and maybe get one of those lobster tails on-a-stick next time.  Lastly, I tried the lobster ceviche.  Not much lobster, but a decent ceviche overall.  A bit sweet from the fruits in it, but the main complaint here is they only gave me 3 chips with it.  Kinda skimpy for a tiny $10 ceviche.  Meh overall.

E5h728sNLJnauyw34Dvx7w.text: Why the less than subpar reviews?   I loved everything I got! We got the lobster mac and cheese, lobster shooter and the lobster roll ($20). All of this totaled up to be around 40 bucks, but we were so pleased when the meal came to our table. They serve hunky chunks of lobster in each order, but my favorite had to be the roll because of the mountain of savory lobster inserted into two buttery toast buns! Get's me so excited!   Great shopping area and quality food in a to-go setting. I'm a fan!

k64B3SsjfjmsHp7Hi8pAug.text: Highly over rated, nothing to talk about to your friends. The lobster roll were small for Vegas, the lobster bisque was thick and disgusting, the meat on the roll tasted like imitation lobster. Highly over priced, I can say that I will not be visiting Lobster me any time soon. The service was good enough, average.

3vWu--HzACRtCyArcEtJ_g.text: Tried several dishes:  Mac and cheese: disappointing. Lack of cheese. Lack of lobster. Just Mac. Overpriced.  Grilled cheese with lobster : spectacular. The best thing on the menu.   Lobster roll: expensive. Ok for a roll not memorable.   Lobster bisque: better than average. Still not memorable.   Would of gone to a buffet at a major hotel for what I paid.

3_k8MFrl32dnyIt8scr8cg.text: It was pretty delicious I must admit. I bought the Maine roll w/ the lobster meat heated up. Omg, the sandwich was so on point. The lobster meat was so moist and juicy. I got it with the house chips and and the coleslaw. I love the chips, they had a slight salt and vinegar taste to me. I didn't even touch the coleslaw because it really didn't fit with the meal to me. My only complaint was that everything is so expensive compared to what you're getting. I know it's lobster, but I expect a lot paying 18.00 dollars for a sandwich with no drink.

zPTK8wVztvLY8FH-VPdkpw.text: I'm thankful that my friend brought me to this place or else I would've never discovered it. I ordered the Maine Style Lobster Roll. Melts in your mouth and makes you want seconds. Coming back the next time I'm in Vegas! *No longer limited to Earl's*

fSlvDZSRG-f-rs0eUr2y1A.text: This place is such a scam, way overpriced for absolutely no lobster. I won't come back

punxjWWEen9XHO3GoPiIYg.text: Inside the Planet Hollywood!  Lobster on a stick...what could be better? However i am not a fried food lover...also it looked more like larger shrimp than a lobster tail. $14.95 for one piece...i can do without =/

GXLO1Mxq_8vCEur0Dia0og.text: 3 words OH MY GOD! This was the best place we went to the entire time in Vegas! The lobster Mac and cheese was amazing!! I wanted it the entire time!! This is a must go in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese!!! To die for!

8hwfDfT07iQGRRx4Rq4SQw.text: expensive but good. they actually give you lobster claw pieces in their lobster roll.  skip the lobster bisque.  Not worth it. just go to earl's and get a cup of chicken noodle instead.  i got the cajun garlic fries! amazing but didnt give enough.  I wouldnt go out of my way to get it since earl's is down the way for 1/4 of the price!

QvWmjPlK3de6EJkFsxAhGQ.text: Love their garlic fries and cajun seasoning. They use actual garlic and peppers instead of something out of a shakers. My dining companions loved the deep fried lobster. Great place to try out while shopping

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Chips

cIfq9iQCuejNadUaF02w8g.text: Great quality (for being nowhere near the ocean) lobster rolls!! Definitely coming back! Good big chunks of lobster, not too buttery toasty bread, crisp tater tots, what's not to love?!! Located at planet hollywood's indoor mall.

cW77DwW2i-FdEH_WDsvV2w.text: I was SUPER excited to try out Lobster Me after my friend had Instagrammed pictures of his lobster rolls while in Vegas. It just so happened to be right next to the Fat Tuesday line so my girlfriend and I had to give it a try.   We ordered the Cajun roll after asking the register girl's opinion and it came out to ~$25... Most expensive sandwich I've ever purchased. But my girlfriend reasoned that it WAS lobster so I bit the bullet and waited it out.   MAJOR disappointment! First off, the large size is only 6 inches. 6 INCHES. I could buy 5 Subway foot-longs with the money I spent on this dinky roll! To be fair, it was absolutely stuffed with lobster meat and 3 claws on top but the meat was COLD. I was appalled. Probably my fault that I didn't ask the waitress if it was going to be a hot or cold sandwich but I didn't know that cold lobster sandwiches were a thing.   If I were to come here again, I would order a non-roll item like the tater tots or the mac and cheese because the roll was WAY underwhelming and WAY too much for my wallet.   Side note: A guy fainted face first on the tile floor and banged up his chin while waiting in line behind me. Not sure if it was from the sky-high prices or heat exhaustion and dehydration from his Fat Tuesday. Either way, be sure to mentally prepare yourself for these menu prices!

DROk-hYDEYUcIrhyE1e4sA.text: First off -- the staff at Lobster Me were awesome!! There aren't many tables available for sitting but they were able to find us another chair for our one-chair table while we were waiting for our food to arrive. Now onto the food -- I had the Original Maine Style and my husband had the Connecticut -- when they came out, the sandwiches looked so tiny BUT man, did they fill those buns up with tasty lobster!! Maybe our eyes were bigger than our stomachs because we both left full! I had the lobster bisque for my side and my husband had the lobster fries. The bisque was good but not the best and the lobster fries were kind of sad. I think we enjoyed our sandwiches the most but next time, we'll pass on the sides. And remember, this is located in the Miracle Mile Shops so don't expect fancy-ness, guys.

tCNo2NJfhmZ2BQSVdbaL4A.text: no idea how the food tastes, cuz i paid and waited 30 min and got nothing. watching the cashiers/servers argue with the kitchen in back is like dinner and a show. after i was repeatedly told "your order is next" and watching other boxes get filled, i went to the cashier to ask for a refund. The 16 y.o. manager just re-printed a receipt for me, the receipt didnt show anything about money going back to the card. 14 days later....nothing on my statement. if you get screwed like me, dont leave until they comp you something.  edit: it's been a week since I emailed the manager/owner that left the comment below. shockingly - no response.

-DQzldbkVEoYB9YvzRxwRA.text: Food here is overrated. Yeah its lobster but I guess I expected so much in taste. It was good but not great. I got the beltway/beltline (cant remember the exact name) lobster roll and upgraded to the fries and drink combo. That came out to $22. In my opinion thats a bit much being that this location has more of the fast food feel. My bf got the lobster cheese fries and they didnt even look good. They looked soggy and just not something I would have wanted. The lobster cheese fries were $14. If I return here on my next visit to Vegas, I'd try something else...although there is nothing that isnt pricey. I think its just the fact that its more of a fast food type spot that thows me off with the prices.

D3lr4gWO7TZTqxCGkrZquQ.text: My favorite lobster roll place. If I see this place I'm going to stop by and get a lobster roll. Any lobster roll is amazing. I also recommend the combo to get the blueberry lemonade and lobster bisque soup. Cajun fries are delicious too. Can't go wrong with anything here.

BYNu9I_zn7oOmTq1lsyvtg.text: Lobster grilled cheese sandwich delicious.  The lobster and shrimp ceviche excellent with big chunks of lobster.  Yum

OEFwagPGJs_HlpR6r3pqCQ.text: It's an ok place to eat. Lobster roll was good, but the bread was too buttery. Also was not worth $16 for such a small sandwich. Nothing beats Luke's Lobster in NYC!!!

dQc9QCqYARpUrxqrHUun2A.text: not worth the price for flash frozen meat. My friend and i work in the casino and wanted to try this out when we saw it open. -( Not a good idea because the food was not good, got the lobster roll and it was just meat on a roll, no flavor at all. yuck!

BckNitrt-sEPAstmiaIR8w.text: Lobster, lobster, lobster.  What can I say? Succulent, juicy, delicate meat. Better than fish meat.  Check.  Better than steak? Maybe not by too much.  One of my favorite spots for a quick lobster roll in Vegas.  Tuckered inside Planet Hollywood's indoor shopping center. The lobster meat are a bit cold on the rolls.  Which dives it down a star.  I like my meat temperature warm or slightly hotter than room temperature so I would know they're pretty fresh from the steamer.  I'm pretty sure they keep it refrigerated after peeling it off the lobster.  I had lobster mac and cheese, 2 lobster rolls and 2 lobster popsicles.  The lobster roll wins hands down. The mac and cheese was good but with very little lobster meat.  The other downside is the quantity of meat.  It's around 5 ounces for a small.  But what I enjoy about it must be the soft buttery bread that encases it.  So good.  My plans in Vegas was to eat mostly Steak and Lobster.  And this does not disappoint on my seafood scale.  Make sure you wash it down with a hefeweizen which they also have on tap.

cQ1X66UFEwehFF9VHan5-A.text: Expected more. Got the large original lobster roll and lobster grill cheese. Lobster roll was ok. Pricey for a hot dog bun stuffed with bland, recently frozen lobster. The grill cheese was really good, but the lobster didn't add much. Lobster Me is located in Planet Hollywood and there are a ton of interesting choices to try next.

fZMuWSJeWxVetQVKQAQsDw.text: I only tried the lobster Mac and cheese and garlic Cajun fries and it was pretty bomb! Will come again to try the other stuff :)

BXgHV5e-Jmecu6IL0LxveA.text: Had to have been the best lobster me and my bf have had. It was amazing. Customer service was amazing my favorite was the lobster roll and their french fries were amazing.

jiUjIRCpRx8jYn-25NZHPQ.text: Needed something fast and just happened to walk by at the Miracle Mile shopping center. The lobster bisque and lobster dog were excellent. I would go back for a quick bite anytime.

651EBv-QMtqhHTEAYZzCNg.text: Lobster was so fresh! One of the most delicious sandwiches I've ever had! I'd recommend the lobster roll and lobster bisque. Lobster ice cream was so creamy with lobster bits. I'd definitely go back.

_Qx0ZMSPbtlYOwCw0n46eg.text: The service was great, food was even better. I had the shrimp roll, it was so juicy (shrimp) and bread was pretty good. I also had the lobster bisque which was excellent, My friend had the lobster roll which had huge piece of lobster meat. I tried it and it was really awesome. Will be back there for sure. You have to try the Lobster Ice Cream.

u-JNa-1SK0g1aDfJ-ugxVA.text: If you are really hungry and price conscious this place isn't for you. Way too over priced. Had lobster and chips, was ok but had 3 small pieces Of lobsters and a handful of fries which they could have added more since fries are the least expensive of the ingredients. If you want softdrink make sure you specify just a little ice or they will literally fill the cup with ice and refill are $2. One of their staff even  "agreed" with me that the lobster Mac and cheese tasted a bit bitter and dry. Instead of saying I'll pass your concern to the chef or the manager, he smiled and stated "I agree" it's like saying we have bad food but we serve it anyways!! Definitely not going back. If I want to spend that money on lunch, I rather go to Red Lobsters..

rFkRrmXWsfNPzM05tzyyBw.text: Where else In Las Vegas could you eat the best tasting lobster roll without paying an arm and a leg for it.  I love this place.  I really think I am in Maine when I go here.  The portion of lobster on the roll is huge.  I also think their lobsticles are great too.  I take all my company to Lobster Me & they love it just as much as I do.  I only wish their seating arrangements were a little more comfortable.

qKMiTOSys_ntrMQG9k5HGg.text: This place was absolutely fabulous!!! Being from the East Coast it is always surprising to see a True Lobster Roll in Las Vegas, and Lobster, Me nailed it! The celery salt on top of the Lobster Roll was the perfect final touch.  Can't wait to go back and try out other things on the menu!

-VyBAyi87LBQWNPHPD61Cg.text: The lobster grilled cheese made me want to "smack my mama," as we'd say in the South.   The Lobster Ice Cream was...interesting, but I think it's a "love it or hate it" scenario and the people who were with me loved it.  The lobster roll was also really delicious.  I wish I lived in Las Vegas so I could eat here all the time.  Actually, maybe it's for the best that I don't.

VraSM_hloBq6d58JOsa4gw.text: All I have to say is... Amazing! My family and I ordered a little bit of everything to sample and share. Lobster Mac and Cheese, Lobster Roll, Lobster and Chips, Lobsicle and yes, even Lobster Ice Cream. Everything was delicious and so different. The atmosphere was simple and cute and the service was great. I would def recommend Lobster ME to anyone!

c0VbO2ODoW9QFtn4MfckZQ.text: I was so excited to try my first lobster roll. Unfortunately I was underwhelmed. The lobster meat was fresh an plentiful but dry, definitely needed more mayo. The bread roll and fries were great. The prices were steep.

MS9My7RylJqDC1kjTa_szQ.text: Being from New England, I have eaten many lobster rolls and have to say they ruined this one with the stripe of mayo in the bottom of the roll and the nasty Old Bay Seasoning smothering the top of it.  A traditional Maine Lobster roll should be lightly tossed in mayo with finely chopped celery on a buttered roll. That's all it should be. Mac & cheese was bland, tater tots greasy and the whole experience over priced. 2 lobster rolls, 2 drinks and mac & cheese over $60!! really.

sZHO2aWoxP8Zxt7hfnRsZg.text: So good. My first experience with a lobster grilled cheese and it was amazing. Will be going back for sure next time I'm in Vegas

f4qcPOOM2kL1KwlpwauSxg.text: i found it on my second day in vegas and loved everything we tried.   considering that we were very disapointed at the meal we had at bobby flay's mesa grille; i was a little hesitant to try lobster me but thought; what do i have to lose...i dropped $200.00 @bobby's the night before and left hungry???   it was perfect....from the service right down to the food....everything was hot, fresh & unbelievable delicious!  i wish we had one here in va because it would definitely be a place i would frequent!!!

_oo9MGpIjUUL08nb-LWcmw.text: A native New Englander, I've wanted to try Lobster Me since it first opened, but rarely make Planet Hollywood a destination. Having won free tickets to the Beatleshow! (which is a really fun show btw) and with a half-hour to kill before we had to line up,  we found ourselves wandering the Miracle Mile and happened  upon Lobster Me. As we perused the menus, written on chalk blackboards (yes there is the obligatory nautical theme here, but you're ordering and picking up at a counter and eating at a random table set not quite in the pedestrian walkway so there's not much in the way of what I'd call "ambience" - hence the 4 not 5 stars) --- anyhow as we were standing there we were approached by a very friendly gentleman who explained the offerings and offered us samples - of which my husband gladly partook. Alas, they were out of lobster ice cream, but we promised to return to sample the cuisine after the show.  True to our word, we returned and ordered the lobster roll (save your money and do not order the extra large -- for 6 more dollars you're only getting about an inch more of roll and maybe one or two extra lobster pieces) and the lobster bisque in a bread bowl.  Aaaaaah the lobster bisque!!!  Served in a delicious sourdough bowl, it was piping hot - just the right temperature, with a lobster garnish and my oh my! it was so buttery and creamy and oh so chock full of lobster chunks!!! i really couldn't believe I was having this in Vegas!!!! And the lobster roll (for 3 more dollars you can get fries and a drink - it's worth it) -- was superb!! Yes I am a lobster roll purist - my benchmarks are Woods Seafood and Lobster Hut in Plymouth, MA -- and I never thought anything, especially out here, would come close. But OH!!! this succulent lobster was dressed perfectly and the roll was grilled just the way it would be back East!!  What a wonderful find!!  There's all kinds of trendy stuff here too -- lobster mac and cheese, lobster shooters, and the aforementioned lobster ice cream that we haven't tried yet,but suffice it to say that we might just make Planet Hollywood a destination, just to partake of the deliciousness that is Lobster Me!!!

A8DS1284vcMDsGE7bl4q3g.text: BEST ever LOBSTER ROLL! I've had Lobster Rolls in San Diego, Santa Monica and now at this Lobster ME location in Las Vegas (Planet Hollywood) and THIS LOBSTER ROLL IS THE BEST! The meat is succulent, juicy, flavorful and fresh. If you're going to spend $18 on a sandwich, know that for a Lobster Roll, this one is worth it. It also comes with Kettle chips and cole slaw. Ok, the cole slaw is more like a tasting (size wise) that you'd get at Costco but it's not what I came here for so not a big deal. Back to the Lobster Roll...you MUST try it if you like seafood and Lobster in particular.   Seating wise...it is off of the strip and we came in on a Saturday evening (10pm-ish) so it was quite packed which is why we took ours to go. It's more counter service than a sit down place unless you can find an open seat that seems to cater to both Lobster Me and Fat Tuesday which is literally next door -it's a food court so you take your chances on seating, other than that, the food was worth standing in line and waiting. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll w/kettle chips
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll

uAUcWX1orqDoWZYmNFSXTQ.text: DISCLAIMER: The photos are deceiving! The rolls are at least 1/3 smaller and the large generous pieces of lobster meat are non-existent. To add insult, the prices have increased.  It's really a shame. If you look at photos posted just a year ago, the rolls are stuffed with a heaping of lobster meat, even full pieces of claw meat, and looks absolutely tantalizing. The roll we got was small (think a thick slice of bread - like Texas Toast folded in half) and it was barely filled with chopped up lobster meat. So, what happened? I want to know where were my lobster claws and why was I robbed of lobster??  Original Maine Style Lobster Roll ($17): Chilled lobster meat mixed with mayo and spices and served on a toasted, buttered brioche. Accompanied by a side of lightly dressed cole slaw. The bread was soft and flavorful and the lobster meat seemed good. It was nice with the freshly-squeezed lemon. Again, I would have really enjoyed it if there was enough lobster meat. There was too much bread to the amount of lobster and we actually had a couple bites with NO lobster! This was really disappointing for the price.  We opted for the Fries + Drink combo (+$3) and went for Cajun Fries (+$1). The beer-battered fries were crispy and delicious. The Cajun version was well-seasoned and I loved the addition of chopped scallions. FYI: If you choose a fountain drink, it has unlimited refills.  Lobster Mac & Cheese ($12): This was just okay. The pasta was dry with not nearly enough sauce and the lobster meat was, again, skimpy. There was nothing special about this dish as it wasn't flavorful and there wasn't enough lobster to taste it within the dish.  The Lobsicle ($14): Lobster tail on a stick and it's available grilled or fried. I went with fried which has a light coating of their beer batter and it's served with melted butter and lemon wedge. This was absolutely delightful. The lobster was cooked nicely and the batter was crispy. I loved the fresh lemon juice and butter for dipping.   I really did enjoy the food, however, I don't like feeling cheated, so I can't say I'll return or recommend the "World's Best Lobster Roll" (meh).  Note: They offer a locals discount of 20%! Just show the cashier your Nevada ID.

jtfincglnN7Kuc_sunwsIA.text: This restaurant is good, but it has declined since my last visit a few years ago.  They increased the price of the lobster rolls and decreased the amount of lobster that is served with them.  If you want a roll like they used to make them, you now have to pay an extra $10.  It's a little ridiculous.  If I'm going to pay $29 for 1 sandwich, I'd rather pay a little more and just eat at a buffet that includes lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot less lobster

xTl6TAbLTSWrHhNwK76W7g.text: Ridiculously overpriced for one slice of bread folded in half filled with lobster. The lobster fries had one piece of lobster.  They ran out of the chowder and need to update their menu online....

bLfMqe-SKXEtcEFheLNArg.text: Undeniably delicious but if you are extra hungry it probably won't fill your belly. The Portions are small and the menu is a bit pricey. All in all it is a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu at Lobster me

iJGsb59D58eqK_27p-uKOg.text: Paid $62 for two Lobster rolls and drink with a nice tip and the rolls had no flavor and were dry. Very disappointed. Visited 4 years ago and it was much better.

jqlFTThhRmq4FPPrwsUzUg.text: Holy crab this place has the best lobster roll I ever had. It was so good. The roll was buttered and toasted warm. The lobster was gushing out because they were generous with it. And their fries were delicious. It's a must try! I saw it a few times when I was in Vegas and finally got it a few days before my flight back home and wish I had ate this sooner.*-*

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll accompanied by some chips

b0qBhXHfW25S-sXhZVssUA.text: Dudes. What are you doing over there?? Seriously?   I used to love this place and always looked forward to going here when I was on the strip. This is no more.   This place has progressively gotten worse each time, unfortunately.   First, they kept changing the sizes of their lobster rolls, then they changed the bread, the seasoning and now the whole thing is just not good.   There is less lobster and the bread is stale and small. They used to serve awesome lobster claws on top, this is no more. Everything about this roll is screaming "What did you do to me!!?!?!?". And I know why it's screaming that.   Also, their lobster mac and cheese is always super cold. They should mention this to the clients if this is their intention. Even the clam chowder tastes more like it's been preserved and not fresh, also served in a stale bread bowl. I feel bad for talking this place up and sending people here.  The service is good, and the cleanliness is fine.   I've been in denial for too long. My love affair in the last year with this place has dissipated.  This is  no longer my favorite place to go on the strip. :(  It's way overpriced for what they're offering now. When they started, it was worth the price.   Please, consider going back to your old ways. And please inform me when you do. Until then, it was a pleasure knowing you.

c6PU65HN2nkGpyktcMqeTw.text: Lobster mac and cheese was so cold .  19 dollars for some shells with cheese wiz ??? Not good! Obiusly was empty!. Avoid!  I thought that they were good after seeing the reviews ,I had much better lobster mac and cheese at the plane on my way to vegas... oh lord...

8YBtPY7aHeVVxpkT7XZWmA.text: OMG!!! THIS IS THE BEST "FAST FOOD" TYPE LOBSTER BAR EVER!  There are so many choices that include lobster! Lobster mac and cheese, lobster grilled cheese, lobster rolls, lobster bisque, lobster tail on a stick!, etc... I was in heaven.   It was a tiny bit pricey but honestly what isn't overpriced in Vegas?   WORTH EVERY PENNY!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y6Y44t4ZdVbJ7-Ir8dvt4g.text: Me and my friend walk up to the counter and the cashier, "Rosa" (although on our receipt it's says "Carolina") is having a conversation with Carolina. She does not acknowledge us at all and carries on with her conversation. She comes and stands in front of us and does not say a word. We wait.... she walks off and from us and finishes her conversation with Carolina. She (Rosa) has yet to acknowledge us. I lean against the counter and Carolina finally asks "Can I help you?" Rosa comes up and takes our order but is not at all friendly! She never said hello, I never got a thank you. She never made eye contact with me.... This is utterly ridiculous.... This type of employee should not work at this establishment... I waited for my order and watched her interact with 2 other couples behind me in the exact same manner. This is a bad depiction of your company.  Good food, HORRIBLE SERVICE !!!!

HwzA1_c36mmEp-YM0iySig.text: A good choice for a fast lunch on the strip.   The lobster has a lot of flavor. The roll is toasted perfectly with  butter .  Over all - good,fast and fair price.

7FK1bFuD96HfPlOSsJbdkg.text: Great little place in Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops! The original Maine style lobster roll is heavenly. Lots of lobster and not smothered in mayonnaise. The coleslaw and house made potato chips are very good too. Glad I tried them.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Maine Style

K8dsOFH2feyHfD7RoIIYnw.text: Small business located inside of Planet Hollywood and right next to Fat Tuesday!  FOOD:  Connecticut Style Lobster Roll $17 (warm lobster meat tossed in butter)  The lobster rolls here are AMAZING. Lobster tastes fresh and chunky. The bread is fat , soft on the inside, slightly crispy on the outside, and drenched in butter goodness. Only downfall is that all the lobster rolls here are very small. Even though it is served with a complimentary small salad on the side, do expect to still be hungry!  Original Maine Style Lobster Roll $17 (chilled lobster with mayo and spices)  This lobster roll equally had fresh chunky lobster. The flavorings tasted simply like lemon and pepper. Still good, but I prefer mines warm.  Clam Chowder +$4 The clam chowder was good. The soup was not gelatinous but was smooth. It had good chunks of potatoes and other good stuff.  Blueberry Lemonade $4 This drink was really good. Not too sour. Not too sweet. Just perfect.  Apple Cider $4 This drink is really unique. It doesn't have a strong apple flavor, but more of a orange spiced apple.   Overall, good places to go for quality lobster. But VERY expensive for such small portion sizes. Great place if you don't have a huge appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maine Style Lobster Roll with Clam Chowder $21
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Conneticut Style Lobster Roll $17
Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Lemonade

js0q23smbvsFlgkOGxeD0A.text: i don't think the english language has a word that adequately describes how ridiculously overpriced the food is. $26 got me a lobster roll about the size of a slice of wonder bread folded in half and fifteen fries. $14 merits unsliced lettuce petals with about 3 oz of lobster on top.  a sign here proclaims that this place has the world's best lobster, which is a big fat lie. they should be ashamed to serve this garbage at a north korean prison camp. overcooked, and overseasoned to cover up the poor flavor.  service is slow and the tables are sticky.  the diet coke tasted okay.  if you are hankering for lobster, do yourself a favor, skip this place and go to red lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this would have been worth $5, but it&#39;s actually $26.

q5h-HA-fJDsPYNI5Ap9cbw.text: Lobster ME: First I have to say, this place is very pricey, yes I know it's lobster, but for the price you pay, I would have expected a little more, either in taste or quantity. For a Lobster Roll and combo, which includes fries and drink, was $25.00.   I ordered the lobster roll with panko or bread crumbs on it. I was expecting chunks of lobster and a couple of claws as stated by other Yelp reviewers.   My lobster roll consisted of shredded lobster than didn't even fill the ends. It could of used a little more mayo on it, it just seemed lacking a little. The meat was tasty, but for the price, it wasn't quite there.   I've had some pretty good lobster rolls at other restaurants, this one came up short. My friend had the same sediments as me. He also got the chowder and said it was really runny.   If the price was less, then what we got for our buck would had been great, but for the price, it needs to stand out more.   I probably won't be going back, since the price and quantity and quality wasn't worth it to me.   But I might try the lobster macaroni one of these days there.

ts-tYpLpD1wV-wZ3qU8Sjg.text: The lobster on a stick is great. Might as well try both grilled and fried. The service has been great every time I have gone. Sometimes they have specials if you check in. Just ask.

photos.caption: Photo of Lobster ME - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing

PomL9F3XKzcauUaTIehsQg.text: I wanted to try this place because I wanted to try my first lobster roll. I wanted to go it so I can enjoy alone with my Pina Colada. The prices are definitely expensive, and I personally didn't think it was worth it. When I got the bag, the box was sideways. So the sauces and the roll was a mess. I was pretty irritated but ate it. It was alright, nothing to rave about. Would definitely suggest to eat it there, if the prices don't phase you.
